en: "At the place where the fates are decided, the Anuna, the great gods, stood by me. They made Šulgi's shepherdship everlasting for me and made Šulgi, the righteous one of his god, rise over the land like Utu for me. They set up a throne of firm reign for him. The shepherd will decree just judgments and will make just decisions upon it . They granted Šulgi a royal crown. …… great …….1 line fragmentary"

akk: šul ^d-[utu] [… im]-ma-an-ri  ur5-ra-aš-ta X […] /mu^?-\-e-tum3-tum3  še-er-zid piriĝ /gal\ […] X /ur\-saĝ <an>-šag4 kug-ta e3(source: DU)-a  ud me-lem4-ni kalam-ma bi2-dul4 ni2 gal mu-da-ri  ^d-utu lugal niĝ2-si-sa2 a zid-de3-eš2 tum2-ma  šen-na dalla mu-na-ni-in-e3 sipad zid šul-gi-ke4  am gal an kug-ta šul ^d-utu izi-ĝar-gin7 ĝa2-ĝa2 ud kalam-ma igi-ĝal2  [kur]-kur-ra me-lem4 ur5-ra-aš  diĝir  <^d->a-nun-ke4-ne /ušumgal\ kug sud-sud  dumu-saĝ ^d-suen-ne2 mi2 dug4-ga en dug4-ga tud-da  šul-gi-ra ^d-utu-u3 /nam^?-\-lugal kalam-ma mu-na-an-šum2
en: Youthful Utu ……, …… from Uraš; brilliant light, great lion, ……, hero emerging from the holy interior of heaven, storm whose splendour covers the Land and is laden with great awesomeness; Utu, king of justice that befits the true offspring, made Šulgi, the trustworthy shepherd, glorious in the battle. The great wild bull, youthful Utu, who like a torch illuminates the Land from the holy heavens; the wise one of all the countries, the fearsome radiance of Uraš, the just god among the Anuna gods, the long , holy dragon, the first-born son cherished by Suen, the lord born to command -- Utu bestowed the kingship of the Land on Šulgi.

akk: /piriĝ\ zag 3-gin7 kur u3-mu-tuku4-tuku4 ki-bal mu-/ḫul\-[(X)]  lu2 gu2-erim2-[ĝal2] ^d-nanna-a-/ka^!-\ gu2 X […]  [X] X saĝ-ĝa2 […] X gal diĝir-re-[ne]  […]-a-ni […] X RA /aĝ2^?-\ […]  […] E […]-ge-eš […]  ^d-utu sipad /šag4^?-\ […] X-ni-ir […]  šul-gi niĝ2-si-/sa2\ […]  gug-kal-la /AN\ […]  dumu ^d-nin-/sumun2\ […]  uĝ3-e ni2 /gal^?-\ […] ḫu-mu-ra-[…]  X šu dug4-ga X […] /na^?-\-me lu2 […]
en: Like a mace with three lion-heads, he makes the mountains tremble and then destroys the rebel lands. …… the enemy of Nanna. …… the great …… of the gods. 2 lines fragmentary Utu …… the shepherd. Šulgi …… justice. …… in famine. …… son of Ninsumun ……. May …… great fearsomeness for the people for you. …… the creation of …… no one …….
23. Sa-gida.
Utu, assign a sweet destiny to the king ……!
25. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-gida.

akk: [ĝiš-gi5-ĝal2 sa]-gid2-da-kam  […] X maḫ-am3  […]-na-gin7 [X] /bi2\-i3-sag9-sag9  […] sipad šul-gi /piriĝ\ […] pad3 ki-bal-a X […]  iri en-na nu-ḫuĝ /ni2^?-\-bi-a […]  šul ^d-utu uĝ3 u8-gin7 lu-[a …]  eš3 kug za-gin3-na ḫul2-la-da X-ba ḫu-mu-[…]  a-ab-[…] saĝ il2 gal-še3 […]  /a-ab^?-\-[…] ab2-šilam-gin7 saĝ /il2\ […]  […] X-ni ḫu-mu-ra-/ab^?-\-[…]  […] ni2-bi-a pa ḫu-/mu\-[…-e3]  […] X BI […]
en: …… is exalted. Like …… very pleasing. …… shepherd Šulgi, the lion …… the rebel lands ……. As long as the cities are not pacified ……. Youthful Utu …… the people numerous as ewes. May …… of the holy lapis-lazuli shrine, rejoicing. …… very proudly ……. Like a cow …… proudly. 3 lines fragmentary

akk: /šul-gi\ /^d-utu\ […]  tir šim^!- ^ĝiš-erin^!--na-da^?- […]  lugal en an-na me-lem4 sud4-/sud4^?-\ […]  barag maḫ an-na ki kug-ga-ta ud X […]  en-ne2 kur-kur-ra an kug-ta si maḫ […]  šul ^d-utu niĝ2 nam-sikil-la-zu-ta mu-na-da-lug-ga  /nam\-til3 niĝ2 dug3 ḫa-la-zu ḫe2-am3 dumu ^d-nin-sumun2-ka
en: Šulgi …… Utu ……. …… a fragrant cedar forest. O king, the lord who covers the heavens with awesomeness ……. …… the heavenly august dais from the holy place. The lord …… august radiance on all the lands from the holy heavens. Because of your purity, youthful Utu has made everything abundant for you; may a sweet life be your lot, son of Ninsumun.
44. Sa-ĝara.

akk: sa-ĝar-ra-am3  šul ^d-utu sipad šag4-ge bi2-i3-pad3  šul-gi sipad zid lugal mu ḫe2-ĝal2-la2 nam-še3 tar-ra-am3  sipad zid ^d-utu-u3 nam tar-ra-ra  ^d-en-lil2-le eš3-e nibru^ki--ta saĝ-e-eš2 mu-ni-rig7
en: Youthful Utu chose the shepherd in his heart. Years of plenty are assigned to Šulgi, the trustworthy shepherd, the king, as his fate. From the shrine in Nibru, Enlil bestowed this on the trustworthy shepherd, whose fate is determined by Utu.
49. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-ĝara.

akk: ĝiš-gi5-ĝal2 sa-ĝar-ra-kam  en me gal-gal-la ^d-nin-gal-e tud-da  /šul ^d-utu en me\ gal-gal-la ^d-nin-gal-e tud-da  […] X /pad3\
en: Lord of all the great divine powers, borne by Ningal! Youthful Utu, lord of all the great divine powers, borne by Ningal, 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

akk: [ma2]-/gur8\ ^d-en-ki-ke4 kar ḫe-ĝal2 nam-še3 ma-ra-ni-in-/tar^ar-\  [a]-/a\ ^d-en-lil2-le igi zid mu-u3-ši-bar^ar-  nin-zu-u3 ^d-nin-lil2-le u3-tud-zu bi2-in-dug4  ux(PA)-a zid lugal šul-gi-da a2-zu mu-da-an-aĝ2  ĝeštug3 daĝal-la-kam sa2 gal mu-u3-ši-in-/pad3\  sipad-de3 ud ĝi6-a u3 nu-mu-u3-ši-in-ku4-ku4  igi-ĝal2-tuku ĝiš-ḫur-re kiĝ2-ĝa2 kug-zu niĝ2-nam-ma-/ke4\  ^ĝiš-tir gal-gal-la erin gal ma-ra-an-ni-[in-kud]  me-zu-u3 šu bi2-/du7\ u6-e ba-/an\-gub-/be2-en3\
en: Oh barge, Enki assigned the quay of abundance to you as your fate. Father Enlil looked at you with approval. Your lady, Ninlil, commanded your construction. She entrusted it to the faithful provider, King Šulgi; and the shepherd, who is of broad intelligence, will not rest day and night in thinking deeply about you. He, the wise one, who is proficient in planning, he, the omniscient one, will fell large cedars in the huge forests for you. He will make you perfect and you will be breathtaking to look upon.

akk: tug2^?- X sig10-ga gu-a tag^?--ga-a-zu-u3 ki X X X [X X]-me-en3  kid-maḫ-ḫal-zu-u3 ud a2-dam kug-ge daĝal-bi si^?--a^?--/me\-en3  ĝiš-šu-dim2-zu-u3 muš-šag4-tur3 sim-dam ak šu-ba nu2-me-en3  gi-/muš^?-\-zu-u3 ušumgal ki-nu2-bi-a u3 dug3 ku4-me-en3  ^ĝiš-mi-ri2-za-zu-u3 muš sig-sig kur-ku šag4 ki tab-ba-me-en3  ^ĝiš-eme-sig-zu-u3 a-ĝi6 ^id2-buranuna kug-ga teš2-ba gun3-gun3-me-en3  ^ĝiš-u3 ^ĝiš-ḫar-ra keše2-keše2-ra2-zu-u3 ki ĝa2-ar-ĝa2-ra-bi  kun-saĝ pu2^?- kur-ra  ĝiš X X sig9-si-ig-ga-me-en3  ^ĝiš-LU kug-zu-u3 ḫe2-ĝal2 ĝar-ĝar-ra-a ki ḫe2-us2-sa-me-en3  ĝiš-ḫum-zu-u3 abzu šag4-bi-a /barag\ maḫ-a ri-a-me-en3  kan4 ud e3-še3 ĝal2-la-a^?--/zu^?-\-u3 ^d-nin-uš^mušen--a  umbin-ba niĝ2 X X mi-ni-ib2^?--la2^?- a2 mu-u3-sud-sud-e
en: Your woven …… is ……. Your covering reed-mats are the daylight spreading wide over the holy settlements. Your timbers are sniffing …… reptiles crouching on their paws. Your punting poles are dragons sleeping a sweet sleep in their lair. Your strakes are …… snakes, ……. Your floor-planks are flood-currents, sparkling altogether in the pure Euphrates. Your side-planks, which are fastened into their fixed places with wooden rings , are a stairway leading to a mountain spring , a …… filled with ……. Your holy …… are persisting and firmly founded abundance. Your bench is a lofty dais erected in the midst of the abzu. Your …… is Aratta, full-laden with treasures. Your door, facing the sunrise, is a …… bird, carrying a …… in its talons while spreading wide its wings.

akk: aš-me kug-sig17-ga gun3-a-zu-u3 ^kuš-usan3^?- il2-la-a-bi  i3-/ti\ niĝ2 giri17-zal kur-kur-ra zid-de3-eš2 e3-a-me-en3  an-/ti\-bal me nam-lugal-/la\-ka še-er-ḫa-an dug4-ga-zu-u3  tir ^ĝiš-ḫa-šu-ur2-ra a sig ĝa2-ra ĝissu dug3-ga-me-en3  gi-zi di4-di4 pa12-pa12-al il2-la saĝ sig10-ga-zu-a  šag4-ba mušen buru5^mušen- ambar^!- kug-gin7 ad mu-ĝa2-ĝa2-ĝa2  mur ša-a-bi du9-du9-u3 ^dug-šakir3-ra-gin7 šag4-ge dug3-ga-bi  ^d-en-lil2 ^d-nin-lil2-ra /ḫul2^?--la^?-\-gin7 mu-ni-ib2-ĝa2-ĝa2-ĝa2
en: Your glittering golden sun-disc, fastened with leather straps, is the brilliant moonlight, shining brightly upon all the lands. Your banner, adorned with the divine powers of kingship, is a woodland of cypress trees irrigated with clean water, giving a pleasant shade. Your small reed mats are the evening sky, illuminated with stars, imbued with terrible awesomeness. In the midst of your carefully tended small gizi reeds with numerous twigs , flocks of little birds twitter as in a holy swamp. Their chirping, as pleasing to the heart as the sound of the churn's shaking, makes Enlil and Ninlil extremely happy .

akk: /^ĝiš-zi\-gan^an--zu-u3 kiĝ2^ku6- maḫ a tal2-la ka ki-sal4-la-/me-en3^?-\  […]-zu-u3 alim ki gal-la ni2 il2-il2-a-me-[en3]  eš2(source: TUG2) ma2 gid2-zu-u3 ^d-niraḫ dar-a kalam-ma la2-a-/me\-[en3]  ^ĝiš-dimgul-zu-u3 uz3-saĝ an-na KA^?- i-i-/me\-[en3]  ^ĝiš-ad-us2-zu-u3 ur-saĝ ur-saĝ-ra  sig10-ga-/me\-[en3]  ma2-saĝ-zu-u3 ^d-nanna ur5-ra-aš sag9^?--[ga …]-/me-en3\  ma2-eĝer-zu-u3 ^d-utu an-ur2-/ra^?-\ […-me-en3]  a2^?--sumur2^?--zu-u3 NE ĜA2^?- /ḪA^?-\ X […-me-en3]
en: Your rudder is a large kiĝ fish in the broad waters at the mouth of the Kisala canal. Your …… are a bison, inspiring terror on the great earth. Your tow-rope is the gliding Niraḫ extended over the land. Your mooring pole is the heavenly bond, which ……. Your longside beams are a warrior striking straight against another warrior. Your prow is Nanna …… fair sky. Your stern is Utu …… at the horizon. Your canopy is …….
40. Sa-gida.

akk: sa-gid2-da-[am3]  ezen kug bi3-lu5-da gal-gal  sipad zid šul-gi-re ki^!--bi-še3 mu-ĝa2-ar-ĝa2-ar  nibru^ki--a diĝir gal-gal-e-ne a kug mu-tu17-tu17-u3-eš2  iri^ki--a nam ki-bi-še3 mu-tar^ar--e me zid mu-ḫal-/ḫal^?-\-[e]  [ama] kalam-ma ^d-nin-lil2 lu2 sag9-ga e2-ta^!- nam-X-[…-e3]  [^d-en]-lil2-le ab2-šilam kug-gin7 gu2-da mu-/ni\-[in-la2]  /barag\ kug-bi dur2 im-mi-in-ĝa2-re-eš2 niĝ2 mi-ni-ib2-/gu\-[ul]-gu-ul-ne
en: The faithful shepherd Šulgi established the holy festival and the great rituals. The great gods bathe in holy water in Nibru. He assigns the fates to their places in the city and allocates the right divine powers. The mother of the Land, Ninlil the fair, comes out from the house, and Enlil embraces her like a pure wild cow. They take their seats on the barge's holy dais, and provisions are lavishly prepared.

akk: [ma2]-/gur8^?-\ maḫ [X X] DU ^id2-idigna-a ḫe2-du7-bi  [id2] /ḫal\-ḫal-la [i3]-kur9-ru X a mul-mul-la^?- [X X] X X X [X]  ur-saĝ ^d-en-lil2-la2 ^d-nin-urta saĝ-bi-a mu-ĝen  /ma2-gur8^?- gi\-dirig kug-ga ^ĝiš-gi-/muš kug^?-\-bi^?- […]  nin X nam-maḫ gal-gal-ni mi2 mu^?--[…]  munus zid-da ^d-nin-lil2 ḫul2-la-e šul-gi mu-[…]  ki-en-gi urim2^ki--e niĝ2-ḫul2-la sag9-ga X […]  ma2-gur8^?- kar me-te-a-ĝi6-a a-ne sud i3-im-[me]  ĝiš-gi tum-ma-al^ki- ^d-en-lil2-la2-ka a2 mu-sud-sud-e  gud du3-gin7 saĝ mu-ni-ib2-/il2^?-\-il2^?- gu2  mi-ni-ib2-mar-/mar\   i3-si3 zig3-ga-a gaba im-ra-ra-ra a šu ni10-ni10 i3-ḪA-[ḪA-ḪA]  a šag4-ga du-bi engur-ra ku6 /im\-ši-ḫu-luḫ-e  a bar-ra du-bi ḫe2-ĝal2-e mul-ma-al im-mi-ib2-za
en: The lofty barge ……, the ornament of the Tigris, enters the rolling river; …… on the shining water. The ritually washed five-headed mace, mitum mace, lance and standard …… at the bow. Enlil's warrior, Ninurta, goes at their front, directing the …… of your wide ferry-boat straight. He …… the holy punting pole of the barge, the holy raft. The ferrymen …… holy songs; they …… the great exaltedness of the lady. The good woman, Ninlil, …… joyfully with Šulgi. Sumer and Urim …… joy and happiness. The barge bobs at the quay Mete-aĝi ; it sails off into the reedbeds of Enlil's Tummal. Like a goring ox, it raises, then lowers its head. It strikes its breast against the rising waves; it stirs up the encircling waters. When it thrusts within the waters, the fish of the subterranean waters become frightened; as it glides upon them, it makes the waters sparkle luxuriantly.

akk: gi-dirig kug-ge nam am3-us2 nin tum-ma-al^ki- a-ra-zu [X X] X  ama^?- /a-a\ ^d-en-lil2-la2 an lugal diĝir nam tar-re giri17 šu^?- X mu-ni-[ĝal2]  šul-gi sipad nidba gal-gal-la-ni mu-ne-ši^?--ib2-dib-dib-be2  ud nam-ḫe-a mi-ni-ib2-zal-zal-ne ĝi6 i3-im-i-i-ne  lugal ma2-gur8 kug du8-a-ra nam mu-ni-in-tar-re-eš2  nam tar-ra-a-bi ul-le2-a-še3 niĝ2 saĝ-ba du-am3
en: …… the holy raft; …… the lady of Tummal …… prayer. Enlil's ancestors and An the king, the god who determines the fates, greets her. With Ninlil, they take their seats at the banquet, and Šulgi the shepherd brings along his great food-offerings for them. They pass the day in abundance, they give praise throughout night. They decree a fate, an allotted fate to be pre-eminent forever, for the king who fitted out the holy barge.

akk: gaba^?- kalam-ma-ka ud mu-u3-ĝa2-ar ^d-utu-u3 dalla bi2-e3  ma2-gur8 gaba^?- [ri]-bi-a nam am3-mi-ib-gu2-un-gun2 gu3^?- mur^?- mu-ša4  nin-mu-tum2 id2 mu ḫe2-ĝal2-la-ka a šu ti-a-am3  eštub^ku6--bi-e tun3:mu mi-ib2-gun3-gun3^gu2- ^d-en-lil2 i3-ḫul2-le  muš-u2^ku6--e gu3 ĝa2-ar-ba  ^d-nin-lil2 i3-ḫul2-le  suḫur-maš2/^ku6-\-e sun4-bi mu-u3-sud-e ^d-nanna i3-ḫul2-le  X X X a-nun-na im-ši-ḫul2-ḫul2-le-eš2  X [X X] /^id2-\buranun-na saĝ mi-ni-ib2-il2-il2 DU mi-ni-X  /šag4^?-\ X […] kur^?--ra-am3 a zal tum3^!--tum3^!--da^?-  ma2^?--/gur8\ [kug kar-re] mu^?--ni-ib2-us2 nibru^ki- ḫul2-la-a-am3
en: Then light shines up at the edge of the Land as Utu rises refulgently. As the barge is travelling upstream, it …… radiates and creaks . …… in the Ninmutum, the canal of the year of abundance ……. As the carp make their bellies sparkle, Enlil rejoices. As the mušu fish play noisily there, Ninlil rejoices. As the …… fish ……, Enki rejoices. As the suḫurmaš fish dart about, Nanna rejoices. The Anuna gods rejoice at ……. …… lifts its head in the Euphrates; it ……. In the midst of …… ever-flowing water is carried. In joyous Nibru, he moors the holy barge at the quay.

akk: ^d-/nin^?-\-[lil2]-/le^?-\ X X DU-a-e lugal šul-gi-ra^?-  igi /ḫul2\-la2 saĝ-ki zalag-ga-na mu-ši-im-bar-bar-re  sipad X X šul-gi mu gi16-sa lugal ezen-/na^?-\  aga [an kug-ge] saĝ-za mu-ni-in-gen6-na ĝi6-bi ga-ra-/ab\-[bad]-bad  ĝidru kug^?- ^d-en-lil2-le ma-ra-an-šum2-ma-[a] ud-bi ga-ra-ab-sud-sud  ^ĝiš-gu-za ^d-en-ki-/ke4\ saĝ ḫa-ba-ra-/rig7\-ga-/a\ suḫuš-bi ḫa-ra-ab-gen6-ge-en6  ^d-nanna amar ban3-da a ^d-[en-lil2-la2] /zid\-de3-eš2 ša^?--mu-u3^?--tud  sipad niĝ2-du7-e pa e3-a X [X] X A a-la^?- sug4-am3  nam-til3-zu-u3 tug2-ba13 kug-ĝu10-/gin7\ bar-ra ḫe2-mi-ni-dul
en: With joyful eyes and shining forehead, Ninlil, ……, looks upon King Šulgi: "Shepherd ……, Šulgi, who has a lasting name, king of jubilation! I will prolong the nights of the crown that was placed upon your head by holy An, and I will extend the days of the holy sceptre that was given to you by Enlil. May the foundation of your throne that was bestowed on you by Enki be firm! Shepherd who brings about perfection, may Nanna, the robust calf, the seed of Enlil, to whom I gave birth, cover your life with …… which is full of exuberance as if it were my holy ba garment!"
91. Sa-ĝara.

akk: en nam-ur-saĝ-ĝa2 šu du7-a ki /aĝ2\ […]  ^d-nin-urta ^ĝiš-meš3 pa mul daĝal-la […]  tukul me3 ak-še3^?-  kur […]  ušum igi ḫuš /muš\-šag4-tur3 ki-bal-a uš11-/bi\ […]  [X X] X /gaba^?-\ zig3 piriĝ zag e3 X X […]  ^d-nin-urta nun gal ^d-en-ki-/da\ […]  lugal-ĝu10 iri-za eš3 nibru^ki- tir X […]  e2-šu-me-ša4 ki šu mu-/ra\-[…]  en nam-lugal-e šu mu-ra-ab-du7 […]  ad gi4-gi4 ušumgal kalam-ma KA X […]  ^d-nin-urta bad3 gal nibru^ki--a X […]  lugal-ĝu10 me sag2 nu-di ur-/saĝ\ […]  piriĝ gaba-ĝal2 NE MU^ĝiš^?-- šu bar-bar […]  lugal ĝeštug2 daĝal an ki-a u2 […]  ĝidru maḫ kalam-e zag dib-ba ki […]  ^d-nin-urta lu2-erim2 ri X X […]
en: Lord, perfect warrior, beloved by ……. Ninurta, meš tree with a broad shining canopy, ……. Weapon striding into battle, …… foreign countries. A dragon with a terrifying face, venomous snake who …… its venom against the rebel lands. …… overpowering ……, foremost lion ……. Ninurta, who …… with the great prince Enki. My king, in your city, shrine Nibru, ……. E-šu-me-ša, where …… for you. Lord, the kingship is perfect with you ……. Adviser, the dragon of the Land, ……. Ninurta, the great wall of Nibru, ……. My king, whose divine powers cannot be scattered, warrior ……. Forceful lion, ……. King with the broad wisdom of heaven and earth, ……. Exalted sceptre rising above the Land, ……. Ninurta, who …… the enemy, …….
17. Sa-gida.

akk: sa-gid2-[da-am3]  ur-saĝ en ni2 er9 gaba zig3-ga […]  ^d-nin-urta ud /ḫuš\ izi er9-ra /nam\-[…]  ud ḫu-luḫ-ḫa sumur^!--ra2 ki-bal-a /piriĝ\ […]  ušum ni2 ri en gaba gi4 /nu\-tuku igi […]  /lugal\ ĝeštug2 daĝal ^ĝiš-rab3 diĝir-[re-e-ne]  [X X]-e a2 maḫ šum2-ma […]  […] X zid šul-gi-ra […]  […] (X) X X X MU NI X /NE\ […]  [… ni2]-te-na-ka šag4-ge ba-e-ni-/pad3\-[X]  […] /TE A\ ^d-nin-urta za3-mi2
en: Warrior, powerful lord, overpowering ……. Ninurta, terrible storm, powerful fire, ……. Frightening storm, raging against the rebellious lands, …… lion. Dragon spreading terror, lord without rival ……. King with broad wisdom, neck-stock of gods. …… given strength ……. …… trustworthy ……, Šulgi …… 1 line fragmentary You have chosen …… among your own …… in your heart. ……, Ninurta, be praised.
28. Sa-ĝara.
……, bestow a long life and prosperous years on Šulgi!

akk: […] /šul\-gi-re til3 su3-ud mu nam-ḫe2 saĝ-e-eš rig7-ga [(…)]
en: 30. Its ĝišgiĝal.
31. A tigi of Ninurta.

akk: ^d-/nergal\ […]  ni2 gal i ganzer X IGI X X […]  ni2 me-lem4-ma-bi sa-bar-/ra\ AN X […] DU  an-ne2 ki-e ni2-bi ba-/ni\-[X X]
en: Nergal who ……, …… great awe, who …… the underworld -- its awesome radiance …… the battle-net, its awesomeness has filled heaven and earth.
5. 2nd šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku 2-[kam-ma-am3]  ur-saĝ am a2 gur-gur ab2-gin7 /in\-[…]  mu ḫuš-zu ni2 su zig3 bar-re-dam  ulu3-gin7-nam ki-bal šub-šub-bu-[me-en]  kur niĝ2-daĝal-ba si-ĝar-bi-me-en  e2-meš3-lam za-e tuš-a-zu-ne  ḫul2-ḫul2-le šag4-ge8 guru6 SUD-me-en3  uĝ3-e gu2 ši-im-si ĝiri3-zu-še3
en: Hero, wild bull with thick horns, …… like a cow, your terrifying name lets loose awe and fear. You fall on the rebel lands like the south wind. You are a bolt on the broad extent of the mountains. When you sit in E-mešlam, your desires are joyously fulfilled . The people assemble at your feet.
13. 2nd barsud.

akk: bar-sud 2-kam-ma-am3  [ki-bal]-e nam-nir-ĝal2-zu ^d-meš3^!--lam^!--ta-e3-a  [ki-bal]-e šul ši-im-mi-niĝin2-niĝin2  [^d-]/nergal\ nam-nir-ĝal2-zu ki-bal-e
en: Mešlamta-ea, your supremacy in the rebel lands! You have encircled the rebel lands, O youth. Nergal, your supremacy in the rebel lands!

akk: [a-a]-/zu\ ki gal-bi ši-im-ma-an-aĝ2  nam-ur-/saĝ\-zu uĝ3-e im-mi-zu-«me»  a-a-zu ^d-en-lil2-le ki gal-bi ši-im-ma-an-aĝ2  nam-ur-saĝ-zu uĝ3-e im-mi-zu
en: Your father loves you greatly. He has made your heroism known among the people. Your father Enlil loves you greatly. He has made your heroism known among the people.

akk: ur-saĝ uĝ3-e TAR-TAR diĝir kur-ra niĝin  ki-bal-e X-da ba-ni-dug4^?-  ^d-nergal uĝ3-e TAR-TAR diĝir kur-ra niĝin
en: Hero …… for the people, god roaming the mountains! You have …… the rebel lands. Nergal …… for the people, god roaming the mountains!

akk: /ki\ dib-ba-zu erin2 teš2-bi-še3 ḫul /mi\-[ni-X X]  an-ša4-an^!-^ ki- ti-da-nu-um-/ma\ [X]  ^d-nergal ki dib-ba erin2 teš2-bi-/še3\ [ḫul mi-ni-X X]
en: Wherever you stride, all their troops suffer. …… Anšan and Tidnum, Nergal, wherever you stride, all their troops suffer.
27. Sa-gida.
May you prolong the life of the hero Šulgi. …… to his strength, …….
30. Its ĝišgiĝal.
unknown no. of lines missing

akk: ^d-en-lil2 ud e3 ŠE3 X dug4-[ga-ni nu-kur2-ra]  u18(source: MIR)-ru gal ^d-a-nun-ke4-ne […]  ^d-šul-gi ušum ni2 /guru3^?-\ […]  lugal šu dug4-ga-ni-ir IGI^?- X X [… bar^?-]  ne gal-gal X [… šum2]  za-pa-ĝa2-ni an ki [X]-bi-a ĝa2^?--[ar-ĝa2-ra^?-]
en: Enlil, the beaming light, ……, whose utterance is immutable, the most powerful of the Anuna gods, ……, looked favourably at Šulgi, the fearsome dragon ……, the king, the creation of his hands. He granted him great strength. His roar fills the whole extent of heaven and earth.

akk: e2-kur gal:muš idim-ma me X […]  dur-an-ki giri17-zal-a me ul ba-bad /nam^?-\-[ḫe2]-/ĝal2^?-\  šeg12 nun ki ĝar-ra-ba ^ĝiš-isimu2^sar--bi ud sud-sud-u5  ^d-šul-gi bal nam-ḫe2 ba-tud-da šag4-ta gal mu-tar  uĝ3 gu3 teš2-a sig10-i3  su3-ud-bi lugal šar2-ra-ba-ke4
en: In the E-kur, the great snake of the deep, ……, in Dur-an-ki, which lavishly …… the eternal divine powers, ……, Enlil determined a great fate from the womb for the long-enduring sapling of the brickwork founded by the princely one, Šulgi, who was born for a prosperous reign: "Make the people obedient, you enduring king of the multitudes!"

akk: dub3-tuku ud mar-uru5 zag-še-ni nu-til-e  kaš4 a2-dam-a2-dam-ta e3-a  ḫu-luḫ-e kaš4-kaš4-e ḫuš-ZA-/am3\  uĝ3-ta igi saĝ5-ĝa2 u3-su-bi saĝ X […]  a2 an-ba9-ra2-a bar-ra-ni-še3 […]  ^d-šul-gi niĝ2 kaš4 ḪU^?- an-ur2-ta ĝa2-ĝa2-ĝa2-/dam\ […]  nu-kuš2-u5 kaskal-e NE^?- X DI-DI  saĝ gig2-ga(source: I)-a lugal na-me saĝ nu-sig10 di [gal]-še3 na-an-ĝar
en: The swift runner, a hurricane -- the strength of his loins is never ending, who emerges victorious from the race among the settlements; the terrifying one, who is furious in his running, the strongest among those selected from the people, ……. When he stretches his arms out, …… at his sides. Šulgi, …… from the horizon. Because of his being most powerful, in his vigour ……. He, the tireless one, …… the road. No king ever cared so much for the black-headed people; he established justice on a grand scale.

akk: nibru^ki- ki-ur3-ta na-kaš4  eš3 urim2^ki- e2-temen-ni2-guru3-še3  ^d-nanna unu2 kiĝ2-nim bur nun sug2-ga-ni sa2 UL nam-mi-in-dug4  ud ne-[X]-a /nam\-ḫe nam im-mi-in-tar  ^d-utu-e /sig^?--ge-eš2\ nam-ši-X  a-ne e2-kur za-gin3-še3 na-gur
en: On a day that dawned for prosperity, that was destined for rain-clouds, he ran from the Ki-ur of Nibru to the shrine of Urim, the E-temen-ni-guru; and provided the princely bowls of Nanna, set up in the morning dining-hall, with a copious ration. On that day, prosperity was decreed for him. In a violent storm, a whirlwind that broke out, Utu ……; Šulgi returned to the lustrous E-kur.

akk: ud til3-la-še3 ur-saĝ-e-ne-e  ^d-šul-gi-ra /nam\-maḫ gal-gal-la-ni a-re-eš2 pad3-de3-de3  X alan^?- ud su3-ra2 mu da-ri2-ka-na  mul-an-ne2-eš2^?- bi2-in-gun3^?-  a-a ^d-en-lil2 maḫ-di nu-kur2-/ra\  igi dug3 niĝ2 giri17-zal si-a-ni-še3 nam-nun-na mi-ni-in-gub
en: In order that the heroes for ever praise Šulgi's great exaltedness, he made his …… enduring statue of everlasting fame brilliant like the heavenly stars, and set it up in majesty before the good eyes, filled with generosity , of the immutably eminent Father Enlil.

akk: […] X /KU^?-\ A  […] dim2^?--ma^?-  […] šu nu-bar-re  […] X-bi sig9-ga-am3  [… šu] /nu^?-\-bar-re  […] ĝeštug2 kalam-ma ud šu2-uš  […] X ri-a mu-ri-kiĝ2^?-  […] /gu2^?-\-un^?- dugud^?--da-a-ni mu-ri-zal  […] /mu^?-\-ri-eš-am3  […] /IN^?-\ zid2-da-ni me-ri  […] /MU\ BI igi bar-re  […] MUNUS UŠ mu-ri-eš-am3
en: 2 lines fragmentary …… does not release ……. 1 line fragmentary …… does not release ……. …… the wise of the Land daily. 1 line fragmentary …… made you pay his heavy tribute in full. 1 line fragmentary …… his flour ……. 2 lines fragmentary

akk: […] /šul^?-\-gi lugal /urim2^ki-\-ma  […] ḪA i3-me-en  […] KA×X-ĝu10  […] /KA\ a-a-ĝu10-ur2  […] lugal-ban3-da  […] /BI\ ga-ḫul2  […] A BA su3-ud  […] sud-bi  […] X ŠE3^?- BA ḪAR^?-  […] UR2  […] X ĝa2^?--a  […] X
en: …… Šulgi, king of Urim. I am ……. My ……. …… for my father. …… Lugalbanda ……. I will rejoice ……. 6 lines fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

akk: /lugal\ ma2 na-mu-u5  [ki unug^ki-]-/ge^?-\ me nam-nun-na-še3  [ki-en]-gi ki-uri u6 mu-e  kar^!- kul-ab4^ki--ba-ke4 ma2 na-ga-am3-mi-in-us2  am gal ḫur-saĝ-ĝa2 a2 il2-il2-la-da  udu en zid-de3 šu-a la2-a-da  maš2 su4^?- maš2 za la2 gaba-a tab-ba-da  ^d-inana-ra eš3 e2-an-na-ka mu-na-da-an-ku4-ku4-u3
en: The king sailed to Unug towards the princely divine powers. Sumer and Akkad marvelled at him as he moored the boat at the quay of Kulaba. With a large wild bull of the mountains with uplifted horns, and with a sheep led by the hand of an en priest at his right side, with a dappled kid and a bearded kid clasped to his breast, he entered before Inana in the shrine of E-ana.

akk: sipad zid šul-gi-re šag4 ki aĝ2 tug2-ba13 tug2 mu-mur10  ḫi-li men-še3 saĝ-ĝa2 mi-ni-ĝal2  ^d-inana-ke4 u6 mu-ni-dug4  ni2-te-ni-še3 šir3 ba-ši-ni-ra  en3-du-še3^!- im-e
en: Šulgi, the good shepherd, a heart in love, dressed himself in the ba garment and put a ḫili wig on his head as a crown. Inana looked at him with admiration and spontaneously struck up a song, singing the words:

akk: lugal-ra  u3-mu-un-ra   a mu-na-tu17-a-gin7   su-ba du5-mu-zid-ra  a mu-na-tu17-a-gin7  im da-ĝu10 šu tag-ge4 dug4-ga-gin7   u3  šembulugx(ŠIM×UḪ3)-ga ka-ĝu10 gun5-gun5-na-gin7  šembi2-zid  i3-bi2-ĝa2 mi-ni-mar-mar-ra-gin7   šu  na-aĝ2-sag9-ga-na-ka   ib2-ib2-ĝu10 mi-ni-dim2-dim2-ma3-gin7   u3-mu-un  i3-nu2 kug ^d-inana^na--še3   su-ba du5-mu-zid-de3   ur2-ra ga i3-du8-a-na-gin7  X IM a2 gi-rin-ĝa2 GI4 in-tenx(GUR8)-tenx(GUR8)-na-gin7  [X] X saĝ kaš^!- saĝ-gin7   mu-uš^?-  mu-tag-ga-gin7  siki-ur2-ĝu10  ĝa2-an-/suḫ3^?-\-[suḫ3-a-gin7]   siki-pa-ĝu10   gal4 kug-ĝa2 šu  bi2-in-ma-ra-gin7   šag4  ze2-ba-ĝa2  u3 [X] X-bi i3-X-/nu2^?-\-a-gin7  ma2 MI-ni-gin7 mu-X-[X]-/AN^?-\-gin7  ma2 sal-la-ni-gin7 mu-un-til-til-la-gin7  ki-nu2-a mi2  ĝa2-ni-dug4-ga-a-gin7    u3-mu-un-ra  mi2  da-an-dug4
en: "When I have bathed for the king, for the lord, when I have bathed for the shepherd Dumuzid, when I have adorned my flanks with ointment , when I have anointed my mouth with balsamic oil , when I have painted my eyes with kohl, when he has …… my hips with his fair hands, when the lord who lies down beside holy Inana, the shepherd Dumuzid, has …… on his lap, when he has relaxed …… in my pure arms, when he has intercourse with me …… like choice beer, when he ruffles my pubic hair for me, when he plays with the hair of my head, when he lays his hands on my holy genitals, when he lies down in the …… of my sweet womb, 2 lines unclear when he treats me tenderly on the bed, then I will too treat my lord tenderly."

akk: na-aĝ2 ze2-eb2 du10-mu-ni-ib2-tar^ar-   sipad zid šul-gi-ra mi2  da-an-dug4    na-aĝ2 ze2-eb2 du10-mu-ni-ib2-tar^ar-   a2-gar3-ra-na mi2-eš2  da-an-dug4    na-aĝ2-sipad  kur-kur-ra   na-aĝ2-še3 du10-mu-ni-ib2-tar^ar-
en: "I will decree a good fate for him! I will treat Šulgi, the good shepherd, tenderly! I will decree a good fate for him! I will treat him tenderly in his ……! I will decree the shepherdship of all the lands as his destiny!"

akk: nin su3-ra2-aĝ2 an-na  ḫi-li saĝ gig2-ga  munus šul-la ama-ni-ra dirig-ga  a-a-ni me ba-a  ^d-inana dumu ^d-suen-na-ke4  šul-gi dumu ^d-nin-sumun2-ka-ra  nam mu-ni-ib2-tar-re
en: The lady, the light of heaven, the delight of the black-headed, the youthful woman who excels her mother, who was granted divine powers by her father, Inana, the daughter of Suen, decreed a destiny for Šulgi, the son of Ninsumun:

akk: me3-a igi-še3 ĝen-zu ĝe26-me-en3  šen-šen-na kuš7-gin7 tukul la2-zu-me-en3  unken-na ka-mud-ĝal2-zu-me-en3  ḫar-ra-an-na zi-šag4-ĝal2-zu ĝe26-me-en  sipad šag4-ge pad3-da X kug-ga-me-en3  lugal u2-a zid e2-an-na-me-en3  šuba3 iri12-gal an-na-me-en3  barag maḫ-ḫa saĝ il2-la-a ba-ab-du7-me-en3  ^ĝiš-gu-za za-gin3-na dur2 ĝar-ra-a ba-ab-du7-u3  saĝ-zu men gun3-a ba-ab-du7-u3  bar-zu-še3 ^tug2-zulumḫi sud-de3 ba-ab-du7-u3  tug2 nam-lugal-la2-ka šag4 la2-a ba-ab-du7-u3  mitum-ma a2 il2-de3 ba-ab-du7-u3  ^ĝiš-tukul-a dub3 bad-ba9-re6 ba-ab-du7-u3  ti sud ^ĝiš-pan  ba-ab-du7-u3  ^ĝiš-ilar ^kuš-gur21(source: TUM)^ur3--ra zag keše2-ra2-a ba-ab-du7-u3  šu-zu-še3 ĝidru kug-ge ba-ab-du7-u3  ĝiri3-zu-še3 ^kuš-e-sir2 kug-ge ba-ab-du7-u3  dub3-tuku-me-en3 ḫar-ra-an-na kaš4 di-de3 ba-ab-du7-u3  amar za-gin3-na-gin7 gaba kug-ĝa2  ba-ab-du7-u3  šag4 ki aĝ2-zu-u3 ud ḫe2-em-su3-re6-e  an-ne2 mi-ri-in-ak na-da-ab-kur2-re  ^d-en-lil2 lu2 nam tar-tar-re-de3 šu na-an-ni-ib-bal-e  ^d-inana-ke4 mi2 mu-ni-in-dug4
en: "In battle I will be the one who goes before you. In combat I will carry your weapon like a personal attendant. In the assembly I will be your advocate. On campaign I will be your encouragement. You are the shepherd chosen by holy ……. You are the king and generous provider of E-ana. You are the pure one of An's Iri-gal. You are worthy of ……. You are one who is entitled to hold high his head on the lofty dais. You are one who is worthy of sitting on the shining throne. Your head is worthy of the brilliant crown. Your body is worthy of the long fleecy garment. You are worthy of being dressed in the royal garb. You are suited to hold the mitum weapon in your arm. You are suited to run fast with the battle-mace. You are suited to hit accurately with the barbed arrows and the bow. You are suited to fasten the throw-stick and the sling to your side. Your hand is worthy of the holy sceptre. Your feet are worthy of the holy shoes. You are a fast runner suited to race on the road. You are worthy to delight yourself on my holy breast like a pure calf. May your love be lasting! An has determined this for you, and may he never alter it! May Enlil, the decreer of fates, never change it!" Thus Inana treated him tenderly.

akk: šag4 ḫul2-la ^d-nin-e2-gal-ka zu  maš2 gig2 umbin ba-an-kiĝ2  maš2 babbar2 a ba-an-tu17-tu17  am ḫur-saĝ-ĝa2 giri17-še3 ba-an-la2-la2  e2 ninda2 maḫ gu3 nun di-dam  šul ^d-utu-u3 eš3 e2-babbar2-ra mu-na-ni-ib2-ku4-ku4
en: He who knows the joyful heart of Ninegala sheared a black kid, bathed a white kid, and tied a wild bull of the mountains by its nose. Then he brought them into the temple E-babbar which roars like a noble breed-bull, to the hero Utu in the shrine.

akk: šul ^d-utu-u3 saĝ-ki zalag-ga-ni mu-ši-ib2-zi-zi  šul-gi sipad zid ki-en-gi-ra-[ra] nam mu-ni-[ib2-tar-re]  [lugal] inim gun3-gun3 igi sag9-sag9  ur-saĝ kalag-ga piriĝ-še3 tud-da  sumun2 tur nam-šul-ba gub-ba  lipiš-tuku ne3-ni-e nu-keše2-ra2  ḫur-saĝ gal-gal-la ĝiri3-ni ĝar  ur-saĝ kur-ra mu-de5-de5-ge-eš  barag-barag-ge ĝiri3 sa-ga i3-mi-/dug4\  mu-zu zag an-na-še3 mu-u3-ĝar  lugal-zu ^d-aš-im2-babbar2-ra silim-ma ĝen-na  enegir3^ki- iri me-lem4-ma du3-a  ma2 nam-ga-am3-mi-in-us2  ^d-nin-a-zu gud-sumun2 naĝ-a ad-ba gu3 di-gin7  NA^?- […]  […] X-zu-/ra\ […]  KA […] X MU ĜA2 […]
en: The hero Utu received him smiling, and decreed a fate for Šulgi the good shepherd of Sumer: "King, eloquent and good-looking, mighty hero, born to be a lion, young wild bull standing firm in its vigour, valiant one, unrestrained in his strength, who tramples great mountains underfoot: you have subdued the heroes of the foreign lands, you have trampled upon all the foreign rulers, you have established your name to the ends of the world. Go now in peace to your master Ašimbabbar." And so he moored the boat at Enegir, the town built in splendour.  "Seed placed by the prince in the holy womb, born on the bright mountain, Ninazu, who like a wild bull which lows in its drinking, 8 lines missing or unclear"

akk: X [X]-e lal3-gin7 i3-nun […]  [ur-saĝ]-me-en ki-bal-ta ĝen-na […]  /lugal\ en inim šudu3-da ra2-zu-[ke4] /šag4\ mu-ni-pad3-pad3-de3  sipad šul-gi en šudu3-da ra2-zu-[ke4] šag4 mu-ni-pad3-pad3-/de3\  /lugal\ [^d-]/en\-lil2-le a2 šum2-ma a-ba mu-da-ĝa2-ĝa2  ḪI^?- X-[zu]-u3 a-ba mu-ku4-ku4  ḪI^?- X-na-zu-u3 a-ba ba-ta-e3-e3  [X] X lu2 šag4-zu-u3 mu-zu-a a2^!--zu   […] me3-zu   [a2] sud-sud-da-zu a-na ba-ta-an-e3-e3  anzud^mušen--gin7 gu3 dub2-da-zu-ne igi-zu-u3 a-ba ba-gub  ud-gin7 šeg12 gi4-gi4-da-zu-ne  kur GI ba9-ra2 NE-da ḫur-saĝ gi-gin7 saĝ im-mi-sag3-sag3  kur-ra e2-bi-a igi mu-ni-bar-bar  tidnum-e u6 dug3 i3-mi-dug4
en: "…… like syrup …… ghee ……. You, the hero, coming from the rebel land ……. O king, the lord of prayers and supplications has chosen you in his heart; shepherd Šulgi, the lord of prayers and supplications has chosen you in his heart. Who can rival a king to whom Enlil has given strength? Who can enter your ……? Who could escape your ……? ……. No one who knows you should desire your strength. If they wished …… battle with you ……, what could escape your outstretched arms? When you shriek like the Anzud-bird, who could stand before you? When you howl like the storm, the foreign lands and the hills tremble like a reed, a split reed ……. The people in the houses of the foreign lands gaze at your deeds , the people of Tidnum joyfully admire them."

akk: ^d-utu-gin7 ni2-zu-u3 me3-a dalla im-ma-ni-e3  ^d-nergal-gin7 ^ĝiš-tukul-zu-u3 uš2-a ka im-ma-ni-ba  ĝiš-gid2-da-zu-u3 u3-mun kalam-ma-ka šu ba-ni-gid2-gid2  ig gal iri-a-me-en3 bad3 gal kalam-ma-me-en3  sa-par3 an ki-e dub^!--ba-me-en3 ^ĝiš-uz3-saĝ ki-en-gi-da sig9-ga-me-en3  ar2^?--zu-u3 ḫe2-ĝal2-la X ḫu-mu-ni-ib2-pad3-de3  inim ^d-en-lil2-la2 niĝ2 gu-la-am3 saĝ-za an-dul3-eš2 ḫe2-em-ak  šag4 ki aĝ2 ^d-inana-ke4 šu na-ri2-bar-re
en: "As if you were Utu, your terror radiates in battle. As if you were Nergal, your battle-mace drools with gore and your spear reaches into the blood of the Land. You are the great door of the city, you are the great wall of the Land. You are a net piled up over heaven and earth, you are a cosmic bond laid for Sumer. May …… proclaim your glory in abundance! May the words of Enlil, which are so enormous, provide a shelter over your head! May the loving heart, Inana, never abandon you!"

akk: ^d-nin-a-zu-u3 MUNUS MA šudu3-da mi-ni-in-pad3-pad3-da-ta  u8 zid-da sila4 mu-ni-in-šar2-šar2^ar-  ud5 zid-da maš2 mu-ni-in-šar2-šar2^ar-  ab2 babbar2-ra amar bi2-/in\-du3-du3  ^d-nanna e2-temen-ni2-/guru3\-na mu-na-da-an-ku4-ku4-u3
en: After Ninazu had pronounced …… and blessings, Šulgi provided a lavish choice of ewes and lambs, he provided a lavish choice of goats and kids, he …… generously white cows and calves, and then entered with them before Nanna in his E-temen-ni-guru and lifted his head high in the royal chamber, its most suitable hall, in its royal offering place, the holy place.

akk: lugal-a-ni ^d-aš-im2-babbar2-re igi ḫul2-ḫul2-la-ni mu-ši-bar-ba-re  šul-gi sipad zid ki-en-gi-ra-ra nam mu-ni-ib2-tar-re  ur-saĝ en gaba-ĝal2 kur-kur-ra a2 zid-da kalam-ma  u3-ma gub-ba-ĝu10-u3 sa2 bi2-dug4 inim mu-dug4-ga im-ma-ni-ĝar  ki-bal nam ba-da-ku5-ra2-ĝa2 e2-bi du6-du6-ra2 /mi\-ni-ĝar-ĝar  itid ud-sakar me šu du7-du7-ĝa2 na-ba-an-kuš2-u3-de3-e  ^d-ezina2-gin7 mu-zu ka kalam-ma-ka ka kur-kur-ra-ka dug3-ge-eš2 ḫe2-eb^?--ĝal2^?-  [kug] ^d-nin-gal nin agrun-na-ke4 [ĝiš] ^kuš-ummud-da-gin7 [ur2] /ḫu\-mu-ri2-in-tal2-tal2  [^d-]suen-e nam dug3 mu-ni-in-tar^ar-
en: His master Ašimbabbar looked at him with joy and decreed a fate for Šulgi, the good shepherd of Sumer: "Hero, lord, mighty one of the foreign lands, the right arm of the Land, you have achieved victory for me, have carried out what I have commanded you. You have reduced to ruins the houses of the rebel land that I have cursed. May you never grow weary of perfecting the divine powers for me every month at the new moon! May your name be as sweet as that of Ezina in the mouth of the Land and in the mouths of all the countries! May holy Ningal, the lady of the shrine, spread out her lap for you, like the wooden frame of a waterskin!" Thus Suen decreed a good fate for him.

akk: e2-gal-maḫ ^d-nin-e2-gal-/la^?-\-kam barag kug-ga-a dur2 ba-a-ĝar  ^d-ištaran ki-en-gi-ra šag4-ta niĝ2-nam zu-u3    ga-eš8 «sar» kalam-ma ki-bi-še3 i3-ba-re  a2-tuku sig9-ga ša-ĝa2-aš-še3 la-ba-an-LAGAB-e  ama dumu-ni-ir sag9-ga mu-na-ab-be2  dumu a-a-ni-ir niĝ2-gen6-na mu-na-ni-ib2-gi4-gi4  ki-en-gi-re ḫe2-ĝal2 mu-da-ab-si^?-  urim2^ki--e giri17-zal mu-da-ab-sug4  ŠID-ni-še3 ga-ki-tir-da mu-da-a-ĝa2-ĝa2
en: He took his seat on the holy dais in the Egal-maḫ of Ninegala. He, the Ištaran of Sumer, omniscient from birth, decrees judgments in due order for the Land, and makes decisions in due order for the Land, so that the strong does not abuse the weak, so that the mother speaks tenderly with her child and the child answers truthfully to his father. Under him, Sumer is filled with abundance, Urim is prolonged in splendour, and …… is established.

akk: lugal-e <ku>-kur silim-e-eš2 dug4-ga-a nam-kalag-ga-ne-e dalla bi2-in-e3-a  /nam\-ur-saĝ-ĝa2-ni šu zid bi2-in-ĝa2-ra  ki-bal-e gu2 ki-še3 bi2-in-la2-a  iri-me urim2^ki--e ḫe2-ĝal2-la gu2-bi mi-ni-ib2-zig3-ga-a  lugal suḫx(MUŠ) za-gin3-na /gun3\-a dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2  men^!- daĝal-la saĝ an-še3 il2-il2  an-da ki maḫ-ḫa-na šag4 kuš2-u3 ur5-ra-aš-da barag gal-e sig9-a  i3-ti <ud> zal-la kalam-e kur-kur-re   en ^d-aš-im2-babbar2 za3^!--mi2
en: Because the king exulted in his triumph and let his might radiate, because he implemented his heroism perfectly, made the rebellious land bow and made our city, Urim, rise in prosperity; because the king is adorned with a lapis-lazuli crown ; because the son of Enlil lifts his head high, wearing a wide crown; because he takes counsel with An in his lofty place and is enthroned with Uraš on a great dais; because he makes the Land of Sumer and all the foreign lands dance with joy day and night, may Lord Ašimbabbar be praised.
Nisaba be praised!

akk: [X X] X X […]  [X X] X ba-ni-ĝar-/re\-[eš]  nam-lugal-ĝa2 ud-bi sud-/da\  bal-ĝa2 ḫe2-ĝal2 pa ed2-ed2-dam  ^d-en-ki en dug4-ga-ni nu-kur2-ru saĝ il2 ba-ni-kur9  ^d-utu inim-ma-ni saĝ-ba du maškim-še3 ma-an-šum2
en: 2 lines fragmentary To make my kingship longlasting, to make abundance conspicuous in my reign, Enki, the lord whose utterances cannot be altered, entered it proudly. He assigned Utu, whose words are pre-eminent, as a constable to me.

akk: ^d-nin-lil2 kalam-ma gu3 ḫul2-la ma-ni-de2-a-ke4-eš2  unken-na ĝizzal ma-ni-ak-ke4-eš2  šul-gi sipad zid ki-en-gi-ra-/me\-[en]  ĝa2-ĝiš-šu2-a e2 di  (X)-na]  e2 maḫ nam-[nin]-a tum2-ma-na  ^e2-pa-paḫ ki /u6\ di kur-kur-ra /ni2 ḫuš\ gur3-ru-na  e2 X X [X] /GI\ šag4-bi-a silim mu-/na\-[(X)-dug4]
en: Since Ninlil had given me her joyful blessing in the Land, and had caused me to be heard in the assembly, I, Šulgi, the faithful shepherd of Sumer, praised her in the Ĝa-ĝiš-šua, in her temple where lawsuits are decided justly, in her august temple befitting her ladyship, in her shrine imbued with terrible awesomeness, a place admired by all the foreign countries, within …….

akk: X gu2 mu-da-/ab\-[…]  urud niĝ2 kalag-ga-a X […]  lu2 ḫul-ĝal2 ^ĝiš-tukul-la mu-ši-[X X-a]  a2 aĝ2-ĝa2-ni-ta me3-a mu-ni-gaz-a  ur-saĝ gal-gal mu-til-la-ĝu10 bar-ba im-mi-X  gu2-bi-a ĝiri3-ĝu10 im-mi-gub  ki-gal-ba ni2-ĝu10 saĝ im-ma-ni-il2
en: 2 lines fragmentary …… the Strong Copper  ……. When at her command I killed in battle the evil people who …… against me with weapons, I …… all the great warriors slain by me. I placed my foot on their necks, and exalted my own person on their pedestals.

akk: alan kug-sig17 alan ^na4-za-gin3-na-ĝu10  kisal maḫ e2-niĝ2-ĝa2-ra-ka-na   aratta kug-gin7 gi16-sa mi-ni-ĝar-ĝar  e2-muḫaldim gal-la-ni gud udu ba-ni-ĝar  e2-gir4 maḫ-a-ni ḫe2-ĝal2-la bi2-de6  e2-lunga3 zabar-re ḫe2-du7-na  kaš-kaš(source: gud-gud)-bi-ta NE ki ba-ni-us2-us2  kaš gig2 kurun kaš su4 <e2> a2 sikil-ba sur-ra  kiĝ2-sig unu2 gal-la-ni ba-ni-ĝar  [X] X X […]
en: I lined up my gold statues and lapis-lazuli statues in the main courtyard of her E-niĝara. I filled it with treasures like those of holy Aratta. I despatched oxen and sheep to her great kitchens. I brought the abundant harvest into her imposing bakery. I …… beer in her brewery, most suited to the bronze vessels. I despatched dark beer, kurun beer, and brown beer, all brewed in its house of the pure strength , to her great dining hall for the evening meals. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

akk: /šeš\-[ĝu10] /U3^?-\ nu-/mu\-[e]-de3-RI-RI-[X]  gi-ru U3^?- nu-mu-[e]-de3-RI-RI-[X]   ki-ga  aĝ2-ĝu10 U3^?- /nu-mu\-e-de3-[RI]-/RI\   i-bi2  sag9-sag9-[ĝu10 U3^?-] [nu-mu-e]-de3-/RI-RI\^la-X-X-e-  an-bi šu-ĝa2 nu-mu-[e-de3]-/ĝa2\-ĝa2  garadin3-bi  /ma\-a-ar  A [X X] X X X X  X-bi  ma-a-[ar]  /A\ X [nu]-ku7-ku7-X  še guru7^?- X […] MA X [X]
en: "The …… because of you does not ……. My brother, the …… because of you does not ……. Lad , the …… because of you does not ……. My beloved, the …… because of you does not ……. My fairest of countenance, the …… because of you does not ……. Its date clusters because of you are not placed in my hand. Its sheaves are …… for me. Its …… are not sweet for me. Grain …… the silos ."

akk: nin9-ĝu10 /gana2\-[ĝu10-še3 ĝe26-e ga]-/ba\-e-de3-ĝen  nin9^!- [sag9-ga-ĝu10 gana2-ĝu10-še3 ĝe26-e ga-ba-e-de3]-/ĝen\  gana2 gal-[ĝu10-še3 ĝe26-e ga-ba-e-de3-ĝen]  gana2 tur-[ĝu10-še3 ĝe26-e ga-ba-e-de3-ĝen]  še nim X a šu-nim-[bi] /dug4\-[ga]-ĝu10-še3  še sig a sig-bi dug4-ga-ĝu10-še3  še-bi a gurun^?--na […]  garadin3-/bi\ X X NI […]
en: "My sister, I would go with you to my fields. My fair sister, I would go with you to my fields. I would go with you to my large fields. I would go with you to my small fields. For my early grain irrigated with its early water, for my late grain irrigated with its late water, …… its grain …… sheaves ……."

en: "My sister, I would go with you to my fields. My fair sister, I would go with you to my fields. …… the large fields. …… in my small fields." 2 lines fragmentaryunknown no. of lines missing

1 line fragmentary "In the …… of the ……, it has become fallow ……. In the …… of the sheaves, the date clusters ……. In the …… of the ……, it has become fallow ……. In the …… of the sheaves, the date clusters ……. Farmer, plough the field, set up the ……. …… of Lord Šulgi. For …… plough the field, set up the ……. He will bring offerings to the …… for you."

"My sister, I would go with you to my garden. My fair sister, I would go with you to my garden. My sister, I would go with you to my garden. My sister, …… my garden, …… the ildag tree. I would go with you to my ildag tree by the watercourse. My sister, I would go with you to my apple tree. May …… the apple tree be in my hand. My sister, I would go with you to my pomegranate tree and then …… there the sweet …… covered in honey."

en: "My sister, I would go with you to my garden. Fair sister, I would go with you to my garden. …… like the plants of the watercourse. 1 line fragmentary …… the sprout of a lettuce. I would …… plant there. I would …… plant there. In your silo …… I would …… for you. 1 line fragmentary Fair sister, luxuriant of heart ……. I would …… of the date-clusters for you ."

en: …… pure from birth ……. …… in the Land ……. 2 lines fragmentary

akk: [lugal]-ĝu10 eridug^ki--še3 na-ĝen  /nun\ [gal] a-a ^d-en-ki ḫul2-/la-a\  ^d-/šul-gi\-re eridug[^ki-]-še3 na-[ĝen]  nun gal [a]-a [^d-]/en\-ki /ḫul2-la-a\
en: My king went to Eridug. Great prince, Father Enki, rejoice! Šulgi went to Eridug. Great prince, Father Enki, rejoice!

akk: lugal-/ĝu10\ /nibru\^ki--še3 na-/ĝen\  kur gal a-/a\ [^d-en]-lil2 ḫul2-la-a  ^d-šul-gi-/re\ /nibru\^ki--še3 na-ĝen  kur gal a-a ^d-en-lil2 ḫul2-la-a
en: My king went to Nibru. Great Mountain, Father Enlil, rejoice! Šulgi went to Nibru. Great Mountain, Father Enlil, rejoice!

akk: lugal-ĝu10 e2-šu-[me]-/ša4\-še3 na-ĝen  en ^d-nin-[urta]-ke4 ḫul2-la-a  ^d-šul-gi-/re\ e2-šu-me-/ša4\-še3 na-ĝen  /en\ ^d-nin-/urta\-ke4 ḫul2-la-/NI^?-\
en: My king went to the E-šu-me-ša. Lord Ninurta, rejoice! Šulgi went to the E-šu-me-ša. Lord Ninurta, rejoice!
My king went to Keš. Ninsumun-zid-gal-ana, rejoice! Šulgi went to Keš. Ninsumun-zid-gal-ana, rejoice!

akk: lugal-/ĝu10\ urim2-še3 na-[ĝen]  en ^d-[aš]-/im4\-babbar /ḫul2\-[la-a]  ^d-šul-gi-/re\ [urim2^ki--še3 na-ĝen]  en ^d-aš-/im4\-[babbar] [ḫul2-la-a]
en: My king went to Urim. Lord Ašimbabbar, rejoice! Šulgi went to Urim. Lord Ašimbabbar, rejoice!

akk: /lugal\-ĝu10 e2-/babbar2\-še3 na-/ĝen\  sun4 [za-gin3] BA^?- X ḫul2-/la\-[a]  ^d-/šul\-gi-re e2-babbar2-še3 na-/ĝen\  sun4 za-gin3 BA^?- X ḫul2-[la-a]
en: My king went to the E-babbar. …… lapis-lazuli beard, rejoice! Šulgi went to the E-babbar. …… lapis-lazuli beard, rejoice!
My king went to Kulaba. Ninirigal, rejoice! Šulgi went to Kulaba. Ninirigal, rejoice!

akk: lugal-/ĝu10\ [ki] /zabalam2\^ki--še3 na-ĝen  […] [^d-]inana-ke4 ḫul2-la-a  [^d-]/šul\-gi-re ki /zabalam2\^ki--še3 na-ĝen  […] [^d-inana]-ke4 ḫul2-la-a
en: My king went to Zabalam. …… Inana, rejoice! Šulgi went to Zabalam. …… Inana, rejoice!

akk: X /kug-sig17^?- UD^?-\ X X [X X] mi2 ḫe2-ma-ni-/in\-[dug4]  ^ĝiš-^ ?-tukul-la ud sud X [X]-ĝa2^?- u18-ru-gin7 ki ḫe2-ma-ni-us2-/sa^?-\  /NI^?-\ [X] X RU X-ma-ĝu10-ne^?-  [X X] X X X X X [X X] X /gaba zig3-ga-ĝu10-ne^?-\
en: Let praise be sung for me that ……. Through weapons an enduring …… has been established for me like a tower, as I ……, as I rise in opposition …….

akk: [še-er]-/zid^?-\ ud-de9-eš2 mu2-a-gin7 [men] kug-ga mul-la-ĝu10-ne^?-  [ĝidru] maḫ nam-ḫe2-a ur4-ur4-ra šu-ĝu10-še3 ĝal2-la-bi  ^ĝiš-gu-za suḫuš gen6-na X X saĝ-eš2 rig7-ga-ĝa2^?-  X X saĝ^?- an-še3^?- ḫe^?--bi2^?--il2
en: When I am radiant in the holy crown like a brilliance that is renewed daily , and the majestic sceptre that amasses abundance has been entrusted into my hands, on my firmly founded throne …… granted as a gift …… I lift my head high.

akk: šul-gi sipad zid ki-en-gi-ra-me-en3 niĝ2-zid ki-bi-še3 ḫu-mu-ĝar-ĝa2-ar  mi2 gal-gal ni2-ĝu10 en-na bi2-dug4-ga  mu ^d-en-lil2-la2 lul ba-ra-/na ḫe2-gen6\
en: I am Šulgi, the good shepherd of Sumer, and I have always established justice. Like a flood, like onrushing water, I have torn out wickedness as being unclean . As much great praise as I have had sung about me -- by the name of Enlil, none is false, and all is true.

akk: am babbar2-gin7 saĝ ḫe2-/ši\-[…]  X X […]  X X […]  unken^?- ak^?- X […]  mi2-bi-im ḫu-/mu\-[dug4]  X X X X […]  [X] /URUD^?-\ X X [X]-/mu^?-\-dug4^?-  [X] X kalam^?--ma^?- ĝen^?--na-ĝa2^?- /mi2\-bi-im ḫu-/mu\-dug4  šu^?- dim4^?- niĝ2 sag9-ge X-gin7 ka-ga mi-ni-ĝal2-la^?- ĝa2-ra mi2 zid-bi-im ḫu-mu-dug4  ĝešpu2 lirum3^?--ta a2 ḫa-ma^?--gun3^?- mi2-bi-im ḫu-mu-dug4  a-la ^d-en-lil2^?--da^?- ma^?--ab^?--be2 kalam^?--ma gi4-a^?- X X X X NA ḪI NIM dar^?--ra^?--ĝa2^?-  eš3 nibru^ki--še3 ĝiri3 urim5^ki--ma-še3 šu niĝin2-niĝin2-na-ĝa2  kaskal da-na 30 ĝen-na-ĝa2 ĝa2-ra mi2 zid-bi-im ḫu-mu-/dug4\
en: Like a white wild bull ……. 1 line fragmentary
1 line fragmentary Let praise be sung that I have …… the assembly . 2 lines fragmentary
Let praise be sung, that I have gone across the …… of the Land. Let deserved praise be sung for me, that in every mouth I have put prudence , an attractive quality like …….

Let praise be sung, that I have shown strength in grappling and wrestling. Let deserved praise be sung for me, that I have …… in the Land, that I have made a return visit to the shrine Nibru and back along the road to Urim, and have marched a distance of 30 dana.

akk: ^d-alad X […]  ^d-amar-^d-/suen\ […] šag4 /mu-un\-X […]  lu2 ^urud-ḫa-zi-in-na e2^!--e KU X […]  ^d-amar-^d-suen-na eš3-e(source: SUM) abzu-a […]  kug-sig17 du3-a ^na4-za-gin3 šu tag X […]  e2-e du3-u3-de3 šu-ni mu-un-[ĝar]  ^d-amar-^d-suen-na lugal-e e2-e du3-u3-[de3] šu-ni mu-un-[ĝar]  lugal-/e^?- uĝ3\-e ba-da-an-bal kur-ra X […]
en: …… protective deity ……. Amar-Suena …… his heart. He who …… the temple with an axe ……. Amar-Suena …… the abzu shrine. …… built with gold, and decorated with lapis lazuli. He applied himself to building the temple; King Amar-Suena applied himself to building the temple. The people turned against the king, and the foreign countries …….

en: In the first year the temple remained in ruins, and he did not restore it. Amar-Suena …… the divine powers of kingship. In the second year it remained in ruins, and he did not restore it. Amar-Suena …… his royal garments for mourning clothes. In the third year it remained in ruins, and he did not restore it. Amar-Suena could not interpret the temple's ominous sign among the birch trees. In the fourth year it remained in ruins, and he did not restore it. Although he had been advised by a sage, he could not realise the plans of the temple. In the fifth year it remained in ruins, and he did not restore it. The abzu shrine has been …… by force. In the sixth year it remained in ruins, and he did not restore it. He was searching for the divine plan of the temple, but could not find it. In the seventh year it remained in ruins, and he did not restore it. Enki spoke to him about the temple, the temple that did not exist. In the eighth year, he applied himself to building the temple. By the ninth year, King Amar-Suena built the E-uduna of the wise lord like …….

en: Then the lord, the great lord Enki, destroyed the site of his own temple. 2 lines fragmentary Father Enki …… Eridug ……. …… his minister …… 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing
1 line fragmentary The guardian of the spacious land ……. As Enki lifted his gaze ……. Having left the temple …… in the abzu.

At that time mankind was not ……. Far-reaching wisdom, wise words were not ……. 1 line unclear To grieve and to do evil was good . Amar-Suena …… to build the temple of Enlil. unknown no. of lines missing

Lord ……. When he performed extispicy regarding the building of Enki's temple, the omen did not mention anything about the building of the temple, so he did not start it. To establish a lasting fame for himself, the king ……; to establish a lasting fame for himself, Amar-Suena ……. …… the temple of Enki ……. unknown no. of lines missing
Lord, wise prince …… 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing
He who ……. King Amar-Suena has not been assigned a fate from it.

akk: nin-e kug-ga-am3 in-tu-ud  a-bi-si2-im-ti kug-ga-am3 in-tu-ud  nin-e kug-ga-am3 in-tu-ud  ĝiš-gen6-na tug2 nam-sag9-ga-ĝu10 a-bi-si2-im-ti-ĝu10  ^ĝiš-saĝ-du tug2 dun-na ĝal2-[la]-ĝu10 nin-ĝu10 ku-ba-tum
en: It was she who gave birth to the holy one, gave birth to the holy one; the queen gave birth to the holy one, Abī-simtī  gave birth to the holy one, the queen gave birth to the holy one -- my cloth beam of the cloth of pleasure, my Abī-simtī! My warp beam placed for weaving, my queen Kūbatum !

akk: suḫur-e /du7\ [u6 di]-/de3\ X gub-ba-ĝu10  u3-mu-un  ^d-šu-^d-suen-ĝu10  inim-ma X […] X X [X]-ĝu10  /du5\-mu  ^d-šul-gi-ra-ĝu10  bi2-dug4-ga-ke4-eš bi2-dug4-ga-ke4-eš  u3-mu-un-e aĝ2  ma-an-ba   me-e  a-al-la-ri bi2-dug4-ga-ke4-eš  u3-mu-un-e aĝ2  ma-an-ba  bulug kug-sig17 ^na4-kišib3 za-gin3-na  u3-mu-un-e aĝ2  ma-an-ba  ḫar kug-sig17 ḫar kug-babbar  u3-mu-un-e aĝ2  ma-an-[ba]
en: My one suited to a mane of hair, a wonder to behold, my lord Šu-Suen, my one …… in words, my son of Šulgi -- because I uttered, because I uttered, the lord gave me a gift, because I uttered an exclamation of joy, the lord gave me a gift. The lord gave me as a gift a golden pin, a lapis-lazuli seal. The lord gave me as a gift a golden ring, a silver ring.

akk: u3-mu-un aĝ2-ba-/zu\ na-/aĝ2\-X  sug4-ga-am3 igi-zu ḫa-[ma-ab-il2]-/il2\  ^d-šu-^d-suen  aĝ2-ba-zu /na\-[aĝ2-X]  /sug4-ga-am3\ igi-zu ḫa-ma-[ab-il2-il2]  […]  /u3\-mu-un  X […]  u3-mu-/un\  […]  […] X sag9-gin7^?- X […]-ĝu10 KU-gin7 mu-[…]   uru2-zu  kud-da-gin7 šu ḫe2-eb2-/mu2^?-\  u3-mu-un  ^d-šu-^d-suen-ĝu10  ur-/nim\-gin7 ĝiri3-zu-še3 ḫe2-nu2  du5-mu  ^d-šul-gi-ra-/ĝu10^?-\
en: O lord, your gifts are ……, may you cast your eyes on me. O Šu-Suen, your gifts are ……, may you cast your eyes on me. …… lord …… lord ……. Like pleasant ……. May your city stretch out its hands to you like a crab , my lord Šu-Suen. May it lie down at your feet like a lion-cub, my son of Šulgi.

akk: AN X X X-ĝu10 za-bi-tum-ma kaš-a-ni  ze2-ba-am3   kaš-a-ni-gin7 gal4-la-ni  ze2-ba-am3  kaš-a-ni  ze2-ba-am3   ka-ga14-a-ni-gin7 gal4-la-ni  ze2-ba-am3  kaš-a-ni  ze2-ba-am3   ^d-šu-^d-suen ba-sag9-ge-na-ĝu10  ba-sag9-ge-na-ĝu10 ba-zil2-zil2-i-na-ĝu10  ^d-šu-^d-suen ba-sag9-ge-na-ĝu10  ki aĝ2 ^d-en-lil2-la2 ^d-šu-^d-suen-ĝu10  lugal-ĝu10 diĝir kalam-ma-na
en: My ……, the barmaid's beer is sweet. Like her beer her genitals are sweet, her beer is sweet. Like her mouth her genitals are sweet, her beer is sweet. Her diluted beer, her beer is sweet -- my Šu-Suen, who pleased me, who pleased me, who delighted me, my Šu-Suen who pleased me, my Šu-Suen, beloved of Enlil, my king, the god of his Land!
28. It is a balbale of Bau.

akk: mu-ti-in  šag4-ĝa2  /mu-lu\ [ki-ig-ga  aĝ2-ĝu10]  ḫi-li-zu  aĝ2 ze2-ba-am3  lal3-[am3 ku7-ku7-da]  gi-ru šag4-ĝa2  mu-lu ki-ig-ga  /aĝ2\-[ĝu10]  ḫi-li-zu  aĝ2 ze2-ba-am3  lal3-am3 ku7-ku7-da
en: Man of my heart, my beloved man, your allure is a sweet thing, as sweet as honey. Lad of my heart, my beloved man, your allure is a sweet thing, as sweet as honey.

akk: en-dab5-en ni2-ĝa2  du5-mu-u8-ši-ĝen    mu-ti-in  ga-ba-e-da-kar ki  mu-nu2-da-še3   en-dab5-en ni2-ĝa2  du5-mu-u8-ši-ĝen   gi-ru ga-ba-e-da-kar ki  mu-nu2-da-še3
en: You have captivated me , of my own free will I shall come to you. Man, let me flee with you -- into the bedroom. You have captivated me ; of my own free will I shall come to you. Lad, let me flee with you -- into the bedroom.

akk: mu-ti-in aĝ2 ze2-ze2-ba du5-mu-u8-ak    ze2-ba  kal-la-ĝu10 lal3-e  da-aĝ2-e-ga   e2^!- ki-nu2-a lal3 ḫab2 dug4-ga-ba  ḫi-li  aĝ2 ze2-ba-zu  ga-ba-ḫul2-ḫul2-le-en-de3-en  gi-ru  aĝ2 ze2-ze2-ba du5-mu-u8-ak    ze2-ba  kal-la-ĝu10 lal3-e  da-aĝ2-e-ga
en: Man, let me do the sweetest things to you. My precious sweet, let me bring you honey. In the bedchamber dripping with honey let us enjoy over and over your allure, the sweet thing. Lad, let me do the sweetest things to you. My precious sweet, let me bring you honey.

akk: mu-ti-in ma-ra  ḫi-li mu-e-kar  ama-ĝu10-ra dug4-ga-na-ab ni2  mu-ra-ab-ze2-eĝ3-e   ad-da-ĝu10-ur2  aĝ2  ba-ba mu-un-ba  ur5-za(source: SA6) ki ur5 sag9-ge-bi mu-zu   mu-ti-in  ud te-en-še3 e2-me-a nu2-a  šag4-za ki šag4 ḫul2-bi mu-zu  gi-ru ud te-en-še3 e2-me-a nu2-a
en: Man, you have become attracted to me. Speak to my mother and I will give myself to you; speak to my father and he will make a gift of me. I know where to give physical pleasure to your body -- sleep, man, in our house till morning. I know how to bring heart's delight to your heart -- sleep, lad, in our house till morning.

akk: za-e  ma-a-ra  ki mu-e-a-aĝ2-a-ta  gi-ru  ma-a-ra aĝ2 ze2-ba-zu  nu-uš-mu-e-a-ak-e
en: Since you have fallen in love with me, lad, if only you would do your sweet thing to me.

akk: u3-mu-un  diĝir-ĝu10  u3-mu-un  ^d-lamma-ĝu10  ^d-šu-^d-suen šag4  ^d-mu-ul-lil2-la2-ke4 ba-ze2-be2-en-na-ĝu10   ki  ze2-ba-zu  nu-uš-mu-e-a-ak-a  ki lal3-gin7  ze2-ba-zu  šu nu-uš-mu-e-tag-ge
en: My lord and god, my lord and guardian angel, my Šu-Suen who cheers Enlil's heart, if only you would handle your sweet place, if only you would grasp your place that is sweet as honey.

akk: tug2 ^ĝiš-ba-an-na-gin7 šu de6-ma-ni  tug2 ^ĝiš-ba-an sum-ki-na-gin7 šu gun3-gun3-ma-ni
en: Touch me like a cover does a measuring cup. Adorn me like the cover on a cup of wood shavings .
30. It is a balbale of Inana.

akk: siki-ĝu10 ḫi-iz^sar--am3 a im-/ma\-[an-dug4]  su-ḫu-uḫ2-ḫu-ub4-bi ba-tag-tag [X]  siki-ĝu10 a-a-lum im-mi-in-ak  suḫ tur-tur-bi mu-un-dub-dub  ḫe2-em-du-ĝu10   ḫe2-em-du siki-ĝu10 ḫi-iz^sar- nisig sag9-sag9-ga-am3
en: My hair is lettuce, well watered. It is the sprout of a lettuce, well watered. Its tangled coils have been tightened. My nursemaid has …… them high and made my hair stag-like. She has tightened its tiny hairgrips and brought order to my charms; my charms, my hair, the lettuce, is the fairest of plants.

akk: /šeš\-e igi bar lu2 til3^!--la-na im-ma-/ni\-in-kur9-re-en  [^d-]šu-^d-suen /saĝ^?--ba^?-\ lu2 sag9-ga im-ma-ni-in-pad3-/de3\-[en]  [X X] X X [ḫi-li]-ĝu10 nu-/til\-le-dam  […]-re-dam
en: The brother has brought me into his life-giving gaze, Šu-Suen, the …… handsome man, has chosen me. …… my allure is without end, 1 line fragmentary 5 lines missing

akk: u3-mu-un-me  ḫe2-me-en  u3-[mu]-/un\-me  ḫe2-me-en  kug ^na4-za-gin3-na  u3-mu-un-me  ḫe2-me-en   mu-un-gar3  še maḫ tum3-me ḫe2-me-en
en: You are our lord, you are our lord, of silver and lapis lazuli, you are our lord. You are our farmer who brings superb grain.

akk: igi-ĝa2 lal3-bi-im šag4-ĝa2 ḫi-li-bi-im  ud nam-til3-la ḫe2-en-na-e3 ^d-šu-^d-suen […]
en: He is honey to my eyes, he is the charm of my heart. May the light of life shine for him, may Šu-Suen …….
23. It is a balbale of Inana.

akk: ^d-nin-urta X /mar\-uru5 ug gal šen-šen-na ru-ru-gu2  a2-ĝal2 uĝ3 erim2 X /RA\ SU  uru2  gul-lu a2-dam saḫar-re-eš gi4
en: Ancient warrior, greatly respected and forceful, with the strength of a full-grown lion! Ninurta, …… flood, great lion, fierce opponent in battle! Mighty one, who …… the enemy peoples, destroyer of cities, who turns the settlements into dust! Ninurta, great wild bull, a battering ram who …… great walls!
5. Barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  a-ma-ru ki-bal-še3 ḫu-luḫ-ḫa gaba-šu-ĝar nu-tuku  lugal ^d-šu-^d-suen uĝ3 daĝal-la mu-ni X-zu  e2-šu-me-ša4 ki-tuš kug igi-šu-galam ki nam /tar\-[re]-za  kisal maḫ-ba^!- gud gal udu gal-e   ^d-šu-^d-suen-na šu ḫa-ra-ni-in-mu2-[mu2 …]  ^d-nin-urta til3 ud su3-ra2-ka NA X […]  ^d-šu-^d-suen-na til3 ud su3-ra2-ka NA /gu2^?-\ […]
en: A flood which frightens the rebel lands, without rival! Ninurta, deathly hush, {…… bolt of lightning , ……} { imbued with fearsomeness, ……, …… the enemy}. You have made the name of King Šu-Suen known among the widespread people. When he directs big bulls and big sheep to the main courtyard of your E-šu-me-ša, the holy residence, the Igi-šu-galam in which the fates are determined, may he greet you from its holy royal offering place, may Šu-Suen greet you from there. …… Ninurta …… long life ……. …… long life …… for Šu-Suen.
15. Šagbatuku.

akk: [šag4]-ba-tuku^!--/am3\  [X X] /a2\-ni sud-sud X […]  […] X X X […]  [^d-]/nin\-urta dumu-saĝ ^d-en-lil2-la2 su-lim-ma X […]  [X] X gu2^?--e me ĝar^?- TE X X DI X […]  […] X X X […]
en: 2 lines fragmentary Ninurta, firstborn son of Enlil, …… fearsomeness. 2 lines fragmentary
21. 2nd barsud.

akk: [bar]-sud 2-[kam-ma]-/am3\  […] X šu nu-te AB^?--/AB^?-\ […] X X  [X X (X)] X si gal-a-ni^?- NA^?- X […] X RA  [X] X ḫuš-am3 an-ur2 X […] X I  ^d-nin-urta kalag-ga ux(PA)-a /maḫ\ [^d-]nin-lil2-le tud-da  i-lim u5 X X (X) ^d-šu-^d-suen ^d-en-lil2-še3 ĝal2-la  ^d-nin-urta bad3 gal-a-ni ḫe2-me-en igi dug3 ḫu-mu-ni-du8  [^d-šu]-[^d-]/suen\ bad3 gal-a-ni ḫe2-me-en igi dug3 ḫu-mu-ni-du8
en: 2 lines fragmentary …… raging …… horizon ……. Ninurta, the strong one, the august provider, born of Ninlil! …… deathly hush …… Šu-Suen who is always at Enlil's service. Ninurta, may you be his great wall, may you look on him favourably; may you be Šu-Suen's great wall, may you look on him favourably.
29. Sa-gida.
Ninurta, may you be the aid of my Šu-Suen's weapons.
31. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: [ĝiš]-gi5-ĝal2-bi-im  […] LU tir KA galam-ma kur-šag4-še3 dub3 bar-re  [^d-nin]-urta ulu3 maḫ ki-bal-a kuš7 lu2-ra su-su  [sa2-ĝar me] [e2]-kur-ra šu du7 ĝiškim-til3 a-a-na  [^d-]nin-urta tir KA galam-ma kur-šag4-še3 dub3 bar-re  ^d-nin-urta ulu3 maḫ ki-bal-a kuš7 lu2-ra su-su  sa2-ĝar me e2-kur-ra šu du7 ĝiškim-til3 a-a-na  lugal-ĝu10 a2 maḫ ^d-en-lil2-la2 kur šu-ni nu-e3  [^d-]šu-^d-suen X X a2 maḫ šum2-ma a-a ^d-en-lil2-la2-ra  ^d-nin-urta /me3\ šen-šen-na šar2 ša-mu-na-an-gul-e  ^d-nin-urta a2 maḫ ^d-en-lil2-la kur šu-ni nu-e3  ^d-šu-^d-/suen\ X X a2 maḫ šum2-ma a-a ^d-en-lil2-la2-ra  ^d-nin-/urta\ /me3\ šen-šen-na /šar2 ša-mu\-na-an-gul-e
en: …… who moves fast into the heart of the mountains! Ninurta, massive stormwind over the rebel lands, devastating the people! Counsellor, who controls perfectly the divine powers of the E-kur, support of his father! Ninurta, …… who moves fast into the heart of the mountains! Ninurta, massive stormwind over the rebel lands, devastating the people! Counsellor, who controls perfectly the divine powers of the E-kur, support of his father! My king, the great strength of Enlil, from whose grasp no foreign country can escape! For Šu-Suen ……, given great strength by Father Enlil -- you, Ninurta, will destroy myriads in the battle and the fray. Ninurta, the great strength of Enlil, from whose grasp no foreign country can escape! For Šu-Suen ……, given great strength by Father Enlil -- you, Ninurta, will destroy myriads in the battle and the fray.

akk: lugal-ĝu10 me ul dili ša-ba-<ak> kiĝ2 gal-le-eš rib-[ba]  ^d-nin-urta u2-sa11-an sig7-ga kalam-ma ni2 ru-ru-gu2  ^d-uraš kug-gin7 ušum su-lim-ma izi-ĝar ḫuš il2-[il2-i]  ^d-nin-urta me ul dili ša-ba-ak kiĝ2 gal-le-eš rib-[ba]  ^d-nin-urta u2-sa11-an sig7-ga kalam-ma ni2 ru-ru-[gu2]  ^d-uraš kug-gin7 ušum su-lim-ma izi-ĝar ḫuš il2-il2-/i\  lugal-ĝu10 maḫ-di ur-saĝ gal ne-ni-da nir-ĝal2  ^d-šu-^d-suen ĝiškim ḫu-mu-un-til3-en en ^d-nin-urta-ra  lugal ^d-en-lil2-le ma-ra-an-šum2-ma-a maškim-zu ḫe2-a  ^d-nin-urta maḫ-di ur-saĝ gal ne-ni-da nir-ĝal2  ^d-šu-^d-suen ĝiškim ḫu-mu-un-til3-en en ^d-nin-urta-ra  /lugal\ ^d-en-lil2-le ma-ra-an-šum2-ma-a maškim-zu ḫe2-a  […] X ^na4-nir7-a kug su-lim-ma kiĝ2 gal-le-eš rib-ba  […] X-gin7 a2 maḫ-za im-mi-in-DU mu-zu [im-mi]-/in\-sar  […] ul-še3 nam-til3-la-ni en-nu-uĝ3 ši-im-[…-ak]  [^d-šu]-/^d-\suen-na kug su-lim-ma kiĝ2 gal-le-eš rib-ba  [X X]-/gin7 a2 maḫ-za\ im-[mi-in]-DU mu-zu im-mi-in-sar  [… ul-še3 nam-til3-la-ni en-nu]-/uĝ3\ ši-im-[…-ak]
en: My king, you alone perform the ancient rites, a truly immense task. Ninurta, yellow evening light that casts fear over the Land, like holy Uraš, a fearsome dragon brandishing a terrible torch! Ninurta, you alone perform the ancient rites, a truly immense task. Ninurta, yellow evening light that casts fear over the Land, like holy Uraš, a fearsome dragon raising a terrible torch! My king, grandiloquent great warrior, confident in his strength! And may you, Šu-Suen, put your trust in him, in Lord Ninurta. May Šu-Suen, the king whom Enlil has appointed for you, be your constable. Ninurta, grandiloquent great warrior, confident in his strength! And may you, Šu-Suen, put your trust in him, in Lord Ninurta. May Šu-Suen, the king whom Enlil has appointed for you, be your constable. …… of nir stone, …… holy and fearsome ……, a truly immense task. Like …… your august strength, he has written your name on it. …… will be the guardian of his life forever. Šu-Suen! Holy and fearsome, a truly immense task. Like …… your august strength, he has written your name on it. …… will be the guardian of his life forever. 1 line missing
63. Sa-ĝara.
Warrior from birth …….
2. Šagbatuku.

akk: /šag4\-[ba-tuku …]  ^d-šu-^d-suen gal-zu X X […]  X X MU lu2 X X X […]  […] X U3 barag X […]  X X [X X] mu-na-ab-X […] ḫi-li me-/te\ […]
en: Wise Šu-Suen ……. 1 line fragmentary …… dais ……. …… the beauty and ornament …….
7. 2nd barsud.

en: An ……. Šu-Suen ……. 2 lines fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing
1 line fragmentary Šu-Suen …… rising …….
3. Sa-gida.
1 line fragmentary
5. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-gida.
As An determined the fates ……. Holy An determined the fates, …… the shrine Urim ……. Like the sunlight An …… for Šu-Suen.
9. Its uru.
10. An adab of An.

akk: /še\-er-zid bad-ta […]  an-na ni2-/bi\ X […]  [X] ĜA2^?- kal […]  ^d-/suen\ […]  ^d-šu-^d-/suen\ […] BAD MU X [X X]  ^d-nanna ša-/mu-u8^?-\-da-an-u5 AN […]
en: …… from the distant radiance, …… in heaven, 1 line fragmentary Suen, ……, …… Šu-Suen. Nanna has elevated …….
7. Barsud.

akk: bar-sud-[am3]  ḫi-li an-na nun uraš-a-X  šul ^d-suen u18-ru ud an ki  mu ḫe2-ĝal2-la [(X)] X dug3 ki-bi-še3^!- zal-e  /^d-nanna\ en itid-da u3-tud-[(X)]  /^d-šu\-^d-suen-ĝu10 mu-un-u3-/tud\
en: The beauty of heaven, the prince of earth, youthful Suen, the immense, the light of heaven and earth, who makes years of prosperity and good …… last permanently, Nanna, the lord who is born each month, sired my Šu-Suen.
13. Šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  peš10-ĝal2 ne3 gal diĝir gal-e-ne  a-a ^d-nanna di-zu eš-bar galam  ^d-nu-nam-nir-da nam gal tar-re  ^d-aš-im2-babbar šul ki aĝ2-ĝa2-na  ^d-šu-^d-suen-ĝu10-ur2 nam mu-ni-ib-tar-re
en: Mighty one, great power among the great gods, Father Nanna, your judgments are ingenious decisions -- deciding great destinies with Nunamnir, his beloved youth Ašimbabbar decides destiny for my Šu-Suen.
19. 2nd barsud.

akk: bar-sud 2-kam-ma-am3  ud /ĝi6 dug3\-dug3 mu zu2 keše2-de3  /^d-^ ?-nanna^?-\ aga3 an kug-ga-ke4  [X X] X X-ni ^d-šu-^d-suen-ĝu10  X [X] X X X X zu ki-zu /ka^?-\  X [X X] X A saĝ MU X […]
en: The light which sweetens the night and structures the year, Nanna, the crown of the holy heavens, …… my Šu-Suen, 2 lines fragmentary
25. 2nd šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku 2-kam-ma-am3  [X] ^d-/nanna^?-\ /en^?-\ gal an ki-a-ka  [X X] X X X pa bi2-in-e3  […] X al-barag2-ge  […] X X X X  […] X X  […] X NAM […]  […] X X X X […]  […] /kisal^?-\ aga zid an-na X [(X)]  […] X saĝ-ĝa2 na mi-ni-in-de5  [^d-šu]-[^d-suen]-ĝu10 nun kalam-ma-ka
en: …… Nanna is the great lord of heaven and earth. …… has made manifest ……. …… is spreading ……. 2 lines fragmentary approx. 1 line missing2 lines fragmentary ……, the just crown …… in heaven, …… on his head, he has given guidance. My Šu-Suen is the prince of the Land.
37. Sa-barsuda.
……, lengthen the days for my Šu-Suen, my Šu-Suen who has grown as high as the heavens.
40. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: /ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi\-im  en dumu an-na […]-a  si mul-mul-/da^?-\ […] X-ka  ^d-nanna gal-di […] NE  KA-KA-ga niĝ2 X PA X X X  ud ĝiš-ḫe2-a ud uraš-a  su-lim-ma-ni uĝ3-e dub3 bar-bar-re  en ^d-aš-im2-babbar /ušum\ pa e3  šul ^d-suen muš3 kug ki us2-sa  ^d-nanna an ki-a u5^?--a e3^e-  [^d-šu]-^d-suen kalam-ma am3-mi-in-u5
en: The lord, the son of An, ……, …… with shining horns, renowned Nanna, ……, whose commands ……, the light of the firmament, the light of the earth, whose luminosity speeds to the people, Lord Ašimbabbar, a viper made visible, the youth Suen whose holy countenance approaches the earth, Nanna -- just as he appears elevated in heaven and above earth, so he has elevated Šu-Suen over the Land.

akk: [(X) X] /ni2^?-\ gur3^?--ru an-e ušumgal  [X X] X ni2^!- gur3-ru an-na [X]  [X X] X nun ^d-šu-^d-suen-ĝu10 nir ša-mu-/u8\-da-ĝal2-la  […] gu2-da mu-ni-in-la2-/la2\  [X] X [X X] kur-kur niĝ2-daĝal-/ba^?-\  /ĝidru ud\ su3-ra2 X X [X X]  uĝ3 ki-bal-a X [X] BI X  dumu nun zi-le ^d-[en-lil2]-/la2\-še3  ^d-šu-^d-suen šu-ni-a [X] /mi\-in-si  lugal-ĝu10 EZEN X-la  ^d-šu-^d-suen giri17-zal X [X] X-ka
en: …… imbued with awesomeness, a dragon for the heavens, …… imbued with awesomeness, …… in the heavens, ……, the prince who trusts in you, my Šu-Suen, …… has embraced ……. …… all the lands in their vastness, …… the sceptre of distant days. The people of the rebel lands, …… all of them ……, have entrusted …… to Šu-Suen for the beneficent princely son of Enlil. My king ……, Šu-Suen …… in celebration!
63. Sa-ĝara.
…… my Šu-Suen days of life.
65. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: <ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im>  en an-na dug3-ĝal2 ki […]  šul ^d-suen en an-na-kam X […]  /^d-\šu-^d-/suen\ X X X […]
en: May the lord of heaven, the well-disposed one, …… the earth, youthful Suen, the lord of heaven, ……, …… Šu-Suen.
69. Its uru.
King Šu-Suen, forceful lord, unknown no. of lines missing

akk: ^d-šu-^d-suen lu2 ^d-nanna di zu-gin7 [X X]-ga igi ^d-en-lil2-la2-še3  u3-tud-da-zu-ta lu2 ne-me-en mu ^d-nanna-e sa4  šu-^d-suen /dumu\ ur-saĝ an-na ki /aĝ2\ ^d-en-lil2-la2  e2-kur za-gin3-ta saĝ il2-la ^d-uraš-e /tud\-da  šag4 ^d-uraš-a-ke4 pad3-da-am3 kur-kur-ra ḫa-ba-il2  suḫ-gir11 saĝ maḫ ^d-en-lil2-la2-kam ^ĝiš-ĝidru-ni ḫe2-su3-ud  dili-ni ĝiš tuku ^d-en-lil2-la2-kam a2 maḫ šum2-ma-am3  šu dug4-ga an za-gin3-na-kam ^d-nin-lil2-la2 tam-ma-ni-im  /^d-šu\-^d-suen ux(PA)-a ḫi-li mul-mul IGI^?- X DI^?- […]
en: God of prosperity born to An and gazed upon by Uraš -- Šu-Suen, like Nanna expert in judgment, …… before Enlil, from your birth you were a man of might whose name was proclaimed by Nanna! Šu-Suen, heroic son of An, beloved of Enlil, head held high in the lapis-lazuli E-kur, given birth by Uraš, chosen by the heart of Uraš, you have been elevated over all the lands. Ornament and august servant of Enlil -- whose sceptre has reached far, who alone has Enlil's ear! Endowed with majestic strength, creation of lustrous An, favourite of Ninlil -- Šu-Suen, provider who radiates beauty, ……!
11. 1st kirugu.
Šu-Suen …… a life of distant days.
13. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-/ĝal2\-[bi-im]  [X X (X)] /^d-\en-lil2-la2 mi-ni-[…]  [X X] [^d-šu]-[^d-]suen AN X […]  saĝ /il2\ […] /tum2^?-\-ma […]  sun4 za-gin3 [sud-sud] [^d-]utu-gin7 kur-kur-ra […]  ^d-šu-^d-suen nir-/ĝal2^?-\ eš3 me i-i /AN\ […]  mir ni2 girid2 i-lim kalam-ma keše2^?- nam-gal-/še3^?-\ […]  ĝiš-nu11 il2 si AN-AN keše2 an-na a2 maḫ ^d-/en\-[lil2-la2]  dili-ni en ḫe2-ĝal2-la ^d-šu-^d-suen piriĝ gal barag-ge2-e-ne
en: …… of Enlil ……, …… Šu-Suen ……, head held high ……, wearing a long lustrous beard, …… like Utu over all the lands, authoritative Šu-Suen, …… the shrine that brings forth the divine powers, fearsome storm, …… radiance of the Land …… for greatness; who bears light, …… rays of heaven; majestic strength of Enlil, who alone is the lord of abundance -- Šu-Suen, great lion among sovereigns!
22. 2nd kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 2-/kam\-ma-am3  a-a ^d-en-lil2 en nam tar-re a2-tuku-/ni ḫe2\-me-en  ^d-utu-gin7 ḫe2-du7-ni ḫe2-me-en ^d-nin-[lil2] eš3 maḫ-a-kam  en sig7-ga ^d-en-ki nam tar-re a-a /ĝeštug2\ [daĝal]-la-kam  gal-an-zu ^d-en-lil2-le igi ĝal2-la-ni-/še3\ [X X] UN zid-de3-eš […]  lugal-ĝu10 diĝir nam tar-ra ki ur5 sag9-ge […]  ^d-šu-^d-suen  ka-aš bar-re-da X X X  lugal-ĝu10 a2 bad ḫu-mu-ni-/in\-[…]
en: You are the mighty one of Father Enlil, the lord who determines destinies! Like Utu, you are an ornament to Ninlil of the majestic shrine, and to fair Lord Enki who determines destinies, the father of broad understanding! Wise Enlil has justly …… to the one he has scrutinised. My king, the gods who determine destinies …… in the place that soothes the spirit. Šu-Suen, …… to pronounce judgments and render verdicts. My king, …… outstretched arms.
30. 3rd kirugu.
The great lord Šu-Suen …… years of abundance.
32. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-[ĝal2-bi-im]  /saĝ\ il2 men /lugal du7\ dumu ^d-nin-/sumun2\-[na]  /peš10-ĝal2\ gaba-/ĝal2\ /^d-\a-nun-na-ke4-e-ne […]  ^d-šu-^d-suen kug ^d-inana-ke4 pa e3 /mu^?-\-[…]  /šag4\ ki aĝ2 ḫi-li niĝ2 nu-til-/le\-dam munus zid […]  saĝ-tab-zu ma-ra-an-[šum2] [^d-]en-lil2-le gu2-da /ḫu\-[…]  kalag-ga a2 maḫ /šum2\-ma kur gal-la usu-ni-ta […]  ur-saĝ en barag-/barag\-ge2-ne /zag\ dib piriĝ gal-bi-im  ^d-šu-^d-suen alan sag9 aga za-gin3 gaba kug-ga u6 [di]  /ur\-[saĝ] nam-diĝir-še3 /tud\-da me-te nam-lugal-la  […] X an ki-a zag kalam-ma-še3 kalag-ga
en: Head held high, fit for the royal crown, son of Ninsumun, mighty and forceful among the Anuna gods ……. Šu-Suen! Holy Inana made manifest ……. Enlil has given to you as your helper the beloved heart whose beauty is unending, the good woman …… -- you have embraced her. Strong one given majestic strength by the Great Mountain, …… from his power; hero excelling all lords and sovereigns, who is their great lion -- Šu-Suen, gracious figure, shining crown, holy breast wondrous to behold, hero born for godhood, ornament of kingship, …… in heaven and on earth, strong as far as the borders of the Land!
43. 4th kirugu.

akk: [ki]-/ru-gu2\ 4-kam-ma-/am3\  […] X ga-an-i-i  […] [^d-nin]-/lil2\-la2-kam in-nin9 X ḫe2-en-na-/nam\  […]-/le\ ^d-utu-gin7 kalam daĝal TAG^?- [(…)] /im-mi-in\-si  […] [^d-šu]-^d-suen /u2^?--a^?-\-zu sud-am3  […]-ra-ra
en: I shall praise ……. …… of Ninlil is indeed the …… mistress! Like Utu, …… has filled the broad Land ……. ……, Šu-Suen, your provider is distant. 1 line fragmentary

akk: šul ^d-suen ud ĝiš-ḫe2 e3-a-še3^?- ^d-en-lil2-le il2-la  su-lim daĝal idim-e dirig ^d-nin-lil2-le tud-da  diĝir muš3-a-ni^!- UN-UN unken kur-kur-ra DU [X]  iti6 X ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10 X X X X mu-un-[…]  me nam-nun-na-ni an-da gu2 la2-[am3]  u18-ru-ni giri17-zal ki us2-sa-[am3]  ^d-aš-im2-babbar-re ^d-i-bi2-^d-/suen\-[ĝu10]  kalam-ma ku6-ĝal2-bi-še3 uĝ3 daĝal-la X […]  ^d-nanna men zid-da dalla mu-[…-e3]  ĝidru ud du6-ul-la ^d-aš-im2-/babbar\ […]  ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10 uĝ3 daĝal-la gu2^?- X […]
en: Lord whose divine powers cannot be dispersed, who emits an awe-inspiring radiance, great crown! Youthful Suen, light elevated by Enlil to shine forth in the firmament, wide-spreading majestic light, floating over the deep , born of Ninlil, god whose appearance is ……, …… in the assembly of the lands! The moonlight ……, my Ibbi-Suen, ……. His princely divine powers embrace the heavens; his …… is splendid, reaching the earth. Ašimbabbar ……, my Ibbi-Suen, to be canal inspector in the Land among the widespread people. Nanna has made the righteous crown shine forth radiantly. Ašimbabbar has …… you the sceptre ……. My Ibbi-Suen, among the widespread people …….

akk: ub-da an ki-ka kalam dug3-ga ĝiri3-na^?- […]  ^d-nanna kur-kur-ra me-ni am3-[…]  an ki niĝ2-daĝal-ba pa MU X X […]  an-e nir GI-ba ^d-aš-[im2-babbar] […]  ^d-nanna nam-šul-la X ḫu^?--[…]  ul-še3 me ud til3-la X X mu-ni-[…]  ^d-i-<bi2>-^d-suen-ĝu10 X ḫu-mu-na-ni-[…]  dug4-ga-ni u18-ru gal sag2 nu-di-dam  ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen šu maḫ-a-ni im-dab^?-  zid-de3-eš-še3 mu-na-an-ak mu dug3 sa4-a-ni
en: In the corners of heaven and earth, in the beautiful land …… beneath his feet, Nanna has …… his divine powers in all lands; he has …… widely in heaven and earth. An …… Ašimbabbar ……. Nanna has …… him in his youthfulness; he has …… the divine powers of his lifetime forever. May he …… my Ibbi-Suen. Nanna's command is a great …… which cannot be dispersed. Ibbi-Suen has grasped his august hand; he has acted truthfully for him, and so is named with a good name.
23. Sa-gida.

akk: sa-gid2-da-am3  urim2^ki- iri me nun šul ^d-suen-na-kam  an ^d-en-lil2 pap gal ^d-nu-dim2-mud  ama ^d-nin-tur5 kalam-ma šir3-ra-ni maḫ-am3 me-teš2 ḫe2-i-i  eš3 urim2^ki- iri me nun šul ^d-suen-na-kam  an ^d-en-lil2 pap gal ^d-nu-dim2-mud  ama ^d-nin-tur5 kalam-ma šir3-ra-ni maḫ-am3 me-[teš2] ḫe2-i-i  ^d-a-nun-na X X X X […]  ^d-en-ki […]  ^d-X […]  ^d-[…]  ^d-[…]  unken ki X […]  EZEN X […]
en: Urim is the city of youthful Suen's princely divine powers. Let them give praise in a great song to An, to Enlil, to the eldest brother Nudimmud and to Mother Nintur of the Land. The shrine Urim is the city of youthful Suen's princely divine powers. Let them give praise in a great song to An, to Enlil, to the eldest brother Nudimmud and to Mother Nintur of the Land. The Anuna gods ……. Enki …… 3 lines fragmentary …… assembly where ……. …… festival …….
37. Sa-ĝara.
38. A tigi of Suen.

akk: [X X] X X X […]  [X X] me-teš2 ši-im-X […]  [X] zi-šag4-ĝal2-la-ke4 šag4-zu im^?--[…]  [^d-]meš3-lam-ta-e3-a su3-u4-ra2 X […]
en: 2 lines fragmentary …… encouragement, your heart ……. Mešlamta-ea, faraway …….
5. 4th kirugu.
You of august power, my prince Ibbi-Suen!
7. Its ĝisgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  ši-im-dirig-ge-en lugal-ĝu10 ši-im-dirig-ge-en ne-zu an-zag-še3  en ^d-lugal-er9-ra ši-im-dirig-ge-en ne-zu an-zag-še3  me-zu me galam-ma me nu-sig10-ge5-da  ab ku-kur ĝal2-la ni2 ḫuš ri-a-me-en  diĝir er9 kalam-ma til3-la-me-en  ni2 gal an ki-a dul-la-me-en
en: You are superlative, my master, you are superlative! Your power reaches to the outer limits of heaven. Lord Lugal-era, you are superlative, your power reaches to the outer limits of heaven. Your divine powers are artfully fashioned divine powers, incomparable divine powers! Sea with high waves, you are imbued with terrible fearsomeness! Mighty god who dwells in the Land, your great awesomeness covers heaven and earth!
14. 5th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 5-kam-ma-am3  nam-maḫ-zu ga-i-i  ši-im-dirig-ge-en lugal-ĝu10 ši-im-/dirig\-[ge-en] ne-zu an-zag-še3
en: I will praise your greatness! You are superlative, my master, you are superlative! Your power reaches to the outer limits of heaven.
17. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  ur-saĝ zid me-teš2-e ga-i-i  en ^d-lugal-er9-ra me-teš2 ga-i-i  ^ĝiš-rab3 gal maḫ diĝir-re-e-ne-me-en  ni2 gal kalam-ma ša-mu-ri-a-me-[en]  ku-kur dugud kur-ra du6-ul(source: lu)-la-me-en  id2-zu id2 kalag-ga-am3 id2 nam tar-ra-am3  id2 maḫ ki ud e3 igi nu-bar-re-dam  ma2-gur8 maḫ a ku-kur-ra u5-a  gu2 si-a nam-lu2-ulu3-ka  en ^d-lugal-er9-ra ĝiri3-zu um-mi-gub  nun kur-ra-ke4-ne ša-mu-e-ši-gam-e-de3-eš  bur3-ra ud zalag ša-mu-un-ne-ri-ib-e3  [X] U ra šu-zu-še3 ša-mu-u8-ĝal2  /en\ ^d-lugal-er9-ra an-zag-še3 maḫ-me-en
en: Trustworthy warrior, I will praise you! Lord Lugal-era, I will praise you! You are the great and august neck-stock of the gods, you are a great awesomeness resting heavily upon the Land, a heavy flood-wave covering the foreign land. Your river is a mighty river, the river which determines destinies, an august river where the sun rises, which nobody can bear to look upon. Great barge riding on the flood waters, Lord Lugal-era: when you set foot in the place where all mankind is gathered, the princes of the underworld bow down before you; in the abyss you emit a bright light to them. …… has been placed in your hands. Lord Lugal-era, your greatness extends to the outer limits of heaven.
32. 6th kirugu.
You of august power, my prince Ibbi-Suen!
34. Its ĝisgiĝal.

akk: /ĝiš\-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  /lugal\-ĝu10 nam-maḫ-za ga-am3-dug4  /en\ ^d-lugal-er9-ra nam-maḫ-za ga-am3-dug4  /za\-e maḫ-me-en dili-zu i3-maḫ-me-en  /diĝir\ er9-ra diĝir-re-e-ne-er rib-ba  lugal sukux(SUKUD)-ra2 an-ne2-e us2-sa  /diĝir\ er9 en zid ni2-te-na  ^d-id2-lu2-ru-gu2 šag4 diĝir-re-e-ne  en ka-aš bar niĝ2-erim2-e ḫul gig  ^d-suen-gin7 niĝ2-si-sa2-e ki aĝ2
en: My king, let me tell of your greatness! Lord Lugal-era, I will praise your greatness! You are august, you alone are august! Mighty god surpassing all the gods, elevated king reaching up to the heavens, mighty god, trustworthy lord by himself, River of the Ordeal, heart of the gods, decision-making lord who hates evil, who like Suen loves justice.

akk: en nam tar-tar-ra an ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-eš  niĝ2-nam an ki ĝal2-ĝal2-la-a-ba  nam tar-re-bi gal-bi mu-un-u2-us2  [X] X ^d-en-lil2-le saĝ-e-eš mu-un-rig7  [X] X nun-e-ne ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10  [X X] X nam-ma-ni maḫ bad3 gal kur KU-KU  [me] /gal\-gal šu du7 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-ka  [^d-lugal]-er9-ra-gin7 ḫul-ĝal2 saĝ KA×X-KA×X  [^d-meš3-lam]-ta-e3-a a2 maḫ-a-na gal-bi  [a2 maḫ]-a-na gal-bi ši-im-mi-DU  [X X] AN^?- ka du8-a kur-ra šu ur3-ur3  [X X] tar-re erim2 zar-re-eš i3-sal-le  [en] [^d-]/lugal\-er9-ra a2 maḫ-a-na gal-bi  [a2 maḫ-a]-na gal-bi ši-im-mi-in-DU  [X X] X NE ĝiškim sag9-ga  [X X]-ga lugal-la-me-eš  […] šu ĝa2-ĝa2-me-eš  […] X ME^?- X […]  ur-saĝ gal-me-eš nam-maḫ-bi a-ri-a sug4-ga-am3  2-na-ne-ne lugal id2-da-me-eš  ^d-id2-lu2-ru-gu2 lu2 zid dadag-ga-[am3]  lu2-erim2 ^ĝiš-<rab3>-gin7 šu ri-ri-a-me-eš  kisiga^ki- iri ul ki ĝar-ra-ba  zid-du nu-dab5-be2 erim2-du nu-dib-be2  ki šag4 kuš2 an [^d-]/en\-[lil2]-la2-me-eš  ki ni2 dub2 RU /AN\ X X X-me-eš  ki gal an-še3 AN^?- X X [X X]-me-en^?-  ki nam tar-re an [^d-]/en\-[lil2]-la2 […]  me-bi kug-kug-ga-am3 X […]  […] NI lu2 nu-[…]  […] X […]  me-bi^?- X X ḫu-ul-ḫu-le-eš sig7-[ga-am3]  me 7-na LAGAB×X gal-le-eš ĝar-[ra-am3]  me še-er-ka-an nun-e abzu-ta nun [X X] še-er-ka-an dug4-ga-[am3]  ^d-meš3-lam-ta-e3-a en ^d-/lugal\-er9-[ra]  nam-ur-saĝ-bi kur-re ba-X-a  nam-maḫ-bi zag an ki-še3 zag an ki-še3 pa e3 ak-a      ki-ru-gu2 10-kam-ma-am3  a2 maḫ nun ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10      ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  kalag-bi ud kalam-ma šu ur3-ur3  ^d-meš3-lam-<ta>-e3-a en ^d-lugal-er9-ra za3-mi2-zu dug3-ga-am3      ki-šu2-bi-im      šir3-nam-gala ^d-meš3-lam-ta-e3-a u3 ^d-lugal-er9-ra
en: They are the lords for whom An and Enlil have determined their destiny. When everything had been brought into existence in heaven and earth, their destiny greatly ……. Enlil granted ……. …… of the princes, my Ibbi-Suen! …… is great, a great wall which …… the foreign lands. Perfecting the great divine powers, he, the son of Enlil, …… the wicked like Lugal-era. In his august power Mešlamta-ea greatly, in his august power he greatly ……. When he opens his mouth ……, eradicating the foreign lands, …… he heaps up the enemies in piles. In his august power Lord Lugal-era greatly, in his august power he greatly ……, …… a favourable sign. They are kings ……. They are …… sparing …… 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

They are great warriors: their greatness is like the empty desert wastes. They are both the lords of the River, the River of the Ordeal which clears the just man.
