They weigh upon the evil man like a neck-stock. In Kisiga, their very anciently founded city, the trustworthy does not get caught, but the evil cannot pass through. They are a source of comfort to the hearts of An and Enlil, they are a source of relaxation ……. They are …… the great place ……. The place for which An and Enlil have determined its destiny ……, its divine powers are holy …… 2 lines fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

Its divine powers ……. The seven divine powers, …… grandly established, adorned with the divine powers by the prince in the abzu, the prince …… adorned ……. The warrior qualities of Mešlamta-ea and Lord Lugal-era …… in the foreign lands; their greatness shines forth to the outer limits of heaven and earth, to the outer limits of heaven and earth.
7. 10th kirugu.
You of august power, my prince Ibbi-Suen!
9. Its ĝisgiĝal.
Their power is a storm which could eradicate the Land. Mešlamta-ea and Lord Lugal-era, it is sweet to praise you!
12. Its kišu.
13. A šir-namgala of Mešlamta-ea and Lugal-era.

akk: [X] an ki su3-ra2-aĝ2 bi2-mu2-mu2  [X X] X nun^?- zid ib-ta-e3-a  [^d-]/suen\ kur gal-e en nun-še3 tud-da  [X (X)] X SAR^?--a X AN DA DI  [gaba]-ĝal2 an ki-<a> lugal-bi na-nam  /en\ ^d-aš-im2-babbar su3-ra2-aĝ2 bi2-mu2-mu2  ^d-suen <su3-ra2-aĝ2 bi2-mu2-mu2>  ^d-X <su3-ra2-aĝ2 bi2-mu2-mu2>  diĝir ud-da <su3-ra2-aĝ2 bi2-mu2-mu2>  gaba-ĝal2 an ki-a lugal-bi /na\-[nam]  an sikil-la mu-un-X ki-še3 pa [am3]-/e3\  eš-bar an-na-kam sa2 gal mu-un-ĝa2-ĝa2  temen  me šar2 mi-ni-in-ed2-e  šul nun-še3 il2-la ^d-i-bi-^d-suen-ĝu10  bal su3-ud nam-ḫe2-a im-ma-ni-in-pad3-de3
en: …… of heaven and earth, renewing his light, …… just prince who comes forth, Suen, whom the Great Mountain engendered to be a princely lord, 1 line fragmentary He is forceful, he is the king of heaven and earth! Lord Ašimbabbar, renewing his light! Suen, renewing his light! ……, renewing his light! The god of light, renewing his light! He is forceful, he is the king of heaven and earth! He …… in the pure sky, he shines forth towards the earth. On the basis of the decisions of great An, he gives important advice. He brings forth all the divine powers, to keep …… in good order. Youth elevated to be prince, my Ibbi-Suen! He calls him to a long and prosperous reign.

akk: en ^d-aš-im2-babbar ki-še3 pa am3-e3(source: DU)  eš-bar an-na-kam <sa2 gal mu-un-ĝa2-ĝa2>  temen  <me šar2 mi-ni-in-ed2-e>  šul nun-še3 il2-la <^d-i-bi-^d-suen-ĝu10>  bal su3-ud nam-ḫe2-a im-ma-ni-in-pad3-da  ki nim-ma kur-zag-še3 gal-bi mu-ni-ib-e3  me kug-bi šen-am3 ĝiš-ḫur nam-mi-ni-in-du7  niĝ2-nam še-er-ka-an-ba igi su3-ud mi-ni-in-il2  aga du7 me ud su3-ra2 dug4-ga nu-kam3-me-de3  ^d-i-bi-^d-suen-ĝu10-ur2 til3 ša-mu-e-da-ab-su3-ud-de3  en ^d-aš-im2-babbar gal-bi mu-ni-ib-e3  me kug-bi šen-am3 <ĝiš-ḫur nam-mi-ni-in-du7>  niĝ2-nam še-er-ka-an-ba <igi su3-ud mi-ni-in-il2>  aga du7 me ud su3-ra2 dug4-ga nu-kam3-me-de3  ^d-i-bi-^d-suen-ĝu10-<ur2> til3 ša-mu-e-da-/ab\-[su3-ud-de3]  en ĝiš-nu11 an ki X X X […]  un3-e^!- ĝiš-ḫe2-a me-te […]  E^?- ḪI DU daĝal DU-bi ḫe2-X […]  me šar2-bi mi-ni-ib-si aĝ2 X […]  ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10 AN X X […]  en ^d-aš-im2-babbar men-bi […]  un3-e ĝiš-ḫe2-a […]  E ḪI DU daĝal DU-bi […]  me šar2-bi […]  ^d-i-bi2-30-ĝu10 AN X X […]
en: Lord Ašimbabbar shines forth towards the earth. On the basis of the decisions of great An, he gives important advice. He brings forth all the divine powers, to keep …… in good order. Youth elevated to be prince, my Ibbi-Suen, whom he calls to a long prosperous reign! He comes forth majestically as far as the highlands and the outer limits of the mountains; their holy divine powers are pure, and he has perfected the divine plans. He directs his far-seeing gaze over everything in all its complexity. He has a perfect crown and divine powers of eternal days; his command cannot be overthrown. He prolongs the life of my Ibbi-Suen. Lord Ašimbabbar comes forth majestically. Their holy divine powers are pure, and he has perfected the divine plans. He directs his far-seeing gaze over everything in all its complexity. He has a perfect crown and divine powers of eternal days; his command cannot be overthrown. He prolongs the life of my Ibbi-Suen. The lord, the light of heaven and earth, ……. He is the ornament of the heights of the firmament. 1 line unclear He has …… all its divine powers ……. My Ibbi-Suen ……. Lord Ašimbabbar is its crown ……. …… of the heights of the firmament. 1 line unclear …… all its divine powers …… My Ibbi-Suen …….
41. Sa-gida

akk: sa-gid2-da-[am3]  an-ne2 ud dug3 X DU AŠ kug mu-[…] X X  aga zid me ud su3-ra2 ĝidru nam-lugal-la  ^d-en-lil2-le ki aĝ2 nam-en nam mu-un-tar  nam-ur-saĝ ba-tud pa e3 am3-mi-ni-maḫ  ^d-en-ki-ke4 nam-ḫe2 ud giri17-zal mu2-mu2  ^id2-idigna ^id2-buranun-na a-u3-ba daĝal X  ^d-nin-tur5 numun i-i /saĝ^?-\ zi-ĝal2 u3-tud  iri a2-dam uĝ3 lu-a ni2-bi-a AŠ BAR UŠ  ^d-nanna ud zu2 keše2 ĝiš-ḫur gen6-ne2  saĝ-kal nam-nun-na ^d-i-bi2-30-ĝu10  sig nim zag an ki e-ne-er ni2 ba-[X]-e  ^d-i-bi2-30 a2 maḫ kalag-ga nam-ur-saĝ-ĝa2  nam-šul-la zag dib kur-re ĝiri3 saga11 di  eš-bar-e kiĝ2-ĝa2 uĝ3-e ĝalga^!- šum2-mu  ^d-utu niĝ2-si-sa2 niĝ2-du7-e bi2-in-DU  nin zid ^d-nin-/irigal\ ama kul-ab^ki--a-ke4  nam-šita a-ra-zu /maḫ^?-\ ud ki-bi šu^?- X E^?- [(X)]  [X X (X)] nin mu maḫ [X X] X X X X  [X X] /zi\ su3-ud-ĝal2
en: An …… favourable day …… holy ……. He has a righteous crown, long-lasting divine powers and a royal sceptre. Enlil has decreed lordship for his beloved one, as his destiny, and has created with magnificent grandeur the qualities of a warrior. Enki, renewing abundance and days of splendour, …… the Tigris and Euphrates in their wide flooding. Nintur, who causes human seed to propagate and brings living beings into existence, …… cities and crowded places, all the numerous people together. Nanna, the …… light, confirming the divine plans, new moon of eternal fame, light which goes towards the earth, has given authority to my Ibbi-Suen, foremost among princes, over the south and the uplands as far as the outer limits of heaven and earth. Utu has produced justice and propriety for Ibbi-Suen the augustly powerful, strong among warriors, unsurpassed in his youthfulness, overthrowing the enemy lands, finding the right decisions and giving advice to the people. The good lady Ninirigal, mother of Kulaba, …… prayer and supplication ……, …… lady with an august name ……. …… long life.
62. Sa-ĝara

akk: [sa-ĝar]-/ra^?-\-am3 (lines 61 and 62 are written as one line in source)   [X X] X IG X X šul ^d-suen-na X  [saĝ]-eš2 mu-ni-in-rig7 lugal an-na-ra
en: …… youthful Suen, has bestowed …… on him, the king of heaven.
65. Its ĝišgiĝal

akk: [ĝiš]-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  [X] A^?- un3-na su3-ra2-aĝ2-bi na-nam  [X X] X ĝiš-ḫe2-a <su3-ra2-aĝ2-bi na-nam>  [^d-i-bi2]-30-ĝu10 <bal> su3-ra2 mu nam-ḫe2  [X X] /til3\ ša-mu-e-da-ab-sud-de3
en: …… is indeed the light of the lofty ……; …… is indeed the light of the firmament. …… a long reign and years of abundance …… and will prolong your life, my Ibbi-Suen.
70. Its uru.
71. An adab of Suen.

akk: en gal ud ĝiš-ḫe2-ta saĝ il2 še-er-zid X-a  ^d-suen ušum saĝ-kal kur un3-ta uĝ3 ud ĝa2-ĝa2  su3-ra2-aĝ2 an bad-da men DU^?- BU^?- giri17-zal a-a ugu-na  dumu gal-di ^d-nin-lil2-le tud-da nir-ĝal2 e2-kur-ra  an-bar7-a dalla e3 šul ^d-suen ud zu2 keše2 an-na  su-lim-ma-ni an-bar7-gana2 ud ĝiš-nu11 uĝ3 saĝ gig2-ga  nir-ĝal2 nun pa e3 ak-a še-er-zid an-na-kam
en: Great lord, light holding his head high in the vault of the sky, …… brilliance, Suen, powerful dragon from the high mountains shedding light on the people, light of the remote heavens, crown ……, joy of the father who begot him! Impressive son born of Ninlil, respected in the E-kur, visible even at noontime, youthful Suen, …… light of heaven, whose majestic radiance is visible even at noontime, light who illuminates the black-headed people, Father Nanna, emerging from the remote ……, understanding well how to make the night pleasant! Respected prince who, when he appears, is the glorious radiance of the heavens!

akk: urim2^ki- iri uz3-saĝ ki-en-gi-ra me-bi nu-kur2-ru-dam  temen an ki-bi a-a ^d-nanna ĝi6 u3-na pa e3  mu mu-un-pad3 ḫi-li šag4-ge bi2-in-si ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10  eš3 nibru^ki- šag4-bi kur ḫe2-ĝal2-la ki-tuš ki-ur3-ra-ke4  nam-nun-na an-ta su-lim-ma-ni kalam-ma mu-un-barag2-ge  kisal maḫ-e su-lim-ma^?- X-bi nu-til-e nam gal tar-re-de3  a-a ugu-na u18-ru gal an ki en ^d-nu-nam-nir-e  ^d-suen-e ub-šu-unken-na-ka u3-gul mu-na-ĝa2-ĝa2
en: At the foundations of heaven and earth, Father Nanna appears in the night time over Urim, the city that is the cosmic bond for Sumer, whose divine powers can never be altered. He has called the name, he has filled the heart with joy, my Ibbi-Suen! At the shrine Nibru, whose interior is a mountain of abundance, the dwelling-place of the Ki-ur, he spreads his majestic light from above over the land in princely style, in the august courtyard, the unceasing …… of its majestic light determining great destinies. Suen offers a prayer in the Ubšu-unkena to the father who begot him, the great …… of heaven and earth, Lord Nunamnir:

akk: ku6-ĝal2 nun barag-ga nun me til3-la šag4-ge pad3-da-zu  eš3 urim2^ki- ki-tuš maḫ lugal-la zi-šag4-ĝal2 kalam-ma  šilam ^e2-tur3-ra dur2 ĝar-ra i3 ga-bi nu-til-e  i3 šar2-šar2-re ku6 mušen u3-tud urud kug-sig17 ib2-ĝal2-le
en: "Canal inspector, prince on the dais, prince with life-giving divine powers! There shall be no end to the butter and the milk of the cow in the cattle-pen -- the shrine Urim, which you have chosen in your heart, the august royal dwelling-place, the encouragement of the Land! It shall have an abundance of butter, fish, birds, births, copper and gold!"

akk: iri^ki- numun i-i me-bi nu-kur2-ru <MU> ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10  nam-lugal-ba pa ḫa-ma-ni-in-e3 nam-til3 ḫe2-ni-ib2-su3-ud-de3  barag gal-ba suḫuš-bi mu-ra-an-ge-en dur2 an-še3 bi2-in-ĝar  dalla ḫe2-ni-in-e3 me nam-lugal-la-ba a2 nun ḫe2-em-ta-e-ĝal2  inim maḫ ul-le2-a-še3 nu-kur2-ru-da ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10  ^d-aš-im2-babbar-me-en an ki niĝin2-na-ba  nam-nir-ĝal2 pa ba-ni-in-/e3\   šag4 kug-ta mu pad3-da ^d-i-bi2-[^d-suen-ĝu10]  ^d-nanna-ar KA GUD^?- X maḫ AN-gin7 pa /e3^?-\ [(X)]  ^d-suen-e ka-ta e3-a-ni e2-kur X X X X […]  an ^d-en-lil2 /nam\ kalam-ma tar-re kur gal ^d-/en\-[lil2] […]  X […] X NI X […]  nam tar-ra […]  ^d-aš-im2-babbar […]  me nam-lugal-/la\ […]  dalla mu-e-/e3\ […] saĝ il2 X […]  ^d-nanna-^d-suen-e […]  giri17-zal en pa e3 an uraš-a X […] X  ĝiškim-til3 dumu ^d-nin-lil2-la2 ḫe2-du7 X X X  ^d-nanna en KA kug mu maḫ-am3 zi-šag4-ĝal2 kalam-ma  nun ḫi-li sud šag4 kug-ĝa2 pad3-da ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10  uĝ3 šar2-ra-ba mu-ni su3-ra2-še3 ka-aš bar kalam-ma X X  bal dug nam-ḫe2 šar2 kug-zu-me-en ĝanun^?- maḫ-<še3> ĝeštug2-zu  a-a ^d-nanna šag4-ge pad3-da-zu X-/ĝal2\ šum2-ma  en giri17-zal numun zid-de3 X X  me gal-gal-la maḫ-di ^d-en-lil2-da eš-bar X [X] ĝal2  gud dili du-de3 en pa ed2-dam^?- ^d-suen /za3\-mi2      u3-lu-lu-ma-ma ^d-suen-na-kam
en: The divine powers of the city which was responsible for the emergence of human seed cannot be altered, my Ibbi-Suen! He has made its kingship shine forth; he prolongs life! He has strengthened for you the foundations of its great dais, and has made you take your seat proudly upon it. He has made the divine powers of its kingship come forth; great power emerges from there. Those august commands cannot ever be changed, my Ibbi-Suen! You, Ašimbabbar, have caused respect for the king to shine forth throughout the whole of heaven and earth. For Nanna …… the just man chosen in the holy heart, my Ibbi-Suen, …… august …… shine forth like a god. Suen …… his command …… the E-kur; An and Enlil, who determine the destiny of the land, the Great Mountain Enlil …… 1 line unclearapprox. 7 lines missing

The destiny which has been determined ……. Ašimbabbar ……. He has made the divine powers of kingship …… shine forth …… with head high ……, Nanna-Suen ……, the noble manifest lord …… in heaven and earth, source of trust, son of Ninlil, ornament of ……, Nanna, lord with a holy mouth and with an august name, encouragement of the Land! Prince endowed with charm, chosen in my holy heart, my Ibbi-Suen! Among the numerous people his name reaches far abroad, …… the decision of the Land. You know well how to benefit the reign and to increase abundance; direct your attention to the great storehouses! Father Nanna, …… is given to the one you have chosen in your heart, you noble lord who …… the good seed, impressive with your divine powers, making …… decisions together with Enlil, unique bull, manifest lord! Praise be to Suen!
16. An ululumama of Suen.

akk: /me^?-\-zu /NE\ […]  a-a ^d-nanna X X […]  uĝ3-ĝa2 mi-ni-pad3 AN^?- […]  an aga zid men saĝ-ĝa2-zu za-e […]  ki barag gal maḫ dur2 ĝar-ra-zu zi^?- […]  ka kug ba-a-zu u18-ru gal me pa […]  aga nam-lugal-la men kug suḫ10-gir11 […]  ^ĝiš-gu-za me ur4-ur4 barag saĝ il2 X […]
en: Your divine powers ……, Father Nanna, ……, …… chose from the people ……. Youthful Suen, your holy shrine ……. An, you …… your good crown and headdress on your head. When you take your seat on the great august dais ……. When you open your holy mouth, …… the great …… and the divine powers. …… the royal crown, the holy headdress and the diadem, gathering together the throne and the divine powers, on the dais with head high …….

akk: peš10-ĝal2 nam barag-ga numun /zid\ […]  ^d-i-bi2-^d-suen-ĝu10 an kug-ta nam X […]  en me kug-ku3-ug me sikil šu-luḫ zalag /nam\ […]  si mul-mul su3-ra2-aĝ2 an-na /šul\ [^d-suen …]  ud te-eš-e gal idim-ma ḫi-li-bi^?- ki […]  nibru^ki- a2 tal2-tal2 ^d-nanna šag4 kug […]  nun zi-le an ki šu2-a-ba iti6 X […]  /gud^?-\ pa e3 ^d-en-lil2-da maḫ dib ḪI X […]  [X] X X AN […] X X MU^?- UD^?- […]  […] X […]
en: Mighty one of the dais, …… good seed ……, my Ibbi-Suen, …… from holy An, lord who sanctifies the divine powers, who purifies the divine powers, who makes brilliant the purification rites, ……, with shining horns, the light of heaven, youthful Suen ……, great ……, ……. Wide-armed Nibru, …… in his holy heart by Nanna, beneficent prince over the full extent of heaven and earth, …… moonlight ……, manifest bull, as august as Enlil, …… 2 lines brokenunknown no. of lines missing

akk: […] X […]  […]-ku4-ku4-/de3\ […]  [a2 zid-da a2] gab2-bu-bi piriĝ im-/da\-[nu2 …]  […]-ib2-dug4 inim ^d-en-lil2-la2-ta  […] iri^ki- du6-du6-da šid-e-de3  […]-de3 nam im-ma-ni-in-tar  […] bal ^d-en-lil2 a2-taḫ-bi-im
en: 1 line fragmentary …… to introduce ……. At left and right was a crouching lion, ……. …… at the command of Enlil. …… to reduce the city to ruin-mounds. He determined ……; …… Enlil is its ally!
8. 1st kirugu.

akk: [ki-ru]-/gu2\ 1-kam  […]-ra ^d-en-lil2-le  […] mu-na-an-e3  […]-in-in-bi-da ba-[…]  […] /X\^ki- mu-na-an-šum2 a2-ni nu-ĝa2-ĝa2  […] LU ul nam-nun-na-e sig-ga ba-ši-in-DU  /muš\-gin7 uš7 ze2 guru5-a-ni erim2-ma im-mi-in-te  [X] X-ma ki-en-gi-ra-ka šu mi-ni-ib-ur3-ur3-re  X X X^ki- larsam^ki--ma [X X] X edin^?- urim2^ki--ka  [X]-e maḫ mi-ni-in-BAD a2-ni la-ba-ra-e3  gu2-erim2-ĝal2-le /ka\ tar-ra-bi X […] igi-ni bal  ^d-iš-bi-er3-ra X X KU […]  […] X DU X-am3 zag bi2-in-gi4
en: Enlil …… went forth ……. unknown no. of lines missing

1 line fragmentary He gave him ……, not implementing his strength. …… in princely style ……. He approached the enemy like a snake spitting venom and gall. He wiped …… in the …… of Sumer. …… Larsam, …… in the plain of Urim. …… great …… did not escape his power. The great mass of the enemy ……. Išbi-Erra ……. 1 line fragmentary

akk: […] /ba\-an-šub šu suḫ3 ḫa-ba-ab-dug4  […] im-da-an-/zig3\ [X] X sag3-ge nu-ĝa2-ĝa2  […] im-ma-ni-in-kur2  […] X GI ŠA KI  […] X X X X  […] X iri-da X […]  […] /dug4\-ga mar-ḫa-[ši^ki-] […]  […] /ma\-da-ma-/da\ […]  ba-ši-mi^ki- gaba a-ab-ba […-ta] zag za-ab-ša-[li^ki-] […-še3]  a-ra-wa^ki- saĝ-kul elam[^ki--ma] […-ta] zag mar-ḫa-[ši^ki-] […-še3]  ki-in-da-tu lu2 elam […]  i3-si-in^ki- bulug gal an [ki …]  lugal-la me3-bi nu-/mu\-[…]  me3 elam^ki--ma ki-en-[gi] […]  gaba a-ab-ba-ka […] /MU\ […]  ma-da ḫu-uḫ2-/nu\-[ri] […]  maš2-anše niĝ2-ur2-4-[…]  lugal-e me3-a […]      ki-/ru\-[gu2 2-kam-ma-am3]   ^ĝiš-gigir maḫ […]  lugal-e i3-si-/in\[^ki-] […]  di niĝ2-gen6-na X […]  ^d-iš-bi-er3-ra […]  an saĝ-/ta^?-\ […]  ^d-en-/lil2\-[le] […]  /uĝ3\ […]-un-ĝar arad […]  /buru5\[^mušen-]-/gin7\ še im-ma-[…]  pu2-[^ĝiš-kiri6] pu2-^ĝiš-kiri6 […]  […] da BI […]  […] X X X AN X X  […] gur^?--ru-de3 im-mi-in-X  [kug]-/sig17\ niĝ2-gur11 gi16-sa-a-bi barag-še3 mu-un-du3  [zi]-/nu\-um lu2 šu-ta šub-ba-bi ^d-en-ki maškim-bi-im  ^id2-buranun-na ^id2-idigna ^id2-kir11-sig ^id2-kiš^ki- zag-bi im-mi-in-gu7  edin bar-rim4 lil2 bu-bu-da enmen-e mi-ni-in-ug7  ki-in-da-tu lu2 elam^ki--ma-ra inim-bi ba-an-na-de6  an-ša4-an^ki--e šimaški^ki- šeg11 ba-ab-gi4 kur im-ma-an-te  /ugnim\-ma-ni pu-uḫ2-ru-um-bi inim mu-na-ni-ib-be2      ki-ru-gu2 3-kam-ma-am3  [^d-]/iš\-bi-er3-ra-ĝu10 engar ^d-en-lil2-le  [X] X a2 maḫ mu-na-an-šum2      [ĝiš-gi4]-ĝal2-bi-im  […]-bi ^d-en-lil2 A an nin X X X  […] ^d-nin-lil2-la2 A X X X  […]-gi4-am3  […]-/še3\ im-ma-an-ĝar  [… mu]-/un\-ur4  […] ĝar  [… a2] im-mi-in-/aĝ2\  […] BA^?- AŠ im-ši-in-[…]  [… ki]-bal-še3 X […]  […] /nu\-mu-un-ĝal2-/la\ […]  […] šimaški/^ki-\  [… mu]-un-dug4
en: He fell …… 4 lines fragmentary approx. 1 line missing

With the city ……. …… Marḫaši ……. …… the foreign lands ……. From Bašimi by the edge of the sea …… to the edge of Zabšali ……, and from Arawa, the bolt of Elam …… to the edge of Marḫaši ……. Kindattu, the man of Elam, ……. …… Isin, the great spindle of heaven and earth. The king's battle did not ……. The battle of Elam …… Sumer. …… by the edge of the sea. …… the land of Ḫuḫnuri. …… the wild animals and four-footed ……. The king …… in the battle.
14. 2nd kirugu.
unknown no. of lines missing
…… a great chariot. The king …… Isin. …… a just verdict. Išbi-Erra ……. 1 line fragmentary 4 lines missing
Enlil ……. The people ……. Like small birds, …… the barley. …… the orchards. 1 line fragmentary approx. 6 lines missing

1 line fragmentary …… to return ……. He put its gold and precious belongings into sacks. As for Zinnum, who escaped from them, Enki is their maškim. He was fed at the banks of the Euphrates and Tigris and the Kir-sig and Kiš watercourses. He died of thirst, persecuted by ghosts in the dry desert. The news was brought to Kindattu, the man of Elam. Anšan cried out to Šimaški, and he approached the mountains. He addressed the assembly of his army.
10. 3rd kirugu.
Enlil has endowed my Išbi-Erra, the cultivator, with great strength …….
13. Its ĝišgiĝal.
…… Enlil …… Ninlil ……. unknown no. of lines missing
10 lines fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

akk: nin me nun-na ud-gin7 dalla e3 ḫi-li zid-da ul-še3 pad3-da  ^d-na-na-a me-te e2-an-ka in-nin-ra tum2-ma  gal-zu nu-u8-gig-ge nin kur-kur-ra zid-de3-eš-še3 pad3-da  ^d-na-na-a kalam e2-an-ka igi-ĝal2 šum2-mu ba-e-zu
en: Lady of the princely powers, emerging brilliantly like the daylight, chosen forever for her virtuous beauty! Nanaya, ornament of E-ana, worthy of the Lady! Wise one, correctly chosen as lady of all the lands by the Mistress: Nanaya, you instruct the Land, bestowing wisdom in E-ana.
5. Barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  an-gin7 sag9 munus saĝ maš3 nin dal-dal-le-e du7  ^d-na-na-a kug ^d-inana-ke4 zid-de3-eš umun2 ak  munus mul-an ḫe2-me-a nin kug-zu niĝ2-nam-še3 ĝal2-la  munus zid šag4 su3-ra2 nin inim-še3 ĝal2-la-bi i3-zal-le-eš  umuš kug ^d-inana-ke4 ak nu-u8-gig-e ki aĝ2  ^d-na-na-a di-kud gal diĝir dur2 maḫ ki unug^ki--ga til3-la
en: As fine as An, woman with a holy head, made perfect by the …… lady! Nanaya, properly educated by holy Inana, woman who is as bright as the stars, wise lady who is available for everything, righteous sympathetic woman, lady who is always available on request, counselled by holy Inana, beloved by the Mistress! Nanaya, great judge, deity who occupies the high throne of Unug!
12. Šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  munus zid eš-bar dug3 kalam-ma-kam di-di-bi gal-zu  ^d-na-na-a  iri\ uĝ3 lu-a igi-ĝal2  munus maḫ inim kug dug4-/ge du7\ nin ḫi-li-a tum2-ma  ^d-na-na-a saĝ il2 e2-an-ka lu2 inim sag9-ge kalam-ma
en: Righteous woman who knows well the verdicts of the good decisions of the Land, Nanaya, who is wise in directing the city and the numerous people, exalted woman adept at holy speech, lady fitted for beauty, Nanaya, pride of E-ana, well-spoken one of the Land!
17. 2nd barsud.

akk: bar-sud 2-[kam-ma]-/am3\  an-e igi sag9 kalam-ma lugal kur-kur-ra […]  ^d-na-na-a kalam e2-an-[na …] ḫi-li […]  šul sipad zid dumu ^d-nu-nam-nir-re in-[…]  ^d-iš-bi-er3-ra me gal-di […] gu […]  ^d-na-na-a su3-ud-še3 a-ra-zu-ni kurun-gin7 su-ub X en LI zid-da-na-ka e2-an-na-kam
en: By An, the benevolent eye of the Land, the king of all countries, Nanaya …… the Land …… E-ana …… beauty ……. The youthful good shepherd, the son of Nunamnir, has …… -- Išbi-Erra, who wields great powers, …… Nanaya his prayers unendingly like strong liquor …… of E-ana.
23. Šagbatuku.
Išbi-Erra, constant benefactor of E-ana.
25. Sa-gida.

akk: sa-gid2-da-am3  ša-mu-da^?--pad3 ^d-na-na-a kalam-ma nu-u8-gig-e ki aĝ2-zu  ^d-iš-bi-er3-ra ul-še3 lu2 inim sag9-ga-ni ḫe2-me-en
en: Your Nanaya, who is beloved in the Land by the Mistress, is chosen together with you , Išbi-Erra; may you always be eulogised by her.
28. Ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  nin gal šag4 ki zi-šag4-ĝal2 tum2-ma nu-u8-gig-e sa2-bi šu ĝa2-ĝa2  me giri17-zal šu daĝal nu-u8-gig-e ma-ra-an-šum2  ^d-na-na-a nin gal šag4 ki zi-šag4-ĝal2 tum2-ma <nu-u8-gig-e sa2-bi šu ĝa2-ĝa2>  uĝ3-e ^d-iš-bi-er3-ra lugal sipad-bi-me-en  ^d-na-na-a inim dug4 [an-na-ta nin] kur-kur-ra za-e-me-en  eš3-e kul-aba4 X IN X ša-mu-na-ab-be2  uĝ3-e za-ra šag4-bi /im\-[mi]-/niĝin2\ ši-im-da-ab-be2-en  ^d-na-na-a munus zid mu ḫe2-sag9 saĝ gig2-ga-me-en  inim kug-zu-zu in-nin-na-ra zal-le-eš im-ma-sag9  šul ḫi-li-a pad3-da nu-u8-gig-e dumu ^d-en-lil2-ke4  ^d-na-na-a in-nin me kug-zu KA^?- ša-ra-mu2-mu2  [ki]-nu2-še3 igi zid nam-til3-la za-e NE^?- ḫu-mu-ni-in-du8  [^d-]iš-bi-er3-ra šul ḫi-li-a pad3-da
en: Great lady, worthy source of inspiration, counselled by the Mistress: luxurious divine powers have been generously given to you by the Mistress. Nanaya, great lady, worthy source of inspiration, counselled by the Mistress! Išbi-Erra, you are the king and shepherd of the people! Nanaya, by the command of An you are the queen of all the countries. In the shrine, in Kulaba, …… he declares it, and the people turn their hearts towards you as you address them. Nanaya, good woman, you are the favourable name of the black-headed! O youth chosen in beauty by the Mistress, son of Enlil, your wise word is brightly made good for the goddess Inana! O Nanaya, the goddess has created your holy powers …… for you. You have …… turned the favourable eye of life onto the bedchamber, and Išbi-Erra is the youth chosen for his beauty.
42. Sa-ĝara.
43. A tigi of Nanaya.

akk: [diĝir] /gal\-gal-e-ne X-zu maḫ en [(…)]  […] X šu […]-du7  […] X X […] A-A X  […] X X X […] X KA […]  tug2-zu tug2 gal-la-am3 […] BA NA […] ^d-en-lil2 ša-mu-X […]  du10-ub an lugal-la-kam buluĝ3-ĝa2-me-en  diĝir gal-gal-e-ne ša-ba-maḫ a2^?- […] X  munus mu-ni ni2 il2-il2 ^d-gu-la […]-/in\-šu2 kur-kur-ra ba-/du\-a-me-[en]  nin sag9-ga-na ḫuš-bi gal-bi […] nam-[diĝir] gal maḫ-a [saĝ il2]
en: The great gods elevated ……, and made …… perfect. 2 lines unclear Your garment is an exalted garment; Enlil has ……. You were brought up sitting on the knees of An the king, and the great gods elevated ……. Woman whose name is exalted, Gula, ……. You go against all the foreign lands, lady who, for all her pleasantness, fearsomely and mightily ……, who lifts her head in great and elevated divinity.

akk: ^d-nin-isin2^si--na /nam\-nin kalam-ma-[kam] a-a-zu bi2-in-[gub-be2-en]  u6 di-zu-še3 ni2 nu-kur2-ru na-[…]  kug ^d-nin-isin2^si--na nin ^d-gu-la  ^d-nin-isin2^si--na e2-gal-maḫ an-ne2 ki us2-[sa]  ^d-iš-bi-er3-<ra> ki aĝ2 šag4-za-ra za-e ḫul2-ḫul2-mu-di-ni-ib
en: Ninisina, your father established you in ladyship over the Land. In awe at you, never altering the fearsomeness ……, holy Ninisina, Lady Gula, Ninisina, in the Egal-maḫ, founded by An -- bring joy to Išbi-Erra, the beloved of your heart.

akk: en ud ḫuš du7-ru kur2-kur2 suḫ3-e kalam-ma ni2 maḫ X du8^?-  ^d-nergal kar gal an ki tud2 KU zi-ĝal2 šar2-ra  en igi ḫuš il2-la-ni uĝ3 lu-a sig10-ge erim2 X ^ĝiš-^ ?-tukul^?- du8^?-  ^d-nergal a2-tuku an ki-a uĝ3 X GI zar-re-eš
en: Lord, furiously raging storm, confusing the enemies and unleashing great terror over the Land, Nergal, mighty quay of heaven and earth, who …… all living things, lord who guards the teeming people when he looks up furiously, turning his weapons against the wicked: Nergal, powerful in heaven and earth, who …… the people in heaps!
5. Barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  en ud gal me maḫ-zu du7-ru ^tum9-u18-lu kalam-ma dul-lu  ^d-nergal erim2 nam ku5-ra2-ni tum9 u8 tu11 lil2-e sag3-ge  en sukux(LIL)-ra2 kalag-ga kišib-la2 tuku na-me e-ne-ra nu-gub-bu  ^d-nergal daĝal il2 u18-ru er9 gur3-ru gal niĝ2 ar2-re-eš e  dirig šul gal-e-ne nam-ur-saĝ-ĝa2-ni ĜIRI3-e nam-ur-saĝ-ĝa2  ^d-nergal an ki zag til-bi-še3 nam-maḫ-a-ni dul-la
en: Lord, mighty storm, raging with your great powers, south storm which covers the Land, Nergal, who smites the enemy whom he has cursed ……, exalted lord, strong one with a powerful wrist, whom no one can withstand, Nergal, rising broadly, full of furious might, great one praised for his accomplishments, pre-eminent among the great youthful gods, whose valour is …… of valour, Nergal, whose greatness covers heaven and earth to their uttermost limits!
12. Šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  ur-saĝ saĝ il2 en nir-ĝal2-lu dumu gaba zig3 a-a-na  ^d-nergal ab ḫu-luḫ ni2 ḫuš ri na-me gaba ru-gu2 nu-zu  šul zig3-ga-ni mir a-ma-ru kur-kur un-tu11-be2  ^d-nergal ušumgal u3-mun dul4-lu uš2 zi-ĝal2-la na8-na8
en: Warrior with head held high, respected lord, son who rises up to protect his father, Nergal, angry sea, inspiring fearsome terror, whom no one knows how to confront, youth whose advance is a hurricane and a flood battering the lands, Nergal, dragon covered with gore, drinking the blood of living creatures!
17. 2nd barsud.

akk: bar-sud 2-kam-ma-am3  en a-a ugu-ni ^d-nu-nam-nir-gin7 til3 mud e-ne-da ĝal2  ^d-nergal e2^?- da-ri2 iri11-gal ^d-en-lil2 ban3-da-me-en  nam tar-re  ka-aš bar-re-da za-a-da ša-mu-e-da-ĝal2  ^d-nergal a-ra2 gal me ḫuš-bi šu maḫ-zu-uš im-si  ĝarza maḫ na-me nu-zu-ba za-a-ra   ^d-nergal ĝiš-ḫur šu-luḫ uĝ3-ba saĝ
en: Lord who, like his own father Nunamnir, has the power to create life, Nergal, enduring house , underworld -- you are the junior Enlil! It is in your power to determine destinies, to render judgments and to make decisions, Nergal, your great hands are filled with mighty actions and terrible powers! Great rites which are revealed to no one are organised for you! Nergal, among this people it is you who take charge of the divine plans and the purification rites!
24. 2nd šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku 2-kam-ma-am3  ki ud šu2-a ^d-utu ma-ra-an-e3 barag ni2 gur3-ru ma-ra-an-ri  ki ud e3 en DIM4 u5 IL2-bi ni2 gal ḫuš gur3-ru-me-en  ^d-nergal za3-mi2 a-re-zu ni2 su zig3 bar-re-dam
en: In the west, Utu has shone forth for you, and an awe-inspiring dais has been erected for you! Nergal, you, lord, are one who has the power to carry off and to bring back ! In the east, lord, ……, you are imbued with a terrible great awesomeness; Nergal, your praise and renown are such as to unleash awe and terror!
29. 3rd barsud.

akk: bar-sud 3-kam-ma-am3  sipad gen6-ne šul zid ^d-utu-gin7   ^d-šu-i3-li2-šu nun me ul pa e3 ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne  ^d-nergal e-ne-ra ḫul-du-ni zar-re-eš sal-mu-na-ab  ^d-šu-i3-li2-šu za-a-ar nir ḫu-mu-u8-de3-ĝal2 ḫul2-la ḫu-mu-di-ni-ib-tum2  sipad ḫa-ba-du ^d-utu-gin7 uĝ3-ba mu-ni ḫe2-em-mi-i-i  ^d-šu-i3-li2-šu kur-kur uĝ3 lu-a zi-ni ḫe2-em-mi-ib2-aĝ2
en: Shepherd who organises, giving just verdicts like the noble youth Utu! Nergal, pile up his malefactors in heaps for him, for Šu-ilīšu, the prince who displays lasting divine powers among the Anuna gods! May Šu-ilīšu rely on you, may he be made joyful by you! May he walk as the shepherd whose name is extolled among this people like that of Utu! May all lands and the teeming people bless the life of Šu-ilīšu!
36. Barsud.
Nergal, may you be the trust of prince Šu-ilīšu until distant days!
38. Ĝišgiĝal and its sa-gida.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2 sa-gid2-da-bi-im  en kur gal-la niĝ2 ul4-le-eš-e ak u3-ma ḫuš erim2 dub2^?--bu  ^d-nergal dub-bu dili-e-bi nu-še-ga  ni2 er9-e-ne  en nir-ĝal2 meš3 ^d-nu-nam-nir-ra u3-tud-da ki ĝar-ra-ni X […]  [^d-]/nergal\ šag4 mir ^d-en-lil2-la2 a sed su3  en gal ĝiri3 kur saĝ dub2-ba X X […] ĜIŠGAL-zu X-ru-uš i3-ĝal2  [^d-]/nergal\ me3-še3 gub-be2 nir saĝ il2-i  [^d-]/nergal\ ^sa-šu2-uš-gal ḫul-du šu šu2-ur gu2-erim2-ĝal2-la  ur-saĝ kur a-a-zu-še3 nu-še-ga ud ḫuš gal-bi-me-en  ^d-nergal iri-bad3 a2-dam-bi ni2 um-ši-te  am-gin7 ĝiri3-za ba-ši-gub-be2-en si gal-zu bi2-tu11  ^d-nergal šeg12-bi in-dal-gin7 an-na um-mi-gu7  ^d-nergal u3-mun-bi šeĝ14-gin7 sur3-sur3-ra i-ni-in-de2  uĝ3 gu2-erim2-ma u8 i-ne2-ĝar zi šar2 kar i3-bi2-dug4
en: Lord of the underworld, who acts swiftly in everything, whose terrifying anger smites the wicked, Nergal, single-handed crusher, who tortures the disobedient -- the powerful ones, fearsome terror of the Land, respected lord and hero, established offspring of Nunamnir ……! Nergal, who sprinkles cool water on the angry heart of Enlil, great lord ……! Nergal, standing ready for battle, superior with head lifted high, lord who overpowers all the wicked like a lion, ……, unwilling to turn back at the door-pivot! Nergal, great battle-net for malefactors, covering all enemies! Warrior, you are a great and furious storm upon the land which disobeys your father! Nergal, you terrify the walled cities and the settlements as you stand in your path like a wild bull, smiting them with your great horns! Nergal, you have consumed their brickwork as if it were chaff in the air. When you lift your furious face, no one dare look at it. When you have …… {in the Land} { among that people}, Nergal, you pour their blood down the wadis like rain. You afflict all the wicked peoples with woe, and deprive all of them of their lives.

akk: ^d-nergal šul za-a-da kar-bi ar2-zu ši-im-galam-e  en šu ĝar ^d-en-lil2-la2 mu-u8-gi šag4 a-a-na mu-un-sed  ^d-nergal kalag-ga dumu kur gam ^d-nu-nam-nir-ra-kam  sipad an-ne2 uĝ3 šar2-ra pad3-da šul zid il2 kur gal-la  ^d-šu-i3-li2-šu šu-luḫ pa e3 ak-de3 ^d-nin-lil2-le tud-da  ḫu-mu-un-taḫ-e šen-šen me3-a ĜIRI3 ĝiš ĝiš-e la2-a  ^d-nergal e-ne-ra ḫul-du-ni sim^mušen--gin7 za-e ur4-ur4-u4-mu-na-ab  kur nu-še-ga-na u18-lu ḫuš bi2-dul ĝiš-gaz-bi ḫe2-me-en  ^d-šu-i3-li2-šu du6-ul-mu-na-ab iri e-ne-še3 nu-ĝal2
en: Youthful Nergal, those who are saved with your help magnify you with praise! Lord, you have avenged Enlil! He has calmed the heart of his father! Nergal the strong, son who subdues the foreign lands for Nunamnir: may you assist in battle, furious fight and combat the shepherd whom An has chosen among the numerous people, the good and exalted youth of the Great Mountain  -- Šu-ilīšu, who publicly performs the purification rites, born of Ninlil! Nergal, catch his malefactors for him like swallows! You cover the land which is disobedient to him with a raging storm; may you be the weapon of slaughter! Heap up in piles for Šu-ilīšu the inhabitants of the city that does not support him.
63. Sa-ĝara.

akk: sa-ĝar-ra-am3  en er9 a-a ugu-na nam-nir-ĝal2 šum2-ma  ^d-nergal en ^d-nu-nam-nir-re nam-nir-ĝal2 šum2-ma  ^d-šu-i3-li2-šu zi su3-ud-ĝal2 nam-til3-la-ni eš3 e2-meš3-lam-ma ul-še3 ša-mu-ra-ab-mu2-mu2
en: Powerful lord of his own father, entrusted with authority, Nergal, the lord whom Nunamnir has entrusted authority! Šu-ilīšu will forever pray to you in the shrine E-mešlam for his long life and good health.
67. Its uru.
68. An adab of Nergal.

akk: […] me maḫ AN […]  […] ^d-šu-i3-li2-šu nam X […] ud ḫa-ba-ni-X-[su3-ud]
en: …… august divine powers ……. May …… prolong …… for Šu-ilīšu.
3. Its uru.
4. An adab of …….

akk: [nu-u8]-/gig\ an-ta e3-a-ra [silim]-ma ga-na-ab-be2-en  [nin] gal an-na ^d-inana-ra silim-ma ga-na-ab-be2-en  izi-ĝar kug an-e si-a-ra  su3-ra2-aĝ2 ^d-inana-ra ud-gin7 zalag-ge-ra  nin gal an-na ^d-inana-ra silim-ma ga-na-ab-be2-en  nu-u8-gig nin ni2 gur3-ru ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne  nir-ĝal2 an ki si gal si-a  dumu gal ^d-suen-na ^d-inana-ra silim-ma ga-na-ab-be2-en  nam-maḫ-a-na nam-gal-la-na nam-nir-ĝal2 buluĝ3-ĝa2-na  an-usan^an--na dalla e3-a-na  izi-ĝar kug an-e si-a-na  ^d-nanna ^d-utu-gin7 an-na gub-ba-na  sig-ta igi-nim-še3 kur-kur-ra zu-am3  nu-u8-gig an-na-ka nam-gal-la-na  in-nin9-ra šir3-re-eš ga-na-ab-be2-en
en: I shall greet her who ascends above, her who ascends above, I shall greet the Mistress who ascends above, I shall greet the great lady of heaven, Inana! I shall greet the holy torch who fills the heavens, the light, Inana, her who shines like daylight, the great lady of heaven, Inana! I shall greet the Mistress, the most awesome lady among the Anuna gods; the respected one who fills heaven and earth with her huge brilliance; the eldest daughter of Suen, Inana! For the young lady I shall sing a song about her grandeur, about her greatness, about her exalted dignity; about her radiantly ascending at evening; about her filling the heaven like a holy torch; about her stance in the heavens, as noticeable by all lands, from the south to the highlands, as that of Nanna or of Utu; about the greatness of the mistress of heaven!
17. 1st kirugu.
Her rising is that of a warrior.
19. Ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  an-na nam-mi-in-gub u3-sumun2 zid an-na-kam  ki-a nir mi-ni-in-ĝal2 nin kur-kur-ra-kam  abzu eridug^ki--ga me šu ba-ni-in-ti  a-a-ni ^d-en-ki-ke4 saĝ-e-eš mu-ni-in-rig7  nam-en nam-lugal-la šu-ni-še3 mu-u8-ĝar  an-da barag gal-la dur2 mu-da-an-ĝar  ^d-en-lil2-da kalam-ma-na nam mu-un-di-ni-ib-tar-re  itid-da ud-sakar-ra me šu du7-du7-de3  diĝir kalam-ma-ke4 gu2 mu-na-an-si-si-iš  ^d-a-nun-na gal-gal im-ši-gam-e-de3-eš  sizkur a-ra-zu-a ši-im-ma-sug2-sug2-ge-eš  nam-šita kur-kur-ra mu-na-da-ab-be2-ne  nin-ĝu10   [^d-inana-ke4] ka-aš bar kalam-ma ^d-en-lil2-[da] i3-bar-[re]  saĝ gig2-ga-ni igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2
en: When standing in the heavens she is the good wild cow of An, on earth she instils respect; she is the lady of all the lands. She received the divine powers in the abzu, in Eridug; her father Enki presented them to her. He placed the lordship and kingship in her hands. She takes her seat on the great dais with An; she determines the fates in her Land with Enlil. Monthly, at the new moon, the gods of the Land gather around her so that the divine powers are perfected. The great Anuna gods, having bowed before them, stand there with prayers and supplications and utter prayers on behalf of all the lands. My lady decrees judgments in due order for the Land. { Inana decides verdicts for the Land together with Enlil.} Her black-headed people parade before her.
34. 2nd kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 2-kam-ma-am3  ^ĝiš-al-ĝar kug-ga-ke4 šu mu-na-tag-ge  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nin gal an-na ^d-inana-ra silim-ma ga-na-ab-be2-en  ub3 kug li-li-is3 kug šu mu-na-tag-ge  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nin gal an-na ^d-inana-ra silim-ma ga-na-ab-be2-en  balaĝ kug li-li-is3 kug šu mu-na-dar-e  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nam-[maḫ-a-na nam]-gal-a-na  nam-nir^!--[ĝal2] /buluĝ3\-a-na  an-u2-sa11-/an-na\ dalla e3-a-ra
en: Making silver alĝar instruments sound for her, they parade before her, holy Inana. I shall greet the great lady of heaven, Inana! Making holy ub and holy lilis drums sound for her, they parade before her, holy Inana. I shall greet the great lady of heaven, Inana! Beating holy balaĝ and holy lilis drums for her, they parade before her, holy Inana. I shall greet { in her grandeur, in her greatness, in her exalted dignity as she ascends radiantly at evening,} {the eldest daughter of Suen} { the great lady of heaven}, Inana!
44. 3rd kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 3-kam-ma-am3  saĝ-ur-saĝ-e-ne suḫ mu-na-an-dub-dub-bu-uš  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  gu2-bar niĝ2-dara2 gun3 mu-na-an-gun3-gun3-ne-eš  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  kuš nam-diĝir-ra su-bi-a mu-un-ĝal2  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  balaĝ niĝ2 sed-de3 ba-KU-a zag mi-ni-ib-gub-gub-be2  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  ^tug2-niĝ2-la2 a2 me3 da-da-ra-še3 mu-dug4  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  ĝiš-gid2-da a2 me3 šu-bi-a mu-un-ĝal2  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2
en: Tightening their hairgrips for her, male prostitutes parade before her, holy Inana. Their locks of hair at the back are adorned for her with coloured rags ; they parade before her, holy Inana. Clothed in the leather of divinity, they parade before her, holy Inana. The trustworthy {man} { king} and the proud lady, the doyenne of the great wise women, parade before her, holy Inana. Those who are in charge of beating the soothing balaĝ drums parade before her, holy Inana. Each girded with a sword belt, the strength of battle, they parade before her, holy Inana. Grasping a spear, the strength of battle, in their hands, they parade before her, holy Inana.
59. 4th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 4-kam-ma-am3  a2 zid-da-bi tug2 nitaḫ2 bi2-in-mur10  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nin gal an-na ^d-inana-ra silim-ma ga-na-ab-be2-en  a2 gab2-bu-bi-a tug2 nam-munus mu-ni-si-ig  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nin gal an-na ^d-inana-ra silim-ma ga-na-ab-be2-en  ešemen2 gu-du gun3-a a-da-min3 mu-na-e  kug inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2
en: Dressed with men's clothing on the right side, they parade before her, holy Inana. I shall greet the great lady of heaven, Inana! Adorned with women's clothing on the left side, they parade before her, holy Inana. I shall greet the great lady of heaven, Inana! Competing with skipping ropes of coloured cords for her, they parade before her, holy Inana. I shall greet {the eldest daughter of Suen} { the great lady of heaven}, Inana!
69. 5th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 5-kam-ma-am3  ĝuruš ^ĝiš-rab3 ĝar-ra mu-na-šir3-šir3-re-eš  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  ki-sikil šu-gi4-a saĝ-ki gu2 la2-e  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  ĝiri2 ba-da-ra igi-ni-še3 UR X X ZA X  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-[dib-be2]  kur-ĝar-ra ed3-da ba-da-ra šu bi2-in-du8-uš  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  ĝiri2 uš2 dul4-dul4-e urin i3-su3-e  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  barag gu2-en-na-ka uš2 i3-bal-bal-e  tigi šem3 ^kuš-a2-la2-e gu3 nun mu-ni-ib-be2
en: Young men wearing neck-stocks sing to her and parade before her, holy Inana. Young women, šugia priestesses, coiffured, parade before her, holy Inana. …… sword and dagger for her, they parade before her, holy Inana. With daggers in their hands, …… kurĝara priests parade before her, holy Inana. Those who cover their swords with gore spatter blood as they parade before her, holy Inana. Blood is poured on the dais standing in the guena hall, as tigi, šem and ala drums are made to sound loudly.

akk: nu-u8-gig an sikil-la dili-ni nam-mi-in-gub  nin-ĝu10 an-šag4-ta u6 dug3-ge-eš im-me  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nin an-usan-na ^d-inana maḫ-am3  ki-sikil ^d-inana me-teš2 mu-e-i-i
en: The Mistress stands alone in the pure heavens. From the midst of heaven my lady looks with joy at all the lands and the black headed people, who are as numerous as {sheep} { ewes}. { They parade before her, holy Inana.} I praise the lady of the evening, Inana, the august one, the young lady, Inana. {The lady of the evening reaches the borders of heaven!} { The lady exalted as high as the heaven, Inana, is august!}
88. 6th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 6-kam-ma-[am3]  an-usan-na mul /dalla\ [e3-a ^mul-dili-bad] ud gal an kug-[ge si-a]  nin an-usan-na ur-saĝ-ĝa2 an-ta nam-ta-[an-e3]  uĝ3-e kur-kur-ra igi mu-un-ši-ib-il2-il2-i  nitaḫ2 mu-un-sikil-e munus mu-un-zalag-/ga\  gud-de3 ^ĝiš-šudul-bi-a saĝ mu-ni-ib-bal-e  udu-bi amaš-bi-a saḫar mu-na-an-dub-dub-bu-uš  maš2-anše lu-a ^d-šakkan2-na niĝ2-zi-ĝal2 edin-na  pu2-^ĝiš-kiri6 mu2-sar ĝiš-gi sig7-ga  ku6 engur-ra-ke4 mušen an-na-[ke4]  nin-ĝu10 ki-nu2-bi-še3 ĝiri3 [mu-ni]-ib-ul4-e  zi-ĝal2 uĝ3 lu-a dub3 mu-un-ši-gam-e  nin-ĝu10 gu3 de2-a bur-šu-ma-e-ne  gu7 naĝ gal-gal-e niĝ2 mi-ni-ib-gu-ul-gu-ul-lu-ne  nin-ĝu10 kalam-ma-na ni2 mu-ni-ib-te-en-ten  ešemen kalam-ma ezem-ma du3-du3  šul-e nitalam-a-ni šag4 ša-mu-un-di-ni-ib-kuš2-u3
en: When at evening, the radiant star, the Venus star, the great light which fills the holy heavens, the lady of the evening, ascends above like a warrior, the people in all the lands lift their gaze to her. The men purify themselves, the woman cleanse themselves. The oxen toss their heads in their yoke. The sheep stir up dust in their pens. Because of my lady, the numerous beasts of Šakkan, the creatures of the plain, the four-legged animals {under the broad heavens} { of the broad high plain}, the orchards and gardens, the plots, the green reedbeds, the fish of the deep, the birds of heaven, all hasten to their sleeping places. All the living creatures and the numerous people bend the knee before her. When called for by my lady, the matriarchs plentifully provide food and drink, and my lady refreshes herself in her Land. There is play in the Land, which is made festive. The young men take pleasure in their spouses.

akk: nin-ĝu10 an-šag4-ta u6 dug3-ge-eš im-me  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nin an-usan-na ^d-inana maḫ-/am3\  ki-sikil ^d-inana me-teš2 mu-e-i-i  nin an-usan-na an-zag-še3 maḫ-/am3\
en: From the midst of heaven my lady looks down with joy. They parade before her, holy Inana. The lady of the evening, Inana, is august; I praise the young lady, Inana. The lady of the evening, her grandeur reaches the borders of heaven!
111. 7th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 7-kam-ma-am3  an-zib2-ba zag ḫi-li an-na me-te an daĝal-la  ĝi6 u3-na iti6-gin7 mu-un-e3  an-bar7-gana2 ud-ud-gin7 mu-un-e3  ama5 kalam-ma-ka u2 dug3 ĝar-ra-ba  kur-kur saĝ gig2 uĝ3 gu2 si-a-ba  ama5 kalam-ma-ka du8-du8 ĝar-ra-ba  ur3-ra nu2-a bad3-da nu2-a  [X X] KA-KA mu-na-an-sug2-ge-eš inim-bi mu-na-an-tum3-uš  ud-bi-a inim mu-ni-in-zu erim2-du mu-ni-in-zu  erim2-du di erim2 ba-ab-šum2-mu ḫul-ĝal2 mu-un-gul-le   igi zid mu-un-ši-bar nam dug3 mi-ni-in-tar
en: At night the skilled and beautiful one , the joy of An, the ornament of broad heaven, appears like moonlight; in the heat of the noon she appears like sunlight. After the storehouses of the Land have been filled with fine food, and all the lands and the black-headed people have assembled, { and the storehouses of the Land have been made full ,} those who sleep on the roofs and those who sleep by the walls step up before her with …… and bring her their cases. Then she makes her orders known, and identifies the evil. She judges the evil as evil and destroys the wicked. She looks with favour on the just and determines a good fate for them.

akk: nin-ĝu10 an-šag4-ta u6 dug3-ge-eš im-me  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nin an-še3 la2-a ^d-inana maḫ-am3  ki-sikil ^d-inana me-teš2 mu-e-i-i  nin an-še3 lu-a an-zag-še3 maḫ-am3
en: From the midst of heaven my lady looks down with joy. They parade before her, holy Inana. The lady exalted as high as the heaven, Inana, is august! I praise the young woman, Inana. The lady exalted as high as the heaven, her grandeur reaches the borders of heaven.
127. 8th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 8-kam-ma-am3  nin sag9 ḫi-li an-na ur-saĝ-am3 an-ta nam-ta-an-e3  zag-si an-na-ka ḫe-du7 am3-mi-in-gur3-ru  an-da ki maḫ-a-na šag4 mu-un-di-ni-ib-kuš2-u3
en: The beautiful lady, the joy of An, has ascended above like a warrior. She carries there what befits the …… of heaven. She takes counsel with An in his lofty place. Among {youths and heroes} { heroic youths}, may she be alone chosen!
132. Ĝišgiĝal.
She is mighty, she is respected, she exalted, she is august and great, she is surpassing in youthfulness.

akk: kalag-ga-am3 nir-ĝal2-am3 buluĝ3-ĝa2-am3 maḫ gal-la-am3 nam-šul-am3 dirig-ga-am3
en: 134. Šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  nin u6 di kalam-ma mul dili ^mul-dili-bad  nin an-še3 la2-a ur-saĝ-ĝa2 an-ta nam-ta-an-e3  kur-kur-re mu-un-ši-ḫu-luḫ-e X X  uĝ3 saĝ gig2-ga zid gu2 mu-un-na-an-ĝar  šul kaskal-la du ḫar-ra-an mu-un-na-ĝa2-ĝa2  gud-de3 ^ĝiš-šudul-bi-a saĝ mu-ni-ib-il2  i-lu šir3 gud sub2-sub2-ba edin-na [… dug4]  engar an im-du u3-a mu-un-[…]  gud-de3 ^ĝiš-šudul-bi-še3 kalam-ma X […]  ama5 kalam-ma-ka niĝ2 mu-un-da-lu-lu
en: As the lady, admired by the Land, the lone star, the Venus star, the lady elevated as high as the heaven, ascends above like a warrior, all the lands tremble before her ……. The faithful black-headed people bow to her. The young man travelling on the road directs himself by her. The oxen raise their heads in their yoke to her. { The melody of the song of those tending the cattle resounds …… on the plain. The farmer …… the cattle …… their yoke in the Land.} With her the storehouses of the Land prosper.

akk: kug ^d-inana-ra ĝiri3 mu-un-ši-ib-ul4-e  nin-ĝu10 an-šag4-ta dug3-ge-eš ḫu-mu-un-ĝa2-ĝa2  edin-na ki sikil-ba ki sag9-ga-bi  ur3-re ur3-bad3-da ur3-bad3 dur2-ra-ka  ki-šu-tag nam-lu2-ulu3-ka  na-izi sig9 tir šim ^ĝiš-erin-na-gin7 mu-na-ab-us2  ^udu-a-lum udu zulumḫi udu niga ĝiš mu-ni-ib-tag-ge
en: Everybody hastens to holy Inana. For my lady in the midst of heaven the best of everything is prepared . In the pure places of the plain, at its good places, on the roofs, on the rooftops, the rooftops of the dwellings , in the sanctuaries of mankind, incense offerings like a forest of aromatic cedars are transmitted to her. They sacrifice alum sheep, long-haired sheep, and fattened sheep for her. They purify the earth for the Mistress, they {carry out purification rites for her} { celebrate her in songs}.

akk: i3-nun zu2-lum ga-ar3 niĝ2-sa-ḫa 7-bi  ^ĝiš-banšur kalam-ma-ka nesaĝ mu-na-ab-si  kurun gig2 mu-na-ra-de2  kurun babbar mu-na-ra-de2  kurun gig2 &kaš;ulušin  nin-ĝu10-ra &kaš;ulušin  ^dug-šag4-gub ^dug-lam-sa2-ri du-bu-ul-da-ba-al mu-un-da-ab-za  šu-tu-bu-ur lal3 i3-nun-ta šar2-ra  ku-bu-ul-lum i3-nun-[ta šar2-ra]  ^ninda-gug2-e lal3 zu2-lum-ma ninda mu-na-ab-ak-e  kurun ud zal-la eša zid2 lal3-a  lal3 ĝeštin ud e3-a mu-na-ab-bal-bal-e  diĝir lu-u18-lu gu7-a naĝ-a-da ša-mu-un-na-an-sug2-sug2-ge-eš
en: They fill the tables of the Land with ghee, dates, cheese, and seven sorts of fruits as first-fruit offerings for her. They pour dark beer for her, they pour light beer for her. Dark beer, emmer beer, and emmer beer for my lady bubble in the šagub jar and the lamsari vat for her. From pastes of honey mixed with ghee { From …… mixed with ghee}, they bake date-syrup cakes for her. They pour out early-morning beer, flour, flour in honey, honey, and wine of sunrise for her. The personal gods of the people also attend upon her with food and drink. {They provide the Mistress with food in the holy place, the pure place.} { They purify the earth for the Mistress, they celebrate her in songs.}

akk: nin-ĝu10 an-šag4-ta u6 dug3-ge-eš im-me  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2  nin an-še3 la2-a ^d-inana maḫ-am3  ki-sikil ^d-inana me-teš2 mu-e-i-i  nin an-še3 la2-a an-zag-še3 maḫ-am3
en: From the midst of heaven my lady looks down with joy. They parade before her, holy Inana. Inana, the lady exalted as high as the heaven is august! I praise the young lady, Inana. The lady exalted as high as the heaven, her grandeur reaches the borders of heaven!
168. 9th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 9-kam-ma-am3  e2-gal e2 na de5 kalam-ma-ka ^ĝiš-rab3 kur-kur-ra-kam  e2 ^d-id2-lu2-ru-gu2 saĝ gig2-ga uĝ3 gu2 si-a-ba  ^d-nin-e2-gal-la-ra barag mu-na-an-ri  lugal diĝir-am3 šag4-bi-a mu-un-da-an-til3  ud saĝ zid-de3 igi kar2-kar2-de3  ud nu2-a me šu du7-du7-de3  zag-mu ud ĝarza-ka  nin-ĝu10-ra ki-nu2 ba-da-an-ĝar  ^u2-numun2-bur2^sar- šim ^ĝiš-erin-na-da mu-un-sikil-e-ne  nin-ĝu10 ki-nu2-bi-še3 mu-na-ab-ĝa2-ĝa2-ne  bar-ba ^tug2-niĝ2-barag2-ge
en: When the black-headed people have assembled in the palace, the house that advises the Land, the neck-stock of all the foreign countries, the house of the river of ordeal, a dais is set up for Ninegala. The divine king stays there with her. At the New Year, on the day of the rites, {in order for her to determine the fate of all the countries} { in order for the life of all the countries to be attended to}, so that during the day the faithful servants can be inspected, so that on the day of the disappearance of the moon the divine powers can be perfected, a bed is set up for my lady. Esparto grass is purified with cedar perfume and arranged on that bed for my lady, and a coverlet is smoothed out on the top of it.

akk: ^tug2-niĝ2-barag2 šag4 ḫul2-la ki-nu2 dug3-dug3-ge-da  nin-ĝu10 ur2 kug-ge a mi-ni-in-tu5-tu5  ur2 lugal-la-še3 a im-ma-tu5-tu5  kug ^d-inana-ke4 naĝa im-ma-an-su-ub-be2  i3 šim ^ĝiš-erin-na ki am3-sud-e
en: In order to find sweetness in the bed on the joyous coverlet, my lady bathes her holy thighs. She bathes them for the thighs of the king; {she bathes them for} { with head held high she goes to} the thighs of Iddin-Dagan. Holy Inana rubs herself with soap; she sprinkles oil and cedar essence on the ground.

akk: lugal ur2 kug-še3 saĝ il2-la mu-un-ĝen  ur2 ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan-še3 saĝ il2-la mu-un-ĝen  ur2 ^d-inana-ka-še3 saĝ il2-la mu-un-ĝen  ^d-ama-ušumgal-an-na ki-nu2 mu-un-da-ab-ak-e  nin-e ur2 kug-ga ki-nu2 mi-ni-in-sug4-ga-ta  kug ^d-inana-ke4 ur2 kug-ga ki-nu2 mi-ni-in-sug4-ga-ta  ki-nu2-a-na šag4 ša-mu-un-di-ni-ib-kuš2-u3  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan-na ki aĝ2-ĝu10 ḫe2-me-en
en: The king goes to her holy thighs with head held high, { she goes to the thighs of Iddin-Dagan,} he goes to the thighs of Inana with head held high. Ama-ušumgal-ana lies down beside her and {caresses her holy thighs} { "O my holy thighs! O my holy Inana!"}. After the lady has made him rejoice with her holy thighs on the bed, after holy Inana has made him rejoice with her holy thighs on the bed, she relaxes with him on her bed: "Iddin-Dagan, you are indeed my beloved!"

akk: ne-saĝ sig10-ga-še3 šu-luḫ ĝar-ĝar-ra-še3  na-izi sig9-ga-še3 na li mu2-a-še3  nidba sug2-ga-še3 bur sug2-sug2-ga-še3  e2-gal-maḫ-a-ni-a im-ma-da-an-ku4-ku4  nitalam ki aĝ2-ĝa2-ni gu2-da mu-ni-in-la2  kug ^d-inana-ke4 gu2-da mu-ni-in-la2  lugal ^d-utu-gin7 zag-ge4 mu-di-ni-ib-sig9
en: To pour libations, to carry out purification rites, to heap up incense offerings, to burn juniper, to set out food offerings, to set out offering-bowls, he goes into her Egal-maḫ. She embraces her beloved spouse, holy Inana embraces him. She shines like daylight on {the great throne dais} { the throne at one side } and makes the king position himself next to her like the sun.

akk: ḫe2-ĝal2 giri17-zal-e nam-ḫe2-a igi-ni-še3   ĝišbun niĝ2 dug3-ga mu-un-na-an-ni-ĝal2  saĝ gig2-ga igi-ni-še3   ĝiš-gu3-di ulu3-ta eme ĝar-ra  ^ĝiš-al-ĝar gu3 dug3-ga e2-gal me-te-bi  ^ĝiš-za3-mi2 ki ur5 sag9-ge nam-lu2-ulu3-ke4  nar-e šir3 šag4 ḫul2-la-ka-ni mu-ni-in-pad3-pad3-de3  lugal-e gu7-a naĝ-a-da šu   ^d-ama-ušumgal-an-na gu7-a naĝ-da šu   e2-gal ezem-ma-am3 lugal ḫul2-la-am3  uĝ3-e nam-ḫe2-a ud i3-zal-e-de3  ^d-ama-ušumgal-an-na ḫul2-ḫul2-e am3-gub  ^ĝiš-gu-za gi-rin-na ud ḫa-ba-ni-ib-sud-de3  barag nam-lugal-la-ka saĝ gu2 mu-ni-in-ĝal2
en: Abundance and celebration are prepared before her in plenty. He arranges a rich banquet for her. The black-headed people line up before her. With instruments loud enough to drown out the south wind-storm, with sweet sounding alĝar instruments, the glory of the palace, and with harps, the source of joy for mankind, musicians perform songs which delight her heart. The king sees to what is eaten and drunk, Ama-ušumgal-ana sees to what is eaten and drunk. The palace is in festive mood, the king is joyous. The people spend the day amid plenteousness. Ama-ušumgal-ana stands in great joy. May his days be long on the splendid throne! He proudly occupies the royal dais.

akk: nin-ĝu10 za3-mi2 an ki-ke4-ne za3-mi2 ma-ni-in-dug4  nu-u8-gig an ki-da tud-da-me-en  nu-u8-gig-e ki kug ki sikil-la šir3-ra mu-na-an-ĝal2  ḫi-li saĝ gig2 me-te unken-na  ^d-inana dumu gal ^d-suen-na  nin an-usan^an--na za3-mi2-zu dug3-ga-am3
en: They praise my lady on my behalf with the hymns of heaven and earth. "You are the Mistress born together with heaven and earth." In the holy place, the pure place, they celebrate the Mistress in songs: "Joy of the black-headed people, ornament of the assembly, Inana, eldest daughter of Suen, lady of the evening, your praise is good."

akk: nin-ĝu10 an-šag4-ta u6 dug3-ge-eš im-me  kug ^d-inana-ra igi-ni-še3 i3-dib-be2
en: From the midst of heaven my lady looks down with joy. They parade before her, holy Inana. {Inana, the lady elevated as high as the heavens, is august!} { The lady of the evening, her grandeur reaches the borders of heaven!}
226. 10th kirugu.

akk: <ki-ru-gu2 10-kam-ma-am3>  kalag-ga-am3 nir-ĝal2-am3 buluĝ3-ĝa2-am3 maḫ gal-am3  nam-šul-la dirig-ga-am3
en: She is mighty, she is respected, she is exalted, she is august and great, she is surpassing in youthfulness!
229. Ĝišgiĝal.
230. A šir-namursaĝa of Ninsiana.

akk: ^d-i-din-^d-da-[gan] an-ne2 ki maḫ-a-ni-a nam gal mu-ri-in-tar  aga zid-de3 dalla mu-ra-ni-in-e3  nam-sipad kalam-ma-še3 mu-un-il2-en  kur ĝiri3-zu-še3 mu-un-ĝar
en: Iddin-Dagan, in his majestic location An has decided a great fate for you, has made the just crown shine for you, has raised you to shepherdship over the Land, has placed the foreign lands at your feet.

akk: ^d-en-lil2-le igi zid mu-e-ši-in-bar  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan gu3 zid mu-ra-an-de2  us2-saĝ ki-en-gi-re gen6-ne2-de3  uĝ3 us2-a sig10-ge-de3  ki-en-gi ki-uri an-dul3 daĝal-la-za ni2 dub2-bu-de3  uĝ3-e u2 nir-ĝal2 gu7-u3-de3 a dug3 na8-na8-de3  ^d-en-lil2-le a2-bi mu-e-da-an-aĝ2  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan sipad šag4-ga-na-me-en  gu3 zid de2-a ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en
en: Enlil has looked at you truly, Iddin-Dagan, he has spoken truly to you. Enlil has commanded you to keep firm the cosmic bond in Sumer, to keep the people on the track, to let Sumer and Akkad relax under your broad protection, to let the people eat noble food and drink fresh water. Iddin-Dagan, you are the shepherd in his heart, the one whom Enlil has spoken to truly.

akk: ^d-en-ki-ke4 ĝeštug2 daĝal niĝ2-nam-ma zu-zu  kiĝ2 igi-ĝal2 zi^?- ka piriĝ-ta [ed2]-de3  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan za-ra mu-ra-an-de6  kur-kur-re me-teš2 ḫe2-i-i
en: Enki has brought to you, Iddin-Dagan, broad understanding, knowledge of everything, wise command, a life that comes from the mouth of a lion. May all the foreign lands praise you.

akk: dumu tud-da ^d-da-gan-na en il2 uĝ3 [daĝal]-le  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan iri-zu-še3 u6 dug3-ge-eš ḫe2-i  i3 li niĝ2 [šag4]-ga nu-da13-da13  ^d-en-lil2 ḫe2-da-ḫul2  ^d-utu-gin7 ud zid e3-a-zu-še3 igi-bi ḫe2-em-ši-ĝal2  kur-kur-re an-dul3 daĝal-la-zu-še3 ni2 im-ši-dub2-be2
en: Son born to Dagan, elevated lord who increases the people, Iddin-Dagan, may you look approvingly on your city. Balm of the heart who neglects nothing, Enlil rejoices in you. When like Utu you bring forth a just light, people's eyes are indeed directed towards it. All the foreign lands stay calm under your broad protection.

akk: ḫar-ra-an kaskal-la   su kalam-ma mu-e-dug3  niĝ2-si-sa2 ka-ga14 mu-e-ni-ĝar  niĝ2-du7 pa bi2-i-e3  in mu-e-dub-dub ki mu-e-sur-sur  ki-en-gi ki-uri gu2 bi2-i-zig3  [šu]-luḫ diĝir-re-e-ne [  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan [ki]-bi-še3 gi4-gi4-en  niĝ2-dug4-ga-zu […] GI […]-im-ĝar  inim-zu an kug-[ge us2-sa]  ka-ta e3-a-zu [an]-ne2 /dul\-[lu]
en: You have put the highways and roads in order, made the Land content, placed justice in every mouth, made propriety resplendent. You have marked the borders and fixed the boundaries, made Sumer and Akkad raise their necks. Iddin-Dagan, you have restored the purification rituals of the deities which you have organised. What you order ……. Your word reaches holy heaven, your utterances cover the heavens.

akk: dug4-ga ^d-en-lil2-la2-ta  igi bar-ra-zu lu2 mu-un-til3-le  ka ba-zu lu2 mu-un-silim-e  dug4-ga-a-zu ^d-en-lil2 mu-ši-[ḫul2]  šag4-ge de6-a-zu ^d-nin-lil2-le ḫe2-am3-bi im-[me]  sipad ^d-en-lil2-ra ĝiškim til3-me-en  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan a-ba za-e-gin7 i3-dim2  igi-bi ḫe2-em-ši-ĝal2
en: At Enlil's command, your gaze brings men life, your conversation brings men health. Enlil rejoices in your speech. Ninlil declares "so be it" to your desires. Shepherd Enlil is your support. Iddin-Dagan, who is built like you? People's eyes are directed towards you.

akk: e2-kur-še3 za-e lu2-bi ḫe2-me-en  nidba-zu e2 ^d-en-lil2-la2-kam   šeg12 e2-kur-ra-ke4 sag9-ga-zu ^d-en-lil2 ^d-nin-lil2-ra ḫu-mu-un-ne-eb2-be2  inim sag9-ga an ^d-en-lil2-la2-ta ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan a2 nun ḫe2-mu-e-te-ĝal2
en: You are indeed the man for the E-kur. May your offerings in the house of Enlil never cease. May the brickwork of the E-kur speak well of you to Enlil and Ninlil. At the favourable word of An and Enlil, Iddin-Dagan, may princely strength be yours.

akk: mu maḫ-zu kalam-ma i3-ĝal2  an-zag-še3 mu-zu pa bi2-in-e3  kalag-ga nam-ur-saĝ a2 me3 šen-šen gub-bu  ki-bal-da du7-du7 mu-e-DU  šag4-ta ^d-da-gan-na [nam]-še3 mu-ri-in-tar  za3-mi2-zu ka-ga14 i-ni-in-ĝal2
en: Your magnificent reputation exists throughout the Land -- your name dazzles to the horizon. Mighty man, standing in battle and conflict with heroism and strength, you come to batter rebellious lands. From the womb Dagan decreed that as your destiny. He has placed your praise in all mouths.

akk: nam-lugal-zu uĝ3-e ba-sag9  nam-sipad-zu šag4-ge um-ma-dug3  uĝ3 e-da-lu uĝ3 e-da-daĝal  kur-kur u2-sal-la mu-e-ri-nu2  uĝ3-e ḫe2-ĝal2-la ud mu-ri-ib2-zal-e  saĝ gig2-ga a-a-zu-gin7  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan igi-bi mu-e-ši-ĝal2
en: Your kingship is good for the people. After your shepherdship had pleased the heart, the people became numerous under you, the people spread wide under you. All the foreign lands lie down in pastures thanks to you. The people spend their days in abundance thanks to you. The black-headed direct their gaze on you, Iddin-Dagan, as on your father.

akk: ^d-en-lil2 en nam tar-tar-re-de3  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan ud-zu ḫe2-eb2-su3-ud-de3  nam-kal-la niĝ2-nam-e zu-a  igi dug3 ḫu-mu-ri-in-du8
en: Iddin-Dagan, may Enlil, the lord who determines fate, make your days long. May he who knows everything look approvingly on you with approbation.

akk: ĝeštug2 dirig dub ^d-nisaba-ke4 šum2-ma-zu  e2-dub-ba-a im-ma   e2-dub-ba-a-ba eš3 niĝ2 u3-tud-gin7 ki nam-ba-silig-ge  dub-sar-tur šu-ni ib2-ši-in-tum4 im bi2-ib2-sar-a  ^d-nisaba nin mul-a X ĝeštug2 ḫu-mu-un-[na-šum2]  šu ḫu-mu-un-bad  ki nam-dub-sar-ra-ka ud-gin7 ḫe2-en-na-e3
en: May your exceeding wisdom, given by the tablets of Nisaba, never cease on the clay in the tablet house. In this tablet house, like a shrine fashioning everything, may it never come to an end. May Nisaba, the shining …… lady, give wisdom to the junior scribe who puts his hand to the clay and writes this on it. May she show generosity. In the place of writing may she come forth like the sun for him.

akk: ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan ad-da-zu ^d-šu-i3-li2-šu lugal kalam-ma-ke4  ki-en-gi ki-uri suḫuš-bi mu-ra-an-ge-en  dug4-dug4-ga an ^d-en-lil2-ta ba-e-dirig  gu2-erim2-ĝal2 sa2 ba-e-dug4  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan lugal kalag-ga lugal i3-si-in^ki--na  lugal ki-en-gi4 ki-uri niĝ2-nam-ma ĝeštug2 eĝer-ra-bi  igi-še3 mu-ri-DU  ibila kalag-ga-me-en3 nir mu-e-ĝal2  ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan nam-nun-na gu2 an-še3 mi-ni-in-zig3
en: Iddin-Dagan, your father Šu-ilīšu, the king of the Land, made the foundation of Sumer and Akkad firm for you. By the commands of An and Enlil you excel and overwhelm the enemy territories. Iddin-Dagan, mighty king, king of Isin, king of Sumer and Akkad, everything to the end of wisdom has come forward for you. You are the mighty heir, you have authority, Iddin-Dagan, you have raised the neck to heaven in princeship.

akk: /en^?-\ ud sumur^!- ḫuš /erim2-ma\ X X X […]  /AN^?-\ X X kalag-ga /en-ĝu10\ uĝ3 til3 a-a /ugu\ […] ri  ud gal X er9-ra /gu3\ [ra]-ra im-mi-/in^?-\-X [X] X X  en nam-šul-la-ni a2-nun-ĝal2 A X X [X] ĝal2
en: The lord, a furious angry storm against the enemy, ……, strong ……, my lord who brings life to the people, whose own father ……, a great storm, a mighty raring ……, has …… -- the lord whose manliness is impressively strong, ……!
5. Barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  ur-saĝ ki-bal-a gu3 /ra^?-\-ra saĝ^?- ḫuš-bi bi2-/tu10^?-\  šeg12-bi ni2 bi2-te /in^?-\-dal-bi an-na ba-e-/ed3^?-\  sumun2 zid ki-bal-a gu3 [ra]-ra saĝ^?- ḫuš-bi bi2-/tu10^?-\  šeg12-bi ni2 bi2-te /in^?-\-dal-bi an-na ba-e-/ed3^?-\
en: Hero, roaring in the rebel-lands, you have angrily piled up skulls. You have terrified their brick buildings and scattered their chaff heavenward. Vigorous wild bull, roaring in the rebel-lands you have angrily piled up skulls. You have terrified their brick buildings and scattered their chaff heavenward.

akk: diĝir a nun-na iri-tuš^?- um-te-ri ^d-lamma-bi mu-u8-ta-/gub^?-\  [uzug] /sag9\-ga-bi saĝ šu ba-e-dug4 ĝiri3 kur2 im-/mi-dab5\  sumun2 zid iri-/tuš^?-\ um-te-ri ^d-lamma-bi mu-u8-ta-/gub^?-\  /uzug^?-\ sag9-ga-bi saĝ [šu] ba-e-dug4 ĝiri3 kur2 im-/mi-dab5\
en: Divine offspring of a prince, by your casting down their city dwellings, their protective gods have been alienated because of you. You have made them abandon their beautiful shrines and follow another path. Vigorous wild bull, by your casting down their city dwellings, their protective gods have been alienated because of you. You have made them abandon their beautiful shrines and follow another path.

akk: kur-bi za-e /ša-mu-u8\-[tab]-en tum9 lil2-e bi2-tum3  šul ur-saĝ-/bi gu2\ [im]-/mi\-ni-ĝal2 me3 la-ba-gub-bu-de3  sumun2 zid kur-bi za-e ša-mu-u8-tab-en tum9 lil2-e bi2-tum3  šul ur-saĝ-bi gu2 im-mi-ni-ĝal2 me3 la-ba-gub-bu-de3
en: You flatten those mountains and turn them over to ghostly winds. You make their young warriors submit, no longer able to enter into battle. Vigorous wild bull, you flatten those mountains and turn them over to ghostly winds. You make their young warriors submit, no longer able to enter into battle.
18. Šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  […] X KA niĝir /gal^?- BA^?-\ ra BI X X X X-/e^?--en^?-\  […] X X [X] X X X X X X  […] X A X X […]  [… gal]-an-zu ar2^?--re-zu X X
en: 4 lines fragmentary
23. 2nd barsud.

akk: /bar\-sud 2^!--kam-ma  [X X sumur] ḫuš erim2-ma /lu2\ ḫul-ĝal2 /ud^?-\ [im]-X-e  […] /e2\ ^d-suen-na-ka gud /  [X X] /sumur^?-\ ḫuš erim2-ma /lu2\ ḫul-ĝal2 /ud^?- im\-X-e  [… e2] ^d-suen-/na\-ka gud /
en: ……, a furious angry …… against the enemy, …… evil men. The …… arranges the cattle for Suen's house. ……, a furious angry …… against the enemy, …… evil men. The …… arranges the cattle for Suen's house.

akk: [X X] X ^d-aš-im2-babbar a-ra2-ni ki /aĝ2\  [X] zid ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan ^d-nanna-/ar^?-\ X-/dug4\  [X] [^d-aš-im2-babbar]-re a-ra2-ni ki /aĝ2\  [X zid] [^d-i]-/din\-^d-da-gan ^d-/nanna\-[ar] X-/an^?--dug4\
en: He has spoken to Nanna on behalf of …… whose ways are beloved of Ašimbabbar, on behalf of the just …… Iddin-Dagan. He has spoken to Nanna on behalf of …… whose ways are beloved of Ašimbabbar, on behalf of the just …… Iddin-Dagan.
1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing
4 lines fragmentary

…… given over to kingship by the word of Suen, …… whom Ašimbabbar has clothed in the royal robe of office! Vigorous wild bull given over to kingship by the word of the hero Suen, …… whom Ašimbabbar has clothed in the royal robe of office!
……, a lion, his father's respectful son, …… who …… for Iddin-Dagan! Vigorous wild bull, a lion, his father's respectful son, …… who …… for Iddin-Dagan!
…… justly like sunlight, …… who like Ašimbabbar gives correct verdicts! Vigorous wild bull …… justly like sunlight, …… who like Ašimbabbar gives correct verdicts!

Vigorous wild bull soothing Nanna's heart for Iddin-Dagan each day, whose just word is pleasing to Suen, who ……! Vigorous wild bull soothing Nanna's heart for Iddin-Dagan each day, whose just word is pleasing to Suen, who ……!

…… hero given great and majestic strength by Ašimbabbar, supporter of Iddin-Dagan, may you destroy the insubordinate lands! Vigorous wild bull given great and majestic strength by Ašimbabbar, supporter of Iddin-Dagan, may you destroy the insubordinate land!

akk: […] X X X […]  […] X X […]  [… DI] X KA zid-de3-eš [mu2]  [sumun2 zid X gal-an]-/zu^?-\ a-a-na ki /ḫe2^?-\-X […]  […] DI X KA zid-de3-eš /mu2^?-\  […] inim ^d-suen-na nam-lugal-še3 šum2-ma  […] ^d-aš-im2-babbar-re tug2^?- tug2-ba13 /mu4-mu4\  [sumun2 zid inim] šul ^d-suen-na nam-lugal-še3 šum2-ma  […] ^d-aš-im2-babbar-re tug2^?- tug2-ba13 /mu4-mu4\  [X X] X ur-maḫ a-a-na dumu giri17 šu ĝal2-la-ni-im  [X (X)] [^d-i]-/din\-^d-da-gan-na AB RI mu-dub^?--dub^?-  [sumun2 zid ur]-maḫ a-a-na dumu giri17 šu ĝal2-la-ni-im  [X (X)] [^d-i-din]-^d-da-gan-na AB RI mu-dub^?--dub^?-  […]-/bi^?-\ ud-gin7^!- zid-de3-eš ak  [X X] [^d-aš-im2-babbar]-/gin7\ ]  [sumun2 zid X X]-/bi^?-\ ud-gin7 zid-de3-eš ak  [X X] [^d-]aš-im2-babbar-gin7   /sumun2^?- zid^?-\ [ud] šu2-uš ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan-na šag4 ^d-nanna /ḫuĝ^?--ĝe26^?-\-e  inim /zid-da\-ni ^d-suen-ra sag9 su^?- zal-le-eš2 ak  sumun2 zid ud šu2-uš ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan-na šag4 ^d-nanna /ḫuĝ^?--ĝe26^?-\-e  inim zid-da-ni ^d-suen-/ra\ /sag9\ su^?- zal-le-eš2 ak  /ur-saĝ\ [X] [^d-]aš-im2-babbar-re a2 gal maḫ /šum2-ma\  /ĝiškim\-[til3] [^d-i]-din-^d-da-gan-na kur nu-še-ga ḫe2-/gul-lu-e^?-\  sumun2 /zid\ [^d-aš]-im2-babbar-re a2 gal maḫ šum2-ma  ĝiškim-til3 ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan-na kur nu-še-ga ḫe2-/gul-lu\
en: 25. Sa-ĝara.
Vigorous wild bull, may you respond to Iddin-Dagan for …… days.
27. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-ĝara.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2 sa-ĝar-ra-bi-im  ur-saĝ ku-kur dugud gaba-ri-bi-še3 nu-e3  en ^d-nin-gublaga ku-kur dugud gaba-ri-bi-še3 nu-e3  ^d-sumun2-zid ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan-na ḫul-du-ni ĝiš-gaz-bi ḫe2-me-en
en: Hero, formidable flood that no man comes forward to oppose! Lord Ningublaga, formidable flood that no man comes forward to oppose! Sumun-zid , may you be the crusher of Iddin-Dagan's enemies!
31. Its uru.
32. An adab of Ningublaga.

akk: nin gal <a>-zu maḫ saĝ gig2-ga  kug ^d-nin-isin2^si--na dumu an-na me-teš2 ḫe2-i-i
en: Great lady, majestic physician to the black-headed, holy Ninisina, daughter of An, may you be praised!

akk: nin ^tum9-u18-lu-ni ud mir-a-gin7 an-šag4-a ki^?- dub2-bu X  ^d-gibil6-gin7 igi /ḫuš il2\-la-ni erim2-ma su dar-dar-re  ušumgal-gin7 ki KA X-a-na uš11-bi nu-ed3-de3  /šu piriĝ\-ĝa2 ĝiri2 u3-sar ak umbin uš2 biz-biz-biz  su X ḪA E de2-de3 ni2 su-a ru-ru-gu2  ĝiri2-zal bulug-kiĝ2-gur4 ĝiri2 piriĝ-ĝa2-gin7 uzu e3-a-zu-uš  uĝ3 saĝ gig2 su ma-ra-sag3-sag3-ge
en: Lady whose tempest, like a raging storm, …… the interior of heaven and the trembling earth, whose upraised fierce face, like a fire, rips the bodies of the enemy; who, like a dragon, does not bring up venom in her place where ……, paws of a lion, sharpened knives, claws constantly dripping blood, …… which prick the body with fear! When you draw through the flesh the scalpel and the lancet, knives like lion's claws -- the bodies of the black-headed people tremble because of you!

akk: ud gal ki us2-sa gaba-šu-ĝar nu-tuku  ud gu3 dub2-dub2 piriĝ šeg12 gi4-gi4 erim2-e gu2 kud-da  ud  aḫ6 [X X] X-ba gug sar ak  ud ad-ba mur ša4 /ka\-bi /mud mu^?-\-biz-biz  ud ka-bi-ta aḫ6 su3-su3-su3 /erim2\-e uš11 bal^?-  /niĝ2^?-\ [X X] X X X X X [X] X DU a2^?- tur^?-
en: Great storm that approaches the earth and has no rival, howling storm, roaring lion that cuts off the neck of the enemy, overpowering storm, …… spittle and gnashing its teeth in its ……! Storm that howls loudly, whose mouth drips blood, storm from whose mouth spittle spews constantly, pouring venom on the enemy, 1 line fragmentary

akk: ni2 gal edin-na saĝ X X X  es2-ad maḫ-gin7 ḫul-še3 /nu2\-[a]  nin me-lem4 ḫuš an-ne2 tud-[da]  saĝ zid kalam-ma-ka  unken-/na igi\ ĝal2  nin til3-la ug5-ga zi kalam-ma šu du8  nu-gig-ra na-me nu-gub-bu kurku2 ad ĝa2-ĝa2  kug ^d-nin-isin2^si--na niĝin3-ĝar ki kug-ga unu2 šuba sud-sud  nin kur-ra dirig-ga me-ni me-/a^?-\ ḫuš  eš3 gal e2 da-/ri2^?-\ kalam-ma-ka X maḫ X mu-un-ri
en: Great terror of the desert that ……! A lion, a leopard rising from its lair and terrifying people, that like a great snare lies in wait for the evil-doer! Lady whose radiance is awesome, born of An, who cares for the righteous of the Land, who watches over the assembly, lady of the living and of the dead, who holds the life of the Land in her hand! Mistress whom no one can withstand, who sounds a triumphal cry! Holy Ninisina, who wears the ornaments of šuba stone in Niĝin-ĝar, the holy place! Lady who is supreme over the mountains, whose divine powers are awesome divine powers, instilled …… in the great shrine, the everlasting house of the Land!

akk: nin til3 mud kalam-ma mu-zu urin gal-bi-im  nin me maḫ an gal-gin7 zag ša4  nu-u8-gig diĝir gal-gal-e-ne  nin ni2-zu /an\ ki-a ša-mu-un-ri  igi-zu ḫuš-me-en za-pa-/aĝ2-zu maḫ^?--me-en\  saĝ-/ki\-zu X IM X X ĜAR [X]-me-en  ka-zu NE /su^?--lim^?- nu^?-\-X X X kur2^?-  a2-zu [sa]-par3-/gin7^?-\ ḫul-du X X [X X] /mu\-un-kud
en: Lady, life-creator of the Land, your name is its great standard. Lady of the majestic divine powers who rivals great An, mistress of all the great gods, lady, you have instilled fear of you in heaven and on earth. Your face is awesome, your cry is majestic, your forehead ……, your mouth ……; your arm, …… the evil-doer like a net, has cut off …….

akk: [kug] ^d-nin-isin2^si--/na\ X X X X X [X] X-e  [šag4] mir-a-ni lu2 nu-te-en-/te\-en šag4 an-/usan^?-\-gin7 du3  [šag4] /ib2\-ba-ni-a diĝir na-me gaba šu nu-ĝa2-/ĝa2\  [a]-ab-ba-gin7 ku-kur um-de6 lu2-erim2 ba-an-/na8^?--na8^?-\  [a]-/ĝi6\ uru16-gin7 ze2 guru5-a gu2-erim2-e bi2-/ib2\-ri  [X] X GU UL en-ne2 /maḫ^?-\ X A X šag4-ba mu-un-zu
en: Holy Ninisina, ……, whose raging heart, made like the heart of dusk , none can cool; whose angry heart no god can confront, which like the sea, bringing a flood-wave, drowns the foe. Like the high tide, she pours spewed-out bile upon the enemy. She has made …… known in its midst.

akk: [kug] [^d-nin]-/isin2\^si--na iri ka tar-ra-zu ki-bi nu-gi4  [X] /ka\ ba-a-zu du6-du6-da ma-ra-an-šid  [ki]-/bal\-a nam ba-e-de3-ku5-ra2-zu lu2 nu-mu-ni-in-dib-be2  [X] ka tar-ra-zu id2-da /nu\-bal-e
en: Holy Ninisina, the city that fears you is not restored. The …… you address is turned into ruins for you. No one moves about in the rebellious land that you curse. The …… that fears you does not cross the river.

akk: [nin]-ĝu10 nam-gur4 dirig nam-buluĝ3-zu [saĝ]-/bi\-še3 e3-a  unken ĝar-ra-zu tuku-a-bi X […] X-da  kug ^d-nin-isin2^si--na nin X […] X nu-bar-re  nu-u8-gig nam-maḫ-a X […] /an-kar2^?-\  kug ^d-nin-isin2^si--na nin /IM\ […] X bar^?-  piriĝ ušum zag e3 X […] X  šu mu-šub-šub-ba /ḫul^?-\ […]  ki nam-erim2-ma šu zid il2-la /im-si-si\ […]  lu2-lul-la mu-zu KA sikil X […]  DA^?- SA UŠ^?- gu2-erim2-e X […]  lu2 ḫul-ĝal2 ^d-i-din-^d-da-[gan-na] […]  ^d-nin-isin2^si--na mu-zu lu2-[erim2-e nam-ba-an-tum3]
en: My lady, your supreme magnitude and eminence being outstanding, the …… of your established assembly being ……, holy Ninisina, lady ……, mistress whose majesty ……, holy Ninisina, lady ……, lion, foremost viper ……, who ……, …… the place of oaths where the just hand is raised, the deceiver …… your name ……, …… on the enemies! May those who plan evil against Iddin-Dagan ……! Ninisina, let not the enemy carry away your name, O your name, Ninisina, O your name!

akk: an maḫ-di a-a diĝir-re-e-/ne\ […] X  /šag4\ su3-ra2 me nun X gal-le-[eš …] e3  gu3 a-ma-ru nu-še-ga dul […] zu  mir mir-ra-«ke4» lu2 […]  /IM\ X X X […] X  lu2-/lul\ ^d-i-/din\-[^d-da-gan-na] [X X X] ĝal2-la-a ^sa-šu2-uš-gal-gin7 [ḫu]-mu-un-šu2  an diĝir maḫ mu-zu lu2-erim2-e nam-ba-an-tum3  a mu-zu an gal a mu-zu
en: Sublime An, father of the gods, ……, patient-hearted, who …… the princely divine powers …… greatly! The voice of a flood that covers the disobedient, that knows ……, the north wind ……, 1 line fragmentary May the deceivers of Iddin-Dagan who …… be overwhelmed as by a battle-net! Majestic god An, let not the enemy carry away your name, O your name, great An, O your name!

akk: ^d-en-lil2 me gal-gal sag2 nu-di ušum diĝir-re-e-ne  ^d-nu-nam-nir X /dug4\-dug4-ge dib^?--ba-zu /ni2\ su zig3 bar-re^!--dam  ^d-a-nun-na kur-kur-ra-ke4-ne šu-ta BA [X] /im\-sag3-ge-ne  eš-bar-zu /u18\-lu sumur-bi X […]  kur gu2-erim2-ĝal2 nu-ĝal2 iri-še3 u3-gul X X X X X  lu2 ĝiri3 ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan-na nu-mu-un-dab5-ba a^?--gin7 ḫu-mu-su-su  kur gal ^d-en-lil2 mu-zu lu2-erim2-e nam-ba-an-tum3  a mu-zu ^d-en-lil2 a mu-zu
en: Enlil whose great divine powers cannot be overturned, viper of the gods, Nunamnir, your …… lets loose fear and terror! The Anuna of all the lands strike …… with their hands. Your decision …… a tempest that …… furiously. In the land where no enemies exist, prayers …… to the city. May those who do not clasp the feet of Iddin-Dagan be drowned as by water! Great Mountain Enlil, let not the enemy carry away your name, O your name, Enlil, O your name!

akk: ^d-nin-lil2 tug2 babbar nin mas-su igi-ĝal2 SA TUG2 e3  nin me-lem4 šar2-ra šu gal-le-eš du7-a ^d-en-lil2-da til3^?-  lugal mu-zu lul-e-eš pad3-de3-de3 saĝ im-ma-ab-šum2-mu-a  ki šer7-da ^d-id2-lu2-ru-gu2 kalam-ma  garaš2 ki uš2 bal-bal-e-ba ni2 la-ba-da-ab-teĝ3-ĝe26-e-/a\  nam-tag dugud su X [X] ed3-de3 e-ne-ra il2  ama gal ^d-nin-lil2 mu-zu lu2-erim2-e nam-ba-/an\-[tum3]  a mu-zu ^d-nin-lil2 a mu-zu
en: Ninlil, garbed in white, foremost and watchful lady who brings forth ……, lady who consummately perfects all radiance, who dwells with Enlil! The king who dares to utter your name falsely, who does not fear the slaughterhouse where blood flows at the place of transgression, the Land's river of ordeal -- make him bear the heavy guilt that ……! Great mother Ninlil, let not the enemy carry away your name, O your name, Ninlil, O your name!

akk: ^d-a-ru-ru me sag2 nu-di u18-lu ḫuš-a ḫe2-X  [X] ^d-en-lil2 su […] tar-re niĝ2-nam-bi luḫ-luḫ  […] IM SA TE gal^?- DA […]  […] niĝ2-erim2 niĝ2-[a2]-zig3  […] X KA ^d-i-din-^d-da-gan
en: Aruru, whose divine powers cannot be overturned, …… an awesome tempest. Enlil who purifies all ……, 1 line fragmentary …… hostility and violence, …… Iddin-Dagan, unknown no. of lines missing

akk: […]  X […]  diĝir gal-gal-e-ne saĝ /keše2\-[bi]  ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne temen-bi  ^d-en-ki-^d-en-ki tug2 zi-ĝal2-bi  me gal-gal-a-ni sag2 di nu-zu  […]-/ni\ saĝ-bi-še3 e3-a  […]-/ni\ na-me sa2 nu-di  […]-me-ni ni2-ba gi4-gi4  […]-ni an ki-bi dug3-dug3  […]-ni iri ki du3-du3  […]-ni kalam ki ĝa2-ĝa2  […] X ĝeštug2 ud zal-la šu du7  […] a2 aĝ2-e gal-zu  […] A niĝ2-zid ki-bi-še3 ĝar  [ad gi4]-/gi4\ inim-ma nu-kuš2-u3  A […] eš-bar-e di-di  X […]-ma di-kud an ki  X […]-ni-še3 ĝal2-la  niĝ2-[zi]-/ĝal2\ X [(X)] /laḫ5\-laḫ5-e  a-[a] [^d-]en-lil2 sipad saĝ gig2-ga  X [X (X)]-ni-ta kur gam-e
en: Enlil, by far …… 2 lines missing He to whom the great gods pay attention; foundation deposit of the Anuna, living …… of the Enki deities; he whose great divine powers know no opponents, whose …… excel all others, whose …… is achieved by no one; whose …… return of their own accord, whose …… is very sweet in heaven and on earth, whose …… founds cities, whose …… establishes the Land; …… wisdom is perfect as time passes; …… wise in command, re-establishing justice ……, adviser who never tires of discussion; ……, giving verdicts, ……, judge of heaven and earth 1 line fragmentary guiding the living ……, Father Enlil, shepherd of the black-headed, by his …… making the foreign countries bow low.

akk: […]-/ni\ zag an ki gen6-ne2  [inim] dug4-ga-ni ka teš2-e ĝa2-ĝa2  /en\ li-ib-a-ni kur-ra du-du  /niĝ2\ ak-ni su zig3 ri-a  di galam-ma-ni na-me nu-pad3-de3  nam-zu-ni-še3 kur-re giri17 šu ĝal2  a2 sa-par4 gal kur-re dub-ba  sa-al-ḫub2 IGI ŠU GAN nu-še-ga šu2-a  an-še3 DU ki^?--tuš^?-   me niĝ2-nam-ma da-ga-an-ba šu ti-a  ĝiš-ḫur niĝ2-ul-e zag keše2-ra2  ub-da 4-ba u18-lu i3-dul4  ^d-en-lil2 dib-ba-ni šu tiĝ4-ĝe26-e nu-zu  a-ar2-ni niĝ2 šu sag3-sag3-ge2-dam  ^d-en-lil2 an-še3 maḫ ki-še3 dib  zag e3 ki-en-gi-ra daĝal tag-ga  ^d-nu-nam-nir en nun-nun-e-ne lugal-a lugal-be2-e  ^d-iš-me-^d-da-gan dumu ^d-da-gan-na-me-en  /iri\ kug-ga nam dug3 ḫa-ma-ni-in-tar
en: He whose …… strengthens the boundaries of heaven and earth, whose utterances unite them; lord whose ominous silence pervades the foreign lands, whose actions are spine-chilling, whose complex judgments cannot be revealed by anyone, whose knowledge is honoured by the foreign lands, whose strength is a great battle-net …… the foreign lands, a fine-mesh battle-net …… covering the disobedient; indefatigable …… in heaven, in possession of every one of the divine powers in their totality, linking together the ancient plans; south wind which covers the four quarters; Enlil, whose …… cannot be grasped, whose fame is enough to make people quake; Enlil, great in heaven, surpassing on earth, exceptional and wide-reaching in Sumer, Nunamnir, lord of princes, king of kings! He determined a good destiny in the holy city for me, Išme-Dagan, son of Dagan.

akk: mu dug3 ḫa-ma-ni-in-sa4  [^d-]nin-tur5 tud-tud-a ḫa-ma-ni-in-gub  /gi\-dur ku5-ra2-ĝa2 […] nam-en ḫa-ma-ni-in-ĝar  [^d-]en-lil2 diĝir saĝ-du-ĝa2-ke4  nam-sipad ki-en-gi-ra saĝ-e-eš ḫu-mu-rig7  ^d-lamma  /saĝ\ ḫe2-mi-in-tuku  alan niĝ2-gen6-na ḫe2-en-ga-/da^?-\-taḫ  […] KA bal-en^?-  X […] ḫa-ma-ni-in-kur9  su^?- X […] X ḫu-mu-UD-MU
en: He named me with a favourable name even when my seed was inserted into the womb. Nintur stood by at my birth, and she established the office of en for me ……, even when my umbilical cord was cut. Enlil, my principal deity, bestowed on me the shepherdship of Sumer, and assigned to me a tireless protective goddess, adding also therewith a correct stature. 3 lines fragmentary

akk: me-lem4-[a-ni kur]-ra ḫe2-bi2-in-X  za-pa-aĝ2-[a-ni] an ki-a ḫe2-em-mi-in-dirig  uĝ3-ĝa2 /ḫu\-[mu]-ni-in-suḫ-en kalam ḫe2-ni-in-pad3-[en]  ^d-en-lil2 lugal diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4  sig igi-nim-ma nam-en-bi ḫa-ma-an-šum2  inim dug4-ga ^d-nu-nam-nir-ra-ta  an-ne2 gu3 zid-de3 ĝa2-a-ar ḫa-ma-an-de2  šibir ešgiri2 šu-ĝu10 ḫa-ma-šum2  ^d-uraš-e dub3 kug-ga-ni-a mi2 zid ḫa-ma-ni-dug4  ^d-nin-lil2-le šag4 zalag-zalag-ga-ni  barag maḫ ud su3-ra2-ka tuš-ĝa2  ĝiš-šub-ba-ĝa2 bal-bi sag9-ge-da  su ^d-en-lil2-la2-ka dug3-ge-ĝa2  e2-kur-re ud šu2-uš saĝ us2-ĝa2  ki-ur3 ki gal-e nam-še3 ḫa-ma-ni-tar  ^d-en-ki en gal eridug^ki--ga-ke4  aga3 zid maḫ saĝ-ĝa2 ḫa-ma-ni-in-ge-en  niĝ2 a-na mu sa4-a X X […]  ĝeštug2 7-a šu gal ḫa-/ma\-[ni-du7]  ^d-suen dumu-saĝ ^d-en-/lil2\-[la2-ke4]  ^ĝiš-gu-za lugal-la me /ur4\-[ur4 …]  barag nam-en-na saĝ-bi-še3 [e3]-a /ḫe2-bi2\-in-[ĝar]  ud su3-ra2-še3 aga-/ĝu10 dalla\ ḫe2-bi2-in-e3
en: His splendour …… the mountains, and his roar reaches beyond heaven and earth. He selected me from my people, and announced me to the Land. Enlil, king of the gods, gave me lordship over the south and over the uplands. At Nunamnir's instigation, An spoke encouragingly to me, and placed crook and staff in my hands. Uraš nursed me on her holy knees. In the Ki-ur, the great place, Ninlil in her radiant heart determined as my destiny that I should sit on an exalted dais until distant days, to enjoy in favour the reign which is my lot; that I should delight Enlil, and that I should daily attend to the E-kur. Enki, the great lord of Eridug, confirmed for me the good and great crown, …… everything, and richly conferred on me seven wisdoms. Suen, the firstborn son of Enlil, …… for me a royal throne that gathers together the divine powers, established an excellent lordly dais, and made my crown shine brilliantly until distant days.
