akk: lugal a2 niĝ2-ḫul dim2-ma ib2-ši-aĝ2-e-a  mu-sar-ra-ba šu bi2-ib2-ra-a mu-ni bi2-ib2-sar-a  aš2 bal-a-ba-ke4-eš lu2-kur2 šu ba-an-zi-zi-i-a  lu2-ba ^d-en-lil2 lugal-ĝu10 ^d-nin-lil2 nin-ĝu10 nam ḫa-ba-an-/da^?-\-[ku5-ru-ne]  ^d-en-ki ^d-iškur ^d-ezina2 ^d-šakkan2 en ḫe2-ĝal2-la-/ke4\-[ne]  ḫe2-ĝal2 an ki-a a-ba-da-an-gi4-eš /ḫul\-bi ḫa-ba-[…]
en: If a king issues evil orders concerning this statue, and erases its inscription and writes his own name on it; or, because of this curse, he makes another man raise his hand against it, then may Enlil my lord and Ninlil my lady curse that man! May Enki, Iškur, Ezina, Šakkan, the lords of abundance, …… him cruelly by withholding abundance from heaven and earth under his rule!

akk: /e2\-kur-/ra\ e2 […]  šu il2-la-zu-še3^!- diĝir gal-gal-/e\-[ne …]  /ur2\ kug til3 niĝ2 dug3 dirig-zu-še3^!- […]  /bal^?-\ dug3-bi-še3 ĝal2-ĝal2-la AB X […]  /^d-\iš-me-^d-da-gan dumu ^d-en-lil2-[la2] […]  [e2]-gal-maḫ e2 nam-nin-a-za UL […]  [X] nun-ne2 ^ĝiš-meš3 pa mul-la X […]  [nam]-/til3\-la-ni dug3-ge daĝal ^d-iš-me-[^d-da-gan] […]  […] X eĝer-bi […]  […] / kur-re ḫe2-si^?- […]  […] X igi bar šeg12 e2-kur-ra-ka […]
en: In the E-kur, the house ……. The great gods …… to your upraised hands. …… holy lap for your exceedingly pleasant life. …… for its good reign ……. Išme-Dagan, the son of Enlil ……. …… joy in the Egal-maḫ, your ladylike house. …… the prince …… meš tree with shining branches ……. …… to make his life pleasant …… Išme-Dagan ……. …… holy …… the child of An ……. 2 lines fragmentary …… brick-built E-kur …….
13. Sa-ĝara.
Dagan, you have …… the shepherd Išme-Dagan, the son of Enlil, with a royal garment.
15. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-ĝara.

akk: [ĝiš-gi4]-ĝal2 sa-/ĝar\-[ra-bi-im]  /en\ maḫ me an-na me ki KA ḪI^?- gal […]  ^d-da-gan en maḫ me an-na me ki /KA\ [ḪI gal …]
en: The lofty lord, …… the divine powers of heaven and the divine powers of the earth; Dagan, the august lord, …… the divine powers of heaven and the divine powers of the earth. He has chosen Išme-Dagan in the Land, he …….
19. Its uru.
20. An adab of Dagan .

akk: /an ki\-a dul4  u18-/ru\-zu maḫ dib2  [eš3] nibru^ki-  ki /an\ a-na-šu2-a-aš  ne3-zu  zag-bi-še3 ĝal2  šeg12 kilib3-ba  kalam-ma ki ĝar-ra  /šeg12^!-\-zu šeg12 saĝ-bi-im  kur-kur-re  iri^ki- <a>-na-du3-a-ba  me maḫ šu mi-ni-ti  me /maḫ\-zu-gin7  mu-zu maḫ-am3  mu-zu-gin7  saḫar-zu saḫar dug3-ga-am3  iri^ki- an ki-a
en: City whose terrifying splendour extends over heaven and earth, whose towers are exceptionally grand, shrine Nibru! Your power reaches to the edges of the uttermost extent of heaven and earth. Of all the brick buildings erected in the Land, your brickwork is the most excellent. You have allowed all the foreign lands and as many cities as are built to receive excellent divine powers. Your name is as excellent as your excellent divine powers. Your soil is soil as good as your name. City, {your name towers} { your divine powers tower} over heaven and earth.

akk: us2-saĝ  sig igi-nim-ma  dim gal uĝ3 šar2-ra-me-en  me-zu me galam-ma  me nu-sag2-dam  ĝiš-ḫur-zu-u8^!-  abzu sig9-ga-gin7  ni2 gal ši-im-du8-du8  nam-maḫ-zu  ^d-uraš sig7-ga-gin7  na-me nu-zu-zu-dam  nam-tar-ra  saĝ-bi-še3 e3-a-zu  niĝ2 ar2-re-eš dib-ba  ḫur-saĝ sukux(SUKUD)-ra2  šu nu-teĝ3-ĝe26-me-en  saĝ il2 zag dib-ba  an-ne2 us2-sa-me-en
en: You are the pillar in the south and the uplands, the mooring post of all people. Your divine powers are supreme divine powers with which no divine powers can compare. Your plans are as if rooted in the abzu, endowed with great terrifying splendour. As if it were the lovely earth itself, no one can comprehend your eminence. Your pre-eminent destiny surpasses all praise. You are a lofty hill that no one can reach. Outstanding, with head high, you reach to the heavens.

akk: šag4-zu u18-ru-me-en  bar-zu  ni2 gur3-ru-me-en  ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne-er  u2 nam-til3-la-bi-še3  za-e  ši-im-ma-ab-du3-en  gu7 naĝ-bi-še3  ši-im-ma-sig7-ge-en  amaš zi-bi-še3 ĝal2-me-en  a2-zu-ta  gu sa-par4 gid2-gin7  niĝ2-nam la-ba-ra-e3  eš3 nibru^ki-  a-ra2-zu niĝ2 maḫ-am3  niĝ2 ka-ge dib-ba  me ḫal-ḫa-zu  ĝiš-šub zid-da  niĝ2 sag2 nu-di-dam
en: Your interior towers up, and your exterior is awesome. You were built as life-giving food for the Anuna gods; you were beautified for their eating and drinking. You are the sheepfold which is there for their life. Nothing escapes your grasp, as if caught in the threads of an outspread net. Shrine Nibru, your activities are quite excellent, quite surpassing all description. The divine powers that you allocate are a good fortune which cannot be overturned.

akk: iri^ki- šag4-zu  kug-ga-am3  bar-zu šen-šen-am3  su-bar-ra-zu  me-lem4 gur3-ru-am3  ki-zu ki suḫ-ḫa-am3  en ĝeštug2-ga  kur gal ^d-en-lil2-le  šag4-zu-a eš3 bi2-in-du3  eš3-bi  eš3 za-gin3  eš3 nam tar-re-dam  e2-kur  e2 za-gin3  e2 nam tar-re-dam
en: City, your interior is holy, your exterior is radiant. Your body exudes terrifying splendour. Your location is a well-chosen location. The lord of wisdom, Enlil, the Great Mountain, has built a sanctuary in your midst; that sanctuary is a lapis-lazuli sanctuary, a sanctuary that can decide destinies. It is the E-kur, the lapis-lazuli temple, the temple that can decide the destinies.

akk: nun-zu  ^d-nu-nam-nir  ninda2 me ru-a  ama ^d-ninx(EGI2)-lil2  ninx(EGI2) gal ki-ur3-ra-za  ninx(EGI2) me u3-tud-da  e-ne-e-ne-gin7  kalam-ma  diĝir a-ba  mu-un-til3  a-ne-ne  TUG2 X kislaḫ temen  šu bi2-in-gur-ru-uš  ĜIRI3^?--bi  bi2-in-dur2-ru-ne-eš  me zid me gal  me ar2-re-ka  dur2 im-mi-in-ĝar-re-eš  ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne  ama a-a ugu-bi-gin7  igi-bi im-ši-ĝal2  inim kug kal-kal  zid-de3-eš di-bi  ĝizzal  ši-ma-an-ke4-eš  ^d-en-lil2  ^d-ninx(EGI2)-lil2-bi  an-na  igi im-mi-in-ĝal2-eš  ki-a  zag mi-ni-in-ĝar-re-eš  ud-bi-a  an gal  ki daĝal-ba  šag4-bi mu-un-e3-a  diĝir ^d-a-nun-na  an ki-ke4-ne  kiĝ2 ib2-gi4-gi4-ne  ^ĝiš-al  ^ĝiš-dusu  niĝ2 iri ki ĝa2-ĝa2  šu^?- /BA^?- NA^?-\  mu-un-ĝal2  […] X X […]  saĝ X X A BA MU X […]  an ki kilib-ba a2 aĝ2-ĝa2-bi […]  /lugal\-la /ĝeštug2\ bad niĝ2-nam zu […]  inim kug dug4-ga ama a-a ugu-/bi\-[gin7 igi-bi im-ši-ĝal2]  ^d-a-nun-na ub-šu-unken-na […]  ^d-en-lil2 ^d-nin-lil2-ra sub2-su8-/ub\ […]  e2-kur eš3 maḫ-še3^!- igi-bi X […]  a2 aĝ2-ĝa2 dugud ^d-en-lil2 ^d-nin-[lil2] […]  maḫ dug4-ga-ni-še3 an ki tuku4^?--tuku4^?- X […]  ur-saĝ gal en ^d-nin-urta-ra šu-ni im-/mi\-[in-sig9-ge-eš]  ka-ga-ni i3 li ku7-ku7-da-gin7 X […]  mu-un-dul-le-eš me an-na me ki šu-ni [im-mi-in-sig9-ge-eš]  ^d-nin-urta ur-saĝ gal a2-tuku MU X […]  šul kur gam en iri laḫ4 X ŠE3^?- AN […]  [a-a ^d-en-lil2] ama gal ^d-nin-[lil2] […]  […] [e2]-kur-ra-ka mi-ni-in-[…]  […] X X KI […]  […] /EN\ […]  […] /BA\ EN /SA\ […]  […] /BA\ teš2-ba […]  [^d-en-lil2] [^d-]/nin\-lil2-bi UGU KUR9^?-  […] ki-bi […]  […] TA […]  […] X-bi dur2 ĝar X […]  […]-bi sud-su3-ud […]  X […] X abzu-še3^!- […]  [^d-]/nuska\ en […] /gub\ […]  [^d-]/en\-lil2 ^d-nin-lil2-bi saĝ-e-eš mu-ni-in-rig7-eš  /nibru\^ki- en nin-zu-gin7 diĝir na-me nu-dib2  e-ne-ne nun er9-me-eš diĝir pa e3-me-eš  ^d-en-lil2 ^d-nin-lil2^!--gin7 diĝir na-me nu-dib2  e-ne-ne nun er9-me-eš en nam tar-re-me-eš  šag4-zu-a sukkal ^d-nuska-ra me mu-na-ni-in-šum2-mu-uš  nibru^ki- šir3 kug-zu niĝ2 kal-kal a-re-eš-še3 dib2-am3  [^d-]/iš\-me-^d-da-gan-me-en du-ri2-še3 ka-ga14 mu-ni-ĝar
en: Your prince, Nunamnir, the steer who has engendered the divine powers, and Mother Ninlil, the great lady of your Ki-ur, the lady who has borne the divine powers -- what god is there living in the Land like these two? They have cultically purified ……. They have settled ……, and taken their seats upon the good, great and praiseworthy divine powers. The Anuna gaze at them as if at their own father and mother, listening attentively when they speak holy and most precious words in the correct manner. Enlil and Ninlil looked at the heavens, while on earth they set bounds ; and then, once their intention became clear in the great heavens and on the broad earth, the Anuna gods of heaven and earth set to work. The mattock and the earth-basket, tools for founding cities, 2 lines unclearunknown no. of lines missing

2 lines unclear The command for the whole of heaven and earth ……; …… of the king, with wide understanding, who knows all ……. They heed the holy words uttered, as if they were those of their own father and mother. The Anuna in the Ubšu-unkena ……, …… going to Enlil and Ninlil. They direct their gaze to the E-kur, the solemn shrine. The important commands of Enlil and Ninlil ……. They have placed in the hands of the great hero Ninurta the power to make heaven and earth tremble at his solemn utterances. They have covered his mouth with …… like finest oil. They have placed the divine powers of heaven and the divine powers of earth in his hands. Ninurta, the great hero, the strong ……, the youth who subdues the foreign lands, the lord who plunders the cities ……. Father Enlil and the great mother Ninlil …… have …… him into the E-kur. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

3 lines fragmentary Enlil and Ninlil …… 5 lines fragmentary Enlil and Ninlil have bestowed this on Nuska, the lord who stands ……. Nibru, no god excels like your lord and lady; they are powerful princes, brilliantly revealed deities. No god excels like Enlil and Ninlil; they are powerful princes, lords who can decide destinies. In your midst they have given divine powers to Nuska as minister. Nibru, your holy songs are exceptionally precious, surpassing all praise. I, Išme-Dagan, have put them in everyone's mouth for all time.

akk: en eš-bar galam diĝir-re-e-ne /sig\ nim-ma u18-ru-/bi\  ešgiri2^!- šu du8 nam-bi tar-tar ^d-a-nun-na sub2-su8-ub [(X)]  me niĝ2-nam-ma dili-ni zag dib en /gal\ zi-ĝal2 ba-X  [nam]-diĝir-bi-še3 1(AŠ)-a-ni pa e3 NIĜIN-NIĜIN-bi-še3 X-[me]-/en\  /dug4\-ga-dug4-ga-ni niĝ2-zid mu2-mu2 me an ki gen6-/ne2^?--me\-en  ĝiš-ḫur bar tam-me^!-  nun gal-bi zu-zu-me-/en\
en: Lord who among the gods makes the clever decisions, most prominent among them from the south to the uplands; who holding a staff in his hand determines their destinies as the Anuna gods come to him; who possessing all the divine powers is alone surpassing; a great lord who …… the living things; who alone is proclaimed as their god -- you are their ……. You, whose utterances make justice flourish, strengthen the divine powers of heaven and earth. You, who examine the ordinances and carry them out correctly, are proclaimed as their great prince.

akk: en numun i nam dug3-bi /tud\-tud us2 dab5-bi pad3-pad3  ĝarza maḫ saĝ-gu2-ĝal2-la^?--bi u2-gin7 zid-de3-eš mu2  ĝidru šum2-šum2 aga3 zid ḫal-ḫa mu maḫ-bi sa4-sa4  nam-diĝir-bi ud ul su3-/ra2-še3 an\ ki-da ĝa2-ĝa2  nun da-ri2 mu2-mu2 A X X X ki^?- za X igi i3-ĝal2  en umuš galam dim2-ma ĝalga sud ĝeštug2 bad-e du7  diĝir zid A RI X SIG7-SIG7 niĝ2-nam-ma-ni ka-ge-e /dib2\  ad gi4-gi4 en a-/ga-na\ šag4 kuš2-u3 šim-gin7 ta-ta-ḫab2  nun šag4 su3-ra2 inim-ma nu-[kam3]-me nam-zu-ni daĝal bur2  kug-zu gal-an-zu en igi-/ĝal2^?- X\ šag4 /daĝal\ niĝ2-nam-ma zu
en: Lord who has made the seed of mankind come forth, who creates good destiny for them, who teaches them the proper practices! He makes august and dignified rites proliferate truly like grass. He assigns the sceptres, he distributes the loyal crowns, and announces their exalted names. He …… their divinity until far and distant times in heaven and earth. Everlasting prince ……. Lord who gives clever counsel, and who is endowed with prudence, outstanding intelligence and profound understanding! Trustworthy god, whose …… wholly surpasses description. Adviser, lord who deliberates only with himself, ……. Deep-hearted prince, whose words are unalterable , who disseminates his wisdom widely. Clever and competent, wise lord, ……, who knows everything.

akk: diĝir-re-e-ne-er šu-mu-un-ne-maḫ-en  ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne /za\-e šu-mu-un-ne-il2-en  me-zu me-bi-ta X X dirig suḫ-a-am3  me kal-kal me [niĝ2] /galam\-ma-zu saĝ keše2 me zid-bi-im  u18-ru-zu li-ib-gin7 šu-mu-ne-us2 u18-lu-gin7 šu-mu-ne-dul  niĝ2-me-ĝar-gin7 mu-ne-e-ĝar AŠ+MAŠ-gin7 šu-mu-ne-šu2  nam-maḫ-za ḫur-saĝ su3-ud bad-gin7 umuš-bi ša-ra-ni-ib-gi4
en: You are the most supreme among the gods! You are the highest ranking among the Anuna gods! Your divine powers …… surpassing theirs, are specially favoured. With your precious and ingenious divine powers, you are the guardian of their true divine powers. Your prominence imposes itself on them like awesome stillness, covers them like a storm, takes their breath away, wraps them like ……. The description of your loftiness …… like a remote and far-away mountain.

akk: uĝ3 ĝar-ĝar-ra-bi en a-a-bi-me-en  nu-DI-DI-a sipad u2 kiĝ2-kiĝ2-bi-me-en  ama a-a-bi-gin7 mu-ne-dug4 uĝ3 gu7 naĝ sug4-sug4-bi-[me-en]  sa2 mu-e-ĝar ĝeštug2 mu-e-gub-gub /kiĝ2\ galam-ma ak-[X (X)]  e2 umuš ĝar ĝeštug2 dirig-zu ĝal2 bi2-taka4  niĝ2-nam u3-tud-zu šu ta-ḫab2 dug4-ga-bi  X X X X X ni2 gal guru3 ki su zig3 ri-a  X du6 X [X X]-ga du3-a ki en ul dur2-ru-na-ba^?-  za-e X X-bi mu-ni-BUR2-BUR2 ŠID gal-bi X X (X)  a-a ^d-en-lil2 X [X X (X)]-ni sa2 bi2-dug4  ĝeštug2 […] X-la-bi ši-im-mi-X  […] taka4 a su3-bi  me […]-a ĝiš-ḫur kal-kal-za  X X […] X X X AŠ mu-ni-in-X  niĝ2 galam […] X im-mi-/in\-e3  nam-tar […] X šag4-ba mu-ni-ĝar  eš3 ZU^?- X […] im-mi-sa4-[X]  TUG2-ta^?- […] X a-ĝa2-ri-in dib X X
en: For the settled people, you are their lord and father. For the ……, you are their shepherd who seeks out food for them. You speak to them as if you were their father and mother; you satiate the people with food and drink. You give advice, you set your mind to work, …… skilful labour. You have opened up your house of instructions and surpassing wisdom. Everything you have created ……. …… full of great awesomeness, a place clad in fearsome radiance. …… mound ……, where the primeval lords dwell. 1 line unclear …… Father Enlil ……. …… wisdom ……. 1 line fragmentary …… your most precious divine plans ……. 1 line fragmentary …… ingenuity ……. …… destiny ……. 2 lines fragmentary approx. 21 lines missing

akk: […]-/ta\ AN X […]  […] /ma\-ra-an-/e3\ […]  […] /nam\ tar-re A^?- […]  […] MU /BI^?-\ [(X)] /barag\ gu-za maḫ kug-sig17 tum2-ma-/am3^?-\ [(X)] /gal\-bi ma-ra-ni-in-gub X […]  […]-ge-bi inim sag9-ge ki-en-gi ki-uri^ki--še3 [(X)] gaba-ba ma-ra-ni-in-sug2-[X]  […]-ge-bi a naĝ /erim2\ e2-kur-ra KA-KA nidba2-ra^?--/am3\ [(X)] /ki^?-\-ba ma-ra-ni-in-sa4-[X]  […] /im^?-\-mi-ib2-X X X e2-kur-ra til-e [X (X)]-ge-gin7 ak X […]  […] X ma-ra-[X-(X)]-da /a2\ zid-za bi2-in-/gub^?-\ […]  […] X ^d-iškur X IN NU še e2-kur-ra šu X la2-/bi\ […]  […] /gu\-za maḫ-ba dur-ba ma-ra-an-gen6 X […]  […] /URUD^?-\ X (X) /maḫ\ ni2 gal-le-eš ri-/am3\ [(X)]  barag kug-za bi2-in-[…] uĝ3-e u6 di-/de3\ [(X)]  kiĝ2 gal unu2 gal-/za\ ud ul-le2-a-še3 sa2-dug4-še3 ma-ra-ni-[X (X)]
en: From …… he brought …… for you. …… the fates are decided ……. He set up grandly for you …… that befits the majestic dais and throne of gold. They lined up before it for you …… favourable words for Sumer and Akkad. …… in the E-kur ……. food offerings. …… in the E-kur ……. …… with your right arm ……. …… Iškur …… in the E-kur. …… on its august throne. He …… a huge copper …… inspiring great awe, on your holy dais. It is to be marvelled at by the people. He …… the main task for you in your great dining hall as a regular offering forever after.

akk: /^ĝiš-\[mi]-/tum\ saĝ 50 ki-bal gul-gul-lu a2 maḫ-zu-še3 pad3-/da\  [i3]-/si\-in^ki- iri nam-lugal-la-/ka\  [^d-]/iš\-me-^d-da-gan-e kiĝ2 gal-eš2 ma-ra-/an\-[…]  mu 50 ma-ra-an-/sa4^?-\ [(X)]  nibru^ki- iri ul ki /ĝar\-ra-ba i3-si-in^ki--ta ma-ra-/an\-X [(X)]  e2-šu-me-ša4 ki-tuš maḫ ni2 X [X (X)]  kan4 igi-šu-galam ki nam tar-re-[dam]  u6 di-de3 ma-ra-an-[X]
en: In Isin, the royal city, Išme-Dagan, …… for you in masterly fashion a fifty-headed battle-mace to destroy the rebel lands, chosen for your great power. For you he gave it fifty names. From Isin he …… it for you into Nibru, the primeval, well-established city and …… to be marvelled at in the E-šu-me-ša, the majestic residence that …… fearsomeness, at the gate of Igi-šu-galam, the place where fates are decided.

akk: ^d-iš-me-^d-da-gan u2-a /nibru\[^ki--a]  /saĝ\ us2 urim2^ki--/ma\  [ud-da] /gub\ eridug[^ki--ga]  [en] [unug^ki-]-/ga\ lugal i3-[si-in^ki--na]
en: Išme-Dagan, provider of Nibru, constant attendant of Urim, he who is daily in the service of Eridug; en priest of Unug, king of Isin unknown no. of lines missing

akk: ^d-en-ki en dumu-saĝ an kug-ga  nam-^d-en-lil2-ban3-da-aš mu-ni-in-il2-i-iš an ki-a du7 maḫ-e-eš  ki pad3-de3 ĝeštug2 7-bi saĝ-e-eš mu-ni-in-rig7-eš  ad gi4-gi4 nam gal tar-tar-re  ud e3 X X X-še3 igi-ĝal2 šum2-mu gi16-sa-še3 mu-ni-in-ak-/eš\
en: To befit heaven and earth grandly, they raised Enki, the lord, the firstborn son of holy An, to the status of junior Enlil. So that he can reveal everything , they bestowed sevenfold wisdom upon him as a gift. They have established eternally that he should give counsel, that he should decide great fates, that he ……, and that he should provide wisdom.

akk: abzu kug e2 /šeg12\-bi KA X bar-bi šag4 kuš2-u3  šag4 X X […] X igi-ni-še3 ĝa2-ĝa2  […] X X X  [e-ne]-/ne nun\ [er9]-/me-eš en nam tar-re-me-eš\  šag4-zu-a en ^d-nin-urta-ra me mu-na-ni-in-šum2-mu-uš  nibru^ki- šir3 /kug\-zu niĝ2 kal-kal a-re-eš dib-ba-am3  ^d-iš-me-^d-da-gan-me-en du-ri2-še3 ka-ga14 mu-ni-ĝar
en: The pure abzu, the house whose brickwork ……, whose façade settles the mind, …… to place before him ……. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

They are powerful princes, lords who decides the fates; in your midst they have bestowed the divine powers on Lord Ninurta. Nibru, your pure songs are most precious, surpassing all praise! I, Išme-Dagan, have made every mouth utter them forever.

akk: […] /mu\-ni-in-[X]  […] X saḫar tuš-a ša-mu-un-X  […] X  ga-ša-an-na-ka   […] X AD^?- RA ša-mu-un-TAR^?-  […] tug2  na-aĝ2-egir3-ra-ka-na   […] /urin^?-\-na ša-mu-un-šar2-ra  […] /ša\-mu-ni-ib-be2 gam-ma-ni na-DU  […] mu-un-dag-dag-ge siki-pa IB TUG2 na-DU  […] in i3-ak e2-ĝu10  na-aĝ2  ba-an-kud  […] X DUB^?- AŠ-ta in-na-še-bi-da  […]  /uru2\-ĝu10 na-aĝ2  ba-an-kud  […]-ĝu10 sug-ge4 bi2-in-gu7  […] tug2-mu-ĝu10 mu-un-pe-el  […] X im-ma-da-an-TAR  […] X ba-ni-in-X  ĝarza a2^?- šu […]  ur5-še3(source: TUG2) ur5  ša3-ab-/ĝu10\  […]  ĝi6 en-nu-uĝ3-ĝa2-/gin7\ […] šurum3-gin7^!- X […]  muš3-me-ĝu10 i-bi2-/gin7\ […]  su-ĝu10 in bar7-a-/gin7\ […]  mu-un-ak a-a X […]-a^!--ba TUG2 […]      ki-/ru\-[gu2 X-kam]   ga-ša-an  […]      ĝiš-/gi4\-[ĝal2-bi-im]  X X […]  šu du3-a […]  še29-eš2 dug4-[ga …]  dumu ^d-en-lil2 dumu /AN\ […]  bar im-ak uĝ3-e X […] ki-en-/gi\ […]
en: 1 line fragmentary …… squatting in the dust ……. …… of Inana ……. 1 line fragmentary …… of her garment of ladyship. …… with blood . …… her submission ……. 1 line unclear …… insulted ……, cursed my temple. …… I despised him. …… cursed my city. …… devastated my ……. …… sullied my garments. 2 lines fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing
…… rites ……. Thus …… my mood and heart. As if during the night watch …… like excrement. …… my countenance like smoke. …… my body like blazing straw. 1 line fragmentary

akk: ^d-en-lil2-me-en /erin2\ LU-LU X […]  i3-ne-eš2-ta ud TE […]  X X X X X […]  /nam\-lu2-ulu3 us2 zid im-mi-in-/dab5\  ki-en-gi-da lu2-erim2 im-ta-an-da-ra  eme niĝ2 ḫa-lam-ma di im-da-an-kur2  niĝ2-si-sa2 urud-gin7 pa bi2-ib-e3  a-a-ra ni2 teĝ3-ĝe26-e ama-ra ni2 su4-ne2  dumu ab-ba-ra inim-ma-ne2-eš dur2-u3
en: 7. …… kirugu.
…… lady …….

akk: ad-da a-a-na an-gu7 ama a-a-na an-naĝ
en: 9. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ki-en-gi ki-uri-a mi-ni-in-ĝar  ^d-iš-me-^d-da-gan dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2  en unug^ki--ga saĝ keše2-ba mi-ni-in-/kur9\  /bi2\-in-ak ^d-inana nin an ki-/ke4\  /an\ gal^!--e ḫe2-am3-bi bi2-/in\-[dug4] ^d-en-lil2-/le\ […]      ki-/ru\-[gu2 X-kam]  […] X X  […] /ḫa\-ra-ni-ib-ĝal2  […] ḫa-ra-ab-be2  […]   [… ḫa]-/mu\-ra-an-KU  [… ḫa]-ra-ab-e3-a  […]-dib  […] X  […] X
en: 1 line missing1 line fragmentary …… whose hands were fettered, …… who had been treated unjustly. The son of Enlil, the son of ……. …… Sumer ……. I, Enlil, ……. From now on ……. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

He made the people follow the proper path, and ousted the enemy from Sumer. He removed the wicked tongues, and made justice shine forth like copper. That fathers should be feared and mothers respected, that sons should pay heed to the words of their fathers, and that mercy, compassion and pity should be shown, that one should provide even one's paternal grandparents with food and drink -- all this he established in Sumer and Akkad. Then she made Išme-Dagan, the son of Enlil, the en priest of Unug, into their guardian -- this is what Inana, the lady of heaven and earth, did; and the great An declared his consent. Enlil …….
14. …… kirugu.
9 lines fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

akk: /ambar\-bi KA X […]  /a\-gar3 /gal\-gal gan2-ne2 /E\ […]  pu2-^ĝiš-kiri6 X kug il2 […]  u2-gu7 a /naĝ\ ^d-a-nun-ke4-[ne] [(X X)]  a-a ^d-en-lil2 ama gal ^d-nin-lil2-[bi] saĝ-e-eš mu-ni-rig7-[eš]
en: unknown no. of lines missing The task of …… its marshes, of …… the great arable lands and the fields, of …… the fruit orchards that bear pure ……, of …… food and drink for the Anuna gods -- all this was bestowed on him by Father Enlil and the great mother Ninlil.

akk: nibru^ki- maḫ en nin-zu-gin7 diĝir /na\-[me nu-dib2]  e-ne-e-ne nun er9-me-eš diĝir pa [e3-me-eš]  ^d-en-lil2 ^d-nin-lil2-gin7 diĝir na-me /nu\-[dib2]  e-ne-e-ne nun er9-me-eš en [nam tar-re-me-eš]  /šag4\-zu-a lugal ^d-/en-ki-ra\ me mu-na-ni-[šum2-mu-uš]  nibru^ki- šir3 kug-zu niĝ2 kal-kal [a-re-eš-še3 dib2-am3]  ^d-iš-me-^d-da-gan-me-en du-ri2-še3 [ka-ga14 mu-ni-ĝar]
en: August Nibru! No deity excels like your lord and lady! They are powerful princes; they are brilliantly revealed deities. No deity excels like Enlil or Ninlil! They are powerful princes; they are lords who can decide destinies. In your midst they have given divine powers to King Enki. Nibru, your holy songs are exceptionally precious, surpassing all praise! I, Išme-Dagan, have placed them in everyone's mouths for all time.

akk: ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en  ^ĝiš-isimu2^sar- ^ĝiš-erin-na-gin7 saĝ mu-il2-la-ta  nitaḫ usu-tuku lirum-ma-me-en  nam-šul-la gu2 gal peš-a-me-en
en: I am a king treated with respect, good offspring from the womb. I am Lipit-Eštar, the son of Enlil. From the moment I lifted my head like a cedar sapling, I have been a man who possesses strength in athletic pursuits. As a young man I grew very muscular . I am a lion {in all respects} { to the extremes }, having no equal.

akk: ušumgal ka du8-a ni2 gal erin2-na-me-en  anzud^mušen- kur-šag4-ga igi ĝal2-me-en  am su-ba saĝ nu-ĝa2-ĝa2-me-en  alim igi gun3 šen-na-me-en  sun4 ^na4-za-gin3 e3-a ĝir2 keše2-keše2-du3^!--me-en  igi sag9 ka sag9 šag4 zal-le-me-en  ulutim2 ḫuš-ḫuš-a ḫi-li du8-du8-a-me-en  nundum inim-inim-ma ḫe2-du7-me-en  a2 il2-la šu-si sag9-sag9-me-en  šul sag9-ga u6 di dug3-ga-me-en
en: I am a gaping dragon, a source of great awe for the soldiers. I am like the Anzud bird, peering about in the heart of the mountains. I am a wild bull whom nobody dare oppose in its anger. I am a bison, sparkling with beautiful eyes, having a lapis-lazuli beard; I am ……. With my kind eyes and friendly mouth, I lift people's spirits. I have a most impressive figure, lavishly endowed with beauty. I have lips appropriate for all words. As I lift my arms, I have beautiful fingers. I am a very handsome young man, fine to admire.

akk: ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 lugal kalam-ma-me-en  saĝ gig2-ga sipad zid-bi-me-en  saĝ-kal kur-kur-ra kalam-ma il2-la-me-en  diĝir nam-lu2-ulu3 nir-ĝal2 uĝ3 šar2-ra-me-en  ibila kalag-ga nam-lugal-la-me-en  an-ta saĝ il2-la ki-gub sig10-ga-me-en
en: I am Lipit-Eštar, king of the Land. I am the good shepherd of the black-headed. I am the foremost in the foreign countries, and exalted in the Land. I am a human god, the lord of the numerous people. I am the strong heir of kingship. Holding my head high, I am established in my position.

akk: išib an-na šu dadag-ga-me-en  an-ne2 aga zid maḫ saĝ-ĝa2 mu-ni-in-ge-en  ^d-en-lil2-le dumu ki aĝ2-ĝa2-ni-me-en  ki-ur3-ra ^ĝiš-ĝidru ma-ni-in-šum2  niĝ2 ur5 sag9-sag9 ^d-nin-lil2-la2-me-en  ĝa2-ĝiš-šu2-a-ka nam dug3 mu-un-tar  ^d-nin-tur5-re šeg12 keš3^ki--a-ta  munus ul-la zid-de3-eš gun3-a-me-en  igi zid bar-ra ^d-nanna-me-en  urim2^ki--ma gu3 zid-de3-eš ma-an-de2
en: I am An's purification priest with purified hands. An placed the great and good crown firmly on my head. Enlil gave the sceptre to me, his beloved son, in the Ki-ur. I am what makes Ninlil happy: she determined a good fate in the Ĝa-ĝiš-šua. I have been made excellently beautiful by Nintur, the joyful woman, in brick-built Keš. I am one looked on favourably by Nanna: he spoke to me affirmatively in Urim.

akk: u4-ta-u18-lu lu2 šag4-ga-na-me-en  e2-šu-me-ša4-ta ni2 gal mu-un-da-ri  ĝeštug2 ba9-ra2 ^d-en-ki-kam-me-en  eridug^ki--ta nam-lugal ma-an-šum2  nitalam ki aĝ2 ^d-inana-kam-me-en  ki unug^ki--ga saĝ an-še3 mi-ni-il2  dub-sar a-ra2 zu ^d-nisaba-kam-me-en  šul inim gen6-na ^d-utu-me-en  nam-lugal-la ḫe2-du7-bi-me-en  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en
en: Uta-ulu imbued me, the man of his heart, with great awesomeness in E-šu-me-ša. I am he on whom Enki has bestowed wisdom: he gave me kingship in Eridug. As the beloved husband of Inana, I lift my head high in the place Unug. I am a proficient scribe of Nisaba. I am a young man whose word Utu confirms. I am the perfection of kingship. I am Lipit-Eštar, Enlil's son.

akk: buru14 maḫ zig3-ga zi kalam-ma-me-en  engar guru7-ni dub-dub-ba-me-en  sipad ^e2-tur3-re i3 ga maḫ-me-en  ambar ku6 mušen gal-gal-la-me-en  id2 ḫe2-ĝal2-la a zal-le tum2-ma-me-en  ḫur-saĝ gal giri17-zal nun-na-me-en  a2 maḫ šum2-ma ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 šul ni2-tuku-ni-me-en
en: I am he who makes an abundant crop grow, the life of the Land. I am a farmer, piling up his grain piles. I am a shepherd making butter and milk abundant in the cow-pen. I am he who makes the fish and birds grow bigger in the marshes. I am a river of plenty, bringing flowing water. I am he who increases the splendour of the great mountains. I have been given enormous strength by Enlil. I am Lipit-Eštar, his young man who respects him.

akk: diĝir-re-e-ne saĝ us2-bi-me-en  e2-kur-ra   lugal kadra-še3 maš2 gaba tab-ba-me-en  sun5-sun5-na giri17 šu ĝal2-la-me-en  lugal šudu3-de3 gub-ba-me-en  inim sag9-sag9-ge ^d-en-lil2 ḫuĝ-ĝa2-me-en  a-ra-zu-ne ^d-nin-lil2 ḫul2-le-me-en   ^d-nuska gub-ba-me-en  ki-ur3-še3 šu ĝal2-ĝal2-la-me-en  ul4-ul4-la dub3 nu-kuš2-u3-me-en
en: I am the provider of the gods. I am he who cares unceasingly for the E-kur. I am the king clutching a kid to the breast as a gift. I pray in all humility. I am a king standing in prayer. I am he who speaks friendly words to appease Enlil. I am he whose prayers make Ninlil happy. I am he who serves Nuska indefatigably. I am he who is ever praying at the Ki-ur. Bestowing many things, I am perfect for the {foundation} { city }. I am one who always hurries, but whose knees never tire.

akk: nesaĝ tum3 e2-babbar nu-dib-be2-me-en  nibru^ki--še3 ḫe2-ĝal2 sar-re-me-en  keš3^ki- išib-bi ba-gub-be2-me-en  urim2^ki--še3 i3 saĝ ga saĝ-me-en  eridug^ki--še3   ki unug^ki--še3 nidba gal-gal-la-me-en  e2-kur-ta nam-til3 šum2-ma-me-en  zi-šag4-ĝal2 iri-ni-še3   ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 sipad kur-kur-ra-me-en
en: Bringing first fruits, I do not pass by the E-babbar. I am he who records abundance for Nibru. I serve Keš as its purification priest. I am first-rate butter and first-rate milk for Urim. I am indefatigable with respect to Eridug. I am he who increases the food offerings for the place Unug. I am he to whom life was given in the E-kur. I am he who desires liveliness for his city. I am Lipit-Eštar, the shepherd of all foreign lands.

akk: lugal me3-še3 ku-kur du7-du7-me-en  da-da-ra nam-šul-la zu2 keše2 nu-du8-me-en  ĝiri2-ur3-ra u3-sar ak-me-en  me3-a nim-gin7 ĝir2-ĝir2-re-me-en  suḫuš gen6-na erin2-na gar3 dar-re-me-en  ^na4-saĝ-kal ^na4-peš6-peš6-a-me-en  ^kuš-gur21^ur3- igi tab ugnim-ma-me-en  ur-saĝ igi zalag-ga zu2 keše2 gen6-na-me-en  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en  ^kuš-ummud a sed-de3 zi ĝuruš-a-me-en
en: I, the king, am like pounding waves in battle. Girded in manliness, I never loosen my harness. I am he who sharpens his dagger. In battle I flash like lightning. A firm foundation, I repulse the troops. I am a saĝkal stone, a pešpeš stone. I am a siege shield, a screen for the army. A clear-eyed warrior, I make the troops firm. I am Lipit-Eštar, Enlil's son. Like a waterskin with cool water, I am life for the young men. Keeping my eyes on the road, I am {the protection} { the aid } of the soldiers.

akk: lugal tuš-a-ni barag-ga tum2-ma-me-en  šag4 dugud-da inim-še3 ĝal2-la-me-en  dim2-ma ĝalga sud a-ra-zu kiĝ2-ĝa2-me-en  niĝ2-nam-e nu-ul4-en eĝer-bi kiĝ2-kiĝ2-me-en  šag4 su3-ra2 ĝeštug2 daĝal-la-me-en  na4 ^u2-niĝ2-buru3-buru3-de3 kalam-ta e3-a-me-en  niĝ2-gen6-na ka-ga14 ĝal2-la-me-en   da-ri2 nu-ḫa-lam-e-me-en  di-kud ka-aš bar-re-da inim   kur-kur-re a2 aĝ2-ĝe26-e gal-zu-me-en  niĝ2-si-sa2 ki-en-gi ki-uri-a mu-ni-ĝar su kalam-ma mu-dug3
en: I am a king who, as he sits, is fitted for the throne. I am possessed of a weighty persona for speaking. I am one with a far-reaching mind and intellect, examining requests. I do not hurry over anything, but research its background. I have a far-reaching heart and broad wisdom. I am a stone that brings …… out of the Land. I am one that has truth in his mouth. I am one who never destroys a just person. I am a judge who, in making a decision, weighs his words fairly. I am one who is well-acquainted with giving orders to the foreign lands. I have established justice in Sumer and Akkad, and made the Land feel content.

akk: niĝ2-gen6-na-ĝu10-uš a-na mu-da-šub  nun ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2-me-en uĝ3-e    a-na   kalag-ga-me-en niĝ2-nam pa bi2-i-e3  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en
en: What of my truthful things can be thrown away? I, prince Lipit-Eštar, keep the people on a straight path. As regards my integrity: in what respect have I ever been idle? I am a strong person who has brought distinction to everything. I am Lipit-Eštar, Enlil's son.

akk: e2-gal nam-lugal-la ki-tuš kug dug3-ga-ĝa2  nitalam-ĝu10 kug ^d-inana-ke4  ^ĝiš-gu-za-ĝa2 suḫuš-bi ma-ni-in-ge-en  su3-ra2 ud ul-le2-a-aš gu2-da ḫu-mu-ni-in-la2  in-nin9-ra ud ga-mu-un-di-ni-ib-zal-e  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 ibila kalag-ga-me-en  lugal niĝ2-si-sa2 pa e3 ak-a-me-en  mu-ĝu10 kur-kur-ra zid-de3-eš ḫu-mu-un-pad3-de3  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en  za3-mi2-ĝu10 dug3-ga-am3
en: In my royal palace, my holy and good residence, my spouse holy Inana made firm the foundation of my throne. She will embrace me forever and eternally. I will spend all day for the Mistress in the {good} { lapis-lazuli} bedchamber that fills the heart with joy! I am Lipit-Eštar, the powerful heir; I am the king that makes justice prominent. May my name be called on in all the foreign lands! I am Lipit-Eštar, Enlil's son. It is sweet to praise me.

akk: ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 lugal saĝ il2 nun barag-ga  ḫe2-du7 ^ĝiš-isimu2^sar- nam-lugal-la  ^d-utu-gin7 du še-er-zid kalam-ma  nam-nun-še3 maḫ me gal-la u5  ub-da 4 uĝ3 ki ĝar-ra  še-ga ^d-en-lil2-la2 ^d-nin-lil2-le ki aĝ2  šul zid igi gun3 barag-ga tum2-ma  men aga zid saĝ me-te-ĝal2  nun ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2 sipad igi-ĝal2-tuku  uĝ3 laḫ5-laḫ5-e ĝissu dug3-ga ud IŠ^?--e ni2 dub2-bu  en alim maḫ an-ne2 ki aĝ2  ĝiškim-til3-zu-um ama ^d-nin-lil2-la2  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 a2 nun ḫu-mu-te-ĝal2
en: Lipit-Eštar, proud king, enthroned prince, most seemly offshoot of kingship, who walks like Utu, brilliant light of the Land, lofty in nobility, riding on the great divine powers; who settles the people in the four quarters; favoured by Enlil, beloved by Ninlil, trustworthy youth with shining eyes, worthy of the throne-dais, whose seemly head is adorned with the tiara, the good headdress, who {holds in his hand} { is perfect with} the sceptre over the black-headed, prince Lipit-Eštar, son of Enlil, wise shepherd, who leads the people to let them relax …… in pleasant shade, lord, great bison, beloved by An! Your trust is put in Mother Ninlil; Lipit-Eštar, you exert great power.

akk: ka lal3-gin7 dug3 mu ka-ge du7  šag4-ge de6-a dam ^d-inana  ^d-en-ki-ke4 ĝeštug2 daĝal saĝ-e-eš rig7-ga  ^d-nisaba munus ul-la gun3-a  munus zid dub-sar nin niĝ2-nam zu  si-zu im-ma   šag4 dub-ba-ka gu-šum2 mi-ni-in-sag9-sag9  gi-dub-ba kug-sig17-ka šu mu-ni-in-gun3  gi-1-nindan eš2-gana2 za-gin3  ĝiš-as4-lum le-um igi-ĝal2 šum2-mu ^d-nisaba-ke4 šu daĝal ma-ra-an-dug4
en: You who speak as sweet as honey, whose name suits the mouth, longed-for husband of Inana, to whom Enki gave broad wisdom as a gift! Nisaba, the woman radiant with joy, the true woman, the scribe, the lady who knows everything, guides your fingers on the clay: she makes them put beautiful wedges on the tablets and adorns them with a golden stylus. Nisaba generously bestowed upon you the measuring rod, the surveyor's gleaming line, the yardstick, and the tablets which confer wisdom.

akk: ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en  niĝ2-zid niĝ2-gen6-na pa bi2-e-e3  en sag9-zu an-zag-še3 na-dul^?-  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 lugal umuš gal-gal-la ad gi4-gi4  inim-ma nu-kuš2-u3 gal-zu ka-aš bar uĝ3-e   ĝeštug2 daĝal niĝ2-nam gal-le-eš zu  di kur-kur-ra-ke4   inim šag4-ga ĝal2-la lul zid-bi mu-e-zu  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 lu2-erim2-ra guru5-uš mu-e-ta-ab-ed2-de3-en  ka šer7-da-ka ĝiri3 saga11 dug4 lu2 zi-zi-i mu-e-zu  nam-tag dugud ka garaš2-kam lu2 til-le mu-ni-in-zu  a2-tuku   kalag-ga sig9-ga še29-eš2 nu-mu-un-ak-e  niĝ2-si-sa2 ki-en-gi ki-uri-a mu-ni-ĝar  su kalam-ma mu-dug3
en: Lipit-Eštar, Enlil's son, you have realised justice and righteousness. Lord, your goodness covers everything as far as the horizon. King Lipit-Eštar, counsellor with huge intelligence, who never tires of discussion, wise one whose decisions guide the people, amply wise, knowing everything in great detail! To decide justly the lawsuits of foreign countries, you recognise true and false even in people's thoughts. Lipit-Eštar, you …… the wicked, but you also know how to save someone by commuting his death sentence; you know how to free someone from the severe punishment, from the jaws of destruction. The mighty do not commit robbery and the strong do not abuse the weak anymore: you have established justice in Sumer and Akkad and made the Land feel content.

akk: ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 lugal i3-si-in^ki--na lugal ki-en-gi ki-uri-me-en  nibru^ki--še3 dub sar-re-me-en  e2-kur-re e2 ^d-en-lil2-la2-še3 ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 saĝ us2-bi za-e-me-en  ^d-en-lil2 ^d-nin-lil2-ra ki aĝ2 šag4-ba-me-en  ur-saĝ ^d-nin-urta maškim kalag-ga-zu-um  ^d-nuska sukkal-maḫ a2-taḫ inim-ma-zu-um  išib keš3^ki--še3 ^d-nin-tur5-re zid-de3-eš pad3-da-me-en  urim2^ki--še3 ĝal2-la šul ĝiš tuku ^d-suen-na-me-en  ^d-en-ki-ke4 eridug^ki--ta aga zid šum2-ma-me-en  ki unug^ki--ga kug ^d-inana-ra ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 ḫi-li šag4-ga-na-me-en  ^d-nin-i3-si-in-na-ke4 i3-si-in^ki--na barag maḫ-zu mi-ni-in-ri
en: Lipit-Eštar, king of Isin, king of Sumer and Akkad, you are the tablet writer of Nibru; Lipit-Eštar, you are the constant attendant of the E-kur, Enlil's house. You are the beloved one of Enlil's and Ninlil's hearts. Hero Ninurta is your mighty commissioner. Chief minister Nuska is your aid in all matters. You have been rightly chosen by Nintur as the purification priest of Keš. When in Urim, you are the youth who has the attention of Suen. You are the one to whom Enki gave the good headdress in Eridug. In Unug, Lipit-Eštar, you are the delight of holy Inana's heart. In Isin, Ninisina set up your lofty throne-dais.

akk: i-lu šag4-ga mu bal sag9-ga  nun-e nun uru16 dirig gal maḫ-bi  ad-da-zu ^d-iš-me-^d-da-gan lugal kalam-ma-ke4  ^ĝiš-gu-za-na suḫuš-bi mu-ra-an-ge-en  inim dug4-ga an ^d-en-lil2-la2-ta
en: Among joyful songs of the heart, in an auspicious regnal year, the prince, the powerful prince surpassing in greatness and majesty, your father Išme-Dagan, king of the Land, made the foundations of his throne firm for you. On the orders of An and Enlil, {he} { you} silenced the loud strife of the foreign countries.

akk: ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en  niĝ2-gen6-na-zu ka-ga14 mi-ni-in-ĝal2  dub-sar-re a-le ḫe2-em-ši-ak-e gal-le-eš ḫe2-i-i  ar2-zu e2-dub-ba-a-ka   sipad gu2-tuku šul dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 za3-mi2
en: Lipit-Eštar, Enlil's son, you have made every mouth speak of your righteousness. {The tablets will forever speak your praise} { May your praise never disappear from the tablets} in the e-dub-ba-a. May the scribes …… and glorify you greatly! May eulogies of you never cease in the e-dub-ba-a! Perfect shepherd, youthful son of Enlil, Lipit-Eštar, be praised!

akk: [en] maḫ zag dib me galam u18-ru  /pa\-bil2-ga en-en-e-ne
en: The august lord, pre-eminent, with the most complex divine powers, almighty grandfather of all the lords --
3. barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  saĝ il2 dirig ninda2 numun i-i  mu idim ni2 gal-le-eš ri-a  maḫ dug4-ga-ni sag2 di nu-zu  kur me sikil-la ni2 mu-ni-in-guru3  barag gal-la dur2 im-mi-in-ĝar  an lugal diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4
en: -- head high, surpassing everyone, breed-bull, who makes the seeds sprout, whose name is respected, spreading great terror, whose august commands cannot be countermanded, who is imbued with awesomeness on the mountain of pure divine powers, who has taken his seat on the great throne-dais, An, the king of the gods --
10. šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  igi zid su3-ra2-še3 mu-un-ši-in-bar  nun ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2-ra igi zid mu-ši-in-bar  nam-til3 su3-ra2-še3 mu-na-an-šum2  nun ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2-ra nam-til3 <su3-ra2-še3 mu-na-an-šum2>  an-na dug4-ga-ni inim ki-bi-še3 ĝar-ra  diĝir na-me saĝ la-ba-ab-šum2-mu  ^d-a-nun-na diĝir kilib3-ba-bi  ki nam tar-re-da gu2 mu-na-si-si-eš
en: -- has looked at him with long-lasting favour, has looked at prince Lipit-Eštar with favour. He has bestowed on him a long life, he has bestowed on prince Lipit-Eštar a long life. The words of what An says are firmly established; no god would oppose them. At the place where the destinies are to be decided, all the Anuna gods gather around him.
19. šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  me gal-gal-la pa mu-ni-in-e3  diĝir an-na mu-na-sug2-ge-eš
en: He has made all the great divine powers manifest; the gods of heaven stand around him.
22. 2nd barsud.

akk: bar-sud 2-kam-ma  ĝiš-ḫur-bi   me maḫ-a me saĝ-ki-a-ba  nam-lugal niĝ2 kal-kal-la-am3  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-ra  an gal-e saĝ-e-eš mu-ni-in-rig7
en: He has implemented their divine plans properly; the gods of the earth {submit themselves to him} { sit around him}. With august and foremost divine powers, great An has bestowed on Lipit-Eštar, son of Enlil, a kingship which is very precious.
29. sa-gida.

akk: sa-«bar»-gid2-da-am3  an gal-am3 diĝir pa e3 gal-am3
en: An, the great, the great god shining forth, An, {the almighty} { eminent}, is indeed the support of King Lipit-Eštar.
32. {Its ĝišgiĝal} { Its ĝišgiĝal of the sa-gida}.

akk: an-e šag4 gu2-bi gi4-a-na lugal mu-ni-in-pad3  šag4-bal-bal nam-lugal-la-ra gu3 zid mu-na-an-de2  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 a2 šum2-ma-ĝu10-me-en gu2 an-še3 ḫe2-zig3  ud gu3 di saĝ-bi zi-zi-gin7 su zig3 ḫe2-me-da-ri  gu2-erim2-ĝal2 kur nu-še-ga-zu u18-lu-zu ḫe2-em-dul  niĝ2-si-sa2 ki-en-gi ki-uri mu-ni-ĝar su kalam-ma mu-dug3  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2 ud-gin7 dalla ḫe2-ni-e3  iri a2-dam maš-gana2 ki ĝar-ra gu3 teš2 ḫu-mu-ra-ab-sig10  uĝ3 saĝ gig2-ga u8-gin7 lu-a us2 zid ḫu-mu-ra-ab-sig9-ge5  ^d-li-pi2-<it-eš4-tar2> kur ki su3-ra2-še3 lugal-bi ḫe2-me-en  ^ĝiš-gu-za maḫ nam-nun-na ḫe2-du7 gi16-sa nam-lugal-la  ^d-en-lil2-le zid-de3-eš ma-ra-an-šum2 suḫuš-bi ḫu-mu-ra-ab-sig10  ^d-suen aga saĝ-za mi-ni-in-ga-na   ^d-en-ki-ke4 me nam-nun-na-ka še-er-ka-an ḫu-mu-<ra>-ni-in-dug4  ^d-inana tug2 nam-nun-na-ka za-e-da ḫu-mu-X-de3-gub  ^d-udug sag9-ga ^d-lamma e2-kur-ra ḫe2-me-da-sug2-sug2-ge-eš  nidba ^ĝiš-ĝeštin /ga^?-\ il2-la-zu šu ḫe2-em-da-ĝal2-ĝal2  dumu niĝ2-dim2-ma [^d-]en-lil2-la2-me-en niĝ2 ḫu-<mu>-ra-ab-dug3-dug3
en: In the overflowing of his heart, An has chosen him as king and blessed the royal descendant: "Lipit-Eštar, on whom I bestowed power, may you lift your head high! May you spread fearsome radiance as if you were the front of a rising tempest! May your storm cover the enemy territories, the disobedient countries! You have established justice in Sumer and Akkad, and made the Land feel content. Lipit-Eštar, son of Enlil, may you shine as brilliantly as the sunlight! May concord be created under you in the established cities, settlements and dwellings! May the black-headed people, numerous as flocks, follow the right path under you! Lipit-Eštar, even in far-away foreign countries, you will be the king! Enlil has faithfully bestowed on you the princely august throne, the eternal ornament of kingship; he has made it firm for you. May you never cease to wear the crown that Suen has placed firmly on your head! Enki has adorned you with princely divine powers. Inana escorts you with the garment of princeship. The friendly guardians and the protecting genii of the E-kur stand by you. May the food offerings, wine, and milk that you bring ……! Son and creature of Enlil, may everything be pleasant for you!"2 lines missing
53. sa-ĝara.
May you, son of Enlil, chosen in his heart by the god imbued with awesomeness, be provided abundantly with everything!

akk: diĝir ni2 guru3 /šag4-ge pad3-da dumu\ /^d-en\-[lil2-la2] niĝ2 ḫa-ra-ab-gu-ul-[gu-ul]
en: 55. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-/im\  an-e dug4-ga-ni nam dug3 tar-[ra-am3]  an gal-e dug4-ga-ni nam dug3 [tar-ra-am3]  ^d-li-<pi2-it-eš4-tar2> dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-ra šu […]
en: What An says decides a good destiny; what the great An says decides a good destiny. …… for Lipit-Eštar, son of Enlil.
59. Its uru.
60. An adab of An.

akk: ^d-nin-urta en ^d-nu-nam-nir-re u18-lu /gal-gin7\ […] X mu-un-tu-ud-de3-en u3-ma-ni gub-bu-de3 gu3 /ma^?-\-[ra]-/de2^?-\
en: Hero, mightiest of the Anuna gods, who comes forth from the E-kur! Ninurta, Lord Nunamnir created you like a great storm ……, he commanded you to achieve triumphs for him.
4. Barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  ^d-nin-tur5-re šu niĝ2 dim2-ma-ni za-ra mu-ri-in-bad^?-  ubur dug3-ga-na ka ma-ra-ni-in-ba ga nam-šul-la mi-ri-in-gu7  am u6 di-gin7 alan-zu mu-un-er9 a2-ur2-zu mu-un-gur4^?-  igi ni2 bur2-e en me-lem4 nam-ur-saĝ da-da-ra-še3 mi-ri-in-dug4  kišib-la2 zid-da-zu im-ma-an-dab5 ama-zu ^d-nin-tur5-re  e2-kur eš3 maḫ-a mi-ni-in-kur9-re-en a-a-zu ^d-en-lil2-ra  mu-na-ab-be2 dumu šu ĝar gi4-zu nam gal tar-mu-ni-ib2
en: For you Nintur has opened wide her creative hands; she has breast-fed you from her sweet breasts; she has fed you with the milk of vigour. As if you were a spectacular wild bull, she has made your figure strong , she has made your limbs massive. She has fitted you out with …… appearance, awesome radiance and heroism. Your mother, Nintur, held you by the right wrist as she led you before your father in E-kur, the august shrine. Then she said: "Decide a great fate for the son who is your avenger!"
12. Šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3 ^d-en-lil2-le igi ḫul2 mu-ši-in-bar nam mu-ni-ib2-tar-re [u4]-/ta\-u18-lu an ki šu2-a-še3 /mu-zu\ ḫe2-em-maḫ me-lem4-zu-/še3\ [diĝir] /gal\-gal-e-ne /saĝ\ im-/da\-[sag3-ge]-/ne^?-\
en: Enlil looked at him with joy and decided his fate: "Uta-ulu, may your name be exalted throughout the extent of heaven and earth. Your awesome radiance will make all the great gods tremble with fear."
16. 2nd barsud.

akk: [bar]-/sud\ 2-[kam]-/ma\-am3  mur ša4-zu /inim dug4\-ga-zu-še3 /kur\-[kur] ni2-ba ḫu-/mu\-[gam]-/de3\  [igi] ḫu-luḫ-ḫa-zu-ne gu2-erim2-ĝal2 su ḫe2-em-da-sag3-ge-de3  u4-ta-u18-lu /im\-ḫul-im-ḫul-/gin7\ zi-zi-i-da-zu-ne  [ki]-/bal\-a /sug\-zag-ge4 um-mi-gu7 X […] X BA gu7-u3-de3  [nam]-/nir-ĝal2-zu\ diĝir gal-gal-e-ne me-teš2 /mu-un\-i-i-/ne\  [… a]-a-zu^!- [^d-en]-/lil2\-le nam-še3 mu-ri-/in\-[tar]
en: "Your roaring and commands make all the foreign countries submit. Your frightening look makes all enemies tremble! Uta-ulu, when like all the evil winds you rise to …… like Gibil, the lord of ……, the hero; 1 line unclear After you have completely devastated the rebellious lands, ……, all the great gods will duly praise your supremacy!" …… your father decided your destiny.
24. Sa-gida.
……, make …… hostile to him bow down for Lipit-Eštar, the son of Enlil!
27. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-gida.

akk: [ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2 sa-gid2-da]-bi-im  […] X a-ab-ba-ta  […] an ki-še3 pa e3-ĝu10-uš  […] saĝ-zu um-mi-us2  […] mu-ni-in-šid saḫar-da im-da-ḫi  […]-gin7 ḫe2-bi2-in-ur4 nu-ĝal2-la mu-ni-in-kur9  ^d-nin-urta ur-saĝ ^d-en-lil2-la2 barag-za dur2 ĝar-bi  nitalam2-zu nin zid ^d-nin-nibru^ki- gu2-da mu-/ri-in\-la2  inim sag9-ga ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2-ra-da ud šu2-/še3\ ḫa-ra-da-gub  u4-ta-u18-lu ki šu [il2]-la-ni a2-taḫ-ni ḫe2-/me\-en  dug4-ga-zu-ta nir /ḫe2\-em-de3-ĝal2 gaba-ri-ni na-an-ĝal2-/le\  /lugal\ nam tar-ra ^d-nin-urta-ke4 ul /guru3^?- ḫe2\-en^?--[na-nam]  [^d-]li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 nun za-a-še3 ĝal2-la dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2-ke4  [niĝ2]-si-sa2 ki-en-gi ki-uri-a mu-ni-in-ĝar  su kalam-ma mu-dug3
en: 3 lines unclear You have counted …… as ruin-mounds, to be mixed with dust. You have swept over ……, you obliterated it. Ninurta, hero of Enlil, as you are sitting on your throne-dais, may your spouse, the true lady Ninnibru, who embraces you, step before you daily with friendly words on behalf of Lipit-Eštar! Uta-ulu, may you be his aid when he prays! May he be able to rely on your words, may he be peerless! May he be the king whose fate Ninurta decides, the one endowed with attractiveness! Lipit-Eštar, the prince who is a supporter of yours, the son of Enlil, has established justice in Sumer and Akkad, and made the Land feel content.
May the shepherd, the expert, most wise in leading, guide the people for you!

akk: sipad mas-su2 tum2-tum2-mu gal-an-zu-a uĝ3 ḫa-ra-ab-laḫ4-laḫ4-e
en: 43. Sa-ĝara.
Great hero, when for prince Lipit-Eštar you reduce to heaps the rebellious lands which are insubordinate to him, may ……!

akk: ur-saĝ gal /nun\ ^d-li-<pi2>-it-eš4-tar2-ra u3-mu-ta-sig10 ki-bal nu-še-ga-na zar^?--gin7 ḫe2-us2^?--u3-us2
en: 45. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-ĝara.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2 sa-ĝar-ra-bi-im en a-ma-ru maḫ suḫuš erim2-ma bur12-re ^d-nin-urta en a-ma-ru maḫ suḫuš erim2-<ma> bur12-re nun ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2-ra ^ĝiš-tukul ḫul-du-ni gi-/gin7\ ša5-ša5 šu maḫ-a-ni si-bi2-/ib2\
en: Lord, mighty flood which tears out the roots of the enemy! Ninurta, mighty flood which tears out the roots of the enemy, may you put a weapon into the mighty hands of prince Lipit-Eštar which will snap his enemies in two as if they were reeds!
50. Its uru.
51. An adab of Ninurta.

akk: [^d-nin-i3]-si-na /dumu\ [gal] an-[na] e2-gi4-a gal nir /gub^?-\-[bu]  [^d-]li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 u2-a-zu ḫe2-am3 e-ne-ra mu-na-an-dug4
en: He told her, Ninisina, the great daughter of An, the great daughter-in-law, ……: "That Lipit-Eštar should be your provider -- so let it be!"
3. Šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  ka-ta e3-a-ni ^d-en-lil2-la2-še3  ^d-nin-i3-si-na-ka-še3 ĝeštug2 ba-ši-in-gub sun5-na-bi mu^!--na-ni-ib-gi4-gi4  a-a ^d-en-lil2 diĝir mu^!- pa e3  i-bi2 mu-lil2-la2-še3   en X X me-zu me-a umuš a2 aĝ2-zu a2 aĝ2-/ta KAL\  […]  u3-mu-un  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2-ra  […] X X SI BA  u3-mu-ni-in-ze2-eĝ3   […] X […]-ra-ab-sug2-e  […] /ḪI^?-\ ki-tuš /uĝ3\ mu-ni-in-ĝar su kalam-ma mu-e-dug3  [igi nam-til3]-la-zu mu-un-ši-bar  na-aĝ2  zid tar-mu-ni-ib
en: Ninisina paid attention to Enlil's utterance. She answered with humility: "Father Enlil, god whose name is manifest, ……, Enlil; lord ……, your divine powers are the most ……, your instructions are the most precious . For the trustworthy shepherd ……, …… Lord Lipit-Eštar 2 lines unclear He has settled the people ……, he has made the Land feel content. You looked upon him with your life-giving gaze: now decree him a true fate!"
14. 3rd kirugu.
"Nunamnir, bestow upon prince Lipit-Eštar a long life of many days!"

akk: [^d-nu]-nam-nir nun ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2-ra nam-til3 ud su3-ra2 saĝ-e-eš rig7-ba-ab
en: 16. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: [ĝiš]-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  /inim\ dug4-ga ^d-nin-isin2^si--na-ka-še3  [kur] /gal\ ^d-en-lil2-le ĝeštug2 ba-ši-in-gub  [lugal]-ra gu3 zid mu-na-an-de2-e nam mu-ni-ib-tar-re  [^d-]/li\-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 mu pad3-da-ĝu10-me-en uĝ3-ĝa2 saĝ mi-ni-in-il2  zi-ĝal2-e ama a-a ugu-bi-gin7 igi-bi ḫe2-en-ši-ĝal2-le-eš  kalag-ga saĝ  e2-kur-ra ensi2 eš3 maḫ-a  u4-ta-u18-lu ki šen-šen-na-ka a2-taḫ-zu ḫe2-am3  ḫul-du-zu sim^mušen--gin7 ḫa-ra-ur4-ru zar-re-eš ḫa-ra-ab-sal-e
en: The Great Mountain Enlil paid attention to the words spoken by Ninisina. He blessed the king and decreed his fate: "Lipit-Eštar, you whom I have called by name, shall be elevated among the people. May the living look to you as to their own fathers and mothers! May the strong one who cares for E-kur, the ensi of the august shrine, Uta-ulu, be your help on the battlefield! May he collect your enemies like swallows for you; may he spread them out like sheaves for you!"
25. 4th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 4-kam-ma  nun ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 ^d-nu-nam-nir-ra  en dug4-ga nu-kur2-ru-de3 uĝ3 šar2-ra-ba mu-ni im-mi-maḫ
en: Nunamnir, the lord whose order cannot be altered, has made the name of prince Lipit-Eštar exalted among the numerous people.
28. Its ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  ^d-en-lil2-me-en an-še3 il2-me-en ki-še3 en /me\ šar2-me-en  ^d-li-pi2-it-eš4-tar2 nam dug3 mi-ni-ib-tar-re niĝ2 nu-kur2-ru ḫe2-am3
en: "I, Enlil, am elevated in heaven, and am the lord of all the divine powers on earth. The good fate I have decreed to Lipit-Eštar is something which can never be changed!"
31. A šir-namgala of Ninisina.

akk: in-nin egir3 zid dumu-gir15 e2-maḫ-ḫa nitalam lugal-la   nu-nus  diĝir nam-nin-na^?- tum2 an ki-e dirig  ar2-/a-ni\ šir3-ra ga-mu-ni-ib-be2 mi2 zid-de3-eš ga-am3-dug4
en: I will perform in song the praise of the mistress, the trustworthy lady, the noble child of the E-maḫ, the spouse of the king, the woman, the goddess who is worth of the ladyship, surpassing heaven and earth. I will pay her due homage.

akk:
X (X) ḫe2-me-a LUM-LUM NE ḫe2-du7 […] X X X me gal-la gub-be2 /^d-li\-pi2-/it\-eš4-tar2 dumu ^d-/en\-[lil2]-la2-ra mi2 zid na-mu-[ni-dug4] [X] X LI IR X […] MA ze2-eb za-e X […] [X] X-bi AĜ2 [X] X X i-ib2-ze2-eb X […] [X X] ki ma-ra ma-an-pad3-de2 […] [X X] X ḫul2-la /dirig\ […] […] X X […] X DU X X X X X […]
^d-inana ^d-/li\-pi2-/it\-[eš4-tar2] […] ur2 kug-za […] X X X NE      ĝiš-gi4-/ĝal2-bi-im\
     u3-a-di ^d-inana-kam
en: 1 line unclear …… great divine powers ……. She cherished Lipit-Eštar, the son of Enlil. …… pleasant ……. …… pleasant ……. …… searched …… for me. …… surpassing in joy ……. unknown no. of lines missing
2 lines fragmentary
Inana, …… prince Lipit-Eštar on your holy lap.
4. Its ĝišgiĝal.
5. An ua-di of Inana.

akk: […] RU^?- maḫ^?--a-ni zag nu-sa2  […] X X ĝi6 u3-na kar2-kar2  […]-a ni2 me-lem4 [gur3]-ru  [X X]-ĝa2-ni-še3 diĝir gal-gal-e-ne ḫu-luḫ-ḫa im-du8-du8  [X] X dug4-ga-ni an-gin7 maḫ ^d-en-lil2-gin7 u18-ru  ^d-inana saĝ-kal me niĝ2-nam-ma zag dib nin-e-ne  ĝiš-ḫur nam-lugal-la šu du7-du7 ki-bi gi4-gi4-de3  [saĝ] gig2  us2 gen6-na dab5-be2-de3  ĝeštug2-ga-ni nam-gub šag4-ga-ni zid-de3-eš-e nam-de6  [^d-]ur-^d-nin-urta nam-sipad zi-ĝal2-la-še3 uĝ3 šar2-ra mi-ni-in-pad3  [X] nam tar-ra me zid ḫal-ḫa diĝir gal-gal-e-ne-še3  e2-kur ki-tuš kug an ^d-en-lil2-la2 ni2 su zig3 gur3-ru-še3  lugal-ra šu-ni im-ma-an-dab5 sun5-na-bi mi-ni-in-kur9  in-nin e-ne-da nu an ki-a nam nu-tar-re-de3  an ^d-en-lil2-da barag-ge4 si-a-na ad mu-un-na-ni-ib-gi4-gi4
en: ……, when she augustly appears, no one can keep pace with her, …… glowing in the night, …… with awe-inspiring splendour. The great gods are filled with fear at her ……. Her …… utterances are as grand as those of An, and as weighty as those of Enlil. Inana is supreme, with multifarious divine powers surpassing the other divine ladies. She perfected the divine plans of kingship, so as to re-establish it, and she made up her mind and truly yearned to provide justice for the black-headed and to give them stable governance. From among the numerous people she summoned Ur-Ninurta to be the shepherd of living beings. She made the king whom she took by the hand humbly enter into the …… where destinies are determined, where the good divine powers are assigned to the great gods -- the E-kur, the holy dwelling of An and Enlil that is imbued with terrifying awe. There the goddess without whom no destiny is determined in heaven or earth sits on the dais with An and Enlil, taking counsel with them.
16. 1st kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 1-a-kam  an gal dug4-ga-zu niĝ2 maḫ-am3 a-ba-a šu mi-ni-ib-bal-e  a-a ^d-en-lil2 nam gal tar-ra-zu sag2 di nu-zu-a  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta šul a2 aĝ2-ĝa2-<zu>-ne-ne DI-DI mu-un-zu-a-ar  nam-sipad zi-ĝal2 uĝ3 šar2-ra du-ri2-še3 saĝ-e-eš rig7-ga-na-ab-ze2-en  e2 iri^ki- du3-du3 kalam gen6-ne2 šag4 kug-ta mu-u8-de6  kur-kur-re a2 aĝ2-ĝa2-bi mu-un-zu a2 gal ḫe2-aĝ2-e  šibir-a-ni ki-bal ḫe2-en-gam-e us2 gen6 ḫe2-bi2-ib-dab5-be2  sig-ta igi-nim-še3 kalam-ma rab3-gin7 šu ḫe2-em-ri-ri-e  ka-ta e3-a-ni […]  udu-gin7 ka u2-gu7 ḫa-ba-kiĝ2-kiĝ2 GU2 a naĝ ḫa-ba-ĝa2-ĝa2
en: "Great An, your commands are great indeed: who can revoke them? Father Enlil, no one knows how to dissipate the great destinies that you determine. Both of you, bestow permanently the role of shepherd of living beings, of the numerous people, upon Ur-Ninurta, the youth who knows how to carry out your orders. He has brought with him from the holy womb a knowledge of how to build homes and cities, and how to strengthen the Land. He knows how to direct all countries: let him give great commands. May his shepherd's crook make the rebel lands bow low; may he let them have stable governance. From the south to the uplands may he clamp down upon the Land like a neck-stock. May his utterances ……. May he search out food for them to eat as if for sheep, and may he get them …… water to drink."
27. 2nd kirugu.
"May Ur-Ninurta shine forth like Utu over the people for long years!"
29. Ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi-ĝal2-bi-im  diĝir numun e3 a-a niĝ2-nam šar2-ra-ke4  lugal-ra gu3 zid mu-na-an-de2 nam mu-ni-ib-tar-re  ^ĝiš-erin suḫ me-te kisal e2-kur-ra  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta kalam-ma ĝissu-zu ni2 ḫe2-eb-ši-te-en-te-en  kur-kur-re sipad zid-bi ḫe2-me-en  ^d-utu-gin7  igi-bi ḫe2-em-ši-ĝal2-e  barag nam-lugal-la suḫuš gen6-na-ba  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta dur2 ĝar-ra-zu-ne saĝ an-še3 ḫe2-ni-in-il2  aga zid-de3 me-te ḫe2-em-mi-in-ĝal2  ni2 su zig3 ur-maḫ nam-lugal-la tug2-ba13-še3 ḫe2-em-mur10
en: The god who made human seed come forth , the father of all that is, spoke favourably to the king, determining his destiny: "Chosen cedar, ornament of the courtyard of E-kur! Ur-Ninurta, may the Land refresh itself in your shade. May you be the good shepherd of all lands. May they attend as if to Utu when you deliver a just verdict. As you take your seat upon the royal dais with its firm foundations, may you hold your head high, Ur-Ninurta. May the good crown be your glory. Inspiring fear and trembling, O lion of kingship, may you wear the royal robe!"
40. 3rd kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 3-kam-ma-am3  e2-an-ka me-bi ḫa-ba-gub-be2  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta bad3 gal-zu ĝe26-e-me-en ud ul du-ri2-še3
en: "May you establish the divine powers of E-ana! Ur-Ninurta, I am your great wall permanently and forever!"
43. Ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  erim2-ĝal2-za ud-gin7 gu3 bi2-ra  me-lem4-zu muru9 dugud-da-gin7 kur nu-še-ga-zu ḫe2-em-dul  /barag\-barag gal-gal ni2 er9-e-ne  […] X X gi dili du3-a-gin7 kilib3-ba-bi saĝ ḫe2-em-da-sag3-ge-ne  [X X] X RA LI NE […]  [^tum9-u18]-lu-gin7 zi-zi-da-zu-ne  kur ki-bal-zu sig10-ge u3-mu-e-ak  uĝ3-bi šaĝa-a um-mu-laḫ5  i3-si-in^ki- iri me gal-gal-la-za  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta ^ĝiš-šudul gu2-ba ĝar-ni  an gal a-[a] diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta sipad ĝiš tuku-ni-ir nam ul-še3 nu-kur2-ru mu-ni-in-tar
en: "You howl like a storm upon your enemies. May your splendour cover like a heavy raincloud the lands that are disobedient to you. Let the great sovereigns and powerful ones tremble …… like solitary reeds. 1 line fragmentary You arise like the south wind, and when you have plotted against the rebel lands, when you have taken their people prisoners, then, O Ur-Ninurta, place the yoke on their necks in Isin, your city of great divine powers." Great An, father of the gods, has determined this as a destiny forever unchangeable for Ur-Ninurta, his attentive shepherd.
56. 4th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 4-kam-ma-am3  en eš-bar an ki šu-na ĝal2 kur gal ^d-en-lil2-le  lugal-ra mu-ni an-zag-še3 pa e3 im-ma-an-ak  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta nam-nir nam-šul-la am-gin7 gu2 ḫe2-ni-peš  ^d-er9-ra ur-saĝ-gin7 me X [X]-an-tuku-tuku  ^d-nin-urta en ud ḫuš erim2-ma dumu šu ĝar gi4-ĝu10  ki me3-ka ka-tab-zu ḫe2-a ĝiškim ḫe2-mu-e-til3-le  kur gu2-erim2 gu2-bi-da [X]-zu zar-re-eš ḫa-ma-ab-sal-e  šu-luḫ kug e2-kur-ra ba-an-ši-/ib\-[…]-en ud šu2-uš-e gub-ba  nidba-zu banšur maḫ unu2 gal-ĝa2 su3-ra2-še3 ḫe2-em-mi-in-ĝal2  saĝ ḫe2-e-il2 /gu2 an\-še3 ḫe2-e-zig3 til3 nu-kur2-ru za-a-am3
en: The lord who has the decisions of heaven and earth in his hands, the Great Mountain Enlil, has made the king's fame extend as far as the boundaries of heaven: "Ur-Ninurta! In authority and youthfulness may your neck be as fat as a wild bull's. Like the warrior Erra, ……, may my avenging son, Lord Ninurta, a furious storm against the enemy, be your helper on the battlefield, and may you put your trust in him. …… the enemy land, and may he spread out in heaps for me ……. The holy purification rites of E-kur ……, serving daily. May your offerings on the august table in my great dining hall be everlasting. May you lift your head and raise your neck to the heavens. Life is yours, irrevocably."
67. 5th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 5-kam-ma-am3  nam tar-ra an gal [^d-]nu-nam-nir en niĝ2-zi-ĝal2-la-še3  ^d-a-nun-na diĝir gal-gal-e-ne ḫe2-am3 ba-ni-in-ne-eš  saĝ gig2 ki-tuš-ba ge-en-gen6-ne2 kur-kur us2-a sig10-ge5  uĝ3 [X] X [X] X ka teš2 ĝa2-ĝa2 ĝiri3-ni-še3 gam-e  ^d-inana dumu gal ^d-suen-na nitalam ki aĝ2-ĝa2-ni  saĝ keše2 me niĝ2-nam-ma mu-un-ur4-ur4 šu-ni-še3 mu-u8-ĝar  2-na-ne-ne ki ^d-en-lil2-la2-ta ḫul2-la nam-[ta]-e3  e2^?--gal^?- ki-tuš lal3 niĝ2 dug3-ba dur2 ki ba-ni-in-ĝal2-le-eš  [X] X X-e lugal-la-ni nu-til-e zid-de3-eš na-mu-un-e
en: The Anuna, the great gods, said "Let it be so!" to the destiny determined by great An and by Nunamnir, the lord of all living beings. In order to strengthen the black-headed in their dwelling-places, to keep the foreign lands on the track, to put …… the people in unison, and to make them bow down at his feet, Inana, the great daughter of Suen and Ur-Ninurta's beloved spouse, gathered together …… all the divine powers and placed them in his hand. Together the two of them went forth joyfully from Enlil's presence to take their seats in the palace, the dwelling-place of sweet honey. …… her king …… does not cease, as she speaks truly to him:
77. 6th kirugu.

akk: ki-ru-gu2 6-[kam]-ma-am3  šul me-dim2 sag9 sig7 X še-er-[še]-er-ra saĝ il2-e-de3  ḫi-li ul gur3-ru me-te  na-aĝ2-u3-mu-un-na  barag kug-ge du7-re6  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta me kal-kal-la-zu  ša3-ab-ĝu10 im-mi-ir    i-bi2  zid il2-la-za mi-ni-in-pad3-de3 mu pad3-da-ĝu10-me-en  an gal-e kur-zag til-la-ba su3-ud-še3 bi2-in-dirig-ge  ur2 kug nam-til3-la DIR-ĝu10 ud-zu sud-sud-de3  šul ^d-en-lil2-le e2-kur-ta a2-bi mu-un-da-an-aĝ2  X X /barag\ mi2 zid-de3-eš dug4-ga-ĝu10   ^d-nanna an kug-ga pa e3-a  ka-na-aĝ2-e  u6 di-gin7  [^d-]/ur\-^d-nin-urta-ĝu10 kur-kur-re ḫi-li ḫu-mu-u8-ši-ak-e
en: "Youth with beautiful and well-formed limbs, …… radiantly and proudly lifting his head, full of charm and beauty, fitted for lordship, worthy of the holy dais, Ur-Ninurta: I have decided to give you your precious divine powers. I called to you when you lifted your faithful gaze: you are the one whom I called by name. Great An has made you forever pre-eminent, as far as the outer limit of the mountains. To prolong your days, O youth, in E-kur Enlil has commanded my …… holy life-giving embrace. You shall not cease to sit on …… the dais which I care for. May the foreign lands rejoice at you, my Ur-Ninurta, as at Nanna when, admired by the Land, he appears in the holy heavens."
88. 7th kirugu.
"My Ur-Ninurta, Enlil has called you truly to be the shepherd of the Land."
90. Ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  […] X KA kug eš-bar zid dug4-ga nu-kur2-ru-ĝu10-uš  […] a2 nun ḫe2-em-te-ĝal2  […]-an-tuku-tuku
en: "…… my holy ……, at my good decision which cannot be changed, …… may impressive strength be with you." 1 line fragmentary
94. 1 line fragmentary
95. A …… of Inana.

akk: ^d-en-ki ĝeštug2 daĝal mas-su maḫ ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne  gal-an-zu tu6 ĝar inim-ma sig10-ga eš-bar-ra igi ĝal2  sa2 pad3-de3 ud e3-ta ud šu2-uš-še3 ĝalga šum2-mu  ^d-en-ki en dug4-ga zid-zid-da me-teš2-e ga-a-i-i  a-a-zu an lugal en numun i-i uĝ3 ki ĝar-ĝar-ra  me an ki saĝ keše2-bi-še3 ma-ra-an-sig10 nun-bi-še3 mu-un-il2-en  ^id2-idigna ^id2-buranuna ka kug-bi du8-u3 niĝ2 giri17-zal si-si  dungu sir2-re a ḫe2-ĝal2-la šum2-mu a-gar3-ra šeĝ3-šeĝ3  ^d-ezina2 ab-sin2-na saĝ il2-il2-i u2-šim edin-na TAR […] X  pu2-^ĝiš-kiri6 lal3 ĝeštin ki tag-ga tir-gin7 sud-sud-e  an lugal diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4 a2-bi mu-e-da-a-aĝ2
en: Lord of complex divine powers, who establishes umderstanding, whose intentions are unfathomable, who knows everything! Enki, of broad wisdom, august ruler of the Anuna, wise one who casts spells, who provides words, who attends to decisions, who clarifies verdicts, who dispenses advice from dawn to dusk! Enki, lord of all true words, I will praise you. Your father, An the king, the lord who caused human seed to come forth and who placed all mankind on the earth, has laid upon you the guarding of the divine powers of heaven and earth, and has elevated you to be their prince. An, king of the gods, has instructed you to keep open the holy mouths of the Tigris and Euphrates, to fill them with splendour, to make the dense clouds release plentiful water and make them rain all over the fields, to make Ezina lift her head in the furrows, to make vegetation …… in the desert, and to make orchards and gardens ripe with syrup and vines grow as tall as forests.

akk: ^d-en-lil2-le mu maḫ saĝ-kug-ĝal2 ni2 gal gur3-ru-ni  šu^?- ma-ra-an-ba en niĝ2-nam u3-tud ^d-en-lil2 ban3-da-me-en  an ki-a dili-ni diĝir-ra-am3 dub-us2-a-ni za-e-me-en  e-ne-gin7 nam sig igi-nim-ma tar-tar-re šu-zu-še3 ša-mu-u8-ĝar  eš-bar zid ka-ta e3-a-zu uru2^ru- dib-ba-am3  ^d-sa2-bar-a kur-zag til-la-aš uĝ3 daĝal dur2-ru-na-ba  gu7 naĝ-bi-še3 im-da-kuš2-u3-de3-en a-a zid-bi za-e  en diĝir-bi-gin7 nam-maḫ-zu me-teš2 im-mi-i-i-ne
en: Enlil, the lord who creates everything, has bestowed on you his august, proud and greatly awe-inspiring name: you are the junior Enlil. Throughout heaven and earth he alone is divine, and you are his younger brother. He has placed in your hands the power like him to decide destinies of both the south and the uplands. A good decision that comes forth from your mouth is exceptionally powerful. Sa-bara , you concern yourself with the sustenance of the people who are widely settled as far as the borders of the mountains: you are their true father. Lord, all together they praise your greatness like the greatness of their protective deities.
21. Sa-gida.

akk: sa-gid2-da-am3  ^d-nu-dim2-mud ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ra inim kug dug4-ga maḫ-zu  nir ḫe2-ĝal2 gaba gi4 na-an-tuku-tuku
en: Nudimmud, let your holy word and august command be a source of honour for Ur-Ninurta, and let him have no rivals.
24. Ĝišgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  en maḫ an ki-a zag bi2-dib mu-zu pa bi2-e3  ^d-en-ki me a-na ĝal2-la mu-u8-ur4-ur4 abzu-še3 mu-u8-ĝar  ki-tuš kug šag4-ge bi2-pad3-da-zu abzu eš3 maḫ-a X X  me-bi me-a dirig ĝiš-ḫur-bi a-re-eš gub-ba-me-en  ĝissu-bi ud e3-ta ud šu-uš kur-kur-ra ši-im-dul  ni2 me-lem4 muru9 dugud-da-gin7 an kug-ge ib2-us2  e2-kur ki-tuš kug an ^d-en-lil2-la2 su zig3 im-du8-du8  šag4-ba ĝidru šum2-mu me ḫal-ḫal-la diĝir gal-gal-e-ne-še3  X numun^?- šar2-ra im-dim2-e nam-lu2-ulu3 u3-tud til3-le i3-ĝal2  a-a ^d-en-ki barag nam-tar-ra-za dur2 ĝar-ra-zu-ne
en: August lord, you excel in heaven and earth, and you have made your name shine forth. Enki, you have gathered up all the divine powers that there are, and stored them in the abzu. You have made praiseworthy the divine powers, exceeding all other divine powers, of your holy dwelling which you have chosen in your heart -- the abzu, the august shrine …… -- as well as its divine plans. Its shadow covers all lands from east to west, and its terrifying splendour rests upon the holy heavens like dense thunderclouds. It fills with terror E-kur, the holy dwelling of An and Enlil. Therein, equipped with the sceptre, you fashion the numerous seeds …… for the assigned divine powers of the great gods; to create mankind and to preserve them alive is in your power, Father Enki, when you take your seat on the dais where you decide destinies.
35. Sa-ĝara.

akk: sa-ĝar-ra-am3  lugal ^d-en-lil2-le nir šum2-ma ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ke4  e2 ĝeštug2-ga nam-gal-an-zu dirig-še3 niĝin ĝal2-la-za  ĝal2 u3-bi2-in-taka4 saĝ gig2-ga mas-su gal-bi ḫe2-em  su zig3 me-te nam-diĝir-ra ur-maḫ nam-lugal-la  niĝ2 šu dug4-ga /ud\ saĝ-ĝa2-na til3-la-še3 pa e3-ni-ib  gu2-un dugud a-ab-ba sig igi-nim-ma saĝ-e-eš u3-mu-e-ni-rig7  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ke4 ḫe2-ni-ib-ku4-ku4 e2-kur za-gin3-še3  ^d-en-lil2-le igi ḫul2-ḫul2-la-ni e-ne-ra u3-mu-un-ši-in-bar  bal-a-na ud dug3 mu giri17-zal nam-til3-la ḫa-ma-ab-taḫ-e  a-a ^d-en-ki nam-gal ni2 ri-a ka-ge dib-ba-zu-uš  ^d-a-nun-na diĝir /šeš\-zu-ne ḫe2-me-da-ḫul2-ḫul2-le-eš  dumu an-na maḫ nir-ĝal2-bi tuku za3-mi2-zu dug3-ga-am3
en: May Ur-Ninurta, the king in whom Enlil trusts, open up your house of wisdom in which you have gathered knowledge in plenty, and then be the great ruler of the black-headed. Make terrifying splendour befitting his godhead issue from him, the lion of kingship, in everything that he does, for as long as he lives. May you present him with weighty tribute from the upper and the lower seas, and let Ur-Ninurta bring it into the glorious E-kur. May Enlil look upon him joyously, and add to his period of rule blissful days and years of joy and life. Father Enki, inspiring terrible awe, surpassing description, may the Anuna, your divine brothers, rejoice over you. Son of An, possessor of august honour, it is sweet to praise you!
48. A tigi of Enki.

akk: ur-saĝ ušum ni2 ri ni2 ḫuš dirig gal-[di]  ^d-nin-urta mar-uru5 šu zig3-ga ĜIRI3 UD […]  kalag-ga usu maḫ tuku kur nu-un-ta-[e3]  a2 nam-ur-saĝ-ĝa2 šag4-ta tum2-a gaba gi4 nu-[tuku]
en: Hero, terror-inspiring dragon of exceptional fearsome terror, powerful Ninurta! Rising hurricane, ……, mighty possessor of august strength, who lets no foreign land escape! Fitted for heroism from the womb, unrivalled!
5. barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  iri ki a2-dam nu-ĝal2-la ki-bal ḫul-ĝal2 ak  ^d-nin-urta piriĝ ḫuš ḫu-luḫ-ḫa-gin7  DU-zu-ne ud e3-ta ud šu2-uš an ki ši-im-tuku4-e  di-kud nir-ĝal2 usu maḫ tuku-gin7 ki-bal du7-du7-zu  ud i3-du7 ĝi6 u3-na ši-im-ma-zig3 ki-bal-e ši-im-nu2-e  igi il2-i-zu ḫur-saĝ gal teš2-ba ši-im-da-tu^!--ku
en: You who treat as hostile the cities as well as the unsettled areas, the rebel lands -- Ninurta, as you pass by, like a terrifying fierce lion you make heaven and earth tremble from east to west. When in judgment, like a hero possessing great strength, you batter a rebel land, by day you thrust, by night you rear up, and you leave the rebel land lying prone. If you merely lift your gaze, you make the great hills tremble together.
12. šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  en iri^?- nam ^d-nu-nam-nir-ra ĝiškim-til3 a-a-na  ^d-nin-urta a2 zid-da kur gal-la-aš ša-mu-un-til3-la-ni-me-en  eš-bar dug4-ga-ni ki-bi-še3 ĝa2-ĝa2 di-di-bi mu-e-zu
en: Mighty lord, with all the qualities of Nunamnir! Support of your father! Ninurta, you are the right arm of the Great Mountain, on whom he has bestowed life. You understand how to establish and to fulfil the decisions pronounced by him.
16. 2nd barsud.

akk: bar-sud 2-kam-ma  en barag-barag ni2 er9-be2-ne ĝiri3 saga11 X […] X X […]  ḫul-du erim2-ĝal2 nu-mu-un-e3 [X]-e bi2-ib2-X […]  kur ma-da daĝal igi zid bar-ra-zu nam-ḫe2-a ma-ra-an-du8  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta šul za-še3 ĝal2 sipad zid ĝiš tuku-zu-um  ub-da an ki uĝ3 ki ĝar-ra-ba saĝ-e-eš mu-ni-rig7  ĝeštug2 šum2-ma ^d-en-ki-ka3 KA tum2-tum2-mu-bi mu-e-zu  saĝ gig2 udu-gin7 lu-a-bi ḫu-mu-ĝal2-e us2-zu ḫe2-bi2-ib2-dab5-be2
en: Lord trampling underfoot all rulers, the powerful ones, ……, you do not let the evil and wicked escape, ……. The foreign land and the broad territories that you have looked upon with favour spread themselves before you in abundance. You have entrusted the various quarters of heaven and earth, with their settled peoples, to Ur-Ninurta, the youth who is all for you, the good shepherd who is attentive to you. You have made him to whom Enki has given wisdom understand how to …… them. May you be available to make the black-headed, numerous as sheep, follow your path.
24. sa-gida.
Cast down in heaps all those who are not obedient to the great hero Ur-Ninurta.
26. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-gida.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2 sa-gid2-da-bi-im  u4-ta-u18-lu en dumu ^d-en-lil2-la2 ḫur-saĝ-ta e3-a  ^d-nin-urta nam-maḫ dugud-da-zu a-re-eš dug4-ge-eš2  nam-nir-ĝal2 nam-maḫ kalag-ga-zu šag4 kur-kur-ra-ka  u18-lu me-lem4-ba ud e3 ud šu2-uš uĝ3 šar2-ra ši-im-dul-[e]  a-a ugu-zu sipad diĝir-re-ne en ^d-nu-nam-nir-re  me gal-gal an ki-a saĝ keše2-bi šu-za ma-ra-ni-in-ge-en  nam-nir nam-zag-dib mu-ra-an-šum2 gaba gi4 nu-mu-ri-in-tuku  ^d-nin-lil2-la2 ḫi-li šag4-ga-na-me-en  ki-ig  gal im-ma-ra-an-aĝ2  a-ra2 niĝ2 ak-zu ḫul2-la-da ni2 am3-il2-il2-i
en: Lord Uta-ulu, son of Enlil, who has come forth from the hills, Ninurta! Your imposing greatness is declared in praise songs. Your authority and your powerful greatness cover the numerous people in all the lands from east to west with their tempestuous splendour. Your father who engendered you, the shepherd of the gods, Lord Nunamnir, has placed the great divine powers of heaven and earth in your hands for safe keeping, has given you valour and pre-eminence, and let you have no rivals. You are the heart's delight of Ninlil: she loves you dearly. Rejoicing in your actions, she has made you awe-inspiring.

akk: a-ba za-gin7 diĝir pa e3-a^?--e^?- mu-ni an-zag-še3  šul  uĝ3 daĝal-la pad3-[da ĝiš] dug4-ga kur gal-la  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta […] la-la gu3 zid de2-a-zu  igi X […]-ke4 DU [… mu]-un-ne-šum2  barag^?- […]-en GIR^?- za-gin3 saĝ-[e]-eš mu-ni-in-rig7  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ra bal mu giri17-zal-la mu-un-ne-taḫ  iri^ki- maš-gana2 a2-dam ki ĝal2-la-ni ḫe2-ĝal2-la ša-mu-un-du3  saĝ gig2-ge ^d-utu e3-[gin7] igi-bi ḫe2-me-ši-ĝal2  ^ĝiš-tukul kur gu2-erim2-ĝal2 […] X X ki tuku4-tuku4-da X-ke4  u3-mu-un-šum2 a2-dam nu-še-ga-ni /sug\-zag^!--ge4 bi2-ib-gu7-e  u4-ta-u18-lu ur-^d-nin-urta-ra šu ḫe2-me-de3-ni-ĝal2-ĝal2
en: Who like you is a god rising in glory, whose name reaches as far as the limits of heaven? You have given …… to the just youth, who was called from among the widespread people, engendered by the Great Mountain -- Ur-Ninurta, …… joy, to whom you have spoken favourably. On the dais …… you have bestowed on him a lapis lazuli ……. You have added years of joy to Ur-Ninurta's reign. You have built his city amid plenty, a habitation where the people are settled. May the black-headed direct their gaze at you as at the rising Utu. When you have given him the weapon that …… the hostile foreign lands, that makes the earth tremble, ……, you will completely devastate the populations that are disobedient to him. Uta-ulu, let Ur-Ninurta grasp it in his hand.
47. sa-ĝara.
May you be …… a helper for the great hero Ur-Ninurta.

akk: ur-saĝ gal ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ra saĝ-tab SI MA A ḫe2-e-me-en
en: 49. Ĝišgiĝal of the sa-ĝara.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2 sa-ĝar-ra-bi-im  en nam tar-ra-zu sag2 nu-di inim kug-zu uru2^ru-  ^d-nin-urta en nam tar-ra-zu sag2 nu-di inim kug-zu uru2^ru-  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta nam dug3 mu nam-til3-la  du-ri2-še3 [nu]-kur2-ru nam-e-eš tar-mu-ni-ib
en: Lord, your fixing of destinies cannot be upset, and your holy word is powerful. Ninurta, lord, your fixing of destinies cannot be upset, and your holy word is powerful. Determine a good fate for Ur-Ninurta, with years of life forever unalterable as his destiny.
54. Its uru.
55. An adab for Ninurta.

akk: in-nin9 zag dib ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne me kilib3-ba ur4-/ur4\  igi-zu nir-ĝal2 an ki-bi-da kur-kur-ra igi ĝal2  ^d-inana piriĝ an-na mul-mul-lu me-zu galam-galam-ma  ĝarza-zu niĝ2 nu-kur2-ru-dam ĝiš-ḫur-zu dugud-da
en: Goddess who excels the Anuna gods, who has gathered together all the divine powers! Your gaze is lordly as it surveys all the foreign lands in heaven and earth. Inana, lioness shining in the heavens, your divine powers are most complex, your cultic ordinances are unalterable, and your divine plans are influential.
5. barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  dim2-ma-zu abzu su3-ra2-am3 igi bar-re nu-um-zu  a-ra2 ak-a-zu niĝ2 gal-gal-am3 diĝir nu-me-da-sa2  me-zu ud silim-ma-bi ba-e-de6 niĝ2-nam la-ba-e-da-šub  nam-lugal zu2 keše2-me niĝ2-nam-ma šu-zu la-ba-ra-e3  an lugal-da zag mu-un-de3-ša4 nam mu-un-di-ni-ib-tar-re  ^d-en-lil2-gin7 ka-ta e3-a-zu ki-bi-še3 al-ĝa2-ĝa2  ^d-inana maḫ-di an ki-a gaba-ri nu-tuku-me-en
en: Your ideas are as profound as the abzu; no one is known to have perceived them. Your actions are very great, and there is no god to rival you. You fetched your divine powers on a favourable day, and none of them escaped you. You have secured the kingship, and nothing escapes from your hand. You have equal rank with An the king, and you decide destinies with him. Your utterances are as well-established as those of Enlil. Grandiloquent Inana, you have no rival in heaven or on earth.

akk: lugal ki aĝ2 diĝir-re-e-ne a-la mu-un-ši-ak-/e\  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta šul igi il2-la-zu me-te-zu-uš en-e  ^d-nin-tur5-re ḫi-li /mu\-[un-ši]-/in-tu\-ud-«de3-en» u6 [di-zu]-/še3\ ma-ra-an-gub  ĝiš-šub-ba-ni sag9-ge mu-/un\-[ge]-/en\ igi-za im-mi-/in\-[X]  ur3^?--ra GA šu-nir-e ḫe2-du7-a nam-nun-še3 mu-un-il2  ir-sim dug3-ga ku7-ku7-da-ke4 šag4 kug-zu ḫe2-em-tum3  ĝiš-nu2 gi4-rin ḫi-li si-a-za gu2 ḫu-mu-un-di-X-re  šul ĝiš tuku nun za-a-še3 ĝal2-la me ul-zu-uš ḫa-ba-gub  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ke4 uĝ3 šar2-re us2 zid ḫe2-bi2-ib-dab5-be2
en: You cheer on the king whom the gods love: Ur-Ninurta, the youth whom you chose, in your honour an en priest. Nintur has created attractiveness for him, and has made him step forward to you for your admiration. She has confirmed his lot as favourable, and has made him …… before you. She has elevated as a prince the …… who is fitted for the emblem. Your holy heart has driven you towards him as if to a pleasant sweet scent. May he …… with you on your flowery bed which is full of delight. May the attentive youth, the prince who is all for you, stand at the service of your eternal divine powers. May Ur-Ninurta make the numerous people follow the just path.
22. sa-gida.
Inana, may Ur-Ninurta never cease doing so, until far-off days.
24. Its ĝisgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  ^d-/inana\ nin an ki daĝal-la u18-ru KI UD-ta  X […] X-ma saĝ mu2-mu2-mu2 ĝi6 u3-na kar2-kar2  […] /kur^?-\ idim-ta e3-a an uraš-a daĝal bur2  […]-/da\ teš2-bi-im ama-na ḫi-li-bi-im  [… ḫe2]-/mi\-ni-in-maḫ-en ur-^d-nin-urta-ke4  […] /saĝ\ ḫu-mu-ni-in-il2 am gal-bi ḫe2-a  […] /gam\-gam-mu-na-ab šu ḫe2-em-ri-ri-e  [a] /zid\-da-ta ri-a-na šu maḫ-a-ni si-bi2-ib  /uĝ3\ u2-sal-la ḫu-mu-un-de3-nu2 na-gada-bi ḫe2-a  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ke4 uĝ3 šar2-re us2 zid ḫe2-bi2-ib-dab5-be2
en: Inana, lady of heaven and of the broad earth, powerful ……, who radiates ……, who shines by night, who …… goes forth from ……, who is diffused wide over heaven and earth. …… may you make eminent …… Ur-Ninurta, …… who is the awe …… and the joy of his mother. …… may he lift his head high, and be their great wild bull. Make …… bow low for him ……, so that he may clamp down upon them. Deliver them into the exalted hands of him created from good seed. Under his rule may the people rest in meadows with him as their herdsman. May Ur-Ninurta make the numerous people follow the just path.
35. sa-ĝara.
Inana, may Ur-Ninurta prolong the days of his life in your sweet holy embrace.

akk: ^d-inana ur2 kug niĝ2 dug3-za ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ke4 nam-til3-la ud ḫa-ba-ni-ib-su3-ud-de3
en: 37. Its ĝisgiĝal.

akk: ĝiš-gi4-ĝal2-bi-im  nin me gal-gal-la nam-nir-ra šu du7  ^d-inana nin me gal-gal-la nam-nir-ra šu du7  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ra ḫe2-ĝal2 zi su3-ud-ĝal2 saĝ-e-eš mu-ni-rig7
en: Lady of the great divine powers, perfect in valour! Inana, lady of the great divine powers, perfect in valour! You have bestowed plenty and long-lasting life on Ur-Ninurta.
41. Its uru.
42. An adab of Inana.

akk: an nir-ĝal2 diĝir pa e3-a  an lugal-la nam gal tar-ra-ni  ^d-ur-<^d-nin-urta>-ra šu zid ḫu-mu-na-ab-ĝar
en: An the powerful, great among the gods, An the respected, brilliantly manifest god! In fixing a great fate for the king, An has laid his hand truly upon Ur-Ninurta.
5. barsud.

akk: bar-sud-am3  zag kur-kur-ra-še3 dili-ni dib  ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne saĝ keše2-bi na-nam  me gal-gal-la zag mu-ni-in-keše2  me šar2-ra ĝiri3-ni nam-mi-in-ĝar  diĝir gal-an-zu nun nam tar-re-de3  gu3 zid mu-na-an-de2 an-ne2 ^d-ur-<^d-nin-urta>-ra gu3 zid <mu-na-an-de2>  kalam-ma mu-ni-in-maḫ an-ne2 [^d-ur]-<^d-nin-urta> <mu-ni-in-maḫ>  ^ĝiš-gu-za nam-lugal-la ul-še3 suḫuš gen6-na  šibir maḫ^!- me kalam-ma ur4-ur4  ĝidru niĝ2-gen6-na uĝ3 šar2 laḫ5-laḫ5-e  ^d-ur-^d-nin-urta-ra mu-na-an-taḫ  an kug-ga ki nam tar-ra-ni  diĝir an-na ba-sug2-ge-eš-a  ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne ĝizzal ba-an-ak-eš
en: As he passes, alone, as far as the border of the foreign lands, he is indeed the guardian of the Anuna. He seizes all the great divine powers, and places his feet upon the numerous divine powers. The very wise god, the prince who decides destiny, has truly spoken to him; An has truly spoken to Ur-Ninurta. He has made him the mightiest in the Land; An has made Ur-Ninurta the mightiest in the Land. He has bestowed upon Ur-Ninurta a royal throne on a foundation established forever; the august shepherd's crook, which gathers up the divine powers of the Land; and a just sceptre which directs the numerous people. When holy An determines a destiny, the gods of heaven stand by and the Anuna pay attention.
20. šagbatuku.

akk: šag4-ba-tuku-am3  unken ĝar-ra-ba ḫe2-am3 ba-ni-in-ne-eš  iri du3-du3 a2-dam ki ĝar-ra  kur gam-e kalam suḫuš gen6-na  mu ḫe2-ĝal2 bal ud sud-da  ^d-ur-<^d-nin-urta>-ra mu-na-an-šum2
en: In their place of assembly, they said "Let it be so!" An gave to Ur-Ninurta the building of cities, the founding of settlements, the subduing of foreign lands, and the strengthening of the foundations of the Land of Sumer; years of plenty, and a reign of long days.
26. sa-gida.
