akk: [^d-]lugal-šubur^ki- /men\ edin-na nam-lugal-la [saĝ-ĝa2 ḫu-mu-ra-an-ĝal2]  [^d-]/en-ki-ke4\ [en] nam-til3-la nam-til3-la /ḫe2\-[eb-…]  e2-u6-nir e2 ĝiš-ḫur an ki-a me^?- /šar2\-[ra u5-a]  suḫ10 nam-en-na-zu ni2 [me]-lem4 ḫa-ra-/dul-e\  me nam-lugal-la pa e3 ḫa-ra-ab-ak-e  ĝiš-ḫur nam-en-na gi16-sa-še3 ḫu-mu-ra-ab-la2  mu7-mu7 nam-til3-la-kam mi2 zid ḫu-mu-ri-in-dug4 nam su3-ud-ĝal2 ḫa-ra-ab-taḫ-e  mu pad3-da-ni-gin7 mu pad3-da-zu su ^d-en-ki-ke4 ḫa-ba-ni-dug3  ĝeštug3 ĝizzal šu zid ḫa-ra-an-ĝa2-ĝa2  [niĝ2] /du-ri2\-še3 [nu]-ub-kur2-ru-gin7 mu nam-lugal-zu  a-a ^d-en-ki mu nam-til3-la-zu ḫa-ba-ni-sud-sud  kur-kur kilib-ba-bi nam-en-bi ḫa-ra-ab-rig7-ge  [^d-]ḫa-am-mu-ra-bi lugal-ĝu10
en: May Lugal-Šubur place on your head the desert crown of kingship! May Enki, the lord of life, …… life, and in the E-unir, the house of the plans of heaven and earth which rides upon all the divine powers, may he cover your priestly headdress in awe and splendour! May he make the divine powers of kingship resplendent for you, and fit you up forever with the plans appropriate to the rank of en priest! May he gently recite for you live-giving incantations, bestowing in addition a long-lived destiny; may the uttering of your name delight Enki as much as the uttering of his own name! May he reward you with wisdom and intelligence! May your royal name be as something unchangeable! May Father Enki prolong the years of your life, and may he grant you lordship over every one of the foreign lands. O Ḫammu-rābi, my king!

akk: ^d-en-ki-ke4 eš3-e ki^?- maḫ^?--a mi2 zid mu-ni-in-dug4  lugal-e lu2 šu-luḫ-e ki aĝ2 me sikil-la tum2-ma  lugal ĝiš-ḫur kal-kal gal-zu^?--a ni2-tuku inim sag9-sag9-ge šu-ni-še3 /ĝal2^?-\-la  sipad šag4 še-ga en ^d-nu-nam-/nir\-[ra] ki aĝ2 ama ^d-/nin\-[lil2-la2]  nidba gal-gal e2-kur-ra ba-[…]  X šag4 dug3-ga nun gal ^d-en-ki-ke4 X […]  mi2 dug4-ga kug ^d-dam-gal-/nun\-[na] sipad zid ^d-ḫa-am-/mu\-[ra-bi]
en: Enki has esteemed him truly in the shrine, the august place -- the king who loves purification rites and is well-suited to the pure divine powers, the king who is skilled in the precious plans, who is reverent, eloquent and deft , the shepherd, favourite of Lord Nunamnir and beloved of Mother Ninlil, who …… great food offerings in E-kur, who delights the great prince Enki, ……, who is cherished by holy Damgalnuna: the good shepherd Ḫammu-rābi.

akk: lugal-e eš3 e2-kiš-[nu-ĝal2] niĝ2-nam mi-ni-in-X […]  ḫa-am-mu-ra-bi X-a-ni X […]  ^d-nanna ^d-nin-gal-bi ud šu2-/uš\ […]  lugal niĝ2-ḫul2-la-ni X […] šu-luḫ ĝiš-ḫur me X […]  ki-bi-še3 bi2-in-[gi4-gi4]  ša-ra-da-gub-/bu^?-\ […] KA NI šu bur2^?--ra  šul^!- ^d-suen niĝ2  …] E še še-ga
en: The king has …… everything in the shrine E-kiš-nu-ĝal. Ḫammu-rābi, whose ……. Daily he …… Nanna and Ningal. The king whose joy is …… has restored the purification rites, plans and divine powers ……. He will stand there before you ……, O youth Suen, fulfilling …… all your requirements.

akk: /NAM\ X X X X IGI^?- X […] ni2-tuku nim-ma X […] X KU^?- u3-na E sa4 /en^?-\ […] šum2-mu-da-ab-ze2-en ^ĝiš-ĝidru […] kan4-diĝir-ra^ki- iri nam-en-na MU […] /lugal\ an ub-da dirig-ge-en-ze2-/en\ […]
en: 1 line fragmentary …… the reverent one, who takes care ……, 1 line fragmentary  "Give him the sceptre ……! …… the name of Babylon, the city of lordship! Make the king pre-eminent in the world ……!"
O Asarluḫi, …… destiny for my Ḫammu-rābi!

akk:
^d-asar-lu2-ḫi ḫa-am-mu-ra-bi-ĝu10-ur2 /nam\ […]
an ^d-en-lil2 ^d-en-ki e-ne-bi-da KA X […] šag4-ga-ne-ne-še3 u3-mu-ni-in-šum2 niĝ2 X […] diĝir gal-gal kilib3-ba-bi ^d-marduk-ra ḫul2-le-eš mu-/ni\-[…] sipad šag4-ga-zu nam-en kalam-ma ak-de3 mu-e-ni-/in\-[…] nam-a-ni gal-le-eš tar-re-en-ze2-en ka kug-za X […] inim-zu BA^?- AŠ-a ba-an-ši-ĝar-re-en-ze2-en sipad \
en: An, Enlil and Enki …… with him. When they had decided ……, all the great gods together …… joyfully to Marduk.  "You have …… the shepherd of your hearts to exercise the lordship in the Land. Determine his destiny grandly, …… with your holy mouths. Appoint …… your word …… for him, the indefatigable shepherd."

akk: lugal-ra im-mi-in-sa4-en-de3-en ub-ta 4-ba X X E NE^?- […] ḫa-am-mu-ra-bi nun me-te diĝir-re-e-ne sun5-na inim-me-eš2 MU […] ba-ra-šum2-mu-un-de3-en nam-barag saĝ gig2 mu-zu zag an […] nam-lu2-ulu3 kalam-ma sa2^?--sa2^?- TE ĝal2-la iri^?- […] X X X /ḫe2\-eb2-su3-ud bal-zu ma2-gur8 za-gin3 šu^?- ḫe2-[…] nam-sipad-zu an X (X) an ki^?- šu ḫe2-ge-en uĝ3-ĝa2 u2-sal-la […] za-pa-aĝ2-zu ^d-iškur šu X X […] /A\ dul lugal gaba-/ri\ [nu-tuku] ka-zu gira2^ra- ḫuš-a šu […] /TUKU\-TUKU sig igi-nim-ma […] šul ^d-utu a2-taḫ-zu ḫe2-a ki^?- NE^?- X (X X) AB inim-inim šag4-ge X […] du-ri2-še3 zag zid-da ĝen-na-zu ḫe2-na-nam igi il2-la-e ḫe2-/na\-[nam] X X KA-za la-ba-an-DIR er3-ra šu X dub^?--bi X X X […] /ḫa-am\-mu-ra-bi dug4-ga maḫ-me-eš2 nir ḫe2-ĝal2 a2 inim dug3-ga X […]
en: "We name him king in the four quarters of the world ……. Ḫammu-rābi, humble prince acceptable to the gods, …… our word, we grant you authority over the black-headed; may your name …… the limits of heaven ……! …… the inhabitants of the Land, keeping in order ……! May your reign endure ……, may it …… a shining barge! May your shepherding …… be firm, and may the people …… in the pastures! Peerless king, your roar of triumph is like Iškur, covering ……! Your mouth is the fiery god of fire, …… below and in the uplands ……. May youthful Utu be your helper, ……. May he always go at your right side and favour you. …… in your ……, Erra ……. Ḫammu-rābi, you should put your trust in our august commands, ……."

akk: /ḫa-am\-mu-ra-bi dug4-ga an ^d-/en-lil2\-bi KU an ki^?- šu an ub-da du3^?--a šu […]  X X (X)-ga NU X-aš an ^d-/en\-[lil2]-bi lugal-ra mu-na-X X X […]  ^d-asar-lu2-ḫi mu-ru-ub diĝir gal-gal-e-ne iri^?- [X X] X GA IM^?- […]  kan4-diĝir-ra^ki- iri ki-šu-peš5 ki-tuš sikil-la X X X GA^?- X X X […]  X X suḫuš barag gal ki-tuš maḫ ki aĝ2-e šag4 ḫul2-la PA nir-ĝal2 X […]  X X X TUR-TUR dumu-gir15 diĝir-re-e-ne mu lugal-la […]  […] X X zid-de3-eš ḫe2-a mu-na-ni-[…]  […] u3-mu-un-zig3-ge-eš nam-^d-en-lil2 uĝ3 šar2-/ra\ […]  […] nam-a-ni pa bi2-in-/ak\-eš zi kalam-/ma\ […]  [ḫa-am-mu-ra]-bi sipad silim-ma-ne2 mu-ni-gal-le-eš kilib3 saĝ /gig2\-[ga …]  […] X X lu2 ^d-en-ki^?--ke4 sag9-ga-ni kalam-ma X […]  […] X X X MU […]
en: Ḫammu-rābi …… the command of An and Enlil, …… of heaven and earth, …… throughout the world ……. An and Enlil …… to the king. Among the great gods, Asarluhi ……. In Babylon, the city, the precinct, the pure dwelling ……. …… foundation, the great dais, the beloved and august dwelling, in joy ……. …… the noble son of the gods, …… royal name, …… they firmly spoke their consent to him. When they ……, they …… the power of Enlil over the numerous people. …… they manifested his destiny, …… the life of the Land. They magnified Ḫammu-rābi, their benign shepherd, and …… over all the black-headed. …… him whom Enki has …… his favour in the Land, 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing
37 lines missing

akk: […] X […]  […] /saĝ\ an-še3 mi-[…-il2]  […] igi-ni-še3 X […]  […] mu-un-na-e-ḫul2-ḫul2 […]  […] gu2-da mu-ni-/in\-[la2 (X)]  X […] X-da-zu nam mu-ni-ib2-/tar\ [(X)]  X […] X-da-bi ḫe2-me-en nam-nun-bi ak-[de3]  [X X] /saĝ\-e-eš mi-ni-in-rig7-ga-zu ]  […] X GI ši-bi2-du7 ud-bi ḫa-ra-su3-[ud-de3]  nam tar-ra mu sa4-a-«mu»-me-en gaba gi na-an-[…-tuku]
en: 1 line fragmentary …… raised his head high. …… before him …… rejoiced at him. …… embraced him. Your …… has determined the destiny. May you be their ……, exercising lordship over them. May …… which has been bestowed on you never cease. You are well-suited for ……, and may its time be prolonged for you. A destiny has been determined for you and you have been called by name; may you have no rival!

akk: nin me maḫ šu du7-a nam-a-ni gal-bi /saĝ^?-\ […] ^d-inana nam-ĝuruš an ki-a an-ne2 ša-mu-na-an-[…]
en: Lady who perfects the august divine powers, …… his destiny grandly! O Inana, to whom An has …… manliness in heaven and earth!

akk: saĝ-kal diĝir-re-e-ne pa e3 nam-a-ni […] ^d-inana an ^d-en-lil2 e-ne-da nu ka-aš kalam-ma nu-[bar (X)] saĝ-kug-ĝal2 ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne nam-gur4 nam-[…] ^d-inana u3-sumun2 zid nun-gal-e-ne nir-ĝal2 nin-[e-ne …] nam-maḫ-zu an ki-še3 dalla e3-a me-zu me […] ka ba-zu dug4 an-na an mu-sa4 […] nam-diĝir-zu gu2-en-na zag dib-ba a-ra2 gal-/gal\ […] an-da uraš-a gi ba-an-šum2-mu-un ^d-en-lil2 X […]
en: Foremost among the gods, manifest, …… his destiny! Inana, without whom An and Enlil cannot make a decision in the Land, proud one among the Anuna gods, …… self-esteem and ……! Inana, good wild cow of the great princes, respected among ladies ……, your greatness shines forth to heaven and earth, your divine powers are …… powers. When you speak it is the command of An, …… named by An ……. Your divinity is pre-eminent in the throne-hall , your great ways are ……. With An, you give judgment on earth; with Enlil …….

akk: zi-ĝal2-ba nam-nin-bi mu-un-ak barag X […] ĝarza2 maḫ a2 aĝ2-ĝa2 eš3 abzu-a […]
en: You behave as a lady among living creatures, you …… the dais; you …… great ritual ordinances and commands in the abzu shrine.

akk: lugal za-da nu nam-sipad kalam-ma-še3 nu-/un\-[…] an ^d-en-lil2 dug4-ga-zu-ta lugal-ra igi […] dug4-ga-za an ki X /nin^?-\ […] nam mi-ni-ib2-tar-ra-zu an ^d-en-/lil2\ […] ḫa-am-mu-ra-bi lugal mi-ni-ib2-X […] ub-ta 4-ba a2 aĝ2-ĝa2-e X […] ud ma-dam mu ḫe2-ĝal2-la til3 […]
en: Without you, no king is …… as shepherd over the Land. An and Enlil …… at your command for the king. By your command, heaven and earth ……. An and Enlil …… the destiny which has been determined for you, Ḫammu-rābi, king ……. In the four quarters of the world …… the ordinances; …… a time of abundance, a year of plenty, …… life.
Ḫammu-rābi ……. unknown no. of lines missing

akk: muš3-me ḫuš ĝiri2 gal nam-ĝuruš-a  igi ḫul2-la saĝ-ki zalag-ga-na im-ma-ši-in-bar  nam sag9-ga-ni-še3 la-la ba-an-ši-in-ak  alan gun3-a-ni-še3 ḫi-li im-ma-ši-in-ti  bal-a-re-ni-še3 im-ma-an-ši-gub  ulutim2 kal-la-bi šag4 im-ma-ab-dab5-be2  šag4 gu2-bi gi4-a-na im-ma-ab-ni10-ni10-e  ^d-inana lugal-ra inim^e- mu-un-gun3-gun3^gu2-
en: The ruddy countenance, the great knife of masculinity, looked at him with joyful eye and shining brow. She conferred attractiveness on his beauty. She made charm approach the colourful statue. She erected the statue for him against the opposing side. She took its precious form to her heart . With overflowing heart, she ……. Inana blessed the king in words:

akk: u3-mu-un na-aĝ2-zu ze2-ba-am3 ki-ig  aĝ2 ku7-ku7-dam  sa-am-su-i-lu-na šuba2 gun3-a maš2 ĝiš  i-bi2  kar2-kam  igi-ĝu10-gin7 silim-ma  de3-gub  du-ri2-še3 til3-la   i-zi-iĝ3 aĝ2  KA-mu7-a asila  da-ra-ab-sig9   uĝ3 gu2-re-a ḫub2 dar  du5-mu-ra-an-ak   sa-am-su-i-lu-na a2-ĝal2 za-a-kam uĝ3 šar2-ra en-e  mu-uš meš3 sag9-ga-zu i3-me-en nam-en-nu-uĝ3 mu-ak-e-en
en: "Lord, your destiny is a good one, and will delight the beloved. Samsu-ilūna, to choose the colourful ……, I will establish, benevolently according to my sight, and lasting for ever, and will fix for you a joyous celebration of incantation rituals . I will fight off the people of the other side for you. Samsu-ilūna, it is your power to possess strength, lord of all people! You are …… your handsome hero, you keep watch."

akk: zag «nam» lugal-la-ka ul-še3 gub-bu-da-ni  uĝ3 nam-lugal-la-še3 nam dug3 mu-un-tar  ur gal ^d-alad2 ^d-lamma mu-ne-en-šum2  an-ta-ne-ne a2-ĝal2 ak-de3  bal-a-re gu2-re ḫub2 dar ak-de3  ^d-inana a2 zid-da ba-an-da-gub  gab2-bu-ne-ne-a sa-am-su-i-lu-na ba-gub
en: Standing joyfully beside the king, she granted a good destiny to the people for the sake of the king. She gave them great beasts, and male and female protective deities, to make their companions powerful, and to send running those on that side, on the opposing side. Inana took up her position at the right-hand side, while Samsu-ilūna stood at their left-hand.

akk: sila3 ga kug-sig17   en3-du  aĝ2  KA-mu7-a mu-un-ku7-ku7-de3-ne  bal-a-re gu2-re mu-un-ti-ti-ne
en: They played with golden jugs of milk; they made sweet the songs of incantation . They tormented those on the opposing side, the other side.

akk: me-en-de3-en  ga-ša-an-an-na  ^d-lamma sag9-ga-me  ildum2 il2-la sa-am-su-i-lu-na me-en-de3-en  me-en-ze2-en bal-a-re zi-in-BU-ka-ke4   [i]-zi-iĝ3 aĝ2  KA-mu7-a la-ba-an-du7 pi-li-pi-li  da-mu-ra-ab-šid   šag4 la2-la2 alan nu-un-ki-zil2-zil2-i  nu-ma-al
en: "We are the beneficent protective goddesses of Inana. We are the raised band of Samsu-ilūna. You are on the opposing side ……. The celebration of incantation rituals is not perfect. I will recite a pilipili." …… statue …… is not. unknown no. of lines missing

akk: zi […]  zi […]  zi X […]  mu-za […]  til3 kug […]  ^d-en-ki an […]  nun sa-am-su-i-[lu-na] […]  me-lem4 daĝal-/še3\ [dul-la …]  ^ĝiš-gu-za-[zu] ^d-en-ki-/ke4\ […]  ĝidru mu ud su3-ra2 saĝ-e-eš […-rig7]  /aga\-zu ^d-utu-gin7 […] ḫe2-[…]
en: unknown no. of lines missing Life ……. Life ……. Life ……. …… of your name ……. …… holy life ……. Enki ……. Prince Samsu-iluna, ……. …… terrifying splendour which spreads far and wide. Enki …… your throne, and …… bestow on you a sceptre of long years and days; may he …… your crown …… like Utu.

akk: /nam\-lugal-/zu\ an ki-gin7 ḫe2-/ge\-[en]  ma-da uĝ3 lu-a lugal-[bi] ḫe2-[me-en]  uĝ3-e sipad zid-bi ḫe2-[me-en]  uĝ3 dur2-ru-na-bi na-/gada\-bi ḫe2-[me-en]  ^d-utu-gin7 di gen6-na [dab5]-be2-da-zu-[ne]  X X X šar2-ra niĝ2^?--gen6 mu sa4 X X X X […]  sa-am-su-i-lu-na lugal inim sag9-sag9-ge ^d-utu-/kam\-[me]-/en\  lugal-e-ne saĝ-kal-/bi\ ḫe2-me-en
en: May your kingship be as stable as heaven and earth! You are king of numerous lands and peoples! You are the people's good shepherd! You are the herdsman of the settled people! When like Utu you impart just verdicts, …… justice, …… you call by name ……, then you, Samsu-iluna, shall be the king of the eloquent words of Utu, and you shall be the foremost of kings.

akk: kur gu2-erim2-ĝal2-la-zu ud /ḫuš-gin7\ du7-zu-[ne]  lugal gu2 an-še3 ḫe2-ni-zig3  sa-am-su-i-lu-na gu2 an-še3 ḫe-ni-zig3  kan4-diĝir-ra^ki- iri me ^d-suen-na-ka nam-/gal-zu\ ud-gin7 pa ḫe2-ni-ib2-e3  ^d-marduk diĝir saĝ du3-zu /gu2\-en nun-e-ne-/ka\ saĝ-zu ḫe2-eb2-il2-/le\  ki me3 šen-šen ĝiš-ĝiš-/la2\-[a]-/ka\ da-za   a2-taḫ ^ĝiš-tukul-zu ḫe2-[me] ud su3-ra2-še3 ḫe2-ba-e-/dirig-ga^?-\  an lugal diĝir-re-e-/ne\-[ke4] zi-zu^?- ud su3-ra2-še3 /ḫe2\-[me]-da-ĝal2  ^d-en-lil2 lugal kur-kur-[ra]-/ke4^?-\ inim-zu ge-en-na inim^?--zu ḫa-ba-ab-dugud  ^d-inana nin gal an-[na-ke4] inim kug-ga-ni-a ḫe2-bi2-ib2-ḫa-za  [^d-en-ki]-/ke4\ uĝ3 šar2-[ra šu]-zu-še3^!- ḫu^!--mu-un-ĝal2  [^d-asari] ensi2 gal /abzu kur^?-\-kur kilib-ba na de5 ba-X-a nir-ĝal2 eridug^ki--ga  diĝir X-ra-na kilib3-ĝal2 X [X]-e-ne-ke4 mu dug3-ga ḫe2-bi2-ib2-sa4 a2 nun gal-zu ḫe2-a
en: When like a raging storm you batter the foreign lands that are hostile to you, may your head be raised high, O king; may your head be raised high, O Samsu-iluna! In Babylon, the city of the divine powers of Suen, may you let your cleverness shine like the sun! May Marduk, the god who created you, lift your head high in the midst of lords and princes! On the field of battle, of mêlée and conflict, may he never stray from your side! May he be your helper with weapons, may he cause you to excel until distant days! May An, king of the gods, make your life last until distant days! May Enlil, king of the foreign lands, who confirms your words, make your words weighty! May Inana, the great queen of heaven, grasp you firmly with her holy word! May Enki deliver numerous people into your hands! May Asari, the great ruler of the abzu, who provides advice for all the foreign lands, the lordly one of Eridug, the god who in his …… calls all the …… with a good name -- may he be your great princely strength!

akk: ^d-namma ama e2-e X […] ki ama kalam-ma-ka ka-za a ḫe2-ĝa2-ĝa2  ^d-dam-gal-nun-na /nin gal\ eridug^ki--ga ki-nu2 dug3 ul-le-eš sizkur2-re-da-ni  mu-la2 ḫi-a […]-ma dam-bi nu-til-e  ud ḫe2-ĝal2-la ud šu^?--a […] /mu\-ni-[(X)]-/bur2\-ra sag9-ga  ki nitalam-a-[ni-ta] /šudu3^!- ḫa\-mu-ra-ab-be2  diĝir gub-ba ^d-lamma /abzu\ lu2 inim-ĝar sag9-ga-zu ḫe2-a AB-e X X-a ud da-ri2-še3  sa-am-su-i-lu-na lugal-ĝu10
en: May Namma, the mother who …… the house, place water in your mouth at the …… of the Land! May Damgalnuna, the great lady of Eridug, when she intercedes joyfully in the good bedchamber, 1 line unclear pray on your behalf for days of plenty and days …… from her husband. May the …… deity, the protective goddess of the abzu, be your source of good omens …… for ever and ever! O Samsu-iluna, my king!

akk: en-e ^ĝiš-gu-za barag maḫ-a dur2 ĝar-ra-zu-ne  ki-tuš nam-lugal-zu ḫa-ba-gen6-ne2  sa-am-su-i-lu-na ^ĝiš-gu-za barag maḫ-a dur2 ĝar-ra-zu-ne  ki-tuš nam-lugal-zu ḫa-ba-gen6-ne2  /šibir^?-\ nam-en-na dab5-a-zu-ne  ^ĝiš-gu-za-zu /suḫuš\-bi ḫe2-ge-en  ki kug ki sikil-la /ni2^?-\ mu2-mu2-da-zu-ne  me nam-nun-na šu gal-bi ḫe2-ni-du7  barag kug nam-lugal-/ke4^?-\ [X] X-ne-da-zu-ne  nam-nir-ĝal2-la gu2 an-še3 ḫe2-ni-zig3
en: Lord, may you confirm your royal position by taking your seat on the throne, the lofty dais! Samsu-iluna, may you confirm your royal position by taking your seat on the throne, the lofty dais! May you strengthen the foundations of your throne by grasping the shepherd's crook of lordship! May you bring to perfect completion the princely divine powers by inspiring awe in the holy place, the pure place! When you …… on the holy royal dais, may you lift your head high in a lordly manner!

akk: me-lem4 nam-lugal-la mu4-mu4-da-zu-ne ud-gin7^!- mul-mul X X X X X  me maḫ me gal-/gal\-la šu du7-a-zu-ne  ni2 gal nam-lugal-/la-ka\ tug2-ba13-gin7 ḫe2-/en6\-mur10  ud zalag-ga-gin7 dalla e3-a-zu-ne  an-e ^d-en-lil2-bi nam gal ḫa-ra-ab-tar-re-ne  ^d-nanna-gin7 kalam-še3 e3-a-zu-ne  nun gal ^d-en-ki-ke4 šag4 gu2-bi gi4-a-na šudu3^!- ḫu-mu-ri-ib2-ša4
en: When you are imbued with the terrifying splendour of royalty, …… shining like the sun! When you perfectly wield the august divine powers, the great divine powers, may you be cloaked as if with a mantle in the great awesomeness of royalty! When you come forth in brilliance like the shining day, may An and Enlil determine a great destiny for you! When you appear like Nanna over the Land, may the great prince Enki pray on your behalf in his overflowing heart!

akk: aga-zu ^d-utu-gin7 kalam-ma ḫe2-eb-zalag-ge  ^ĝiš-ĝidru-zu uĝ3 šar2-ra   ^d-suen-e zi-ĝal2 ḫe2-ni-ib-laḫ4-laḫ4-e  šibir-zu ki-en-gi ki-uri ḫe2-ni-ib-/tum2\ ama [a-a]-/bi\-gin7  uĝ3 daĝal-la uĝ3 gu3 [teš2-a sig10]-/ga-zu\  ma2-gur8 an-na-gin7 zalag-ga-zu-še3 giri17 šu ḫa-[ra-ab-ĝal2-le]  kur ni2-ba tuš-a diĝir-bi [ḫe2-me-en]
en: May your headdress sparkle over the Land like Utu! May your sceptre correctly guide the numerous people! May Suen let you control the living beings! With your shepherd's crook may you lead Sumer and Akkad as if you were their mother and father! May the widespread people, the people whom you have united, pray to you as you shine like the Barge of Heaven! May you be the god of the foreign lands that are settled together!

akk: ^d-utu-gin7 e3-a-zu-še3 asila^?- X […]  ama a-a ugu-bi-gin7 igi-bi […-ĝal2]  u2-gu7 daĝal-la-zu-še3 zi-bi […]  a naĝ ḫe2-ĝal2-la-zu-še3 X […]  uĝ3 saĝ gig2-ga […]  ĝissu-zu-uš /ni2\ […-te-en-te-en]  nam-sipad-zu […]  [X] X X X X […]  […] /ḫe2\-i-i  [… nam]-/lugal\-la ud da-ri2-še3 ḫe2-eb-ge-en  […] X-me-en  […]-me-en  […] /dadag\-ga-me-en  sa-am-su-i-lu-na lugal-ĝu10
en: When you come forth like Utu, joy ……, and their gaze is fixed as if on their own parents. When you feed them lavishly, may their lives ……! When you generously give them drink, ……! May the black-headed people …… cool themselves in your shade! Your shepherdship ……. 1 line fragmentary 2 lines missing May …… be praised! May your royal …… be forever stable! May you be ……! May you be ……! May you shine ……! O Samsu-iluna, my king!
He causes brilliance, he …… from his holy heart. unknown no. of lines missing

akk: [X X] X-ĝu10 mu gi16-sa saĝ il2-la me-te nam-nun-na  [X X] X niĝ2-si-sa2 niĝ2-gen6-e ki aĝ2-e  […] X-e mu maḫ sa4-a  [^d-en]-lil2-le X X nam gal tar X-a  ^d-nin-lil2-le X […]  ^d-nin-urta kalag-<ga> a2-taḫ-zu i3-me-a  ^d-nuska sukkal-maḫ ^d-en-lil2-la2 kingal kur-kur-ra  e2-kur-ra ad-da saĝ e2-gal-la-zu i3-me-a  nam-til3-la gu2 an-še3 ḫe2-ni-zig3  nam-nun-na saĝ an-še3 ḫe2-ni-il2  sa-am-su-i-lu-na me-te nam-nun-na  nam-til3-la ud-bi su3-ud-ba-ni-ib
en: My …… of eternal fame, head lifted high in princely worth, …… who loves righteousness and truth, …… named with an august name, for whom Enlil …… has determined a great destiny, and Ninlil ……! The valiant Ninurta is your helper. In the E-kur, Nuska the august minister of Enlil, the assembly leader of all lands, is your foremost palace superintendent. Throughout your life, may you carry your neck high; in princely manner may you lift your head high! -- Prolong the days of his life for Samsu-iluna, of princely worth!

akk: igi sag9-ga an lugal diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4 ḫe2-e-ši-bar  an gal maḫ a-a diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4  aga su-lim si maḫ gal gur3-ru  ^ĝiš-gu-za nam-lugal-la pa mul-bi daĝal-la an-gin7 DU X  PA ka-aš bar [X] X X X   saĝ gig2 zi-ĝal2 a-na lu-a u2-a-še3 laḫ5-laḫ5-e  ud til3-la su3-ra2-še3 saĝ-e-eš ḫu-mu-<ni>-in-rig7  ^d-en-lil2 X X lugal kur-kur-ra-ke4  niĝ2-dug4-ga [(X X)] a2 bad-a-zu ḫe2-ri-DU  iri ma-da-za ḫu-mu-ra-ab-X  suḫuš ma-da ḫu-mu-ra-ab-gen6-ne2  ^d-nin-lil2 nin diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4  šag4 ḫul2-la-ni-ta ḫe2-mu-e-ši-ib2-RI  saĝ-ki zalag-ga-na igi ḫu-mu-ri-gub  ki ^d-en-lil2-la2-ta ad gi4-gi4-/da^?-\ X  ki SI X / [(X)]  inim sag9-sag9-ga X UŠ ḫe2-X
en: May An, king of the gods, look upon you favourably; the great and august An, the father of the gods, he with the splendid crown, full of great and august radiance, …… your royal throne whose branches and sprouts …… as wide as the sky. May he bestow upon you, during the days of your long life, the power to make decisions ……, to direct ……, to serve as the provider of the black-headed creatures in all their multitude! May Enlil, ……, the king of all countries, protect you …… command. May he …… for you the city of your country. May he make firm for you the foundation of your country. May Ninlil, the queen of deities, joyfully …… for you, and may she look upon you with shining face; may she who takes counsel …… with Enlil, and who cares for ……, …… her favourable word.

akk: ^d-nin-urta ur-saĝ kalag-ga ^d-en-lil2-la2-ke4  en eš-bar an ^d-en-lil2-gin7 dug4-ga maḫ-a-ni dugud-da  nam-nir-ĝal2 me-lem4 nam-ur-saĝ gaba-ĝal2 lu2-u ru-gu2  iri gu2 du3-a-zu zar-gin7 ḫa-ra-ab-sal-e  erim2-ĝal2-zu šu-zu-še3 ḫe2-bi2-ib-si-si  ^d-nuska sukkal-maḫ ^d-en-lil2-la2-ke4  kadra-zu šeg12 e2-kur-ra-še3 ḫul2-la ḫe-ni-ib-ku4-/ku4\  saĝ-ki zalag-ga ^d-en-lil2 ^d-nin-<lil2>-la2-ke4 an-ta ḫe2-bi2-ib-gi4-gi4-in  kan4-diĝir-ra^ki- iri ur-saĝ-e-ne-ka  nam-lugal-zu suḫuš-bi ḫa-ra-ab-gen6-ne2  inim maḫ dug4-ga X ^d-en-lil2 X […]  […] X lugal-bi ḫe2-a  […] X X ki ḫa-ra-ab-sa2-sa2  […] X X AN ud-gin7 an kug-ga itid-da u3-tud-/da\  […] X X-e nam-til3-da gurun gibil-gin7 /ḫe2\-en-da-mu2-mu2  [sa-am]-/su\-i-lu-na lugal-ĝu10
en: May Ninurta, the strong warrior of Enlil, the lord of decisions, whose august commands are as weighty as those of An and Enlil, he of lordly character, terrifying splendour and heroism, who resists the forceful, the strong shepherd who crushes the evil and wicked -- may he spread out in heaps for you the inhabitants of the cities which you hate, and may he deliver your enemies into your hands! May Nuska, the august minister of Enlil, let you enter brick-built E-kur joyfully with your offerings, and escort you before the shining faces of Enlil and Ninlil; in Babylon, the city of heroes, may he make firm for you the foundation of your kingship. The august command …… Enlil ……. ……, may …… be their king! ……, may he …… a place for you! ……, like the light born monthly in the pure sky. ……, and may you too grow throughout your life like a fresh fruit, O Samsu-iluna, my king!

akk: lugal palil an-na šag4 kug-ge pad3-da  sa-am-su-i-lu-na lugal palil an-na šag4 kug-ge pad3-da  TI NI BAL ga-ar-za UM MU-MU DI maḫ-ḫa  KAL ZU^?- ša ḫu-la saĝ-be2-eš ḫa-pa-DU saĝ us2-sa-a  ^ĝiš-gu-za kug-sig17 ĝar-ra DI nam-lugal-la(source: ĝu10) saĝ il5-la  šag4-bi^?- a2 nam-ur-saĝ-ĝa2-ki^!--im maḫ-bi tuš-ša-a  sa-am-su-i-lu-na lugal kalag-ga an-ne2 di-/kud\ maḫ an-ne2 nam gal mu-re-tar  aga gen6-na ti-il5-la mu-ra-ni-in-zal
en: O king, foremost one of An, chosen in his holy heart, Samsu-iluna, king, foremost one of An, chosen in his holy heart, …… rites …… august, ……, joyful, supreme, assiduous, with head high on the gold-decorated throne of …… kingship, who sits majestically …… in its midst in heroic strength, Samsu-iluna: An, the mighty king of heaven, the august judge, has assigned you a great destiny, and has made you to pass your life with a secure crown.

akk: lu2 ^d-en-lil2^!- NAM GUR A^?- IR EŠ ŠI nam-sipad uĝ3 da-ga-an-ni-ši mu-un-na-šum2-ma-daḫ  sipad kiĝ2^?- nibru^ki- saĝ us2 e2-kur-ra  engar gen6-na e2 ^d-a-sa-lim-a-ka-am  niĝ2-nam nu-si-li-ge18 e2-saĝ-il5-la-ak-ki-im  ^d-en-lil2 me nam-sipad-zu kalam-ma ak-ka kur ĝiri3-zu-uš mu-ĝar  še-ga ^d-utu-ke4 kiĝ2^?- ^d-inana-ke4  sa-am-su-i-lu-na lugal nam nu-ug-ru ^d-en-lil2 lugal-ĝa2-ta  inim dug4-ga ^d-en-lil2 ^d-en-ki-ka3-ta u2 ^d-a-sa-lim ^d-za-ba-ba ^d-lugal-gu2-du3-a lugal e2^!--a mu-du3-a  [X] X X X /kur\ ki-bal GU2 LU DI X […] X  /^d-iškur^?-\ sa kur-kur-[ra …]  kur-kur-re me-te-eš ḫe-i kalag-ga si-ig X X pa3 mu-na-<e3>  sa-am-su-i-lu-na mu-u2-a sa3 nir-ĝal2 kalam-ma-an-ni  gal-zu ka-aš pa-ar kalam-me /  sa-am-su-i-lu-na gu2 ^id2-idigna gu2 ^id2-bur-na gu2 a-a-ba^?--aš-ši DU gu da-a-bi-ša2 lu2 mu-na-a-IGI  e2-kur-re e2 ^d-en-lil2-la2-ta NI IGI pa-la-ak šag4 ḫu-la-ka-ni^?- mu-un-ni-tuš  ^d-en-lil2-la2 za-am-me-en-zu dug3-ga  ^d-en-lil2 lugal-ĝu10 nam zal-ga mu nam-til3-la šu-mu  zi u2 su-ud-ĝa2-al niĝ2-ba-aš-ši-i ba-am-ma
en: He is the man to whom Enlil has given …… and the shepherdship over the widespread people, the beloved shepherd of Nibru, the constant servant of E-kur; he is the trustworthy farmer of the house of Asalim, who takes care that provisions do not cease in E-saĝ-ila. For you to exercise your divine powers of shepherdship in the Land, Enlil has placed the foreign lands at your feet. Obedient to Utu, beloved of Inana, Samsu-iluna, the king whose fate is never altered by Enlil, my king, at the command uttered by Enlil, Enki and Asalim, Zababa, Lugal-gu-dua, the king who builds temples, …… the rebel lands …… unknown no. of lines missing

Iškur, the net of the foreign lands …… made the foreign countries praise him duly, and made the mighty …… manifest. Samsu-iluna, the good hero, lordly one of his Land, has wisely co-ordinated decisions for the Land. From the banks of the Tigris and the banks of the Euphrates, to the shores of the sea …… and the banks of its rivers, men …… Samsu-iluna. In E-kur, the house of Enlil, …… he has taken his seat on his dais of joy. Enlil, it is sweet to praise you. Enlil, give my king a brilliant destiny and years of life! Grant him as a gift a life of long days!

akk: ^d-en-<ki> ^d-a-sa-lim u3 diĝir-dumu eridug^ki--ga^!-  (e2-a ^d-marduk u3 ^d-a-sa-lu-ḫa)  diĝir gal-gal-e-ne šu-du-um mu-un-na-an-/ša^?-\   šag4-bi^!- an^!--na nam-ur-saĝ-ĝa2-ak-ka-ni maḫ-bi su-uš-a  (a-na i-di qar-ra-du-ti-ka ṣi-ri-iš lu-u2 wa-aš-ba-a-ti sa-am-su-i-lu-na LUGAL ši-in-nu-u2)  lugal urim2^ki--ma lugal larsam^ki--ma  lugal ki-en6-ĝi6 ĝi6-u2-ri-ke4
en: He greeted {Enki, Asalim and the son of Eridug} { Ea, Marduk and Asalluḫa}, the great gods, {while sitting majestically on the golden throne of kingship with head high in heroic strength in its midst} { on your golden throne of kingship, whose head is raised high in the strength of your heroism, may you sit majestically, Samsu-ilūna, double king}, the king of Urim and king of Larsam, the king of Sumer and Akkad.

akk: /zi\-na ni-da-ba SI GA^?- X e2-kur-še3 nam-ku4-u2
en: …… offerings ……, he brought them into E-kur.

en: In the E-kur, the house of Enlil, Samsu-ilūna, the mighty king {whose …… awesomeness covers all people} { whose splendour covers all people} {1 line unclear} { reach ……} 3 lines fragmentary

en: {1 line fragmentary} { by saving …….} The foreign lands …… {has wisely made decisions } { ……; who has inflicted defeat …… on all hostile lands}. {Samsu-ilūna, the good hero, lordly one of his Land} { Samsu-ilūna, the good hero, lordly one of his land}! O Samsu-ilūna, it is sweet to praise you!

akk: lugal me an ki-bi-da-ke4 ab-ur4-ra dumu saĝ-kal ^d-en-ki-ke4  ^d-marduk en er9-ra ur-saĝ šag4 1(AŠ)-ša4 palil ^d-nun-gal-e-ne  a2-ĝal2 ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne diĝir gal-gal-e-ne gen6 eš-bar ab-šum2-šum2-mu-a  nun gal šag4-bal-bal an kug-ga-ke4 en nam tar-tar dab-ba niĝ2-nam-ma  gal-an-zu šag4-zu maḫ nam-diĝir-bi pa e3-a saĝ  igi im-bar-ra-ke4  pa-bil2-ga-zu an lugal diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4 nam-en-zu an ki um^?--ma-na-bi ib2-ta-an-ĝal2
en: King who gathers up the divine powers of heaven and earth, foremost son of Enki, Marduk, mighty lord, perfect hero, foremost of the Great Princes , strong one of the Anuna, the great gods who have given him justice and judgment! Great prince, descendant of holy An, lord who decides destinies, who has everything in his grasp , wise, august knower of hearts, whose divinity is manifest, who shows concern for all that he looks upon! Your ancestor An, king of the gods, has made your lordship effective against the armies of heaven and earth.

akk: a2 aĝ2-ĝa2 gal maḫ an ki-bi-da-ke4 saĝ /keše2-da\-bi [ma]-ra-an-šum2 šibir kur-kur-ra gamx(GURUN)-ma šu ḫe2-em-/mi-la2-am3\  diĝir gal-gal-e-ne ib2-dirig-ga ĝidru lugal ĝarza diĝir-re-e-ne  mu-ra-an-taḫ  ^d-en-lil2-le nam-lugal kiš^!- an ki-bi-da-ke4 nam-še3 mu-ni-in-tar zag ša4 la-ba-an-tuku  ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne mi-ri-ib2-gu-ul nam-mu-ru6-na ak-de3 mu-ra-an-šum2
en: He has given you the supervision of great august commands of heaven and earth, he has bound to your hand the shepherd's crook that curbs the foreign lands, he has made you excel among the great gods, and in addition has given you, to control them, the royal sceptre and the ritual ordinances of the gods. Enlil has fixed as your destiny kingship over the totality of heaven and earth and has relieved you of any rivals; he has made you eminent among the Anuna, and has bestowed on you the exercise of domination.
11. 1st kirugu.
Marduk, in all quarters of the heavens they have made shine forth like Utu the lordship of prince Abī-Ešuḫ, the beloved son of your heart, and have relieved him of any rivals.

akk: ^d-marduk nun a-bi-e2-šu-uḫ dumu ki aĝ2 šag4-zu-ke4 nam-en-bi ^d-utu-gin7 an ub-ta pa e3 ḫa-ba-ak-eš zag ša4 nu-un-tuku-tuku
en: 13. Ĝišgiĝal.

The lordship of the hero standing in all his strength upon this august pedestal is indeed eminent in heaven and earth. The lordship of Marduk standing in all his strength upon this august pedestal, is indeed eminent in heaven and earth.

en: On a shining day may …… for you! On a bright day may your heart ……! The bright day when Utu the judge ……. …… his pleasure, his fulfilment. …… the staff of An, in heaven and earth. …… Marduk ……. approx. 4 lines missing

en: There ……. 2 lines fragmentary Before Utu and Nanše ……. Before Abī-Ešuḫ ……. 1 line unclear …… your divinity ……. …… your lot. The door …… to the house ……. …… day and night ……. …… from the mouth, its tongue ……. Your personal god …… like life. Your protective goddess …… life. …… life …… prayer.

en: In those days, in those far-off years …… The holy hand …… his protective goddess ……. Nisaba, the lady of Ereš, ……. …… a jar in which there was barley. Walking …… …… on roads and routes ……. …… words which he had uttered, ways ……. …… a hired worker, like a midwife, a female weaver ……. …… who spoke to Utu ……, …… who spoke to Nanna ……. He who enters a house ……. …… small and great ……. …… sitting on his chair, lying on his bed, 1 line unclear …… your ways, your personal god …… …… years of life, months of peace in a place of contentment.

akk: ^d-marduk ḫe2-til3-e X-la ḫe2-ri-ib-si-si nam-til3-zu ^d-marduk ḫe2-eb2-be2 nam-til3-la-zu ḫe2-ri-ib-sud-dam [ud] /du\-ru-še3 ḫe2-ri-ib-tuku-a ḫe2-til3-la ḫe2-silim-ma gi16-sa-aš ḫe2-a ĝiš-šub-ba-zu nam-til3-la ḫe2-a nam-til3 šag4 dug3-ga ḫa-la-zu ḫe2-a ud nu2-a ma-mu2-zu ḫe2-en-sag9 zig3-ga-am3 inim-ĝar-zu ḫe2-en-sag9 ki ĝiri3 gub-ba-zu silim-ma ḫe2-ni-ib2-gen6
en: May Marduk grant life! May he make your …… full! May Marduk decree life for you! May he prolong your life, and may he let you keep it for everlasting days! May you live, and may you have peace! May it last forever! May life be your lot, and may a life of contentment be your share! When you lie down to sleep, may your dreams be propitious, and when you rise, may your omens be favourable! Wherever you walk, may you be established in peace!

akk: /til3\-la lugal-ĝu10 igi an-ne2 a-a diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4 sag9-ga  [X] lugal-zu kalam-ma ḫe2-ri-ib-il2^?--e  [X] X ^ĝiš-gu-za-zu su3-u4-ra2-še3 ḫu-mu-un-X X  /KA^?-\ X /gi16\-sa-aš ḫe2-a  <ĝiš-šub-ba-zu nam-til3-la ḫe2-a>  ^d-a-a KA nam-til3-la X […] a2-zu […]  ka-ta gub-ba nam-til3 ḫa-ba-rig7  ḫe2-til3-la ḫe2-silim-ma gi16-sa-aš ḫe2-a  ĝiš-šub-ba-zu nam-til3-la ḫe2-a  nam-til3 šag4 dug3-ga ḫa-la-zu ḫe2-a  ud nu2-a ma-mu2-zu ḫe2-en-sag9  zig3-ga-am3 inim-ĝar-zu ḫe2-en-sag9  ki ĝiri3 gub-ba-zu silim-ma ḫe2-ni-ib2-/gen6\  ud du-ru-še3 ḫe2-til3 X […]
en: May the life of my king be pleasant in the eyes of An, father of the gods! May he let you wear your royal …… in the Land! May your …… throne be …… until distant days! ……, may it last forever, and may life be your lot! May Aya …… life, …… your strength! 1 line unclear May it be your lot to be a god, eating food and {…… peaceful water} { drinking water ……} of long life! May a divine command bestow life on you! May you live, and may you have peace! May it last forever and may life be your lot! May a life of contentment be your share! When you lie down to sleep, may your dreams be propitious, and when you rise, may your omens be favourable! Wherever you walk, may you be established in peace! May you live for everlasting days ……!

akk: ^d-nibru<^ki-> iri diĝir-re-/e-ne\ me /saĝ\-[e-eš2 rig7 (…)]  ^d-nu-nam-nir kur(source: LU2?) gal en an ki-da /gu\ [la2 (…)]  lugal-ĝu10 sipad saĝ gig2-ga šag4-ta […]  sa2 pad3-de3 me nam-^d-en-lil2-la2 šibir /AN\ […]  ^d-en-lil2 dug4-ga-zu /lugal^?-\-e /šu\ KA A […]
en: Nibru, the city where the divine powers are presented to the gods ……. Nunamnir, the Great Mountain, the lord who embraces heaven and earth ……. My king, the shepherd of the black-headed people already in the womb ……. Adviser, who …… the divine powers of a supreme deity and the shepherd's crook ……. Enlil, your orders …… by the king.
Say to my lord: this is what Aradĝu, your servant, says:

akk: kur su-bir4^ki--še3 ḫar-ra-an kaskal-la   gun2 ma-da ge-en-gen6-ne2-de3  a-ra2 ma-da zu-zu-de3  ugu a-pi-il-la-ša gal-zu unken-na-še3  ad gi4-gi4-de3 gu3 teš2-a sig10-ge5-de3  KA ud-da-ka-ne-ne-a ḫe2-em-tum3 a2-še3 mu-e-da-a-aĝ2
en: You instructed me, as I was taking the direct route to Subir, to secure your provincial taxes, to inform myself precisely as to the state of the territory, and to ensure its obedience by taking counsel with Apillaša, the 'Sage of the Assembly', so that he could thus return the people of Subir to their customary way of speaking .
But when I arrived at the palace gate, no one enquired after the well-being of my lord. No one rose from their seat before me, or bowed down. { They intimidated me.}

akk: e2 kaskal-la-zu ga-rig2-ak ^urud-šukur kug-sig17 kug-babbar  ^na4-gug ^na4-za-gin3 ĝar-ra-ta a-ab-du3-du3-a 30 sar-am3 i-ib2-KU  ^ĝiš-gu-za barag ^tug2-šutur-e ri-a i-ib2-tuš  ^ĝiš-ĝiri3-gub kug-sig17-ka ĝiri3-ni i-ib2-ĝar  ĝiri3-ni na-ma-ta-an-kur2
en: {When I came nearer} { …… carries ……} -- well, your wayside hostel where carding-combs and lances inlaid with gold, silver, cornelian and lapis lazuli have been set up, covers an area of one hectare! Apillaša himself is decked out in {gold and lapis lazuli} { lapis lazuli, gold, silver and cornelian}, and he sits on a raised throne furnished with a rich raiment. His feet rest upon a golden footstool. He would not remove his feet in my presence!

akk: aga-us2 saĝ-ĝa2-na 5 li-mu-um-ta-am3 zid-da gab2-bu-na ib2-ta-an-gub-bu-uš  šu-luḫ lugal-ĝa2-ke4 sa2 bi2-in-dug4
en: To his right and left he had …… soldiers stationed, five thousand at each side. He placed at their disposal six fattened oxen and {60} { 20} fattened {sheep} { rams} for a meal. He assumed the right to perform my lord's lustration rites.

akk: kan4-na  lu2 na-ma-ši-in-kur9-re-en  ku4-ku4-da-ĝu10-ne  ^ĝiš-gu-za gar3^?--ba kug-sig17 ḫuš-a ĝar-ra lu2 ma-an-de6 tuš-a ma-an-dug4  a2 aĝ2-ĝa2 lugal-ĝa2-ke4 i3-gub-be2-en nu-tuš-u3-de3-en bi2-dug4
en: After a close interrogation at the gate, nobody even bade me enter. When I finally entered, someone brought me a throne with studs plated with red gold and told me: "Sit down!" I replied: "I am here to present the instructions of my king. Therefore I will not sit down!""

akk: nu-kar2-kar2-de3 aga-us2 lugal-ĝa2-ke4 ^ĝiš-banšur-ĝu10 in-bal-a-še3  ni2 ba-da-te su ba-da-zig3
en: They brought me {two fattened oxen} { one fattened ox} and {20} { 6} fattened sheep to my table. Then because, without ……, my lord's soldiers overturned my table, I became frightened and my flesh crept.

In the month Ezen-Ninazu, after {the 15th day} { five days had passed}, my lord gave me his instructions. {By the first day} { after one day had passed} of the month U-bigu, I {sent to you} { I sent to my lord ……} a messenger. Now it is {midday} { mid-month} { the day did not ……}, …… approached. May my lord know!
Say to Aradĝu: this is what Šulgi, your lord, says:

akk: lu2 in-ši-gi4-in-na-zu lu2 šul-a-zu in-nu-u3  a-na-aš-am3 niĝ2 a-na an-ga-am3 bi2-in-ak-a-ni ur5 i3-me-a nu-e-zu
en: The man to whom I have sent you is not your subordinate -- he will not {accept} { change} orders from your hand! How can you ignore what he himself has done too, and that it is indeed so?

akk: ĝe26-e niĝ2 ĝe26-e-gin7-nam ma-da gen6-ne2-de3  iri^ki- ma-da ud teĝ3-ĝe26-de3-en-na-zu umuš-bi zu-zu-a  lu2 gal-gal-be2-ne inim-bi zu-a  a2 kalag-ga a2^!- nam-ur-saĝ-ĝa2-ĝu10 kur-kur-ra ḫe2-en-šub-šub  PA-PA edin-na lib4-lib4 a-šag4-ga   en-na a-pi-il-la-ša gal-zu unken-na-ĝu10 sa2 an-ne-en
en: As I myself ordered, you were to secure the provinces, and to correctly guide the people and {make them obedient} { secure the foundations of the provinces}. When you approach the cities of the provinces, inform yourself precisely of their intentions, and inform yourself of the words of their dignitaries. Let my roar {be emitted over all the lands} { fill all the lands} { cover all the lands}. Let my powerful arm, my heroic arm, fall upon all the lands. Let my storm {cover} { be released over} the Land. Make the …… disappear into the desert, and the robbers into the fields! Until you reach Apillaša, my 'Sage of the Assembly', ……! Let …….
That was how I had instructed you. Why have you not acted as I ordered you?

akk: tukum-bi gal-zu unken-na-ĝu10 ĝa2-a-gin7-nam nu-ub-gur4-re  ^ĝiš-gu-za barag ^tug2-šutur-e ri-a nu-ub-tuš  ^ĝiš-ĝiri3-gub kug-sig17-ka ĝiri3-ni nu-ub-ĝar  ensi2 nam-ensi2-ta  ni2-te-ni2-te-a li-bi2-in-ĝar u3 nu-ub-ta-gub-bu  lu2 nu-un-gaz igi nu-un-ḫul  lu2 igi bar-ra-ka-ni lu2-al li-bi2-dirig  a-na-gin7-nam ma-da ib2-gen6-ne2
en: If I do not make my 'Sage of the Assembly' feel just as important as I am, if he does not sit on a throne on a dais, furnished with a high-quality cloth cover , if his feet do not rest on a golden footstool, if he is not allowed by his own highest authority both to appoint and then to remove a governor from his function as governor, an official {from his charge} { from his function as official} { from an official}, if he does not kill or blind anyone, if he does not elevate his favourite over others -- how else can he secure the provinces?

akk: tukum-bi ki um-mu-e-a-aĝ2  šag4-zu šag4 zu2 keše2 ba-ra-na-ĝa2-ĝa2
en: If you truly love me, you will not bear him a grudge!

You are important, {but you do not even know your own soldiers} { and you even know the soldiers that are at Apillaša's disposal}. Your eyes have learnt something about {these men} { Apillaša's men}, and about {Apillaša's heroism} { my heroism}.

akk: igi 2(MIN)-na-zu-ne-ne im sar-ra gu3 ḫe2-em-ta-de2-de2-e  gu3 teš2-a sig10-ge5-NE-en-ze2-en  suḫuš ma-da gen6-ne2-eb-ze2-en  a-ma-ru-kam
en: If {you, Aradĝu, are indeed my servant} { you, Aradĝu and Apillaša, are indeed my servants}, you should both pay attention to my written communications. Come to an understanding, you two! Secure the foundations of the provinces! It is urgent!
Say to my lord: thus says Aradĝu, your servant:

akk: lugal-ĝu10 niĝ2 na-me-še3 a2-še mu-e-da-a-aĝ2  a-ab-ba kur dilmun^ki--na-ta
en: My lord, you have given me instructions about every matter, from the sea and the land of Dilmun, {from the salt waters and the borders of the land of the Martu} { to the salt waters and the borders of the land of the Martu}, {to} { from} the {side } { borders } of Simurrum and {the territory of ……} { the territory of Subir}:

en: I have established strong guards for their fortresses, and I have made all their troops submit. 1 line unclear

Say to my lord: This is what Aradĝu, your servant, says:

akk: [lugal]-ĝu10 ma-da daĝal-la niĝ2 /nam-ra\-aš mu-ra-an-šum2-ma-a  /gu3\ teš2-a sig10-ge5 dim2-ma-bi 1(AŠ)-am3  /uĝ3\ u2-gin7 lu-lu ^d-šul-gi-ra sipad /inim^?- gen6\-na-bi  /nam\-lu2-ulu3 sig igi-nim-ma diĝir-bi za-e-/me-en\  /igi\-bi ma-ra-ši-ĝal2
en: My lord, the vast territory which has been given to you as booty has been made obedient: it is of one mind. The people, abundant as vegetation, belong to Šulgi, shepherd of the reliable word. You are the god of mankind, in the south and the highlands. They keep their gaze fixed on you.

1 line fragmentary …… which he obtained , I am ……. 1 line fragmentary …… the citizens of the territory of Gutium, ……, Mari and Rāpiqum, who will listen at all times, are before me. Whatever you say, my lord, I will do.
Say to my lord: this is what Aradĝu, your servant, says:

en: Aba-indasa, the captain of the royal pledged troops, has sent you ……. May my lord take note most carefully concerning this matter.

Why do they let him rise up from among their troops and make him enter …… of my guard? Carry it , and have your heart bear the offence, …… the enemy has departed, and then return him to their troops!

en: …… when you have made good by appointing ……, …… you …… ruin ……! …… was set, it was …… for you. In a safe place where …… before you, you should take your seat on a throne. This is urgent!
1 line fragmentary …… Ur-Namma, my own father, …… the fortress ……. …… I have set up for their ……. From …… the fortress ……. After …… my letter, return …… to their troops!
May …… not ruin their city! Its pride …… for their troops. ……, may you …… on a throne.
Say to my lord: This is what Aradĝu, your servant, says:

en: My lord, your word is the word of An, it ……. Your decreed destiny has been bestowed on you as on a god.

en: As to the fortification which my lord sent me back to, the work on it has been put into effect. The approach of the enemy is kept at a distance from the Land. My lord continues to maintain his sublime reputation in the south and the uplands, from the rising to the setting sun, as far as the borders of the entire Land. {The rebellious Martu have turned back ……} { The totality ……}.

akk: ^m-kur-gam-ma-bi ^d-šul-gi-ra DU X […]  (ku-un-ši-ma-tum a-na […])   ḫar-ra-an-kalag igi-ḫur-/saĝ\-[ĝa2] […]  (a-na ḫal-ṣi2 [X X] X X […])  u3 a-ba-a an-da-/sa2\ […]   […] X lugal-/ĝu10\ […]  (ṭup-pi2 be-li2-ia […])   niĝ2 lugal-ĝu10 ab-[…]  (/ša\ be-li2 […])  lugal-ĝu10 […]
en: {Kurgamabi} { Kunšī-mātum} …… to Šulgi. The fortress Igi-ḫursaĝa ……. And who will rival him ……? unknown no. of lines missing
{……} { The letter of} my lord ……. Whatever ……, my lord, ……. My lord should ……!
Say to my lord: this is what {Puzur-Šulgi} { Puzur-Marduk} { Puzur-Numušda}, the commander of the fortress Igi-ḫursaĝa, your servant, says:

akk: zi-ni-še3-am3 in-nu-u3  bad3 gal igi-ḫur-saĝ-ĝa2 mu lu2-kur2 ḫul-ĝal2-še3  uĝ3 kalam-ma-ni-še3 mu-un-du3
en: All the {gold and silver} { gold and lapis lazuli} { silver and gold} that my lord has been fashioning for the { great} gods -- is it not for his own life? For {the life} { the well-being} of the troops and his land, my king has built the great fortress Igi-ḫursaĝa for the people of his land, because of the wicked enemy.
And now the enemy troops have risen up. {One} { ……} man who had fled from me has been brought back. Having been caught, he has given me evidence of this, and {went ahead} {  "…… go!", and I went}.

akk: ĝiškim lu2-kur2-ra ĝe26-e i3-zu  lu2-kur2 me3^!--še3 usu-ni im-ma-til usu-ĝu10 i3-tur
en: I am also well-informed about the oracular signs concerning the enemy: the enemy has replenished his strength for battle. However, my strength is limited. I cannot strengthen the fortress further or {guard it} { guard the cities } against him.

akk: 5 nindan ḫe2-ni-dar-dar  nam ^m-KA-kug-ga-ni ensi2 ma-da MURUB4^ki-  45 nindan gaba dab5-ba-bi ba-gul-gul  50 nindan saĝ ba-sud4 murub4-ba im-da-an-ri
en: As for the sector of {Šu-Numušda} { Šu-Marduk} { Puzur-Numušda}, the ruler of Ĝirilumtura: five nindan lengths of it are cut off. As for the sector of Lugal-melem, the manager of the {Šegšeg watercourse} { city of …… }: {40} { 25} { 30} { 45 } nindan lengths of …… on top of it are no longer fixed. As for the sector of Ka-kugani, the ruler of the territory of Murub: 45 nindan lengths were destroyed when the opposite side was captured. As for the sector of Tākil-ilišu, the {canal inspector} { ruler} of the Ab-gal and Me-Enlila watercourses: 50 nindan lengths of the edge have been removed, and in the middle of it they collapsed.

Moreover it is not {established} { stated} { known} when the enemy will pitch camp. {Once the enemy is camped I will replenish my powers} { The enemy will replenish his strength for battle}. { I will fortify …… and …….} His troops are camped among the hills.

If my lord agrees, {may he send to me speedily} { ……, let there be available} 7,200 soldiers as workmen who will carry baskets for me. {May he send to me speedily} { May there come, at my disposal,} 70 {Šimaškian attendants ……} { ……} { ……}.

akk: ḫe2-zu ĝi6-ta ud ul-le2-a-aš nam-tag-ni dugud
en: {The enemy has devised their plans concerning this: "I will resettle them"} { The enemy has devised his plans and has resettled the people} { Plans concerning me have been devised: "I will resettle them"}. May it be known that, by night or by day the enemy's sins are forever grave.

en: I am the loyal servant of my lord Šulgi. { …… which is not negligent.} Let this not be the death of me! May my lord know! { It is urgent!}
Say to Puzur-Šulgi, the commander ……: this is what Šulgi, your lord, says:

en: When I had …… the fortress Igi-ḫursaĝa, and An and Enlil had …… supreme rule over all the foreign lands and the widespread people, the cities and the Land ……, and the people of the widespread Land lay ……. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

en: They should mobilise all these cities.

akk: ^m-puzur2-^d-nu-muš-da-a2-ra mu-un-ne-du  ^m-^ d-šul-gi lu2-gal-zu2 na-ap-pa-a  up pa-ad gi igi^gi--ḫu-ur-saĝ-ga mu-un-ta-a
en: When the master-builder has taken up the work concerned, he is to re-establish securely any place where the fortification has fallen into ruins. Let him reinforce and also rebuild it. The neglected work load is to be completed within one month; I shall be questioning him about this work.

akk: ki niĝ2-dam-gal-be ku-tu-uš ne-ḫa mu-un-šu-ub  (TA šu-ub-ti-šu mu-gal-li-ta X)   nitaḫ2^ta--be ki šag4-ga-an-ne e-du  (NITAḪ2-šu e-mi li-ib-bi-šu DU-ka)   munus-še bal ^ĝiš-gi-ri-da^?- šag4-ga-an-ne al-<…>  (MUNUS-tu qa-du ^ĝiš-BAL-ša3 u3 ki-ri-is-si2 <…>)   edin-na niĝ2-dam-gal-be na-rig5 u3-mu-ĝar X  (EDIN-ra ra-ap-ša3 ta-bi-ni u2-ma-al-<li>)
en: …… the Tidnum have returned from their mountain land. I am therefore setting over you Lu-Nanna, the ruler of the province of Zimudar, together with his troops . There is for you …… together with his ……. There is not for him ……. 1 line fragmentary
May …… be sent when …… is completed.

akk: /ki\-im /pa\-da^!--be ak-ka-a-a ba-ad-be ne-er-ga-al li-bi-ib-tu-ul-le  (ši-pir2 BAD3 e-pe-ša3 e-te-el-li-iš lu-u2 aq-bi)   zi um-ni-im u3 da-ša3 X-ne-et-te ši-li-ma  (ŠE3 ZI-a u3 ZI KUR-ti-a ŠE3 šu-ul-lu-mi)   šak ku-še ša qa-al mu-un-na-an-du  (aš-ta-al am-ta-li-ik-ma BAD3 ša3-tu DIM2)
en: Should Lu-Nanna, the ruler of the province of Zimudar, together with his troops, abandon you, then you and Aradĝu {should not turn aside} { should not feel constrained }.

akk: e-ne-eš-še um-ni-im im-ma-an-ĝen  (i-na-an-na um-ma-nu iṭ-ṭe4-ḫa-a)   ki-im bad3-be lu-u2 ki-ig-be ḫe-em-tu  (ši-pir2 BAD3 DIM2 DIM2 BAD3 DIM2)   ne-e-še ur-du-um-gu ši-im-gi  (i-na-an-na ur-du-um-gu ub-te-e’2-i)
en: The orders are rigorous: you should not neglect your work load. They are to proceed with the building work by night and in the heat of noon. You will not be sleeping during the night or in the heat of noon! You should know this! It is urgent!
Say to Puzur-Numušda: this is what Šulgi, your lord, says:

When I had built the great fortress Igi-ḫursaĝa and An and Enlil had given to me the …… over all the foreign lands and the widespread people, each of their towns and all their provinces, and the people of the widespread Land lay in green meadows. I made them rest in spacious habitations, in peaceful dwelling places.

As for their men and women: the man among them goes wherever he pleases, and the woman with spindle and hair clasp goes wherever she pleases. After they had set up stock-pens in the vastness of the desert, and established their tents and camps, the workmen and the labourers spend the days in the fields.
In order that the ruler and the general manager can build everything for you concerning the fortress, carry out this work on the fortress now. The reputation of this fortress shall not be diminished.

By consulting omens and according to my heart's desire I have benefited the life of the troops and the province ……. Now the troops have arrived. As for the work on this fortress, the men are to proceed with the building work on it.
Now I have sent Aradĝu to you. Let the ruler and the general manager bring these men. They are to mobilise all the settlements.

akk: lu2-saĝ-gi-in-ne mu-un-dab5^?-  (LU2 TA SAĜ-ad ši-ip-ri-šu ŠE3 E2 <…>)   ḫe-em-ta-ak-lu u2 ḫe-em-du  (li-iq-qu2-ur2 u3 li-pu-uš)   šag4 itid 1-ka bad3 ḫa-ra-ab-ti-il-le  (TA ŠA3 itid 1 BAD3 šu-u2 lu-u2 qu2-ut-tu)   ki-ig-be-eš-še   (ši-pir2 BAD3 DIM2 BAD3 DIM2-šu)
en: The master builder has taken up his work. Where substantial work has been neglected, let him return to it. He is to reinforce and rebuild it. He is to complete the fortress within one month. Let him not question this assignment.

akk: zi-bi-is-še3 ḫe-em-da-am-du-ku  (ṣi2-di-is-su2 na-ši2-ku)   niĝ2 kalag-ka la-ba-nam-da-ad-da2  (te-ki-ta la i-ra-aš-ši2-ku)
en: May Lu-Nanna, the ruler of the province of Zimudar, go to join his troops. He certainly has flour provisions with him. He should not be deterred by hardship.
When the fortress is completed, a letter from the two of you should reach me .

akk: up pa-at ti-il-la du-ub-de3-en-ne-en-ne ḫe-pi-niĝ2-du  (UD-mi BAD3 šu-u2 qu-ut-tu-u2 ṭup-pa-ku-nu DU)   u3 igi^gi--zi-ne-en-ne mu-un-da-re-eš-še  (UD-mi IGI-ku-nu ta-aš-ta-ak-na-ni)   ša-e ur-du-um-gu nam-be-eb-le-e  (at-ta u3 ur-du-um-gu la tu-ḫa-ra-ni)   ge-e ab-ra-a ki-ig-be ḫe-em-tu  (mu-ši u3 ur-ri ši-ip-rum DIM2-uš)   a ga-zi kalag-ka a ga-mu-uš-de3-en-ne e-ma-ru-uk-ka  (te-er-ta-ku-nu lu-u2 da-an-<na>-at ri-it-ta-ku-nu e-ma-ru-uk-ka-pu-tu)
en: When you have seen for yourselves, let Lu-Nanna, the ruler of the province of Zimudar, proceed to his troops. You and Aradĝu should not delay them! Let the building work proceed both by night and by the noonday heat. Your orders are rigorous, and you should not give up this work load. It is urgent!

akk: ^m-puzur4-^d-šul-gi šagina bad3 igi-ḫur-saĝ-ĝa2 u3-na-a-dug4  ^d-^ ?-šul-gi lugal-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Say to Puzur-Šulgi, commander of the fortress Igi-ḫursaĝa: this is what Šulgi, your lord, says:
{Where} { when} I had built the great fortress Igi-ḫursaĝa, the …… not come out. The …… cannot drink water, {because of a breach in the Tigris and Euphrates} { …… together with the Euphrates}.
In order that …… should lie down, in order that …… should be absolutely clean, in order that …… should be put ……, 1 line missing

en: I will make …… change ……. After sending you back ……, I instructed you ……. I have built there ……. They returned …….
May …… be taken up. May he rebuild …….

en: …… is sending to me ……. I will ask you ……. …… of Zimudar shall indeed come to you ……. 1 line fragmentary …… was taken .
…… be sent. I know very well ……. …… abandon you . Should …… take ……, you both ……. It is urgent!
