en: Say to my lord: this is what the merchant Ur-DUN, your servant, says:

akk: kug lugal-ĝu10 mu-e-NE-šum2-ma  kur su3-ra2-še3 šim ^ĝiš-erin-na  sa10-sa10-de3 mu-e-ši-gi-na  ud kur-še3 X kur9-re-na-ĝu10  šim ^ĝiš-erin-na bi2-sa10-sa10-ĝu10  ^m-a-pi2-la-ša gal-zu unken-na ma-an-gi-ma  sam2-ĝu10 mu-da-an-kar2-re-eš
en: My lord gave me silver and sent me to a distant land in order to purchase cedar resin. After I had entered the land and had purchased cedar resin, Apillaša, the 'Sage of the Assembly', sent men to me and they took away my goods.

akk: kan4 e2-gal-la-ni u3-um-ĝen  lu2 na-me inim-ĝu10   ^m-arad-ĝu10 arad-zu u3 ba4-ba4-ti pisaĝ-dub-ba  zi-mu-dar^ki--ra-ta si-mu-ur-ru-um^ki--še3  i3-re-eš-ma  […] /in\-ne-zu-/ma\  [lu2]-/kiĝ2\-gi4-a-ne-ne in-[…]
en: When I arrived at his palace gate, no one enquired about my business. Aradĝu, your servant, and Babati, the archivist, had gone from Zimudar to Simurrum and had learnt …… and their messengers …….

akk: […] lugal-ĝa2 ba-e-ni-[…]  /usu^?-\ nu-tuku a2 dar-re-bi nu-mu-/da^?--ĝar^?-\
en: …… of my lord ……. Being in a weak position, I was not able to …… their illegal seizure.

akk: dug4-ga lugal mu-ra-an-šum2  niĝ2 lugal-ĝu10 ab-be2-na-ĝu10
en: He has given you a report, lord. Whatever you say, my lord!

akk: lu2 la-ga lu2-sa-gaz-e edin sig9-si-ig-ga-bi ^ĝiš-niĝ2-gul-bi bi2-ak  lu2 kiĝ2 ak-bi lu2 gud-apin la2 a-šag4-ga ud mu-un-di-ni-ib-zal-e
en: The men started irrigation work on the watercourses, {…… the watercourses ……} { and dug and cleaned them out thoroughly}. These bandits and brigands applied their hoes to levelling the desert completely. As for their men and their women { …… the road ……}: the man among them goes wherever he pleases, {the woman among them} { the woman}, holding a spindle and hair clasp in her hand, {goes } { ……} { going} the way of her choice. In the vastness of the desert {they set up} { they knock up} animal pens, and {after setting up their tents and camps} { they lie in green meadows in their tents and camps}, their workers and agricultural labourers spend the day together on the fields.

akk: a2 aĝ2-ĝa2 ^d-šul-gi lugal-ĝa2-ke4 gu2-ĝu10 nu-mu-da-šub  gu2 bi2-X ĝi6-ba an-bar7-ba a2-bi X i3-ĝen-ne-en  lu2-ĝarza2 gal kur-kur-ra-ke4 ugu-bi um-mi-dirig  lugal-ĝu10 niĝ2 gal-gal ba-e-dirig gaba-ri MU X-ni-in-[…]
en: I have not neglected the instructions of my lord Šulgi: both at night and in the noonday heat I …… my neck; I …… the workload concerned. Since his childhood, Apillaša {has ……} { has not ……}. A man such as he knows my heart, as your eyes {know} { have seen}. My lord, with the open eye of a god, {…… to an evildoer ……} { you know the evildoer}. While the great …… official of all the foreign lands surpasses ……, my lord, you surpass all great things, …… an equal.

akk: inim sag9-ga-ni šag4-za i3-ĝal2 ud us2-sa i3-X X  šag4-ĝu10 šag4 zu2 keše2 a-gin7 ḫe2-en-ĝa2-ĝa2  ma-da suḫuš bi2-ge-en gu3 teš2-a bi2-sig10-ge5  lugal-ĝu10 lugal nu-mu-e-da-sa2 šag4-zu ḫe2-eb-dug3-ge
en: {The report is returned ……;} { Whatever statements have been made ……,} your matter is an important matter, and your affairs are great affairs. His pleasant words are in your heart, ……. They are the people. Your eyes ……. How could I bear a grudge? I am securing the foundations of the province, and making it obedient. My lord, no king can rival you; let your heart be glad!
To Aradĝu ……: …… Šulgi ……:

akk: A^?- […]  lu2 […]  inim-zu-še3 […] /ḫe2\-[…]  erin2-bi-še3 X […] nu-X […]  ba-ni-ib-ḫa-[…] I […]  erin2-bi […] X […]
en: 2 lines fragmentary As regards your concern ……. May ……. For their troops …… not ……. 1 line fragmentary Their troops …….
Say to Išbi-Erra: this is what Šulgi, your lord, says:

akk: inim me-e ga-na u2-ud-ki-im me-e-ḫu-lu  (a-na a-wa-at ta-aš-pu-ra da-an-ni-iš aḫ-<du>)   /e\-me-du di-ik-ki-nam mi-in-na na-ar-ra a-ba ma^!--an-šu  (IR3 ša3 ki-ma ka-<ta> ta-ak-lu(source: KU) ia-a-ši2 ma-an-nu i-na-an-di-na)   a-am-ga lu-ga-al-be šu zi-im ga-ra a-ba ab-tu-ku-e-še  (le-e-a ša3 a-na be-li-šu šu-ud-mu-qu2 ma-an-nu i-šu-uš)
en: You have made me so happy with the news and everything. Who could give me a house-born slave such as you are? Who has such a capable man, so beneficial to his lord?

akk: ne-e-še niĝ2 a-na mu-ši-iq-qa-an-gu  (i-na-an-na mi-im-ma ša ta-aš-pu-ra)   ĝiš-ki-im li-ig-in-ne u2-gu-zi-eš-še me-e-ra-am-gi  (u3^!--ul e-gi ŠE3 EDIN-ka aṭ-ṭa2-ar-da)
en: Now, no sign can confirm anything of what I have been sending to you, but I have sent it to you anyway .

akk: ba-ba-tu pi-ša3-ad-ba-ar-ra at-ta-at-ta e-eg-la-am-gu  (ŠE3 ba-ba-ti ša3-an-da-ba-ak-ki)   li-be-ra ad ki-ki ad ki-ki mu-un-da-a  (la-be-ra mu-un-ta-al-ka ša3 mi-it-lu-u2-ka i-du-u2)   mu mu-nu-ut-ku we-eĝer mi-na-an-gu šu mu-un-te-em-ga im-ma-ši-im-gi  (aš-šu mu-nu-ut-ke-e ša3 EĜER um-ma-ni-ia il-qa-am-ma it-ta-al-ka-ak-ku)
en: I had Babati, the archivist -- who is to me a grandfather, an advisor of longstanding, who knows how to give advice -- send you 600 talents of silver and 600 talents of gold, which I had delivered to you because of the taking of …… from my troops.

akk: u2-mu-uš eri-na-ak-ke u2-gu-uz-ze-eš-še me-e-ra-am-gi  (ṭe4-mi um-ma-ni-ia ŠE3 ṣe2-ri-ka tu-ur2-ku)   e-ne-er-ra šu-mu-un-na ni-ig-na-ma-an-ne ak-ka-a  (a-na ša3-šu i-di-iš-šu-um-ma ša3 qa-be-šu DIM2-uš)   e-ma-ru-uk-ka ša3-ap-pi ḫu-un na-an-gi-ga  (ap-pu-tu ŠA3-šu la i-ma-ra-aṣ-ku)
en: I have also sent you intelligence information about the troops. Pass it on to Babati, and do whatever he wishes, lest his heart suddenly turns to hatred!

akk: šu du-uz-zu ni-ig-nam na-an-nu-le  (TA ŠU-ka li-ib-qur-ma mi-im-ma la ta-ar-ru-ur2)
en: You are to receive the gold and silver from him, and purchase grain everywhere according to whatever exchange rate they will take from you. May your …… nothing at all.

akk: u2-da-da dumu^mu- ša3-az zu-ga-am-gu-u2 de-mi-in  (uš-tu UD-mi an-ni-i DUMU-rum mu-ṭi3-ib li-ib-bi-ia at-ta)   iri du kur mar-du e2-nam du-a-be mu-ra-ga me-e-ek-ki-na mi-du-gu-ut-ta  (ŠE3 IGI a-mur-ri-i u3 NIM-ti ka-li-šu ĜAR-na-a-ti ki-ma ia-a-ti KU-ib)
en: From today , you are my son who makes me happy. The cities of the province , the land of the Martu, Elam -- all of them I have placed before you: you are just as important as I am.

akk: du-ru-be-šu uz-zu ḫu-ur-mi ni-ig na-me na-an-tu-uk-ku  (e-li-šu-nu u2-te-el-li mi-im-ma la te-ne-e’2-a)
en: So sit before them on a throne on a golden dais ……! Let their messengers prostrate themselves in front of you! May your …… at its rear; do not …… at all!

akk: lu-u2 na-an-ga lu-u2 uk-ka igi^gi- lu-u2 uk-ka ḫu-la-a  (be-el an-ni a-šu-ur2 uz-ni LU2 gu-ul-li-il)   u2-ku-uš i-gi du-uq-qa im-ma-an-sig5-qa  (re-e-da-a ša3 TA IGI-ka id-dam-qu2-ma)   e2 nam-šul-zu e-ne-er-ra du-mu-un-na šu-um ĝar-zu ma-ḫa  (E2-ti eṭ-lu-ti ŠE3 ša3-šu DIM2-ma gi-mil-la^!--ka li-ti-ir)
en: Remove a governor -- appoint a governor! Appoint a commander! Designate a captain-general! Certainly you should put a man to death, a man who has killed: blind the man who has killed! Build your house of manhood for an attendant who has been favourably looked upon ! Make sure your recompense is great!

akk: ne-e-še niĝ2 ga-na mu-ši-iq-qa-an-gu  (i-na-an-na mi-im-ma ša3 ta-aš-pu-ra)   e-ma-ru-uk ka-az-zu na-ap-pa-le-e  (ap-pu-tu pi-ka la te-en-na-a)
en: Now, you should not suddenly alter your word about all that I have been sending to you.

akk: ^d-šu-^d-suen lugal-ĝu10-ra u3-na-a-dug4  šar-ru-um-ba-ni gal-zu unken-na arad-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Say to Šu-Suen, my lord: this is what Šarrum-bāni, the 'Sage of the Assembly', your servant, says:

akk: bad3 gal mu-ri-iq-tidnim-e dim2-me-de3 kiĝ2-gi4-a-aš bi2-gi4  mar-tu ma-da-aš mu-un-šub-šub-bu-uš  bad3 du3-u3-de3 ĝiri3-bi ku5-ru-de3  ^id2-idigna ^id2-buranuna-bi-da
en: You sent me a message ordering me to work on the construction of the great fortification Murīq-Tidnim. {You presented yourself before me} { A messenger presented himself before me}, announcing: "The Martu have invaded the land." {You instructed me} { You have imposed on me as a task } to build the fortification, so as to cut off their route; also, that no breaches of the Tigris or the Euphrates should cover the fields with water.

akk: zi-zi-da-ĝu10-ne  gu2 ^id2-ab2-gal-ta en-na ma-da zi-mu-dar^ki--ra-še3  […]-bi i3-zig3-NE
en: When I was setting out, their …… from the bank of the Ab-gal watercourse to the province of Zimudar.

akk: bad3-bi 26 danna-am3 dim2-e-da-ĝu10-ne  dal-ba-na ḫur-saĝ 2(MIN)-a-bi-ka sa2 di-da-ĝu10-ne  dim2-me-ĝu10-še3 mar-tu ḫur-saĝ-ga-ka ib2-tuš-a ĝeštug2 mu-ši-in-ak  si-mu-ur4^ki- nam-tab-ba-ni-še3 im-ma-da-/ĝen\  dal-ba-na ḫur-saĝ ebiḫ^ki--ke4 ^ĝiš-tukul sag3-ge-de3 im-ma-ši-ĝen
en: When I was constructing this fortification to the length of 26 danna, and had reached the area between the two mountain ranges, I was informed of the Martu camping within the mountain ranges because of my building work. Simurrum had come to their assistance. So I set off to the area between the mountain ranges of Ebiḫ in order to engage in military action.

akk: u3 ĝe26-e erin2 ^gi-dusu i3-il2-il2-eš-am3 /igi^?- nu^?-\-um-mi-du8  ^ĝiš-tukul sag3-ge-de3 X-ri-ni-še3 ba-ĝen-/na^?-\
en: But as far as I can say, I have not seen troops carrying baskets. In order to engage in military action, I went to their …….

akk: tukum-bi lugal-ĝa2 an-na-kam  lu2 kiĝ2 ak-ne ḫa-ma-ab-taḫ-e a2 ḫa-ma-ĝa2-ĝa2  gun3-a ma-da sa2 nu-ub-da-dug4-ga dug4-en^?--de3^?--en^?-
en: If my lord agrees, may he provide me with additional workmen and set the wages for me. …… did not succeed …… tribute of the provinces .

akk: ma-da MURUB4^ki--še3 lu2-kiĝ2-gi4-a mu-ni-gi4  ma-da dim2-ma-bi ba-da-kur2  bad3 du3-u3-de3 nu-šub-be2-en i3-du3-en u3 ^ĝiš-tukul i3-sag3-ge-en  gal-zu unken-na im-ri-a gu-la-am3 ḫe2-em-ma-da-ri  dim2-ma ma-da nu-ub-da-kur2-ra na de5 mu-un-e
en: I sent a messenger to the province of Murub: the attitude of the province has altered. I will not neglect to build the fortification -- in fact I am building and engaging in military action at the same time. After all, as 'Sage of the Assembly' I descend from a great lineage! I have been advised that the attitude of the province has not altered.

akk: ud lu2-kiĝ2-gi4-a-ĝu10 igi-zu-še3 mu-e-ši-gi4-a-ĝu10  lu2-kiĝ2-gi4-a mu-ni-gi4  7200 erin2 mu-e-ši-in-gi4
en: At the time I sent my messenger to you, I sent another messenger, after him, to {Lu-Nanna} { Lu-Enki}, the ruler of the province of Zimudar. He has sent you 7200 workers.

akk: lu2 ^gi-dusu ib2-si lu2 ^ĝiš-tukul sag3-ge bi2-ib-tur  tukum-bi lugal-ĝu10 erin2 kiĝ2 ak-de3 du8-u3-bi ab-be2  u3-šub ^ĝiš-tukul ga-an-da-sag3
en: Basket men are available; however, men fit to engage in military action are limited. If my lord should arrange the dismissal of the workers ready to work, let me pursue military action together with them, when I have removed them.

akk: lu2 gal-gal ma-da-za lu2 in-ne-ši-in-gi4  igi-ne-ne ma-an-ĝar-re-eš-ma  me-en-de3 iri-iri en-nu-uĝ3 nu-mu-da-ak-en-de3-en  a-na-gin7-nam ugnim a-ra-ab-šum2-mu  lu2-kiĝ2-gi4-a-ĝu10 mu-na-ni-in-gi4-eš
en: The dignitaries of your provinces are sending a man to them. They have presented themselves before me, announcing: "As far as we are concerned, we are unable to guard all the cities. But how exactly will any troops be given to you?" My messenger has been sent to them .

akk: ud lugal-ĝu10 a2 mu-e-da-aĝ2-ta  ud ten ĝi6-ba kiĝ2 im-mi-ib-gi4-gi4-in u3 ^ĝiš-tukul i3-sag3-ge-en  mu inim lugal-ĝa2-ke4 i3-gub-be2-en ^ĝiš-tukul ib2-laḫ4-laḫ4-e  usu nu-um-ĝar ^ĝiš-tukul-ta nu-um-me-ge-en ud kur-kur ḫe2-en-dul^?-  lugal-ĝu10 ḫe2-en-zu
en: Once my lord has given me instructions, I will repeatedly return to work at nightfall and at midnight, as well as engaging in military action. I stand at the disposal of the fame and word of my lord, and so I will bring weapons to bear. No strength has yet been displayed , nor any firmness shown by means of weapons. Let the storm cover all the lands! May my lord know!
Say to Šarrum-bāni: this is what Šu-Suen, your lord, says:

akk: lu2-kiĝ2-gi4-a mu-e-ši-gi-a-ĝu10 dirig šag4-še3 X […]  ud e3 a2 aĝ2-ĝa2-ĝu10 ĝa2-a-gin7-nam ma-[…] li-bi2-ib-dirig-/ge\  ud ed2-da-zu-ne igi nu-/ub^?-\-X-[…]  ĝe26-e a-na ma-ab-<be2>-en-na-X […]
en: The messenger whom you have sent to me ……. …… you do not exceed …… my instructions, as I ordered you. 1 line unclear As for myself, whatever you say to me …….

akk: šag4 ma-da-ka ĝen-a-zu-[ne]  ma-da a-ba^?- e-te ĝi6 sa2 na-[…]  lu2 gal-gal-be2-e-ne inim u3-[…]  KU-ne-ne KUŠ-a-ni^?- […]  lu2 gal-gal-be2-e-ne šubtum6 ḫe2-mu-e-da-sug2-[…]  e-ne-ne-gin7-nam ma-da […]
en: When you went into the province -- who but you has approached the province? Spending the night ……. When their dignitaries have …… their words, if …… 1 line unclear Their dignitaries should stand by you in their quarters. When their …… have been cast away, they themselves …… the province.

akk: tukum-bi u3 lu2-ĝarza2-be2-e-ne  dib2-be2-de3-aš-am3  buru3-da-ne-ne nu-e-da-sig10-ge5  lu2-kur2-ra ĝar-ĝar-bi X  iri-bi zag-bi u3-ne-eš2
en: If …… officials should pass by , 1 line unclear By placing the enemy, their cities, their borders ……, until {they come down} { they come out from their fortress}, they must not overturn it!
When their men had killed, {their women} { their soldiers} passed through your cities of the province; it was not …….
That was how I instructed you. Why did you not act as I ordered you?

akk: lu2 gaz-de3 igi ḫul-ḫul-le-de3  /iri gul\-gul-de3 šu-zu-še3 nu-ĝar-ra  /nam-nir\-ĝal2 mu-ra-šum2
en: You were not empowered to kill anyone, to blind people or to destroy cities; but I gave you authority to do so.

akk: ud bad3 igi TA DA KAM ^d-šul-gi ad-da-<ĝu10> mu-un-du3-a  za-e-en-ze2-en in-nu  ^ĝiš-gu-za-ĝa2 ^ĝiš-gu-za ^d-šul-gi-ra-ka in-nu
en: When my father Šulgi built the fortress ……, it was not you people who were involved -- and my throne is not the throne of Šulgi!

akk: ^m-<lu2>-^d-en-ki ensi2 ma-da zi-mu-dar^!-^ ki--še3  ḫe2-mu-e-ši-du  60 ugnim-ma-ka ḫe2-tum2  […]-/ta\ ḫe2-mi-ib-gi4-gi4
en: Concerning Lu-Enki, the ruler of the province of Zimudar, he should come to you, and should bring with him 60 troops. Let them be sent together with …….
……, the archivist, made …… limited . According to the instructions that have been given to him, he should build that fortress.

akk: u3 za-e erin2 šu-zu-ta i3-ĝal2-la  [ḫi]-ri-tum2«^ki-» ba-al-la2
en: And as for you, with the soldiers who are under your authority, get the trench dug!

akk: ma-da dim2-ma-bi nu-kur2-ru-de3  nam-ba-šum2-mu-[un]-ze2-en  en-na ma-da nu-um-gen7-na-ta  erin2 nam-mu-un-du8-re-ze2-en
en: So as not to change the attitude of the province, you people are not to release the workers while the land has not yet been secured.

akk: lu2-kiĝ2-gi4-a-e-ne a2 aĝ2-ĝa2 ma-da  ^d-utu ed2-da-bi ḫa-ma-tum3  a-ma-ru-kam
en: Let messengers bring me news about those eastern provinces. This is urgent!
Say to Ibbi-Suen, my lord: this is what Išbi-Erra, your servant, says:

akk: kaskal i3-si-in^ki- ka-zal-lu^ki--še3  ganba 1 še gur-ta-am3 še sa2 di
en: You ordered me to travel to Isin and Kazallu to purchase grain. With grain reaching the exchange rate of one shekel of silver per gur, 20 talents of silver have been invested for {the purchase} { ……} of grain.

akk: inim mar-tu lu2-kur2-ra šag4 ma-da-zu kur9-ra ĝiš bi2-tuku  a-da-al-la-bi mar-tu du3-du3-a-bi šag4 kalam-ma-še3 ba-an-kur9-re-en  bad3^?- gal-gal dili-dili-bi im-mi-in-dab5-dab5  ugu-ĝu10 mu-ta-ni-kalag i3-tuš-u3^?--de3-en
en: I heard news that the hostile Martu have entered inside your territories. {I entered with 72,000 gur of grain} { 72,000 gur of grain was brought} -- the entire amount of grain -- inside Isin. Now I have let the Martu, all of them, penetrate inside the Land, and one by one I have seized all the fortifications therein. Because of the Martu, {I am unable to hand over} { I am unable to make ……} this grain for threshing. They are stronger than me, while I am condemned to sitting around.

akk: ^ĝiš-ma2 72 kalag-ga 20 ^ĝiš-ZA /PI X\ 30 X X GAN  50 ^ĝiš-X 60^?- ^ĝiš-ig /ma2 ugu ma2^?- ĝa2-ĝa2\  u3 ^ĝiš-ma2 du3-a-bi ḫe2-X
en: Let my lord repair 600 {barges} { boats} of 120 gur draught each; 72 solid boats, 20 ……, 30 ……, placing 50 …… and 60 boat doors on the boats , may he also …… all the boats.

akk: id2^?--da ^id2-^ ?-kur-ra ^id2-pa-li-iš-tum-ta  ki^?- ^ĝiš-ma2 kar-bi ugu-ĝa2 e-tuku  ḪI-ḪI še du3-a-bi ḫe2-ĝa2-ĝa2 ḫe2-e-/sa2^?-\
en: {Let them bring it up} { May he make them go out} by water, along the Kura and the Palištum watercourses, to the grain heaps that are spread out. And I myself intend to {go } { come out} and meet them . The place there where the boats moor will be under my responsibility. Let them load up huge amounts of grain , the entire amount of grain; it should reach you.

akk: tukum-bi še ba-an-tur-re-en  ĝe26-e še ga-mu-ra-kur9
en: If you have not got enough grain, I myself shall have grain brought in to you.

akk: lugal-ĝu10 elam-ma^ki- šen-šen-na   še-ba-ni ul4-la-bi al-til-la  lirum-lirum na-an-taḫ^?--en  nam-arad-da-ni-še3 saĝ-zu na-an-šum2-mu-un  u3 eĝer-ra-ni-še3 na-an-du-un
en: My lord has become distressed about the battles in Elam. But the Elamites' grain rations have quickly been exhausted, so do not slacken your forces! Do not fall head first into their slavery, nor follow at their heels!
I have at my disposal enough grain to meet the needs of your palace and of {all the cities} { all your cities} for 15 years.
{That I should guard for you} { To guard} { the city of} Isin, and Nibru: {let it be my responsibility.} { my lord, is this my responsibility?} My lord should know this!

akk: lugal-ĝu10 ni2 nu-te ni2 nu-gid2-i šag4-ba ĝe26-e nu-/te\-BU  diĝir dili-dili-bi igi^?- ḫe2-ni-ib2-kiĝ2-kiĝ2-e ki-bi ḫe2-kiĝ2-/kiĝ2\  uĝ3 daĝal-bi nam-lu2-ulu3-/bi^!-\ […] X BI maḫ
en: My lord, I am without fear! I will not delay ; I will not …… in their midst. Each one of Isin's and Nibru's gods may search there for faces ; I have indeed looked for them. Their widespread people, their population ……, huge ……, are indeed healthy; the true seed is {indeed great there} { precious}.

akk: urim2^ki- /iri\ kug-zu an ki-/da mu2\-a  nun gal-me-e GAG [(X)] X saĝ-ki-bi kal-la  me šum2-mu uš^?- ĝiš-/ḫur ge\-en-gen6-ne2 sig igi-nim-ma  šu-ta ḫe2-kar-re /KA^?-\ [(X)] X-bi ḫe2-eb2-be2
en: Urim, your holy city, rivalling heaven and earth, whose great prince you are ……, of which the appearance is precious, which dispenses the divine powers and makes the foundations and the plans firm both in the south and in the uplands, will surely escape from the grasp and will cry …….

akk: e2-kiš-nu-ĝal2 eš3 an ki šu2-šu2 X X X nu-tuku  elam^ki- ur-idim lu2 niĝ2 ḫa-lam-ma-ke4  šu pe^!--el nu-ma-ak-e ^d-lamma-bi nu-si-/il\  lugal-ĝu10 KA sig10-sig10 gal-gal dub3-tuku mu-/un-kar^?-\
en: Elam, a raging dog, a destroyer, will not defile E-kiš-nu-ĝal, the sanctuary which covers heaven and earth, which has no ……. Its protective spirits shall not be split apart! My lord: the loudest roarer , the runner, has taken flight !

akk: ^m-i-bi-^d-suen-ka šag4-ta-am3 ki /aĝ2\-me-eš  an ^d-en-lil2 ^d-en^!--ki igi zid ḫu-mu-un-ši-bar-re-e-ne  [X X] X (X) RU E X X X ḫe2-en-ĝar igi-bi ḫe2-eb2-[gi4]-gi4  [(X)] X abula^!- urim2^ki--ma ĝal2 da13^!--da13^!--da a-a  X ḫe2-ni^!--ib-be2 a-ba-am3 lugal-ĝu10-e-še  /lugal\ ^d-en-/lil2\ [(X)] X gaba-ri nu-tuku-me-/en\
en: May An, Enlil and Enki, who have loved Ibbi-Suen from the womb, look upon him approvingly. …… is indeed placed there; they have changed their appearance. With the …… and the city-gates of Urim opening, they cry "Aee!" If …… says, "Who is my lord?" -- You are the king to whom Enlil has given …… no rival!

akk: [X] X X X […] šag4-zu na-an-gig-/ga\  [X] šu mu-/un\-gi suḫuš-bi mu-ri-in-ge-en  [X] X numun-bi-a šag4-zu ḫe2-en-dug3-ge  /en\-na lugal-ĝu10 al-til3-la nam-lugal urim2^ki- mu-un-ak-e
en: Your heart should not fret over this, ……! For …… has avenged ……; he has made its foundations firm for you. Let your heart be glad over …… and its seed. As long as my lord is alive, he will exercise kingship over Urim.

akk: niĝ2 na-me lugal-ĝu10 kiĝ2 mu-na-ni-ib2-gi4  a-ma-ru-kam nam-ba-e-šub-de3-en-ze2-en  /igi\ ^d-utu-kam ka-ĝu10 nu-bal-e
en: Do not suddenly reject anything that is sent as a message to my lord! Before Utu, I will not change my word .
Say to Išbi-Erra: this is what your lord , Ibbi-Suen, says:

akk: en-na ^d-en-lil2 /lugal^?-\-ĝu10 me-še3 i-im-ĝen-ne-en  za-e ur5-gin7 ka i3-bal-e  ud-da ^d-en-lil2-le ĝa2-a-ra ḫul ba-an-gig  dumu-ni ^d-suen-na-ra ḫul ba-an-gig  urim2^ki- lu2-kur2-ra bi2-in-šum2-mu  ki šag4-ba nu-me-a lu2-kur2 im-zig3-ge kur-kur im-suḫ3-suḫ3  ud ^d-en-lil2-le dumu-ni ^d-suen-na-ra im-me-gur  za-e inim-zu ĝiškim im-ma-an-tuku
en: As long as Enlil was my lord , what course were you following? And is this how you alter your word? Today Enlil detests me, he detests his son Suen , and is handing Urim over to the enemy. Its central part is gone, the enemy has risen up, and all the lands are thrown into disarray. But on the day when Enlil turns again towards his son Suen, you and your word will be marked out!

akk: 20 gun2 kug-babbar še sa10-e-de3 /šu\ ba-e-ti  2 še gur-ta-am3 kug-babbar 1 giĝ4-e bi2-in-/sa10-sa10-e\  ĝa2-a-ra 1 še gur-ta-am3 za-e mu-un-gen6
en: You have received 20 talents of silver to purchase grain. You purchase it at the price of one shekel of silver per 2 gur of grain, but in dealing with me, you fix the price at one shekel of silver per 1 gur of grain!

akk: puzur4-^d-nu-muš-da šagina bad3 igi-ḫur-saĝ-ĝa2  mar-tu lu2-kur2-ra šag4 kalam-ma-ĝu10-še3 a-gin7 im-da-an-kur9-re-en  en-na ^ĝiš-tukul sag3-ge-de3 nam-mu-e-ši-in-gi  lu2 saĝ-du nu-tuku kalam-ma i3-ĝal2-la  a-gin7 mar-tu-e an-ta nam-mu-ši-in-gi
en: How could you allow Puzur-Numušda, the commander of the fortress Igi-ḫursaĝa, to let the hostile Martu penetrate into my Land? Until now he has not sent to you word about engaging in battle. There are puny men in the Land! Why has he not faced the Martu?

akk: /^d-^ ?-\i-bi2-^d-suen lugal-ĝu10-ra  u3-na-a-dug4  ^m-puzur4-^d-/šul\-gi ensi2 ka-zal-lu^ki- arad-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Say to Ibbi-Suen, my lord: this is what Puzur-Šulgi, the governor of Kazallu, your servant, says:

akk: lu2-kiĝ2-gi4-a ^d-iš-bi-er3-ra ugu-ĝu10 i-im-ĝen  igi-ni ma-an-ĝar-ma  ^d-iš-bi-er3-ra lugal-ĝu10 ugu-zu-še3 kiĝ2-gi4-a im-mi-in-/gi4\
en: A messenger of Išbi-Erra came to me. He presented himself before me announcing: "Išbi-Erra, my lord, sends you a message:"

akk: ^d-en-lil2 lugal-ĝu10 nam-sipad kalam-ma KA-KA-ni ba-an-SUM  gu2 ^id2-idigna gu2 ^id2-buranuna gu2 ^id2-ab2-gal u3 gu2 ^id2-me-^d-en-lil2-la2  iri^ki--be2-e-ne diĝir-be2-e-ne u3 ugnim-be2-e-ne  igi ^d-nin-isin2^si--na-ka-/še3\ ku4-ku4-de3  i3-si-in^ki- nam-ĝa2-nun ^d-en-lil2-la2-še3 ĝa2-ĝa2-da mu-še3 tuku-tuku-de3  ^d-en-lil2-le ĝa2-a-ra ma-an-dug4
en: " "Enlil, my lord, has …… the shepherdship of the land. Enlil has told me to bring before Ninisina the cities, deities and troops of the region of the Tigris, Euphrates, Ab-gal and Me-Enlila watercourses, from the province of Ḫamazi {to the sea of Magan} { and from the …… of Magan}, so as to make Isin the storehouse of Enlil, to make it famous, and {to make those regions its spoils of war and to make Isin's citizens occupy their cities} { to make Isin's citizens occupy the cities as spoils of war.}""

akk: a-na-aš-am3 gu2 mu-da-ak-e  ka-zal-lu^ki- šu-ĝa2 sa2 ḫe2-eb-be2
en: " "Why do you oppose me? {I swear by the name of my lord Enlil and by Dagan, my personal god} { I swear by the name of Dagan, my personal god}, that I will indeed get hold of Kazallu!""

akk: iri ma-da ^d-en-lil2-le ma-an-dug4-ga  eš3-eš3-a-ne-ne-a ga-am3-ak  ĝi6-par4-ra-ne-ne-a ga-bi2-ib-dur2-ru-durun  igi ^d-en-lil2-la2-še3 šag4 e2-kur-ra  igi ^d-nanna-še3 šag4 e2-kiš-nu-ĝal2-[la]  TUR-TUR-ma^?--ke4 sizkur2-bi ḫe2-eb-be2
en: " "The cities and the province which Enlil has promised me {I want to build up} { I want to place} within Isin in their ……. I want to perform at their ešeš festivals. I want to install my statues, my emblems, my en priests { and lumaḫ priests} and nindiĝir priestesses in their ĝipar shrines. Before Enlil, within the E-kur, before Nanna, within the E-kiš-nu-ĝal, the …… shall speak their prayers.""

akk: u3 za-e lu2 ĝiškim-til3-zu-um  i3-si-in^ki--na bad3-bi ga-am3-du3  i-di-il-pa-šu-nu mu-še3 ga-an-sa4
en: " "And as for you, {I want to remove} { …… eradicate} from within his country the man in whom you placed your trust! I want to rebuild the fortification of Isin and name it Īdil-pāšunu!""

akk: bi2-in-dug4-ga-gin7-nam  i3-si-in^ki--na bad3-bi ba-an-du3  i-di-il-pa-šu-nu mu-še3 ba-an-/sa4\
en: Just as he said he would, he has rebuilt the fortification of Isin and named it Īdil-pāšunu.
He has captured Nibru and installed {his garrison} { set guards} there. Also he has captured Niĝdugani, the chief administrator {of Nibru} { at Nibru}.
He {has imprisoned} { made a prisoner of} Zinnum, the governor {of Subir} { of Kiš}. He has plundered Ḫamazi.

akk: šu-^d-en-lil2 ensi2 kiš^ki--a  ki-ni-še3 ba-an-gur-ru-uš  za-pa-aĝ2-ĝa2-ni-ta ma-da [(…)] X-gin7 i3-/dul^?-\
en: He has made {Nūr-aḫī} { Nūr-Ea}, the governor of Ešnunna, Šu-Enlil, the governor of Kiš, and {Puzur-Tutu} { Puzur-Marduk}, the governor of Bad-ziaba, return to their posts. At his cry of victory the land …… is covered like a ……. Išbi-Erra is constantly at the head of his soldiers!

akk: bi2-in-dug4-ga-gin7-nam  gu2 ^id2-idigna gu2 ^id2-buranuna gu2 ^id2-ab2-gal u3 gu2 ^id2-me-^d-en-lil2-la2 ba-an-dab5  ^m-i-din ma3-al-gi4-a^ki--a ba-ni-in-kur9  ^m-gir-bu-bu ensi2 ĜIR2-kal^ki--ke4
en: Just as he said he would, he has captured the regions of the Tigris, Euphrates, Ab-gal and Me-Enlila watercourses. He has made Iddin enter Malgium . {Opposing} { hating} Girbubu, the governor of Ĝirikal, he {cut off his strap} { he removed his barley stores } and captured him. {His cry of victory lies heavily upon us } { …… he named ……}.

akk: ugu-ĝu10-uš igi-ni ma-an-ĝar  ^lu2-tab-ba nu-tuku lu2 nu-mu-un-da-sa2-e  šu-ni sa2 nu-mu-un-da-ab-dug4-ga-ta  u3-mu-un-šub ga-am3-ma-ĝen  lugal-ĝu10 ḫe2-en-zu
en: Now Išbi-Erra is looking in my direction. I have no ally, nobody with whom I can align myself. Since he has not yet been able to get me in his grasp, let me come to you when he falls upon me. My lord should know this!
Say to {Puzur-Šulgi} { Puzur-Numušda}, the governor of Kazallu: this is what Ibbi-Suen, your lord, says:

akk: [(X)] X erin2-ta mu-ra-suḫ-a-gin7-nam ensi2 ka-zal-lu^ki--še3 mu-ra-ĝal2
en: When I had chosen for you …… from among the troops, they were at your disposal, as governor of Kazallu. But as in my own case, are not {your troops} { your people} proof of your importance?

akk: a-na-aš-am3 [X]-gin7 lu2 mu-e-ši-in-gi4  ^m-iš-bi-^d-er3-ra  ugu-ĝu10-še3 igi-ni im-ma-ši-in-ĝar  u3 ĝe26-e u3-mu-un-šub ga-am3-ĝen
en: Why have you sent me somebody saying: "Išbi-Erra has got his eyes upon me -- so let me come to you when he falls upon me"?

akk: en-na iš-bi-^d-er3-ra kur-/re\ bi2-in-gi4-a a-gin7 nu-e-zu  za-e /gir-bu\-bu ensi2 ĜIR2-kal^ki--ke4  a-na-aš-/am3\ erin2 šu-zu-še3 /i3\-ĝal2-la igi-ni-še3 la-ba-an-sug2-ge-za-na  X /ki^?-\-bi gi4-gi4-da  a-gin7 mi-ni-ib-šum2-za-na
en: How come you did not know how long it would take to make Išbi-Erra return to the mountain lands? Why have you and Girbubu, the governor of Ĝirikal, not confronted him with the troops which you had at hand? How could you allow him to restore ……?

akk: /ud^?--da^?-\ ^d-en-/lil2\-le ki-en-gi ḫul mu-/un\-gi4  nam-sipad kalam-ma-še3 /mu\-[X]-il2  ^m-iš-bi-er3-ra numun ki-en-gi-ra nu-me-a nam-lugal-la mu-na-an-šum2
en: Today Enlil loathes Sumer and has elevated to the shepherdship of the Land an ape which has {descended} { come forth} from those mountain lands. {Now Enlil has given kingship to a dishonest man, {a seller of} { who values} asafoetida} { At this moment Enlil …… to somebody who sells asafoetida, a peripatetic criminal} -- to Išbi-Erra, who is not of Sumerian origin.

akk: ga-nam pu-uḫ2-rum ki diĝir-re-e-ne ki-en-gi sag2 ba-ab-dug4  a-a ^d-en-lil2 dug4-ga-dug4-ga-ni dib-be2-da-aš  en-na urim5^ki--ma lu2-erim2-ša mu-un-ri-a  iš-bi-^d-er3-ra lu2 ma2-ri2^ki--ke4 suḫuš-bi ba-bur12-re  ki-en-gi ḫe2-aĝ2-e ur5-gin7-nam bi2-in-dug4
en: See, the assembly where the gods are and Sumer itself have been dispersed! Father Enlil, whose words prevail , said: "Until the enemy has been expelled from Urim, Išbi-Erra, the man from Mari, will tear out Urim's foundations. He will indeed measure out Sumer like grain." He has spoken just so.

akk: u3 tukum-bi ensi2 URU×A dili-dili i3-ĝar-ĝar-re-en-ze2-en  inim ^d-en-lil2-la2-ta iš-bi-er3-ra i3-bal-e-eš-a  ^lu2-tab-zu-gin7 iri erim2-ra ba-šum2-mu-na-ta
en: Even though you were installed as governors of the various …… the others will defect to Išbi-Erra, in accordance with Enlil's word. Should you hand over your city to the enemy like your companions, {Išbi-Erra will not recognise you as his faithful and agreeable servant.} { will Išbi-Erra recognise you as his faithful and agreeable servant?}

akk: i3-ne-eš2 inim dug3-ga gi4-gi4-de3  lul du8-du8-u3-da ḫe2-ni-ib-tum2-tum2-mu  uĝ3-ba buru14-ba ḫe2-ak-e-de3  šu-ni iri^ki--a nam-bi2-ib-sa2-sa2  lu2 ma2-ri2^ki--ke4 ĝalga ur-re nam-en na-an-na-ak-e
en: May it now be brought about that good words should be restored and treason extinguished. Let Išbi-Erra participate in the harvest among the people there; but you yourself, {do not turn back} { do not harvest}, and do not come to me! His grasp should not get hold of the city! This man from Mari, with the understanding of a dog, should not exercise lordship!

akk: elam^ki- ki zag mu-un-tag-ge u3 ^d-iš-bi-er3-ra mu-un-dab5-be2  kalam ki-bi gi4-gi4-de3 nam-kalag-ga kur-kur-ra ḫe2-zu-zu  […] /gi4\  […] X […] X X /DU^?-\  […] X E NE […] ba-e-sug2-ge-de3^?--eš  […] X kur šu /bi2-gi4\-a a-gin7 nu-e-zu^!-  […] X ĜIR2-kal^ki--a-ke4  […] in-ĝal2-le-eš igi-ni^?--še3^?- la-ba-an-sug2-/de3^?-\-eš  […] X-da a-gin7 mi-ni-ib2-šum2-mu-za-na  […] /gi\ ḫul ba-an-gig  […]-/de3\  nam-sipad kalam-ma <mu>-un^?--il2-la  […] nu-ḫa-ra^sar-  […]-me-a nam-lugal-la mu-na-šum2  […] /gi^?- sag2\ u3-bi2-in-/dug4\  […] X […] /RI\  […] /bi2-in-dug4^?-\  […] X X X X E NE  […] [X]-X-/er3-ra\ i3-bal-e  […] X […] /erim2-še3^?-\ ba-ra-an-šum2-ma-ta  […] X […]-/er3\-ra ni2-bi mu-un-zu-a  […]-ze2^?--me-en  […]-e-ši-ḫul  […]-a-kam  […] X-ur2 illu ba-ni-bal-e  […] X-gi4-gi4  […] KA ŠU ĝal2-la-ĝa2  […] ĝeštug2-ga mu-de5  […] X X X silim-ma im-ma-an-ĝar  […] X DA^?- X X BU ba-da^?--dirig u3-mu-ni-ak  […]-/be2\-e šu-ĝa2 ba-ni-in-dab5-be2 KA ĜIŠ BI RA-RA  […] BI KID UD ŠU ed2-de3 BA KI ba-nu2-de3  […] X
en: {Now Enlil, my helper, has made the Martu rise from their mountain lands} { Now Enlil has …… the Tidnum as …… from their mountain lands}. They will repel Elam and seize Išbi-Erra. To regain the Land will indeed make our might known in all the foreign lands. It is urgent! {Do not be neglectful} { Do not all give up}!
