I had in mind ……. …… was set there in prosperity. …… is supreme over ……, after I have made …… there. I will seize him with my own hands ……. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

akk: lugal-ĝu10-ra u3-na-dug4  maš2 ḫur-saĝ-ĝa2 a2 sag9-sag9-ĝu10  anše-kur ḫur-saĝ-ĝa2 umbin ḫu-ri2-in^mušen--na  ^ĝiš-ĝišnimbar ki sikil-e mu2-a zu2-lum ^na4-za-gin3 la2-ĝu10-ur2  u3-ne-de3-taḫ  arad2-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Say to my lord, and repeat to my kid of the mountains, with beautiful horns; to my horse of the mountains, with an eagle's claws; my date-palm, growing on untouched ground and with fresh dates hanging from it: this is what the captain of pledged {troops} { soldiers}, Aba-indasa -- who, by means of prayers for his king, greatly pleases his king's heart -- your servant, says:
You are mighty, {my lord; I will follow you} { let me be your soldier}! {Let me be the courier of your business} { I will stand before him attentively}!

akk: ^ĝiš-ma2 gub-ba ^ĝiš-ĝisal mu-un-sig10-ge  dumu /gub^?-\-ba še mu-un-sig10-ge  […] (X) X mu-un-zalag-ge
en: When a boat is available, I will steer with the rudder; {when water is available} { when a father is available}, I will plunge in; { when a son is available, I will thresh ;} { …… I will make …… shiny;} when wind is available, {I will winnow} { I will ……}.

akk: dub-sar-me-en na-du3-a ab-sar-re-en  inim ugnim-ma /mu\-[…]  inim pu-uḫ2-ru-um-ma šub-ba ed3^?--de3^!--bi mu-un-da-sig10-ge
en: I am a scribe and I write on stelae. { …… business concerning the troops.} I will …… business which has been neglected in the assembly, when it ……. { …… business which makes good …… equal.}

akk: inim sag9-ge gaba-ri X […]  ĝiš-gin7 ^ĝiš-tir-ĝa2 mu-un-du3-nam mu-dur7-re im-gam-e  ^ĝiš-gu-za-ĝa2 lu2 mu-un-da-la2-a šu-ĝu10 eš2 im-ma-an-la2  iri-ĝa2 tug2^!- dan6-na-a mu-ni-mur10-ra tug2-mu-dur7-ra ba-an-mur10  lag-e a mi-ni-in-tu5-a saḫar igi-ĝa2 ba-e-DU
en: But like a tree planted in riverine thickets, I am bowed down in dirt. They have bound a rope around my hands, on my chair where they have tied me. In my city, where I would wear clean clothes, I am clothed instead in mourning dress. When I wash away clods of soil, dust still gets into my eyes.

akk: ur-e ad6 ib2-gu7 gaba-bi ib2-zi-zi  ušumgal-e saĝ ĝiš ib2-ra-ra ka-ta ab-taka4 i3-ib2-taka4  ĝiš-gi izi ib2-gu7 id2^?- i3-tuku-tuku  ^d-utu i3 un-gu7 ga un-gu7 ^ĝiš-banšur ukur3-ra-še3 šu-ni ib2-ši-tum3
en: Dogs devour corpses, lifting their chests. When dragons kill, what is left from their mouths is put aside. Fire consumes reedbeds even though they have waterways. Utu, who eats butter, who eats cream, nevertheless touches the table of the poor. { Grant me my life and hold my hands! I am a son of a widow, and I have no one to take care of me.}

akk: zi-ĝu10 ba-e-i^!- šu-ĝu10 ḫa-za-a-ab  dumu nu-mu-un-su-me-en lu2  la-ba-an-tuku
en: As for me, when will the heart of Šulgi, my lord, be restored to me? { May my lord attend to me and restore me to my mother.}

akk: lugal-ĝa2 u3-na-dug4  ^m-^ d-suen-illat ra-bi-si2-ka3-tum-ma  arad-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Speak to my lord: this is what Sîn-illat the general, your servant, says:

akk: ka-ku-la-tum/^ki-^ ?-\ gaba-ri gid2-da-ĝu10-ne  mar^?--tu ^ĝiš-/tukul^?-\-ta šubtum6-ta im-zig3  ĝe26-e X […]-ga-ĝu10-ne […] X 70^?- i3-dab5  ka-ku-la-tum/^ki-\-še3 ba-ni-in-kur9
en: When I moved opposite Kakkulātum, the Martu rose up from their ambush with their weapons . When I ……, I captured 70 …… and brought them into Kakkulātum.

akk: tukum-bi lugal-ĝu10 ugnim-ma tuš-u3-bi ab-be2  ^kuš-a-ĝa2-la2 keše2-da-bi šu ḫe2-mi-ib-da13-da13  tukum-bi lugal-ĝu10 ugnim-ma nu-tuš-u3-bi ab-be2
en: If my lord arranges for the troops to encamp, let him have them take their tied-up leather sacks. If my lord arranges for the troops not to encamp, {then let them stay put} { then let them go}. {May my lord know} { This is urgent}!
Speak to Sîn-illat the general: this is what Iddin-Dagan, your lord, says:

akk: kaskal-ĝu10 ni2-tuku saĝ gi4-a gu2 id2-da 2(MIN)-a-bi mu-da-ab-bal-e  ka-ku-la-tum[^ki-] gaba-ri gid2-da-zu-u3-ne  ^d-lamma ^d-da-gan ^d-X X u3 ^d-en-lil2 lugal kalam […] erin2-na gu2^?- bi-in-ri  me-lem4-ĝu10 kalam-ma ba-e-dul  u3 za-e nam-ur-saĝ nam-kalag-ga-zu X X-bi-še3 ba-e-[X]  [X] TAR […] ba-an-da-[X]
en: My expeditionary force is able to cross to both banks of the river, inspiring awe and creating a blockade. When you moved opposite Kakkulātum, the protective goddess and Dagan and …… and Enlil, king of the Land, …… the soldiers. My splendour covers the Land. And as for you, your heroism and strength ……. 1 line fragmentary Kingship …….

akk: /ugnim\ [X] [X]^ki- bi2-[…]  kiĝ2^?- gal^?--la^?- […]  lu2 X X-ne en-nu-uĝ3 ĝa2-ĝa2-da  a-ga-aš gi4-bi /ḫe2\-mi-in-du8  ku4-ku4 ed2-de3 kiĝ2^?- bar ḫa-ra-ak-ne  lugal-ĝu10 TUKU GA NE ĜA2 X NA  ka lul-za u3-mu-e-X [(X)]  ul4-la-bi ĝa2-nam-ma  a-ma-ru-kam
en: The troops ……. …… heavy work . You should …… the recruits of the …… men who are mounting guard. They should check on your behalf …… all those entering and leaving. My lord, ……. When you …… by your treacherous ……. {Do not cut back your troops} { their troops ……}. Come quickly! It is urgent!

akk: lugal-ĝa2 u3-na-dug4  ^m-^ d-nanna-ki-aĝ2 ra-bi-si2-ka3-tum-ma  arad-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Speak to my lord: this is what Nanna-ki-aĝ the general, your servant, says:

akk: e2-danna^da-na-/^ki-^ !-\ lugal-ĝu10 ba-an-da-bal  šag4 e2-danna^da-na--še3 6 me-at ugnim gu-un-gu-nu-um  ^m-at-ta-ma-an-nu-um ba-ni-in-kur9
en: E-danna has turned against my lord. Atta-mannum has made six hundred troops of Gungunum enter into E-danna.

akk: ugnim-bi iri-saĝ-an-na libir-ra-še3 ku4-ku4-de3 la-ba-šum2  /iri\^ki--gibil-am3 al-dur2-ru-ne-eš  [X] /du3\-u3-de3 du-un-nu-um^ki- ak-de3  […] X X-al-e-de3 ba-ĝen
en: I would not allow these troops to enter old Iri-saĝ-ana. They camped instead in Iri-gibil. {These troops} { The troops of Gungunum} have come from the banks of the Id-Amar-Suena watercourse, in order to build ……, to make Dunnum ready and to …….

akk: /tukum\-[bi] lugal-ĝu10 NIM ^ĝiš-/pan^?-\ ^ĝiš-gag-pan  ^ĝiš-ma2 tur-tur šu-KU6 X X X  ^kuš-^ ?-a-ĝa2-[la2] keše2-da-bi ^ĝiš-tukul ^ĝiš-[X ^ĝiš-]/šu^?-\-kar2  a2 me3 […] nu-um-ta-[…] DU  ugnim […] gu2 id2-amar-[^d-suen-ka]-ta  šeg12 ba-du3-e X […] X X-e u3 id2 [X] al-ba-al-e
en: If my lord does not …… crews of highlanders, bows, arrows, small boats, fishermen ……, their tied-up leather sacks, weapons, …… and implements, the armaments of battle, then the troops will construct brick structures by the bank of the Id-Amar-Suena watercourse, …… and dig a …… canal.
They should not be neglectful, my lord! It is urgent!
Say to Nanna-ki-aĝ, the general: this is what Lipit-Eštar, your lord, says:

Because of {enemy troops} { the enemy}, {I, the king, have sent you a letter} { I have sent a letter}. Atta-mannum, who pleases his lord, is a better {servant to his lord} { man} than you! Why is it that {you have not been avenging your lord, and not keeping me informed} { while I have kept the soldiers loyal , you have not stationed them among those people}? { So now you are to station the troops there.}

Now, {I have sent to you in haste} { they have pursued } {2000} { 4000} { 3000} soldiers {who are spear-throwers} { who are …… spear-throwers}, {2000} { 4000} soldiers {who are archers} { who are …… archers}, and {2000} { 1000} soldiers {who are double-axe wielders} { who are …… double-axe wielders}.

akk: lu2-kur2 iri-gibil-a al-dur2-ru-ne-eš  ki-tuš-bi-ta sar-bi2-ib  X X šu^?- i3-ĝar-re-ne nam bi2-X […]  iri dili-dili zag-/ba^?-\ zag^?--za en-nu-uĝ3-bi /ak^?-\-X-ab  iri-bi šu-zu-ta la-ba-ra-e3  nam-lu2-ulu3-zu ĝar-bi2-ib  a-ma-ru-kam
en: The enemy has camped down in Iri-gibil. Chase them away from those settlements; do not ……. Guard each city ……. Do not let these cities out of your grasp. Station your people -- it is urgent!

akk: ^d-utu lugal-ĝu10-ur2 di-kud /maḫ\ an ki  saĝ / kalam-ma ka-aš mu-/un\-bar-bar-re  diĝir zid lu2 til3-le-de3 ki aĝ2 a-ra-zu ĝiš tuku  arḫuš sud /šag4 gur-ru^?-\ mu-un-[…]-zu-[…]  niĝ2-si-sa2 ki aĝ2 niĝ2-zid [bar] /tam\-me NE […] /U3\ […] dug4
en: Say to Utu my lord, the exalted judge of heaven and earth, who cares for the Land, who renders verdicts; just god, who loves to keep man alive, who heeds entreaty, who extends mercy, who knows …… compassion, who loves justice, who selects honesty, ……:

akk: sun4 mu2 /dumu\ ^d-nin-gal sun4 ^na4-za-gin3 X X X […]  en saĝ-kal dili-a-ni pa e3-a nam-maḫ-a-ni zag nu-sa2  ur-saĝ dumu ^d-nin-gal-e tud-da me saĝ keše2 ur4-ur4  diĝir zid nun^!- nam tar-tar-re a-a saĝ gig2-ga lugal-ĝu10-ur2 u2-na-de3-taḫ  ^m-^ d-suen-i-din-nam lugal larsam^ki--ma arad-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Repeat to the bearded one, the son of Ningal, …… a lapis-lazuli beard, {who opens the bolts of heaven and earth} { who opens the bolts}, who creates brightness in darkness; foremost lord who alone is resplendent, whose greatness is unequalled; warrior, son given birth by Ningal, who guards and gathers together the divine powers; just god, prince who determines all the fates, my lord, father of the black-headed: this is what Sîn-iddinam, king of Larsam, your servant, says:

akk: iri-zu larsam^ki--ma šag4-ge pad3-da-zu niĝ2-gig-ga im-ma-an-ak  erin2^!- sag9-ga-zu gu2 ĝar-ĝar-ra gi gi-sig^?--ga-gin7 si-il-si-le-de3 /ba\-an-/til^?-\-le-eš  ĝuruš^!--zu še ud a2-ba-gin7 ab-gur10 ba-an-šab-eš gurun^?- gibil^?--gin7 mu-X-/dub2\-uš  uĝ3-ĝa2 alan im-gin7 im-ma-an-gul-lu-uš ni2-bi-a ba-an-/til\-[…]  di4-di4-la2 ur2^?- ama-be2-ne-ta ud ḫul ba-an-da-/kar\-[(X X)]  uĝ3-ĝa2 ĝeštug^!- ḪAR-re muš3-bi ba-an-kur2 X […]  erin2  /šu\ bar-ra-am3 kalam zid2-gin7 KA×ŠU /e3^?-\ […]  šul ^d-utu iri-/za\ larsam^ki--ma lu2-kur2-gin7 bar-ta ba-da-gub
en: Distress has been caused in your city Larsam, which you have chosen in your heart. The broad squares where days have been passed in merriment {have been reduced to} { are left in} silence. Your commendable troops who were assembled have been annihilated like reeds from a reed fence splitting apart. Your young men have been harvested like barley at the due time; they have been picked and have been plucked like ripened fruit . The people have been smashed like terracotta figurines; they have perished all together. An evil storm took away the little ones from the laps of their mothers. The people ……; their appearance has been changed. Overwhelming troops have been set loose, …… the Land …… like flour. O youthful Utu, like an enemy you stand aside from your city Larsam.

akk: kur elam^ki--ma X^mušen--gin7 maḫ-/bi\ lu2 uš2-a nu-ĝal2-la  su-bir4^ki- muru9 dugud-da diĝir-re-e-ne ni2 teĝ3-ĝe26 nu-/zu\-a  ma-da-bi nu-ub-ta-be4 /ud-bi\ nu-ĝal2-la  za-lam-ĝar til3-la ki diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4 nu-mu-un-zu-a  lu2 mu diĝir sal-la-bi niĝ2-gig-ga i3-/gu7\-e ugnim-bi silim-ma
en: The mountain land of Elam where there are no dead in great numbers like ……, and Subir, a heavy cloud, which knows no reverence even towards the gods -- these districts have not been weakened; their time has not yet come. {The Šimaškian does not elect nugig or lukur priestesses for the places of the gods} { The Šimaškian knows neither his god nor those elected nugig and lukur priestesses} { The Šimaškian …… neither the nugig nor the nubar priestesses for the places of the gods}. His soldiers are numerous like grass; his seed {is widespread} { is indeed exalted}. He who lives in tents, who does not know of the places of the gods: like a wild beast which mounts, he knows nothing of {eša flour nor prayers} { flour and the offering of prayers}. The evil namtar demon and the distressing asag demon {have not carried him off } { do not approach him}. Who …… a divine oath is committing sacrilege, yet his troops are in good health.

akk: diĝir gal-gal-e-ne sizkur2 ud šu2-uš-e al-gub-be2-en inim sag9-sag9-ge-ĝu10 maḫ-/am3\
en: {For seven years, in my city there has been no battle and combat, and death has not been imminent } { For five years, in my city we have not been extinguished by battle, not oppressed by death}. In the open country the lion {does not diminish} { ……} devouring men. I am {treated} { I have been bound } like one who does not know how to entreat a god fervently. I serve the great gods daily with prayers, and my fervent entreaties are sublime.

akk: šul ^d-utu nam-bi-še3 iri-zu larsam^ki--ma igi zid bar-mu-un-ši-ib  /a\ iri-zu dug4-ga-ba-ab  a eš3 X X dug4-/ga-ab\  arḫuš /sud\ /larsam^ki-\-ma šu te-ba-ab  niĝ2-gig-ga ak-bi   [X (X)] X larsam^ki- e3-ni-ib  [X] /ḫuš^?-\-a /šag4\ /larsam\^ki--ma-ka /šu^?-\ X […]  X taka4-a šu nam-uš2-ta ba-e-šub-bu-de3  X-til-le-eš numun-bi ḫe2-maḫ  /a2^?-\ taka4-a ka tar-/zu\ ḫe2-si-il-le
en: O youthful Utu, for that reason look favourably upon your city Larsam! Say "Alas!" for your city! Say "Alas for the sanctuary!" ……! Extend sympathetic compassion to Larsam! Take heed of the causes of distress, and make …… leave …… Larsam! Remove …… and distress from {its midst } { within Larsam}! …… the frightful …… in Larsam, so that …… may escape the clutches of death. …… may its seed be great! May …… sing your praise!

akk: u3 ĝe26-e /ni2 teĝ3\-ĝe26-ĝu10-uš nam-til3 šum2-mu-na-ab  zi su3-ud-ĝal2 niĝ2-ba-e-eš2 ba-mu-na-ab
en: And as for me, for my reverence give me life! Bestow on me long life as a gift!
Speak to my lord, the {bull} { wild bull} { bison } with sparkling eyes, who wears a lapis-lazuli beard:
Repeat to my golden statue born on a favourable day, to my water buffalo reared in a holy fold, chosen in the heart {of holy Inana} { of holy Inana, …… of Suen}, to my lord, the trusted one of Inana:

akk: za-e dim2-ma-zu dumu an-na-me-en  (wa-X […] X-ra-ni)  ^m-ur-sag9-ga arad-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: You are fashioned like the son of An. As with the words of a god, {what you say is irrevocable} { all the foreign lands cannot answer your words}. Your words, like rain pouring from the skies, {are uncountable} { are uncheckable} { are uncontrollable }: this is what Ur-saga, your servant, says:

akk: e2 ad-da-ĝa2 lu2 nam-ba-ab-tum3  lugal-ĝu10 ḫe2-en-zu
en: My lord {has taken care of me} { has not taken care of me}; I am a citizen of Urim. {If my lord agrees} { If it pleases my lord}, let no one waste my father's household, let no one take away {the home of my father's estate} { my old man's home}! May my lord know this!

akk: lugal zalag-ga-ni iti6-gin7 kur-kur-ra pa e3-a  u3-na-dug4  lugal ^d-utu-gin7  eš-bar ^d-ištaran-gin7   lugal šudu3-de3 ĝiš tuku-ĝu10-ur2 u3-na-de3-taḫ
en: Say this to the king who has made his radiance resplendent over all the lands like the moonlight. Repeat it to the king who renders just verdicts like Utu and regulates decisions like Ištaran, to my king who heeds prayers. This is what {Lugal-nesaĝe} { Lugal-šu} , a citizen of Nibru and your servant, says:

akk: udu-gin7 ka u2 gu7-ĝu10 mu-e-pad3 naĝa dub2-ba i-ni-bad  gud ^ĝiš-šudul4-a nu-ub-ḫa-za la2-gin7 edin-na ba-ab-ĝen-ne-en  ab2 amar-bi nu-ub-da-la2-a-gin7 gu3 arḫuš-a im-me  u8 sila4-bi e2-ubur-ra dab5-ba-gin7 šu-ni ba-ab-dab5-be2  ^ĝiš-ma2 kar gen6-na-a li-bi2-ib-taka4-a-gin7 tum9-e ba-ab-dirig-ge
en: Like a sheep I use my mouth for eating grass and I am unfamiliar with washing with soap. Like an ox bearing a yoke which it cannot support, I have been driven out into the high plains. Like a cow whose calf is not close by, I utter pitiful cries. As happens to a ewe whose lamb is restrained in the milking pen, hands seize me. As happens to a bird, men take my nest away. As happens to a boat which is not anchored to a firm quay, I drift in the wind.

akk: i-si-iš sila nibru^ki--ka mu-gu7-e-en  iri kur2 iri-ĝa2 mu-da-an-kur9 lu2  la-ba-tuku
en: In the streets of Nibru grief consumes me. A hostile city has taken over my city and I have no protector. A hostile house has taken over my house and …… against me. In my city, like a slave, no …… and I wear a filthy …… fleece.

akk: gu5-li dub3-sa zu-a kal-la-ĝu10  lu2 dili gu7-u3-gin7 igi tur mu-un-gid2-i-eš  dug3-ge-eš ga-ĝu10 gu7-ĝu10 ka-ĝu10-ta ba-an-kar  a-a-ĝu10 šag4 ur2-bi-ta guru3-gur3-ru-a ki-ta ba-an-ĝar-re-en  nin arḫuš-a-ĝu10 e2-bi ba-kal igi nu-mu-un-ši-bar-re
en: My friends, companions, acquaintances and esteemed colleagues look on with scorn as at a man who eats alone. My mother who begot me and whose breasts are crescent-shaped has snatched from my mouth my contented consumption of milk. My father who raised me in his lap has cast me aside. My merciful lady whose house is treasured no longer notices me.

akk: ĝiš ḫul gurun nu-il2-la-gin7 lu2 na-ma-ši-ḫul2-le
en: As happens to a sickly tree that has borne no fruit, no one rejoices over me. I am fresh fruit but I have no buds and I do not …….
May my king care for me and may I return to my former status.
…… to my king who heeds prayers. 1 line fragmentary …… Nibru …….

Like a sheep I set my mouth to eating grass and I am unfamiliar with washing with soap. Like an ox under a yoke which it cannot support, I have been driven out into the high plains. Like a cow whose calf is not close by, I utter pitiful cries. As happens to a ……, hands seize me. As happens to a boat which is not anchored to a firm quay, I drift in the wind.

akk: lugal ^d-utu-gin7 šag4 kalam-ma mu-un-zalag-ga  u3-na-dug4  i-^d-utu ab-sin2-ta ib2-ta-an-zig3-ga  lugal idim-bi-še3 ab-šid(source: SIPA)-de3-a  u3-na-de3-taḫ
en: Say this to the king who like the sun has made the heart of the Land radiant. Repeat it to the one who removed oppressive toil from the furrow, who {defeated} { confronted} Tidnum and holds its sceptre, who is counted as its honoured king. This is what {Lugal-nesaĝe} { Lugal-šu} , a citizen of Nibru and your servant, says:

akk: šul-a-lum nu-zu-ĝu10 saĝ-ki ba-gid2  til4 ak-ĝu10 mu-e-pad3  iri kur2-ra tum12^mušen--gin7 še mi-in-ša4  šag4-ne-ša4 la-ba-an-tuku  ur-gin7 ki gam-ma nu-zu šu dag-dag-ge ba-si  mušen šu sur2-du3^mušen--ta dal-a-gin7   igi la2 e2 lugal-ĝa2-ke4 ib2-sig9-ge inim-ĝar gig ma-la2
en: A punishment which I do not understand has ravaged me and I have wailed my lamenting. In a strange city I moan like a dove and receive no mercy. I am constantly restless like a dog which does not know where to settle down. I am watchful like a bird which has flown from the claws of a falcon. My exuberance has perished in blight like a garden that has not been {watered} { tended} . Envy within my king's palace overwhelms me and a bad reputation besets me.

akk: zaraḫ-e X X X X […]  gud-gin7 mur-ĝa2 eme ZU /ĜA2^?-\ […]   peš amar-ĝu10 gud3-bi […] zi ba-ni-in-gi4 ka u2 gu7 /ba^?-\-[…]  ug5-ga ki nu-tum2-ma-me-en še-gin7 ar3-[ar3 …]  šeš-ĝu10 lu2 kur2 nu-me-a igi tur mu-/un\-[…]  X […]  /KA\ […]  sag9-ga X […]
en: Grief ……. Woe ……. Like an ox I am overwhelmed, …… my fodder. My descendants and offspring are on good terms …… their nest, …… the mouth for eating food. {As happens on} { Like a distant …… from} the …… high plains where the winds blow, …… the mill. I will not be buried on dying but …… ground like grain. My brother, although not an enemy, …… contemptuously.

akk: lugal KA /NE\ […]  ^d-utu-gin7 X X X GA […]  mušen šu sur2-du3^mušen- X X X X X […]  ^ĝiš-kiri6 a dug4-ga-gin7 X […]  igi la2 e2 lugal-ĝa2-ke4 ib2-sig9-ge X […]  [u8]-e-a TUL2 E LA MU X RA ḪAR-re /ḫa\-X-X-[…]  gud-gin7 mur-ĝu10 eme^!--ba šid nu-tuku-gin7   peš^!- amar-ĝu10 gud3-ba  ba-ni-/ib2\-[…]  /edin\ KAL tum9 dal-a-ta RI ba9-ra2-gin7 e2 /ar3\-[ar3-ra ba-…]  /ug5\-gin7 ki tum2-tum2-mu nu-zu še-gin7 ar3-[ar3 …]
en: The king ……, …… like Utu.

…… a bird …… the claws of a falcon. …… like a garden which has been watered. Envy within my king's palace overwhelms me and ……. Grief ……. Woe ……. Like an ox I am overwhelmed, like …… my fodder. My descendants and offspring are worried in their nests. Like a distant …… from the …… high plains where the winds blow, …… the mill. I will not experience being buried as befits the dead but …… ground like grain.
Say to the governor and temple administrator what Ur-Enlila says:
The irrigation ditch which has been cleared was bringing water but {Enlil-diĝirĝu} { Enlil-aĝu} { Enlilaĝu} and Ḫanzamu have drawn off the water and taken it from the ditch.
And what Lugal-Ane says:

akk: ^m-lugal-an-ne2 na-ab-be2-a  ĝe26-e pa5 1(DIŠ)-am3 za-e pa5 1(DIŠ)-am3 ensi2 pa5 1(DIŠ)-am3  erin2 id2-zu nu-ma pa5-bi a i-ib2-tum3  ĝa2-a saḫ6-bi a ma-ab-tum3  a-ma-ru-kam
en: I proposed, " {Water should be brought} { The irrigation should be done} on the basis of one ditch for me, one ditch for you and one ditch for the governor," but they did not agree. Your canal has no workers but its ditch brings water. It brings water for me unchecked. My workforce is inadequate so send me five or {10} { 60} able-bodied men. It is urgent.
Say to our king what the governor and temple administrator say:

akk: [a]-/šag4\ da-ab-ta^ki- šar2-šar2-šar2^iku--bi  bur3^iku--am3 sa-dur2 a-šag4-ga-bi  ^m-iq-bi-sum2 u3 a-bi-qa2-ti-e inim mu-da-an-ĝar-re-eš  tukum-bi lugal-me an-na-kam  ra-gaba ḫu-mu-ši-in-gi4-gi4-ma  kiĝ2 a-ak bulug /a\-šag4 inim dug4 ḫu-mu-ni-ib-[X]
en: The three šar of the field Dabta are assigned for the benefit of Enlil { , Ninlil} and Ninurta. Of this, {three bur } { three BURgunû } are the portion of the men in charge of the requisitions. Iqbisum and Abī-qātī have made a claim over one bur at the bottom of the field. If our king consents, he should send a courier and should …… the instructions for doing the work and for the boundary stakes of the field.

akk: ^ĝiš-al-ta ba-dub2 kiĝ2-še3 ba-ak  erin2 taḫ-ḫu-um engar šag4-gud lu2 ^ĝiš-apin-na nu-me-a  gud dili-dili-ta a-šag4 ĝiš bi2-ur3  al i3-ak-en-de3-en lugal-me ḫe2-en-zu  a-šag4 me-am3^ki- [šar2-šar2-šar2]^iku--am3  eš2-gar3 ^d-en-lil2 u3 ^d-nin-urta  šag4-bi-ta BUR3gunû-BUR3gunû-BUR3gunû^iku--am3  šukur2 lu2 niĝ2-PAD-e-ne  al-ta ba-dub2  erin2-ta ḫe2-X-a  (scribal error for erin2 taḫ-ḫu-um)   kiĝ2-še3 sar a-šag4-ga lu2 apin-bi nu-bi  iq-bi-sum2 u3 a^!--/bi-qa2-ti\  inim mu-e-de-ĝar-re-eš  tukum-bi lugal-ĝu10  an-na-kam  ra-gaba ḫu-mu-un-gi4-gi4  kiĝ2 ak bulug a-šag4-ga-bi  inim dug4-ga14 mu-ni-ib-X-/ne\
en: Two iku at its …… and the …… area facing the field have been hoed and worked upon. Workers, extra labourers, farmers, ox-drivers and ploughmen being unavailable, the field has been harrowed with single oxen and we do the work with hoes. Our king should know this.

The three šar of the field Meam are assigned for the benefit of Enlil and Ninurta. Of this, three BURgunû are the portion of the men in charge of the requisitions. Two iku which are at its …… have been hoed and ……. Ploughmen are not available for work on a plot in the field. Iqbisum and Abī-qātī have made a claim against you. If my king consents, he should send a courier. They …… the instructions for doing the work and for the boundary stakes of the field.
Say to my brothers what Aba-taḫ-lugalĝa says:

akk: al-su3-ud kaskal i-im-re7-de3-en  u3 lugal gen6-na lugal-me /ĝiri3^?-\ ba-an-/us2\  kaskal-kaskal-e kaskal ba-an-taḫ  ama-me   dag-gi4-me ud /na\-an-šu2-uš-a lul-aš  1(DIŠ) sila3 mun 1(DIŠ) sila3 gazi  [X] UŠ šu-ta e-[…]  1(DIŠ) šag4-ga-du3^tug2-  lu2 du ḫu-mu-/e^?-\-[X]  kaskal-me al-su3-ud  a-ma-ru-kam
en: We are to go on journeys that are long and now the just king, our king, draws near . Journey is to be added to journey after journey. I shall not be able to look after our mother. Take great care that the sun does not set over our neighbourhood before you have …… one litre of salt, one litre of mustard { , …… from the hand,} and one …… garment for travellers. Our journeys will be long. It is urgent.
Traveller, traveller, say to my mother what Ugubi says:

akk: urim2^ki- iri giri17-zal ^d-nanna-kam  eridug^ki- iri ḫe2-ĝal2 ^d-en-ki-ka3-ka  ĝe26-e eĝer ^ĝiš-ig e2 nar-gal-ka al-tuš-en  igi-tum3 la2 mu-gu7-en  nam-ba-da-ug7-en  ninda ba-ra-gibil-la2 kaš ba-ra-gibil-la2  lu2 du kaskal-e šu taka4-ma-ab  a-ma-ru-kam
en: Urim is the joyful city of Nanna. But I sit behind the door of the chief musician's house in Eridug, the abundant city of Enki. Longing consumes me. I don't want to die because the bread is never fresh and the beer is never fresh. Send a messenger to me at once. It is urgent.
Say to Ilak-ni’id what Šamaš-ṭāb says:

akk: kaskal itid 1(DIŠ) ud 15-kam ud IM-za ḫe2-bi2-DU  a2 aĝ2-ĝa2-zu na-ma-tum3  bar-zu  ĝiri3-zu   2(MIN) anše-ĝiš-am3 kug-bi 4(LIMMU5) giĝ4  1(DIŠ) šag4-ga-du3 gada kug-bi MAŠ giĝ4  a2 ^ĝiš-ma2-zu 1(DIŠ) giĝ4  a bi2-si-ig  zig3-ga dili-dili-zu šag4-bi-ta nu-ĝal2
en: It is a journey of one month and fifteen days, and ……. Why on the third day of the month have you not brought your news to me {at} { from} Niqqum? I have looked out for you and your route was arranged. In question are: 4 shekels of silver for 2 yoked donkeys, 1/2 shekel of silver for 1 linen …… garment, 1 shekel for your rental of the boat, and 1 and 1/3 shekels for your …… rental of the boat. 1 line unclear Your additional expenditure is not included in this total.

akk: ĝeštug2-zu ḫe2-en-ĝal2  ud-da-ta a2 aĝ2-ĝa2-zu ḫe2-em-tum3
en: I have calculated the cost of two loads of purple wool for you. The price is {1 and 2/3} { 2/3} mana of silver -- bring me the equivalent in tin. And look out for quartz , …… stone and …… stone. Your extra silver and the capital have been held for you and recorded on a clay tablet. From now on news should be brought about you. It is urgent.

akk: dumu diĝir-ra-ni-ir gub-ba a-a ama-ni ni2 teĝ3-ĝe26-e-ra  u3-na-de3-taḫ  ^a-la^!--ad-^ d-alad ^d-lamma diĝir  kal-la-ĝu10  (ša^!- i-di) ulutim2 alan zil2-zil2-i  me-te nam-dub-sar-ra  ^m-lugal-nesaĝ-e nu-eš3 ^d-en-lil2-la2 lu2  lugal-la
en: Say this to Enlil-massu who {enhances} { pronounces} advice and counsel, the mellifluous mouth which makes speech persuasive. Repeat it to the son who serves his god and respects his father and mother. {Say it a third time} { Repeat it} to my protective guardian and propitious spirit -- the precious powers -- whose form and stature are pleasing, honour to the scribal craft, {hero among the administrators and ornament of the palace} { hero among the administrators} { ornament of the palace and hero among the administrators} who reinstates decrees and greatly pleases the heart of his king. This is what Lugal-nesaĝe, the nueš priest of Enlil and person who brings laughter to the king, son of {Enlil-alsag} { Zuzu} , the scholar of Nibru and your father, says:

akk: nam-zu ib2-gu7-en  i-si-iš-zu  (ta-az-me-tu-ka) ib2-sig9-ge-en   maḫ-zu  (ĜIŠ-KU-ka) ib2-sur-re-en
en: When {your mighty ……} { my ……} completely crushed me, my heart sank and {thirst and hunger} { hunger and thirst} wasted me away. Your status consumes me, your complaints crush me, your majesty oppresses me, your {slander} { your storminess} puts an end to me. {After being attentive I have been abandoned} { Despite being attentive I have been cut off from my position} . {Deceit has emerged from my wisdom and sympathy} { Deceit has replaced wisdom and sympathy} .

akk: ni2 te-te-ĝu10-ta šag4-ĝu10 uš2 lugud ba-si     [ni2 te]-te-ĝu10-ne šag4-ĝu10 uš2 lugud2-lugud2 X [X]      (a-ša-[X-X])     ni2 teĝ3-teĝ3-ĝe26-de3 šag4-ĝu10 uš2 lugud ab-si
en: {After my becoming sorely afraid, my heart is full of blood and gore. As a result of deep concern, I am in distress.} { On my becoming sorely afraid, my heart …… blood and much gore. As a result of deep concern, I am in distress.} { As a result of deep concern, I am in distress. As a result of becoming sorely afraid, my heart is full of blood and gore.} So long as I have not gone to the place where destiny is decided, may your countenance favour me in accordance with the instructions of Enlil.

akk: ^d-nin-tin-ug5-ga aĝrig zid e2-kur-/ra\  a-zu kalam-ma-ra u3-na-a-dug4  nin tu6 dug4-ga-ni uĝ3 šar2 til3-le  mu7-mu7-ma-ni uĝ3 sag9-ga  nin šag4-ne-ša4 lu2 til3-til3 šudu3-de3 ki aĝ2-ra  u3-na-de3-taḫ  til3-la ug5-ga  za-e-me-en  lu2-kud-lu2-kud-ba du7-du7 gal-bi-me-en  ^m-^ d-inana-ka dumu-munus ^d-en-lil2-a2-maḫ  geme2-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Say to Nintinuga, the reliable stewardess of the E-kur, the physician of the Land; repeat to the lady, whose incantation heals the multitude of people, whose spells make the people recover, to {my}{ the} relenting lady, who loves to revive the people and loves supplications, the merciful and compassionate one who listens to prayers. You are the caretaker of the living and the dead; you are the great healer of all the crippled ones. This is what Inanaka, the daughter of Enlil-a-mah, your maidservant says:

akk: […] mu-da-an-TAR […] RA X […] X  nin-ĝu10 e2 ma-an-du3-ma igi la2-bi ba-tuš-en  lu2  la-ba-an-tuku  im-ma-si im-ma-dirig-ga-ta
en: I have fallen ill {for a second time}{ twice }, but I do not yet know the divine oracle concerning {my being in agonies}{ these agonies}. { …….} My lady, a house has been built for me, but I have to sit there with longing eyes. My valued acquaintances {keep}{ stay} away from me. I have no one who would take care of me. Since this is full, too full for me, I am distressed.

akk: tukum-bi nin-ĝa2 an-na-kam  u3-ba-sag9-ge nin-ĝu10 lu2-kud-da du7-du7
en: If it pleases my lady, {and the asag demon which is in my body leaves my body, and thus}{ may the asag demon which is in my body leave my body, so that} {it allows me}{ I can} step again on the {path}{ ground} of life with my feet. {I will then be your maidservant, the courtyard sweeper of your temple, and will serve you. Furthermore after I have recovered, I will name you, my lady, as "the healer of the crippled"} { I will then be her maidservant, the courtyard sweeper of her temple, and will serve her. Furthermore after I have recovered, I will name her, my lady, as "the healer of the crippled"}.
Say to Enlil-massu what Inim-Inana says:

akk: inim na-me ma-an-ne-eš-ma lul-aš ba-ḫul2-le  ^d-lamma ud til3-la-a kal-le lugal-šu2  ^m-na-<bi>-^d-en-lil2 u3 ^d-en-lil2-al-sag9  um-mi-a šu igi /du\-zu-ne  ^d-nin-imma3 diĝir-zu  u3 ^d-nisaba nin ĝeštug2 daĝal-la-ke4  ĝeštug2 ḫa-ra-ab-šum2-mu-ne  niĝ2 im-ma im-sar-re-a  iri šu-bi nu-gi4 al-me-a nu-e-zu-u3  2(MIN) giĝ4 kug-babbar 1(DIŠ) tug2 2(MIN) ^tug2-bar-sig9  lu2-gen6-na šu mu-ra-da13-/da13\ šu ti-ba-ab  a-ma-ru-kam
en: They told me everything and I am pleased beyond exaggeration. May the precious protective power of a lifetime; Lugal-šu, Nabi-Enlil and Enlil-alsag, the scholars who precede you; and Ninimma, your own goddess, and Nisaba, the lady of broad wisdom, give wisdom to you. You did not know what was written on the tablet or that the city would be unforthcoming. Lu-gena is sending you two shekels of silver, one garment and two sashes. Accept them. But your mother should not touch the remaining assets. It is urgent.
Say to Lugal-ibila what Inim-Inana says:

akk: eme-gir15-še3 gu2-zu na-ab-šub-be2-en  2(MAN)-kam-ma-še3 eme  lu2 mu-e-ši-in-gi4-gi4  […] ḫe2-ĝal2  lu2-tur igi-zu-še3 al-durun^un--na  e2-dub-ba-a-ta na-ab-ta-ed2-en  na-an-ga-ma lu2 na-me lul i-ri-ib-sig10-ge5  ugu ad-da-na-še3 ga-am3-ĝen a-ra-ab-be2  en-na ĝiškim ĝe26-e u3 za-e inim i3-bal-en-da-na  lu2-u3 mu-e-ši-in-gi4-gi4-a  lu2-tur šu nam-bi2-bar-re-en
en: Don't neglect the Sumerian language. For the second time, I am sending you a message in correct language. { …… is …….} Don't let the children who sit before you go out from the school. However much anyone misleads you and says "I want to go" on account of his father, until you and I agree on a sign and a messenger comes to you, don't let the children out. {……} { A father entrusts his child's well-being to your ……} . It is urgent.
Speak to my god: this is what Gudea, your servant, says:

akk: udu-gin7 sipad gen6-na nu-tuku  na-gada gen6-na nu-mu-un-tum2-tum2-mu
en: I am like a sheep who has no reliable shepherd; there is no reliable herdsman to lead me on.

akk: dam-gara3 saĝ du3-du3 nu-zu bal-še3^!- mu-X-ak  anše-gin7 ^kuš-usan3 ḫul-ĝal2-la ḫul-ĝal2-la bi2-in-[X]
en: An unintelligent merchant transported me for trading purposes. With a vicious whip he …… me cruelly like a donkey.

akk: saĝ i3-tuku inim nu-um-me^!- igi tuku igi mu-[…]-/un\-X  niĝ2 ak-a-ĝu10 igi^?- a-ra2 7-e nu-un-DU X X  zag-ba a-ra2 7-e nu-mu-un-da-pad3-[X]-X
en: I am noble but do not utter a word, being vigilantly ……. Seven times …… has not …… my accomplishments. Seven times my god has not been able to find out about their extent.
My god, I am not one to be hostile. May you show sympathy towards me once again.

akk: ^d-nin-i3-si-in-na dumu-saĝ an kug-ga saĝ il2 nin-e-ne  X [X] X-a^!- gal en ^d-nu-nam-nir-ra me e2-kur-ra šu du7  X X [X] X gi4 ama gal ^d-nin-lil2-la2^!- inim šag4-ga-na niĝ2 di  /dam\ [(X)] /ur\-saĝ gal en ^d-pa-bil-saĝ-ĝa2 šul gaba-ri nu-tuku  /simx(GIG)\-simx(GIG)-ma ki ku10-ku10-ga-ba šag4-bi lu2 nu-zu  kug /^d-nin\-i3-si-in-na ^tug2-^ !-niĝ2-la2 sed4-de3 ki-bi-še3 bi2-ib2-gi4^!--/gi4^!-\  ama kalam-ma a^!--zu gal saĝ gig2-ga šim-mu2 uĝ3 lu-a  /diĝir nin\ e2-gal-/maḫ\ KA×X-KA×X-ga-ta lu2-bi mu-un-silim-e  X [X] X X lu2 til3-le^!--de3 DI X  A [X] (X) zu ĝiš tuku nin-ĝu10-ra u2-na-a-dug4
en: Speak to Ninisina, first-born child of holy An, eminent among ladies, …… of Lord Nunamnir; who perfects the divine powers of E-kur, …… of the great mother Ninlil, with notions in her heart which are expressed ; wife of the great hero, Lord Pabilsaĝ, youth who has no rival; holy Ninisina, you reapply a dressing to soothe the dark place of sores which no one can understand; mother of the Land, great physician of the black-headed, incantation priestess of the widespread people -- from the namtar demon and …… which are settled in a man's body and which no one knows how to expel, divine lady of the Egal-maḫ, with the help of …… you will make that person well again. …… to keep a person alive ……, …… who knows and listens, to my lady:
This is what Nanna-manšum, the scribe, son of Ilšu-muballiṭ, your servant, says:

akk: ud AN X a2 mu-un-ta-e3 KA×X-ĝa2 bi2-ib-ĝar «KI»  šu-i lu2^?- X gu-za-la2 diĝir-re-e-ne-ke4 mu-un-šum2-en  [X (X)] nibru^ki- ^si-isin2-na^ki- gu2 mu-ĝar-/re\-eš  [X]-ma-teĝ3-ĝe26-e-eš nam-til3-ĝu10 KA-KA-ne-ne la-ba-an-šum2^!--mu-uš  ^tug2-niĝ2-la2^!- nu^!--keše2-da ba-e-šub-bu-uš ba-e-dim2-eš  tum12^mušen- niga mi-ni-in-DU X-ĝu10-še3^?- ba-an-TI-TI
en: When …… took care , she placed on my ……. The barber ……, the throne-bearer of the gods has given me ……. Nine times she has placed on my head …… and battle-axe. …… gathered in Nibru and Isin. They approached me but did not give their …… for my life. They have applied and created a dressing which does not hold. She made a fattened dove come , for my …….

akk: ^d-nanna dumu-saĝ ^d-en-lil2-la2 šudu3-de3 ki aĝ2-ra  u3-na-a-dug4   en iti6 daĝal bur2 men an uraš-a  (a-na be-lim ša ṣi2-it wa-ar-ḫi-šu ra-bi-iš šu-pa-ru-ru a-ge-e ša-me-e u3 er-ṣe-tim)   en gal lu2 til3-til3 ki aĝ2-me-en a-a saĝ gig2-ga  (be-lum ra-bu-u2 ša a-we-lam bu-lu-ṭu2 i-ra-mu a-bi ṣa-/al\-ma-<at> qa2-<qa2>-di-im)   lugal šag4-la2 sug4(source: BU) si-il(source: GI4) u3 du8 mu-un-zu-a^!-  (a-na šar-ri-im re-me-ni-im ša^!- /ru^?--ma^?-\-am u3 pa-/ṭa-ra-am\ mu-du^!--u2)   diĝir arḫuš sud šag4 gur-ru a-ra-zu-/e\ ĝiš tuku  (a-na i-lim re-me-ni-im ta-a-a-ri-im še-mi te-es3-li-tim)  u3-ne-de3-taḫ
en: Say to Nanna, the firstborn son of Enlil, who loves prayers; repeat to the lord whose light spreads widely, the crown of heaven and earth, the great lord who loves to revive man; the father of the black-headed; the merciful king, who can untie and release; the merciful, compassionate god who listens to appeals:

akk: nam-en-na šu du7 aga zid /gur3-ru\-me-en  (be-lu-tam šu-uk-lu-lu a-ga-am ki-nam na-šu-u2)   muš3-me ḫuš ulutim2-ta nir-ra alan kug ḫi-li du8-du8  (zi-mu ru-šu-/tum\ bu-na-nu tu-ru-ṣu2-tum la-nu-um el-lum /ša^?-\ […]-du-u2^!-)  nam-maḫ-zu kur-kur-ra dul-la  me-lem4-zu  an kug-ga šu2-a  (ša-me-e el-lu-tim sa3-/aḫ\-pu)   /ni2 gal\-zu su zig3 im-du8-du8  ([…] X X ša-lu-ma-tam ma-lu)   […] /kalam\-e zag dib  ([…] i-na ma-tim šu-tu-uq)   [ud e3-ta ud šu2]-/uš\-e za-/e\ maḫ-me-en  ([i-na ṣi2-it ša-am]-/ši\ u3 e-re-eb [ša-am]-ši at-ta-ma ṣi-ra-a-ti)   […] /an-šag4-ta^!- ma-ra\-an-šum2 an /šu-zu-uš\ mu-un-ĝar  ([… id]-di-kum ša-me-e i-na qa2-/ti\-[ka (…)])   [an ki]-bi-ta lugal-bi za-e-me-en nam-bi i3-/tar-re\  (ša-me-e u3 er-ṣe-tam be-el-šu-nu at-ta-ma ši-ma-ti-šu-nu ta-ši-a-am)
en: You who are perfect in lordship and wear the legitimate headdress, the one with gleaming appearance and noble countenance, holy form endowed lavishly with beauty: your greatness covers all countries. Your fearsome radiance overwhelms the holy sky. Your great awesomeness is imbued with terror. …… is pre-eminent in the Land. You are indeed glorious from east to west. From the interior of heaven …… has given you ……, and entrusted you with the heavens. You are the king of heaven and earth; it is you who decide their fate.

akk: lugal inim sag9-sag9-ge diĝir-re-e-ne-er gub-ba  ninda nidba  u3-na-a-dug4  alan sukud-da dim2-ma ad gi4-gi4 in-tuku  šag4-la2 sug4 šag4 kalam-ma dug3-ga  u3-ne-de3-taḫ  ^m-inim-^d-en-lil2-la2 dub-sar dumu <^d->suen-pa-lil2  arad-zu na-ab-be2-a
en: Say to the king who entreats the gods fervently and, serving the gods, prepares the food offerings; repeat to the one elevated in stature who has the ability to give advice and counsel, the merciful one who makes the Land feel content -- this is what Inim-Enlila the scribe, son of Suen-palil, your servant, says:

akk: nam-tag-ĝu10 nu-zu nam-tag-ĝa2 ĝeštug2 la-ba-ši-ĝal2  nam im-ri-a ḫi-iš6-ši i-si-iš-bi ib2-gu7-en  ĝiri3-pax(PAD)-ra2-ĝu10 šag4 iri kur2-ra-še3 a nam-ma-an-tum3^?-  … X X /šag4\ …
en: I do not know my punishment: my punishment has not been considered yet. I am devoured by sorrow at the fate of the captive families. Let my bones not be carried off by water to a foreign city. unknown no. of lines missing
1 line fragmentary may not be part of this composition unknown no. of lines missing

akk: [u3]-/na-a\-[dug4]  ad gi4-gi4  X […]  diĝir me ba-a inim dug3-dug3 u3-luḫ gi-rin saĝ-/ĝa2\ [X (X)]  diĝir gada la2 abzu saĝĝa gal ba-an-gi4 sag9 dug4-ga-ni saĝ-ba du  igi taraḫ abzu uru17-bi en ĝeštug2 daĝal til-la-ni  lagar3 ad-ḫal an-na zu-a diĝir na-me nu-mu-e-da-sa2  en ^d-lamma-^d-lamma igi dug3 gal nir gub-bu  nidba šum2 ^d-a-nun-na diĝir gal-gal-e-ne  na de5 /e3\ utaḫ-ḫa-ke4 kug ^d-inana-ra tum2-ma  e-ne-da nu nam-en nam-lugal-la ^ĝiš-ĝidru maḫ la-ba-an-šum2  ^d-nin-šubur diĝir šag4-la2 sug4 šudu3 a-ra-zu ĝiš tuku u3-ne-de3-taḫ  ^m-kug-^d-nanna šim-mu2 dumu lugal-ka-gen6-na arad-zu na-be2-a
en: Say to 1 line missing to the counsellor who constantly cares for ……, the god who distributes the divine powers, who utters pleasing words, who …… a verdant branch by his head; the linen-clad god of the abzu, the chief administrator, who makes the oracular responses favourable, whose words are pre-eminent; the powerful one at the bow of the boat "Stag of the Abzu", the lord of wide and complete wisdom, the minister who knows An's secrets, with whom no god can compare; the lord of the protective goddesses; him whose great sweet eyes inspire confidence, who provides the Anuna gods, the great gods, with food offerings; the adviser who comes forth from the skies, who is worthy of holy Inana; without whom no lord or king could receive the lofty sceptre -- to Ninšubur, the merciful god who listens to prayers and supplications, repeat: this is what Kug-Nanna the incantation priest, the son of Lugal-ka-gena, your servant, says:

akk: [X] X-me-en šu-gi4 nu-silim-me-en ĝiš-šu dab5-/be\ X [(X)] X-/me\-en  […] X X X AN NE X X […]  […] X X […]  […] X gul-gin7 ĜAR X [X] X LAGAB X […] X-ĝa2 mu-ni-ib2-gul-gul-e  /ŠEŠ\ X X MU X nam-uš2 kur2-ra igi tur-ĝu10 ba-an-du3 A MI BI ak-ĝu10 in nam-ma-ĝa2-ĝa2  gu5-li-ĝu10 e-sir2-ra ka nu-mu-un-ba gu2 ki-še3 bi2-in-ĝar  tukum-bi diĝir-ĝu10-ra an-na-/kam\  šag4 ib2-ba-zu ga-ab-ḫuĝ-e ur5-zu ḫe2-bur2-e  maškim ḫul ĝa2-ĝa2-da ḫe2-eb2-si-il su-ĝa2 ḫe2-/da\-ab-dal  a2-sag3 ĝiš-ge-en-gen6-na-ĝu10 ḫe2-eb2-zi-zi ud ku10-ku10-ĝu10 ḫe2-NE-en-zalag  nir dugud-da-zu nu-mu-da-il2 ab-gul dug4-ga-ab  arad sun5-na-me nam-mu-til-e-/de3^?- ab\-gul dug4-ga-ab  ga-gin7 ĜA2 LI za-ra-/ta\ […] X […] nam-gur4-zu […]  ki-ĝu10-še3 ḫa-ba-X […]  X X X (X) […]
en: I am ……, I am an ailing old man, I am …… handcuffs. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing
1 line fragmentary 1 line unclear …… foreign plague …… looked at me contemptuously and insulted me for my doing ……. In the street my friend would not talk to me; he bent his head down.

If it pleases you, my god, allow me to soothe your angry heart, so that your spirit will be assuaged. May the maškim demon that perpetrates evil be ripped apart, so that he will flee my body. May the asag demon be extirpated from my limbs, so that my dark days will become bright. I cannot bear your heavy punishment any longer; declare that "It is over"! May I, the humble servant, not be destroyed; declare that "It is over"! Like milk …… your greatness ……, …… to my home. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

akk: [X X] /gibil^?--la\ […]  inim maḫ […]  id2-lu2-ru-gu2 a-ra2 maḫ [(X)] X AN […]  mu-še3 mu-ri-in-/sa4\  lu2 zid kug-sig17 mu-un-dadag-/ge\-[en]  lu2-erim2-e ud za-ḫa-al-e ba-ab-šum2-/mu\-[un]
en: 5 lines missing …… new ……. …… august words. Enki has named you with the name Id-lu-rugu , the sublime course ……. You cleanse the just man like gold, and you hand over the wicked to extinction.

akk: umuš ĝalga dim2-ma ga zid-de3-eš gu7-a  e-ne ad gal dug4-dug4  gal-zu maḫ dumu-saĝ ^d-en-ki-ke4  […] u3-tud kilib-ba-bi mu-e-šum2-/mu\  ^d-asar-lu2-ḫi ĝeštug2 /bad\ a-a-ni-gin7 gal-[zu]  igi-ĝal2-tuku niĝ2-nam buru3-buru3-e e-ne-/ra niĝ2-nam\ […]  nir-ĝal2 dumu abzu^!- ĝeštug2 kug šu du7 ^d-/marduk\ ĝalga tum2  alan maḫ an ki-a me niĝ2-nam-ma igi zu-zu
en: Nourished on the good milk of intelligence, advice and reason, his voice resounds loudly. August sage, firstborn son of Enki, he gives …… to all who are born. Profoundly intelligent, as wise as his father, possessed of understanding, Asarluḫi penetrates everything. Nothing …… him. Lordly son of the abzu, endowed with holy wisdom, he is Marduk, the bringer of counsel. Tall in stature, he can survey all the divine powers of heaven and earth.

akk: dumu ĝeštug2 daĝal šu du7 a-ra2 si gal gi ḫal-ḫal-la-ke4  ^d-asar-lu2-ḫi uru5 maḫ nam gal tar-re  šu bar a-ra2 niĝ2-nam nu-zu-zu  an gal an ki-še3 me ba-a  mu7-mu7 mu-e-šub-eš  diĝir igi sag9 igi ni10-ni10 nam-lu2-ulu3  ulutim2 ḫi-li sud tibira^ra- gal-an-zu kiĝ2 gal-le ak  ad gal di-kud eš3 maḫ-a inim-ma nu-kam3-me  a-ra2-ni maḫ šir3-ra-ni ga-am3-ed3 mu-ni pa ga-am3-e3
en: Son endowed with a broad understanding, whose movement is that of an animal with large horns in the split reeds; Asarluḫi, mighty deluge determining great fates, unleashed and knowing no course whatsoever! When great An shared out the divine powers for heaven and earth, incantations fell to your lot. Scanning all mankind with a glance, god of benign features, with an attractive physique; most skilled metalworker, creating masterpieces; counsellor and judge, whose word in the august sanctuary is unalterable and whose character is sublime: I shall exalt him in song and glorify his name.

akk: saĝ gun3-gun3-nu abzu^!- sukkal-maḫ eridug^ki--ga  ^d-asar-lu2-ḫi nir-ĝal2  /enkum\ ninkum  ka kug ba-a-zu igi-bi ḫu-mu-un-/ši\-[ĝal2]  ud šu2-uš-e e3-bi za-ra ḫu-mu-ra-an-sig10-/ga14\  šu sikil ĝiri3 sikil niĝ2-nam kug-ku3-ug šu-luḫ dadag-ga  nam-šita4 e2-abzu zu2 keše2-bi za-e-me-en
en: Eloquent one of the abzu, great minister of Eridug, lordly Asarluḫi! The enkum and ninkum priests, the abgal and abrig priests, the …… priestesses and the …… all pay attention when you open your holy mouth. Daily as they go forth, they circumambulate you. Cleansing the purification rites with pure hands and pure tread, holy in every respect, you are the supervisor of the purification priests of E-abzu.

akk: kuara^ki- iri ki aĝ2 šag4-ge pad3-da-zu  ḫul2-la ḫu-mu-u8-da-an-tuš  ^d-asar-lu2-ḫi nun šag4 daĝal mu-še3 mu-ri-/in\-[sa4]  muš2-bi-še3 MI NI bi2-in-ak^?-  […]-/ba\-an nam-nin-e […]
en: Kuara, the beloved city which you have chosen in your heart, lives in joy because of you. The generous-hearted Prince  named you with the name Asarluḫi. 2 lines unclear or fragmentary up to 5 lines missing
3 lines fragmentary Let us …… praise you, the beneficent protective goddess of Bau.

akk: X X X X zu^?- a kar-ra X […] ([…] i-qa2-ab-/bu\-[u2 …]) X X X X ib2-be2-a a kar-ra X […] ([…] i-qa2-ab-/bu\-u2 X […]) X X DU ĝiškim-til3 BI^?- saĝ šu^?- X […] ([…] a-la^?--ki-šu ta-ki-/il\-[…]) X X NI ki^?- šu nu-la2-e-da usu i3-X […] ([X X] X X [X] X u2-ul i-ša-X X […]) X NE^?- niĝ2-tuk-u3 /nu\-[X]-X-du šu nu-la2-e-[da] (a-na ša-/ri\-im u2-/ul\ il-la-ak X […]) X LA2 X nu-X X [X] X-da dug3-ga DI X X (u2-/ul\ [X X] KI-it-ti X ŠA NU X […]) ma2-gur8 ^d-suen /sud-sud\ [nin] a-na-zu nu-zil2-zil2-i ([e]-le-pu [X X]-tum ša i-ša-ad-de3-ḫu /NIN mi\-[in-ki la X]) an-ti-bal ul gur3-ru [^d-]lamma a-na-zu nu-sag9 ([X] X X [X ul]-ṣa na-ši-a-at ^d-LAMA /mi\-[in-ki la X]) [^d-lamma] sag9-ga ^d-ba-u2 mi2-/bi\
en: 3 lines fragmentary She does not ……. She does not go to the rich …… nor ……. She does not ……. The barge of Suen as it proceeds -- lady, is not yours as beautiful? The joyous symbol of Inana -- protective goddess, is not yours as attractive? Let us …… praise you, the beneficent protective goddess of Bau.

akk: […] ĝiš-ta du-a-ni  ([…]-ši a-/la\-[ki-ša])   […] X X X […]  ([…] X X X […])   […]  ([…] X X X X X)   […]  ([…] X i-na i-di-šu ša-ki-[in])   […]  ([… ta-ad]-di-ni-šum-ma)   […]  ([…] ta-na-ad-di)   […] la-ba-ni10-ni10  (/in^?-\ […]-pa-at-su2 X X ba^?--nu u2-ul i-ik-lu5-šu)   […] X TUM^?- mu^?--un-da-ab-dub  (/ik^?-\-[X X (X)] X-ak-nu-šum-ma a-na ša-a-ši-im i-ik-mi-i-is-si2-X)   […] ud šu2-uš ĝiri3-X i3-im-X  (ba^?- ak X šu^?- šar-ru u4-mi-ša a-na še-pi-ša ša-pi-ik)   […] X dug3-zu nin-ĝu10 im-mi-in-ši-X  (i-na i-mi-it-ti-šu^?- X X-ki ṭa-ba-am be-el-ti i-ZA-[…])   [X X (X)] /giri17\-zal sug4 nin a-na-zu nu-zil2-zil2-i  (bi-it ni-gu-tim ša ta-ši-il-tam ma-lu-u2 NIN mi-in-ki /la\ [X])   [X X] X maḫ kalam-ma ^d-lamma a-na-zu nu-sag9  (u4-um ri-ša-tim ṣi2-rum ša ma-ti ^d-LAMA mi-in-ki la [X])   ^d-lamma sag9-ga ^d-ba-u2 mi2-bi <X X ga-mu-u8-de3-en>  (^d-LAMA da-mi-iq-tum ša ^d-ba-u2 te-ek-/ni\-[tum])
en: 8 lines missing or fragmentary ……, daily …… at her feet. My lady, at his right side you …… your good …… towards him. …… full of glory -- lady, is not yours as beautiful? …… magnificently in the Land -- protective goddess, is not yours as attractive? Let us …… praise you, the beneficent protective goddess of Bau.

akk: munus zid nin šu tab-ba til3 mu2-da-ni i3-dug4-ga  (MUNUS ZID ru-ba-tum ka-mi-is-tum ša ba-la-as-sa3 /iq\-[…])   a2-gu2-zig3-ta zur-zur-re-eš2 zag-ga-na šub-bu-dam  (i-na ki-ma še-er-tim i-na ku-te-en-ni-i zu-X X a-/na\ [X X])   mu-zu gug2 i3 ga-gin7 ka-ge mu-na-ab-si-a  (šum-ki ki-ma ku-uk-ki šam-ni u3 lil2-di pi-a-am ma-[X-X])   niĝ2 sila^si-la2--ta de6^de--a-na kaš sur-ra-na saĝ-bi  (mi-im-ma ša iš-tu su2-qi2-im i-na ba-ba-li-ša rex(SIPAD)-eš-ti [X X])   a2 ud-da eš3 ĝir2-su2^ki- igi mu-ri-ib-du8-am3  (u4-mi-ša i-na bi-tim gir-ši-im i-na-aṭ-ṭa-[al])   ud šu2-uš-e zalag-ga-ni igi-zu-še3 mu-ni-ib-dib-dib-a  (u4-mi-ša /nam\-ri-iš i-na maḫ-ri-ki i-[ta-al-la-ak])
en: Good woman, prayerful lady for whom has been decreed the creation of life -- each day as she goes about, conversing, from early in the morning she is to be …… at her side with honour. Your name fills the mouth like cakes, butter and cream. Whatever she brings from the street and the beer she brews are of the best quality. She instructs people to provide her with the best produce of her orchards. As a daily task, she inspects the shrine Ĝirsu. Daily she passes before you in radiance.

akk:
^d-/lamma\ X lu2-ulu3-ba dam a-a-še3 mu-na-e-šum2 (^d-LAMA a-na a-wi-il-tim ša-a-ti mu-tam ki-ma [a-bi ta-ad-di-ni-šim-ma]) [dam a-a-še3 mu-na]-e-šum2 dumu a-šag4 šukur2-še3 mu-na-e-šum2 (mu-tam ki-ma a-bi ta-ad-di-ni-šim-ma […]) […] X inim in-de2 lu2 i3-DU (bi-X-sa3 u2-X-ma mi-im-ma X X […]) […] X šum2 X X X niĝ2-su-ub ak-a (MUNUS X […]) munus zid ^d-utu kalam-ma diĝir-ĝa2 me-teš2 ga-i-i sukkal-maḫ ama ^d-ba-u2 zi lugal-la u3-tud saĝ šum2 (mu-X-ḫi-iš-tum) me-te ^d-ba-u2 itima kug-ga ḫe2-du7-bi-im ^d-lamma lu2 sizkur-ra ^d-ba-u2 ur2-saĝ ḪI ZA KA^?- nam-lu2-u18-lu ki aĝ2 niĝ2-ba-bi ḫul2-le-za ^d-lamma sag9-ga ^d-ba-u2 mi2-bi su3-ud-še3 ga-mu-e-i-i-de3-en X saĝ sig7 ḫi-li gur3-ru KIŠI4^?--KIŠI4^?- ^na4-za-gin3-a […] sig7-ga umuš ĝar šita-e gun3-gun3^gu2--a^?- […] DU X X MA RU X IGI X DI^?- IB […] lugal-še3^!- ḫe2-em-ši-ni-ĝal2 […] X gub^?--bu-zu lal3 X […] […] X X DAG^?- X RU X […] […] X gen6-na UD-UD MA KA […]-ra munus zid ^d-lamma-ĝu10 [^d-lamma sag9-ga ^d-ba-u2] /mi2\-bi su3-ud-še3 ga-mu-e-i-i-de3-en […] ḪA^?- UM^?- MA^?- ŠE3 la2-a i-im-me ZA UD DU UR4 ak nir-ĝal2 ki aĝ2 ^d-ba-u2 nin X saĝ ga zid-da-ke4 en ^d-ig-alim-ma-ke4 ĝidru-bi ḫu-mu-ĝal2 me-teš2-bi munus zid ^d-lamma-ĝu10 nin nam gu3 de2-a-za ^d-lamma sag9-ga ^d-ba-u2 mi2-bi su3-ud-še3 ga-mu-e-i-i-de3-en nin gu7 naĝ KA NI^?- X X nam-ḫe2-a zu2 keše2 i ki-tuš ḫe2-ĝal2 abzu-ta DIN-bi-a gu3 nun di
^d-lamma-ĝu10 /nin\ […] munus zid giri17-zal il2-il2-i šudu3 inim-ma [ĝiš tuku] inim dug3 eme nin niĝ2-gen6-e ki /aĝ2\-X /sukkal\-maḫ ama ^d-ba-u2 nundum^?- kug-babbar-ra-ke4 X ĝeštug me-ze2 UD-UD-e SI A munus zid ^d-lamma-ĝu10 ulutim2 lu2 nu-sig10-ge5-zu igi X X TI-ĝu10 mi2-bi su3-ud-še3 ga-mu-u8-en-de3-en
kuš X me a dadag-ga sag9-ga gal-bi dirig-ga-am3 AD ZA X X DAG^?- X ḪU NE zi-pa-aĝ2 X [X] X X X sal-sal siki sur-sur GAR3 mun-na SA^?- X RA^?- [X X (X)] /unu2\ šuba sud-sud zag-še siki […] X ZI-gin7 il2-il2-i a2-ur2 ud-gin7 zalag-/zalag^!-\-[ga-am3] X X ŠE3-/la^?-\-gin7 la-la-ĝal2 a2-diš-kuš3 /sal\-[la-am3] X-ge KA tum2-ma šu-si kug-babbar […] [^na4-]nir7 SUM […] [X] e2^?--gal X UN […] [munus] zid ^d-lamma-ĝu10 /ulutim2\ lu2 nu-sig10-/ge5\-[zu] [mi2]-bi su3-ud-še3 ga-mu-u8-/en-de3\-[en]
sukkal niĝ2 nu-ḫa-lam-e nin ki ur5 /sag9\ […] šag4 sud TA lu2^?- GIM DU LI […] SIG4^?- ^ĝiš-ĝišnimbar^?- ŠU RI A TUM TI TA […] ib2-ib2 daĝal u2 X (X) MA […] me-te-ĝal2 mu-zu X X-gin7 NA MUNUS […] X nu-NUNUZ-a niĝ2 šu DI SI SAR-SAR nin X X X-gin7 la2
BA^?- sal-la KA tuku4-tuku4-e munus zid ^d-lamma-ĝu10 /alan\ šu-a gi4-a-za [mi2]-/bi su3\-ud-še3 ga-mu-u8-en-de3-en […] ga i3-ti-ir-da-gin7 TA^?- lu-ug-ge
en: Protective goddess, …… you have given this person a husband in place of a father. You have given her a husband in place of a father, you have given her a son in place of a smallholding. 2 lines fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing

I shall praise the good woman, the Utu of the Land, my goddess. Mother Bau's august minister, who creates life for the king! Holy messenger who brings the tablet of life down from the interior of heaven, who sets rain on its way from heaven, and brings forth abundance! Expeditious, an honour to Bau and an ornament of the holy shrine, protective goddess of those who pray to Bau, …… -- because you love mankind and rejoice at its gifts, let us forever praise you, the beneficent protective goddess of Bau.
…… with a lovely head, full of beauty, …… of lapis lazuli, lovely ……, giving advice, radiant in prayer , 1 line fragmentary …… may she favour the king. 1 line fragmentary unknown no. of lines missing
2 lines fragmentary ……, good woman, my protective goddess, let us forever praise you, the beneficent protective goddess of Bau.

1 line fragmentary respected one, beloved of Bau, lady …… true cream, 1 line unclear As is fitting, she lets Lord Ig-alim have the sceptre. Just woman, my protective goddess, lady -- because you ……, let us forever praise you, the beneficent protective goddess of Bau, the lady who …… food and drink and …… in abundance, who from the dwelling place of the abzu's abundance speaks in a noble voice in its …….

My protective goddess, lady ……, good woman encouraging celebration and listening to words of prayer, guiding fine speech and tongues, lady who loves the truth, august minister of Mother Bau, with silver lips, directing …… and …… ears and cheeks! Good woman, my protective goddess, your appearance unmatchable, my ……, let us forever praise you.

Completely filling the …… with clear and good water, 1 line fragmentary …… a very fine …… of woven wool, covered with šuba ornaments, …… a woollen …… thighs, rising up like ……, with limbs as bright as daylight, exuding opulence like a ……, with fine forearms, fit for the ……, …… fingers of silver, …… nir stone, …… the palace! Good woman, my protective goddess, your appearance unmatchable, let us forever praise you.
Minister who forgets nothing, lady who …… the place that soothes the spirit, …… a patient heart, 1 line fragmentary with broad hips ……, seemly ……, your name …… like a ……, ……, lady …… like a …….
1 line unclear Good woman, my protective goddess -- because you …… the statue, let us forever praise you who …… like cream and butter . unknown no. of lines missing

akk: /nun\ gal ^d-en-ki […] an ki NE […] mi2 mu-ri2-in-[dug4]  e2-gi4-a  ^d-am-an-ki  nam zid-de3-eš tar-re  sumun2 gal ulutim2-bi dirig-ga niĝ2-ul^!--e-eš rib^?--ba  nitalam-zu en gal ^d-nu-dim2-mud zag kalam-ma šu du7  en igi-ĝal2-la an lugal šum2-mu ad gi4-gi4 gal-zu  en gal-an-zu dug4-ga-ni saĝ-ba du kug-zu niĝ2-nam-ma-kam  mas-su maḫ šag4 ^d-en-lil2-la2-ka sig10-ge5 me-bi sag2 [nu]-di  /ĝeštug2\ daĝal mu dug3-ga /sa4\-a eš-bar-e šum2-[X]  [u3]-tud-da zu X […] šag4 X […]  an /lugal\ […]  u3-sumun2 /zid\ […]  zi nam-/til3\ […]  lu2-ulu3-bi […]  ne-saĝ ĝar-ra […]  ur5 sag9-ge šag4 […]  nam-til3 zi /sud\ […]  e2 kaš de2-a A […] i3 ^ĝiš-erin-/na\ […]  ^dug-šakir3^?- […]  nun gal ^d-en-[ki] […] X […]  /e2^?-\ […]  /abzu\ me-bi X […]  X sag9-ga /lu2\ […]  saĝ il2 nam-nin-a za3-mi2-zu^?- X  eridug^ki- kur ḫe2-ĝal2-la-zu dam-bi nu-til-e  diĝir /gal\-gal-e-ne u3-tud-bi ḫe2-a diĝir-bi ḫe2-em      šir3-šag4-ḫul2-la ^d-dam-gal-/nun\-[na-kam]
en: The great prince Enki, …… heaven and earth, …… cherishes you. Bride of Enki who determines fates favourably, great wild cow, exceptional in appearance, pre-eminent forever! Your husband, the great lord Nudimmud who makes perfect the borders of the Land, the lord on whom An the king has bestowed perceptiveness; the wise adviser, the sage lord whose command is foremost, who is skilful in everything, the majestic leader who pleases Enlil's heart; whose divine powers cannot be withstood, he of deep understanding, called by an auspicious name, reaching decisions …… who is knowledgeable about giving birth, ……, unknown no. of lines missing

An the king ……. Vigorous wild cow, ……. Life and living ……. Mankind ……. The established first-fruit offerings ……. Pleasing the spirit and …… the heart, ……. Living and a long life ……. In the house where beer is poured out, …… the oil of cedars ……. unknown no. of lines missing
The churn ……. The great prince Enki ……. The house ……. unknown no. of lines missing

The divine powers of the abzu ……. The good ……. Outstanding among ladies, your praise ……. You never cease being the wife of your Eridug, the mountain of abundance. She is the birth-giver of the great gods, she is their goddess.
6. A šir-šagḫula of Damgalnuna.

akk: niĝ2 nu-kur2-ru ka-ta e3-a-ni nam ul-še3 tar-re  igi il2-la-ni kur-re di-di  ĝiš-nu11 il2-la-ni kur-šag4-ga igi ĝal2  ^d-nu-nam-nir nam-en nam-nun-na šu gal du7-a-ni  diĝir ki ni2-ba mu-un-na-gam-e-eš  a2 aĝ2-ĝa2 zid-de3-eš im-ma-sug2-ge-eš
en: Enlil's commands are by far the loftiest, his {words} { commands} are holy, his utterances are immutable! The fate he decides is everlasting, his glance makes the mountains anxious, his …… reaches into the interior of the mountains. All the gods of the earth bow down to Father Enlil, who sits comfortably on the holy dais, the lofty {dais} { engur}, to Nunamnir, whose lordship and princeship are most perfect. The Anuna gods {enter before him} { stand before him} and obey his instructions faithfully.

akk: en u19-ru gal an ki-a dirig di zu gal-an-zu-e  dur-an-ki-ka dur2 ba-an-ĝar ĝeštug2 daĝal-la-ke4  nam-nun-na ni2 pa e3-a ši-bi2-in-ak ki-ur3 ki gal-la  nibru^ki- uz3-saĝ maḫ an ki-ka ki-tuš im-ma-ni-in-du3  iri igi-bi ni2 me-lem4 ḫuš-a  bar-bi diĝir u19-ru-na saĝ nu-ĝa2-ĝa2-dam  šag4-bi ka ĝiri2 kiĝ2-a ka garaš2-a-ka  ^ĝiš-es2-ad ki-bal-a pu2 sa ak-a
en: The mighty lord, the greatest in heaven and earth, the knowledgeable judge, the wise one of wide-ranging wisdom, has taken his seat in the Dur-an-ki, and made the Ki-ur, the great place, resplendent with majesty. He has taken up residence in Nibru, the lofty bond between heaven and earth. The front of the city is laden with terrible fearsomeness and radiance, its back is such that even the mightiest god dare not attack, and its interior is the blade of a sharp dagger, a blade of catastrophe. For the rebel lands it is a snare, a trap set with a net.

akk: gal-bi dug4-ga-bi ud la-ba-ni-ib-su3-ud-de3  di-da inim erim2-ĝal2 nu-mu-ni-ib-be2  inim kur2 niĝ2 kur2 u3-nu-ĝar-ra  sun7-na inim bur2-ra ni2 buluĝ5 di silim-eš2 di  iri niĝ2-gig-ga nu-mu-ni-ib-dib-be2
en: It cuts short the life of those who speak too mightily. It permits no evil word to be spoken in judgment . ……, deception, inimical speech, hostility, impropriety, ill-treatment, wickedness, wrongdoing, looking askance , violence, slandering, arrogance, licentious speech , egotism and boasting are abominations not tolerated within the city.

akk: nibru^ki- a2-bi sa-par3 gal-la-am3  šag4-ba ḫu-ri2-in^mušen--e dub3 mu-un-bad-ba9-re6  lu2-erim2 lu2 ḫul-ĝal2 šu-bi la-ba-ra-e3  iri niĝ2-gen6-na saĝ-e-eš rig7-ga  niĝ2-zid niĝ2-si-sa2 gi16-sa-še3 ak-a  tug2 dan2-dan2-na kar-ra ĝal2-la  šeš-gal šeš-ban3-da dugud-de3-da nam-lu2-ulu3 ak-da  inim ab-ba-še3 ĝizzal ak-de3 ni2 šu-a gi4-gi4-dam  dumu ama-ni-ir sun5-na ni2 teĝ3-ĝe26-da nam-ab-ba sud-de3
en: The borders of Nibru form a great net, within which the ḫurin eagle spreads wide its talons. The evil or wicked man does not escape its grasp. In this city endowed with steadfastness, for which righteousness and justice have been made a lasting possession, and which is clothed in pure clothing on the quay, the younger brother honours the older brother and treats him with human dignity; people pay attention to a father's word and reap the benefits; the child behaves humbly and modestly towards his mother and attains a ripe old age.

akk: iri a2-dam kug ^d-en-lil2-la2-kam  nibru^ki- eš3 ki aĝ2 a-a kur gal-la-kam  barag nam-ḫe2 e2-kur e2 za-gin3 saḫar-ta ša-ba-ra-an-il2  ḫur-saĝ il2-la-gin7 ki sikil-la bi2-in-mu2  nun-bi kur gal a-a ^d-en-lil2  e2-kur eš3 maḫ-a barag-ba dur2 bi2-in-ĝar  e2-a me-bi diĝir sag2 nu-di  šu-luḫ sikil-bi ki-gin7 nu-silig-ge  me-bi me abzu lu2 igi nu-bar-re-de3
en: In the city, the holy settlement of Enlil, in Nibru, the beloved shrine of father Great Mountain, he has made the dais of abundance, the E-kur, the shining temple, rise from the soil; he has made it grow on pure land as high as a towering mountain. Its prince, the Great Mountain, Father Enlil, has taken his seat on the dais of the E-kur, the lofty shrine. No god can cause harm to the temple's divine powers. Its holy hand-washing rites are everlasting like the earth. Its divine powers are the divine powers of the abzu: no one can look upon them.

akk: šag4-bi ab su3-ra2 an-zag nu-zu-a  di-ir-ga me ul-e šu im-ta-du7-du7  inim-inim-ma-bi šudu3-šudu3-de3  ezen i3 gara2 sud ḫe2-ĝal2-la du8-a  ĝiš-ḫur-bi giri17-zal šag4 ḫul2-la di-bi niĝ2 gal-gal-la-kam  ud šu2-uš ezem-ma ud zal-le buru14 maḫ-am3  e2 ^d-en-lil2-la2 kur ḫe2-ĝal2-la-kam  šu gid2 igi-tum3 la2 šu sumur niĝ2-gig-ga
en: Its interior is a wide sea which knows no horizon. In its …… glistening as a banner , the bonds and ancient divine powers are made perfect. Its words are prayers, its incantations are supplications. Its word is a favourable omen ……, its rites are most precious. At the festivals, there is plenty of fat and cream; they are full of abundance. Its divine plans bring joy and rejoicing, its verdicts are great. Daily there is a great festival, and at the end of the day there is an abundant harvest. The temple of Enlil is a mountain of abundance; to reach out, to look with greedy eyes, to seize are abominations in it.

akk: e2-a en-bi e2-da mu2-a   lagar^!--bi  (ša^!- ka-ra-bi) šu silim-ma ḫe2-du7-am3  nu-eš3-bi šita kug-ge du7-me-eš  engar maḫ-bi sipad zid kalam-ma  ud dug3-ga zid-de3-eš tu-ud-da-am3  engar gana2 daĝal-la ḫe2-du7-am3  ši-im-da-ĝen nidba gal-gal-la-da  ĝiš-la2-bi nu-mu-un-DU e2-kur za-gin3-še3
en: The lagar priests of this temple whose lord has grown together with it are expert in blessing; its gudug priests of the abzu are suited for { your} lustration rites; its nueš priests are perfect in the holy prayers. Its great farmer is the good shepherd of the Land, who was born vigorous on a propitious day. The farmer, suited for the broad fields, comes with rich offerings; he does not …… into the shining E-kur.

akk: ^d-en-lil2 a2-dam kug ki-a ḫur-ra-za  nibru^ki- iri ni2-za ši-im-mi-du3-du3-am3  ki-ur3 kur ki sikil-zu a bi2-dug3-ga  ub-da 4-ba murub4-ba dur-an-ki-ka ki ba-e-ni-tag-ge  saḫar-bi zi kalam-ma zi kur-kur-ra-ka  šeg12-bi kug ḫuš-a uš8 ^na4-za-gin3-na-ka  kur-kur-re saĝ im-ma-da-sag3-ge  ezen gal-gal-ba uĝ3-e nam-ḫe2-a ud-bi mu-un-di-ni-ib-zal-e
en: Enlil, when you marked out the holy settlements, you also built Nibru, your own city. You …… the Ki-ur, the mountain, your pure place. You founded it in the Dur-an-ki, in the middle of the four quarters of the earth. Its soil is the life of the Land, and the life of all the foreign countries. Its brickwork is red gold, its foundation is lapis lazuli. You {made it glisten on high} { raised its glistening top} in Sumer as if it were the horns of a wild bull. It makes all the foreign countries tremble with fear. At its great festivals, the people pass their time in abundance.

akk: ^d-en-lil2 ^d-uraš kug ḫi-li du8-du8-a-zu  kur sig itima kug ki ni2 te-en-te-en-zu  e2-kur e2 za-gin3 ki-tuš maḫ ni2 gur3-ru-zu  ni2 me-lem4-bi an-ne2 im-us2  ĝissu-bi kur-kur-ra ša-mu-un-la2  suḫ10-bi an-šag4-ga-aš ša-mu-un-bad-ba9-re6  en-en-e barag-barag-ge2-ne  nidba kug-ge
en: Enlil, holy Uraš is favoured with beauty for you; you are greatly suited for the abzu, the holy {throne} { engur}; you refresh yourself in the deep underworld, the holy chamber. Your presence spreads awesomeness over the E-kur, the shining temple, the lofty dwelling. Its fearsomeness and radiance reach up to heaven, its shadow stretches over all the foreign lands, and its crenellation reaches up to the midst of heaven. All lords and sovereigns regularly supply holy offerings there, approaching Enlil with prayers and supplications.

akk: ^d-en-lil2 sipad igi zid bar-ra-zu  gu3 zid de2-a kalam-ma il2-la-zu  kur šu-ni-še3 kur ĝiri3-ni-še3  kur-ra ki su3-ra2-bi gu2 mu-na-ab-ĝa2-ĝa2  a sed4-gin7 du8-a niĝ2 ki-šar2-ra-ka  maš2-da-ri-a gu2-un dugud-da-bi  sa2 bi2-in-dug4 e2 niĝ2-gur11-ra-ka  kisal maḫ-ḫa nidba   e2-kur e2 za-gin3-na ma-sar-re-eš im-mi-in-tum3
en: Enlil, if you look upon the shepherd favourably, if you elevate the one truly called in the Land, then the foreign countries are in his hands, the foreign countries are at his feet! Even the most distant foreign countries submit to him. He will then cause enormous incomes and heavy tributes, as if they were cool water, to reach the treasury. In the great courtyard he will supply offerings regularly. Into the E-kur, the shining temple, he will bring …….

akk: na-gada mas-su niĝ2-zi-ĝal2-la-ka  tum9 ḫur-saĝ-ĝa2 barag-ge si-a-na  ^d-tir-an-na-gin7 an-e ši-in-gi4  dungu dirig-ga-gin7 ni2-bi-a mu-un-ĝen
en: Enlil, faithful shepherd of the teeming multitudes, herdsman, leader of all living creatures, has manifested his rank of great prince, {adorning himself with} { putting on} the holy crown. As the Wind of the Mountain occupied the dais, he spanned the sky as the rainbow. Like a floating cloud, he moved alone .

akk: an-na dili nun-bi-im ki-a ušumgal-bi-im  ^d-a-nun-na-ke4-ne diĝir maḫ-bi-im  nam ni2-te-a-ni ši-im-mi-in-tar-re  diĝir na-me igi nu-mu-ni-in-du8  dug4-ga inim šag4-ga ĝal2-la-ni  mu-un-da-an-zu šag4 mu-da-an-kuš2-u3  a2 aĝ2-ĝa2 daĝal-bi mu-un-na-da-an-tum2  šita kug me kug-ga šu mu-un-na-mu2-mu2
en: He alone is the prince of heaven, the dragon of the earth. The lofty god of the Anuna himself determines the fates. No god can look upon him. His great minister and {commander} { chief barber} Nuska learns his commands and his intentions from him, consults with him and then executes his far-reaching instructions on his behalf. He prays to him with holy prayers and divine powers .

akk: kur gal ^d-en-lil2-da nu-me-a  iri nu-du3 a2-dam ki li-bi2-ib-ĝar  tur3 nu-du3 amaš nu-ĝar-ĝar  lugal nu-il2-e en nu-u3-tud  lu2-maḫ nin-diĝir maš2-e nu-mu-un-dab5-be2  erin2-e šagina ugula nu-tuku-tuku  id2-da a-eštub^ku6- u3-bi nu-dun-dun  eĝer-bi ab-ta e3  kun-bi nu-mu-un-sud-e  ab-e erim3 dugud ni2-ba nu-mu-un-u3-tud  ku6 engur-ra-ke4 ĝiš-gi-a nunuz nu-mu-ni-ib-nu2-nu2  mušen an-na-ke4 ki daĝal-la gud3 la-ba-ni-ib-u2-us2  an-na dungu sir2-ra ka-bi nu-du8-e  a-šag4-ga še gu-nu a-gar3-ra nu-si-si  edin-na giri17-zal-bi u2-šim nu-mu2-mu2
en: Without the Great Mountain Enlil, no city would be built, no settlement would be founded; no cow-pen would be built, no sheepfold would be established; no king would be elevated, no lord would be given birth; no high priest or priestess would perform extispicy; soldiers would have no generals or captains; no carp-filled waters would dredge the rivers at their peak; the carp would not …… come straight up from the sea, they would not dart about. The sea would not produce all its heavy treasure, no freshwater fish would lay eggs in the reedbeds, no bird of the sky would build nests in the spacious land; in the sky the thick clouds would not open their mouths; on the fields, dappled grain would not fill the arable lands, vegetation would not grow lushly on the plain; in the gardens, the {spreading trees} { forests} of the mountain would not yield fruits.

akk: kur gal ^d-en-lil2-da nu-me-a  ^d-nin-tur5 nu-ug5-ge saĝ ĝiš nu-ra-ra  ab2-e ^e2-tur3-ra amar-bi nu-šub-be2  u8-e amaš-bi-a sila4 ĝa2 gig nu-e3  a-za-lu-lu ni2-ba lu-a  maš2-anše niĝ2-ur2-4-e numun nu-mu-ni-ib-e3 e-ne su3-ud-bi nu-mu-un-u5
en: Without the Great Mountain Enlil, Nintur would not kill, she would not strike dead; no cow would drop its calf in the cattle-pen, no ewe would bring forth a …… lamb in its sheepfold; the living creatures which multiply by themselves would not {lie down in their ……} { sit within ……}; the four-legged animals would not propagate, they would not mate.

akk: ^d-en-lil2 niĝ2 galam-ma-galam-ma-zu niĝ2-me-ĝar sug4-ga  šag4-bi gu suḫ3-a   gu-gu gilim-ma igi nu-pad3-de3-dam  nam-diĝir-zu-še3 nir im-te-ĝal2  šag4 kuš2-u3 ad gi4-gi4 en ni2-te-na-me-en  niĝ2 ak-zu a-ba i3-zu-zu  me-zu me pa nu-ed2-de3  muš3-za diĝir igi nu-bar-re-dam
en: Enlil, your ingenuity takes one's breath away! By its nature it is like entangled threads which cannot be unravelled, crossed threads which the eye cannot follow. Your divinity can be relied on. You are your own counsellor and adviser, you are a lord on your own. Who can comprehend your actions? No divine powers are as resplendent as yours. No god can look you in the face.

akk: en diĝir lugal ^d-en-lil2-la2-me-en  di-kud ka-aš bar an ki-me-en  inim maḫ-zu an-gin7 dugud-da-gin7 zig3-zig3 nu-e-zu  inim-zu-še3 diĝir ^d-a-nun-na šu šum2-ma^!- im-ma-an-ak-eš  inim-zu an-še3 idim-ma ki-še3 temen-am3  an-še3 idim gal an-ne2 us2-sa  ki-še3 temen sag2 nu-di-dam  an-e um-ma-te ḫe2-ĝal2-la-am3  an-ta ḫe2-ĝal2 im-da-šeĝ3-šeĝ3  ki-a um-ma-te giri17-zal-am3  ki-ta giri17-zal im-da-mu2-mu2  inim-zu gu-am3 inim-zu še-am3  [inim]-zu a-eštub zi kur-kur-ra-kam  niĝ2-zi-ĝal2 niĝ2-ki^!- u5-a  zi dug3-ga u2-šim im-da-pa-an-pa-an  X-ga dub3-tuku-am3 mul gun3-gun3-a
en: You, Enlil, are lord, god, king. You are a judge who makes decisions about heaven and earth. Your lofty word is as heavy as heaven, and there is no one who can lift it. The Anuna gods …… at your word. Your word is weighty in heaven, a foundation on the earth. In the heavens, it is a great ……, reaching up to the sky. On the earth it is a foundation which cannot be destroyed. When it relates to the heavens, it brings abundance: abundance will pour from the heavens. When it relates to the earth, it brings prosperity: the earth will produce prosperity. Your word means flax, your word means grain. Your word means the early flooding, the life of the lands. It makes the living creatures, the animals which copulate and breathe joyfully in the greenery. You, Enlil, the good shepherd, know their ways . …… the sparkling stars.

akk: ^d-nin-lil2 nitalam kug inim-ma-ni šag4-ga  tug2-ba13 kug ulutim2-ta nir-ra alan me-dim2-ta sig10-ga  munus zid igi il2-la ba-e-de3-tuku-dam  ul gur3-ru e2-kur-ra nin me-te-ĝal2 zu  ad gi4-gi4 inim-ma ba-ab-du7  inim-ma-ni su-a bi2-dug3-ga-bi i3 li šag4-ga-kam  ad ši-mu-da-an-gi4-gi4 šag4 ši-mu-da-an-kuš2-u3  nam tar-re ki ^d-utu e3-a nam ši-mu-da-ab-tar-re  ^d-nin-lil2 nin an ki nin kur-kur-ra-ke4  za3-mi2 kur gal-la-ka mi2 dug4-ga
en: You married Ninlil, the holy consort, whose words are of the heart, her of noble countenance in a holy ba garment, her of beautiful shape and limbs, the trustworthy lady of your choice. Covered with allure, the lady who knows what is fitting for the E-kur, whose words of advice are perfect, whose words bring comfort like fine oil for the heart, who {shares} { sits on} the holy throne, the pure throne with you, she takes counsel and discusses matters with you. You decide the fates together at the place facing the sunrise. Ninlil, the lady of heaven and earth, the lady of all the lands, is honoured in the praise of the Great Mountain.

akk: maḫ-di inim-ma-ni ki-bi-še3 ĝar  dug4-ga a2-taḫ-a-ni niĝ2 nu-kur2-ru  ka-ta e3-a-ni saĝ ba-an-gub  ĝiš-ḫur-ḫur-ra-ni inim ge-en-ge-en  kur gal a-a ^d-en-lil2 za3-mi2-zu maḫ-am3
en: Prominent one whose words are well established, whose command and support are things which are immutable, whose utterances take precedence, whose plans are firm words, Great Mountain, Father Enlil, your praise is sublime!

akk: […] X […] X […]  […] X X X X […]  […] X igi-ĝal2 X X […]  [^d-ḫendur]-/saĝ\-ĝa2 me-zu maḫ-am3 lu2 ]
en: 5 lines missing or fragmentary …… wise ……; Ḫendursaĝa, you have great divine powers, more than anyone could require.

akk: […] /ur3\-bad3-da na de5-/de5\  saĝ šu du3-du3 en /uru16\-e-ne  ešgiri2 šu du8 barag-barag-ge2-ne  unud(UNU3) uĝ3 lu-a igi il2-il2-i  niĝ2-na de5 ĝi6-a en-nu-uĝ3 MAŠ-a-gin7 sila daĝal peš-peš-e  kan4 ud e3-ba ĝal2 da13-da13 ^ĝiš-ig-bi sila-ba gub-bu  ^d-ḫendur-saĝ-ĝa2 me-zu maḫ-am3 lu2
en: …… who gives advice on the rooftops ; you who among powerful lords are ……, who among rulers hold the staff, a shepherd who oversees the teeming people; ……, who strides about the city's squares by night at the middle of the watch; you who open the gates at daybreak, who make their doors stand open onto the street: Ḫendursaĝa, you have great divine powers, more than anyone could require.

akk: [^d-]/nin\-dar-a lugal niĝin6^ki- ki niĝ2-daĝal-la-ba šid-du3-bi za-e-me-en  [^d-ḫendur]-/saĝ\-ĝa2 ĝiškim maḫ ^d-nanše šu-za im-ma-/gub\  [in]-/nin\ ama ^d-nanše šag4 mu-ti-ni-ib-kuš2-u3  [X] /šibir\ ĝidru ĝiš-ḫur-ra-bi ki sikil-la bi2-in-mu2  [X] X-zu sila sig9-ga il2-la-aš igi […]  [X] kug-zu kar  ^ĝiš-ma2-gur8 sikil-am3 dadag-ga-am3  in-nin ama ^d-nanše ma2-gur8 kug ša-mu-ra-ab-dirig-ga  šag4-ba nar dug3 nun ša-mu-na-du12-am3  gana2 zid ki mu-e-ĝar-ra-zu gig ziz2 gu2-gal-la-am3  ki niĝ2-gur11 im-mi-ĝar-ra-zu e-ri-ne ^ĝiš-asal-a  pap-zu en ab kug-ga dar^mušen-  ^d-nin-dar-a lugal lagaš^ki--ra  ab2-šilam kug-ge i3 mu-na-ab-tum3 ga mu-na-ab-tum3  itid zag-mu ud sa2-dug4-ga-kam  ^d-nin-dar-a e2-za niĝ2-mussa  in-nin ama ^d-nanše ša-mu-ra-da-ab-ak-e
en: You are the accountant of Nindara, king of Niĝin in its spacious location. Nanše has placed a mighty symbol in your hand, Ḫendursaĝa. The mistress, Mother Nanše, speaks confidentially with you. She has made …… crook and sceptre for its plans flourish in a pure place; she …… her gaze to your …… raised in the quiet streets. Your holy ……, the straight harbour-wall, the pure barge -- all is shining. When the mistress, Mother Nanše, floats her holy barge to visit you, sweet and noble singers perform for her on board. Your well laid-out fields have wheat, emmer and chick peas. The places where you have laid up supplies lie amid cedars and poplars. The holy cow delivers butter and delivers milk to your older brother, the lord of the holy sea, the cock Nindara, the king of Lagaš. Also with her help, monthly and at the New Year on the days of regular offerings, in your house Nindara makes the wedding-gifts on your behalf for the mistress, Mother Nanše.

akk: id2-zu ku6 ku3-ĝal2 nu-un-dab5 kun-bi nu-sud-e  a-šag4-zu engar-e niĝ2-kud la-ba-ab-ak-e  gud-zu-ta lu2 gud ed3-da-ke4 gud la-ba-ra-ab-ed3-/de3\  udu-zu-a u2-tul2 nu-un-ku4-ku4 šid nu-du3-e  ^ĝiš-buniĝ(SUG) niĝ2-silaĝ-ĝa2-zu niĝ2-kud la-ba-ab-ak-e  nitaḫ lu2 la-ga mu-e-ši-niĝin2-na a-niĝin2 mu-na-an-du3-uš  sila sig9-ga-ba saĝ šu bi2-du3  ki-e-ne-di-ba lul-eš2 im-ta-e-/en\  ^d-ḫendur-saĝ-ĝa2 me-zu maḫ-am3 lu2
en: You have no river where fish could be caught by the fisheries inspector as they dart about there. No produce is derived by the farmer from your fields. The collector of cattle taxes cannot collect a single bull from your cattle; the shepherd cannot penetrate among your flocks, nor can he make an official assessment. There is no reed …… among your stakes . Your dough trough does not produce any revenue. But the robber who encounters you is ……. On the quiet streets ……; in the play areas you …… very much. You are the chief constable of the dead people who are brought to the underworld. Ḫendursaĝa, you have great divine powers, more than anyone could require.

akk: diĝir lu2-ulu3-ke4 gu7 /naĝ\-da ša-ra-da-/gub\  lu2-ulu3 ^gi-kid-aš-X u3-bi2-in-dab5 šu-na u3-mu-ni-[…]  mu ^d-/ḫendur\-saĝ-ĝa2-ka um-mi-in-pad3  sila sig9-[ga] ĝi6 u3-na-ka  mi-ni-dab5-[be2]  dub-sar-dub-sar a-ra-li ŠE3^?- X ZU^?- ŠE3^?- ba-sug2-ge-[eš]  GUR^?--eš ur3-bad3-da ki-nu2 /dug3^?-\-dug3-ge-/en\  /niĝir\-ra 7-na-ne-ne ša-mu-da-sug2-/ge\-[eš]  X bad3 kalam-ma-ka ma-ra-ši-niĝin2^?- […]  ki^?--ba uĝ3 TAR ma-ra-ra […]  [X] ḫul-ĝal2 iri-a […]  [X] /erim2\-du šag4-ĝar NE […]  [^d-]/alad\ igi sag9 ^d-lamma […]  [X (X)] X nu-UL ^d-/lamma\ […]  […] X X X […]  […] A X […]
en: A man's personal god stands by at your behest for eating and drinking. If the man grasps ……, and …… in his hand, and calls upon the name of Ḫendursaĝa, then he will take the correct route through the silent streets at dead of night. All the scribes of Arali serve ……. …… who walks during the day ……, and you let …… sleep peacefully on the rooftops . The seven heralds stand at your service, and they patrol for you on the …… walls of the Land. 1 line fragmentary the wicked …… in the city; the evil …… hunger. The protective god with friendly face, the protective goddess ……; ……, the protective goddess ……. 1 line fragmentary 11 lines missing1 line fragmentary

akk: […] X U3^?- E sila /sig9\-[ga …]  […]-bi^?- a im-mi-tu5 […]  […] /GI^?-\ gum-ma /NIM^?-\ X X NA [X (X)]  […] X MA NU [X] /gur^?-\-ra  e-ne-ne-ne en ĝi6-par3-ra bi2-in-ḫuĝ-e-ne  nin-diĝir maš2-a im-mi-in-dab5-be2-ne  gudug ḫi-li-a bi2-in-gub-bu-ne
en: …… in the silent streets. …… bathes 2 lines fragmentary They come out from ……; it is they who appoint the en priestess in the ĝipar, who choose the nin-diĝir priestess by extispicy, who establish the gudug priest with his curly hair.

akk: ud ne ud te-en-na um-ma-te-a-ta  7-ba 1 ka5-a-am3 kun im-ur3-ur3-re  2-kam-ma ur-gir15-gin7 si-im-si-im i3-ak-e  3-kam-ma uga^mušen--gin7 za-na gug im-kul-e  4-kam-ma te8^mušen- maḫ ad6 gu7-a-gin7   5-kam-ma ur-bar-ra nu-me-a sila4 gig2-ga i3-šub  6-kam-ma ^d-nin-immax(LAGAB×SIG7)^mušen--gin7 X X tuš-a-gin7 gu3 mi-ni-ib-ra  7-kam-ma kušu2^ku6--am3 a-ĝi6 im-bu-bu-bu  7-be2-ne diĝir munus nu-me-eš u3 nitaḫ nu-me-eš  nitaḫ-ra šu mu-un-du3-ne munus-ra a2 mu-un-la2-ne  munus-ra ^ĝiš-tukul da-bi mu-ni-ib-ĝa2-ĝa2-ne  me diĝir-re-e-ne šu im-du7-du7-ne  ^d-ḫendur-saĝ-ĝa2 me-zu maḫ-am3 lu2
en: On this very day, as evening approaches, the first of the seven is a fox with a sweeping tail. The second snuffles around like a dog. The third pecks greedily at caterpillars like a raven. The fourth overpowers everything like an enormous carrion-eating eagle. The fifth, although not a wolf, will fall upon a black lamb. The sixth screeches like a hawk, when he sits ……. The seventh ……, a shark in the waves. These seven are neither female deities nor male. They hinder a man and hamper a woman; they put aside the woman's weapon. They spread {a stench} { lamentation} in the Land, precisely implementing the divine powers of the gods. Ḫendursaĝa, you have great divine powers, more than anyone could require.
